name: Stubble Jumper
description: A farming game where players roll the dice to move around the board and purchase land, cattle, and hogs. Players sell crops, cattle, and hogs for money. Players deal with weather events and disasters. The goal is to have the most money when the game ends.

name: Treasure Thieves
description:
Treasure Thieves is an action-packed, fast-paced, family-friendly card game. The goal is to have the most Treasure in your hand by the time the last card is drawn.

Simple enough, but there is a catch! Everyone is against you. Other players will do whatever it takes to nab your Treasure. Also hidden within the deck, are Treasure Thieves who will steal your booty from you.

Luckily, the deck holds cards that help you defend and protect your valuables, as well as do a little thieving of your own. Hey, it’s not called Treasure Thieves for nothing!

The game gets more intense with every turn, because less cards in the deck, mean less opportunities for you to score big.

So, if you’re into card games, treasure, pirates, or time travel get your hands on Treasure Thieves.

—description from the designer

name: Spy Wars
description:
World War II has ended. The Third Reich has been destroyed. Former war- time allies, the United States and the U.S.S.R, grow increasingly suspicious of each other’s motives and plans for a post-war world. As this suspicion grows, both nations will seek to exert their will on the global chess board of geostrategic politics and espionage.

Spy Wars is a two-player game. Each player will lead their nation’s Secret Service during the 1950’s era. Players are tasked with deploying their spies to collect enemy Intel (Intelligence) enabling them to carry out missions, and if successful, to steal enemy secrets.

The key objective for players is to gain the most Victory Points (VP). There are 3 ways to do this: (1) successfully complete missions, (2) steal enemy secrets, and (3) advance on the space-race track.

Winning the game:
The game ends after 10 game turns, or if the VP counter is on the ’10’ space on the victory point track at the end of a game turn.

This game is a low ink prototype entry in the 2023-wargame-print-and-play-game-design contest, and gained 2nd place in the best multi-player game category:

https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/3023014/2023-wargame-print-...

—description from the designer

Disclaimer: all art work appearing in or associated with this game is placeholder (temporary) artwork. The game designer claims no copyright on any of the game artwork.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Bribery, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Treasure Hunter
description:
Embark on a perilous quest through the depths of the steaming jungle, in search of lost treasure.

Using a special deck of cards, deal 4 cards each turn onto 4 stacks. Using only the current top card on each stack, discard all but the highest level cards of the same suit. If you ever discard 4 or more cards in 1 round, you can draw a Boon card for an added power. Once you cannot remove any more cards, the round is over and you deal 4 more cards. Keep playing until all cards have been played and you're unable to remove any others. Add up your points and see if you won!

Use your luck and your wits - with some help from bonus cards earned on your adventure - and you may uncover the priceless lost idol!

name: Invasion of Mars Shooting Game
description:
Invasion of Mars Shooting Game is an English 1950s target game. The game sees Martian targets with guns drawn perched on a cardboard frame. A background scene on the inside box has some great retro graphics of Dan Dare like spaceships and the Earth.

The game-play sees players use a simple gun with rubber bands to knock the Martians down and score points. Points are accumulated and the winner is the player with the most points after an agreed time.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: The Wales Space Treasure Game
description:
The Wales Space Treasure Game is a spin and move game produced as a promotional game in the late 1950's by the Bank of New South Wales in Australia.

The game sees players using a numbered spinner and starting on earth they traverse a path through the Solar System to finish on Pluto. Along the way a number of detours can be encountered as well as things like cosmic dust, Martian Saucers and Space pirates that will cause delays in reaching Pluto. The winner is the first to reach the Space Treasure chest on Pluto.

The promotional game was included in the Bank of New South Wales (Wales Bank)showbag from one of Australia's Royal Shows in the late 1950's. Showbags are a very popular and distinctive feature of Australian shows (the Australian term for fairs or carnivals) and companies are keen to promote products, samples and brands in their Showbags.

name: The Search for the Golden Boomerang Game
description:
The Search for the Golden Boomerang Game is children's board game based on an Australian biweekly Radio serial during the 1940's.

The popular serial spawned several children's fiction magazines centered on the concerns of an Aboriginal boy named Tuckonie. The game appeared as a supplement in 1942 to one of these magazines where 11-year-old Tuckonie and his best friend Peggy, daughter of white settlers search for a golden boomerang

A simple roll and move game sees players follow a path in search for the Golden Boomerang. Dangers along the way such as headhunters, cave of wonders and an underground river can impede or assist movement. First to reach the Golden Boomerang is the winner

name: Räuber und Soldat
description:
The game includes 9 white pawns (soldiers), 9 black pawns(soldiers), 2 red pawns (robbers).
At the bottom of the board place the soldiers, black on black and white on red. Their movement is only forward from space to space. The two robbers are placed anywhere on the towers of the robber's castle. They may march forwards and backwards to the next space, or vault sideways over a soldier to the next space, thereby capturing the soldier. The soldiers have lost if they no longer have enough white or black soldiers to fully occupy the castle. The robbers cannot be captured, but lose if the castle is occupied or if they are so surrounded by the soldiers that they can no longer move.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Static Capture

name: Once More...
description:
Once more is a quick, solo wargame where you will take your squadron of four biplane fighters out on missions to support the troops at the front or clear the way for them to move forward. You will need to make decisions about when you attack and when to coordinate your fighters against an enemy of aerial fighters and ground troops. Be careful, resources are scarce and once one of your planes is shot down, there are no reinforcements to fill the ranks.

—description from the designer

name: Ransom War
description:
Ransom War is a card game that features fantasy creatures in an epic game of war! No longer do you simply match high and low numbers on an ordinary deck of cards as in traditional game of war. Now, battle it out in a fantasy theme! Roll dice and compare stats and special abilities to determine who wins each battle. At the end, it is not who has the most cards but the person who has the most gold in their ransom from captured and victorious units!

—description from the designer

name: Motifs
description:
The year? 1800. The locale? Vienna, Austria, the City of Music. 9 years have passed since the death of Mozart, Beethoven has just premiered his first symphony, and you are an aspiring composer looking to be the next maestro to leave your mark in the annals of music history. Will you succeed?

In Motifs, you will be placing your composer, assistants, and apprentice tokens around the city of Vienna, purchasing supplies, gaining inspiration, making acquaintances, and obtaining commissions, pupils, and patronages. When not gallivanting around the city, you will be home writing compositions to be performed and published. The more you perform and publish, the more your prestige and opportunities grow. Are you ready to begin your journey to become the most prestigious composer in all the land?

name: Dinn: Sentient Starter Deck
description:
Dinn is a fast-paced action card game where you harness legends and myths from all of human history and literature. You must use strategy, and luck to defeat your opponent.

Each player begins the game with three Heart cards. Play takes place over a series of rounds. During each round, both players reveal one Hero and up to two Equipment or Action cards. In addition to various game-changing effects, these cards contribute to the Heroes’ Power. After all cards are resolved, the player with the weaker Hero must shatter a number of their Heart cards.

When your opponent’s last Heart card is shattered, you are victorious!

Dinn starter decks are the ideal way to jump into the game. Designed to allow pick-up-and-play, and provide a simple entry into the alternate reality game.

Every single card is a puzzle. Solving these puzzles will navigate you through a maze of custom-built clues: websites, professionally recorded audio-files, blog posts, and videos.
Every element of a card can be part of its puzzle. Its art, name, attributes, ability, and identification codes are all items we’ll use to craft puzzles.

You will have to take each element into consideration when attempting to solve a puzzle.

name: Dinn: Beast Starter Deck
description:
The Beast attribute deck focuses on famous beasts, creatures and behemoths from myth, and legend. Everything from the mighty Leviathan, to the ferocious Minotaur live in this deck.

It gets better the closer to defeat it gets. Like a cornered animal, your opponent must defeat you quickly, or they’ll soon regret it.

The more shattered hearts in your graveyard, the more powerful your Heroes get. Additionally, this deck is filled with Heroes that are treated as shattered hearts when they’re in the graveyard to add a new strategic element to gameplay.

name: Dinn: Horror Starter Deck
description:
The Horror attribute deck focuses on iconic monsters and horrible creatures throughout history. The Heroes that lurk in the heart of the Horror deck live up to their name.

This deck utilizes the fear of the unknown. The Hero you play at the beginning of the turn, may not be the Hero in play at the end of your turn.

Keep your opponent on their toes as you exchange the Heroes on the field with Heroes in your hand at different points in the game.

This deck also introduces new terrifying mechanics that allow you to play Heroes in unconventional ways.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Dinn: Divine Starter Deck
description:
The Divine attribute deck is made of gods, angels, demons and prophets throughout human history. Divine intervention is almost always in your favor when you play these cards.

The Divine attribute focuses on control. Specifically, how many cards you have in your hand, and your opponent has in theirs. Ten, five, two. These numbers will define the strength of your Heroes.

name: Dinn: Essence Starter Deck
description:
The Essence attribute deck is made of up of events, actions and the unchanging elements of life. The creatures of the dark forest, the unmovable mountain, or the simple virus.

It plays by a very specific set of rules, and your opponent will be playing by those rules as well. Will the card your opponent draws next turn be their card, or will it be yours? You’ll be the one to decide.

name: Dinn: Given Starter Deck
description:
The Given attribute deck is made up of machines, creations and engines scattered throughout humanity's past, and future.

The Given attribute focuses on continual improvement. The Heroes you play at the end of the game will receive benefits from the Heroes you played at the beginning. It’s best to defeat a Given deck early, because defeating it late may not be an option.

name: Halloween Never Ends
description:
Roll your dice to move your investigators through the house, placing room tiles as you go. Use evidence to complete and illuminate the 3 rooms and collect spirit cards for points. One player will be dealt the Autumn card, marking them as possessed by her. Autumn can jump from one player to another, so no one should be stuck with her the entire game. While they are possessed, that player works against the other players. Once the 3 rooms are completed and illuminated, the players must escape through the portal in the corn maze before Autumn can capture them all.

Introduction from the game manual:

You are an experienced paranormal investigator... The best in the field, to be transparent. You take your decades of experience and knowledge and use it to investigate the house where Halloween Never Ends... Spirits roam trapped within the walls by an evil and unseen force. Investigate the house, illuminate all three rooms, set each trapped spirit free and then escape through the portal within the corn maze.

But beware, for the guardian of the house, the evil scarecrow named Autumn, is out to trap you, making you the newest slave of the great and terrible nightmares of the house where Halloween Never Ends!
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Paletto: Plus
description:
In the last few years, "Paletto" has been one of our best-selling games. On the request of many customers, the author, Dieter Stein, has come up with simplified rules so that "Paletto" can now also be played with children from 3 or 4 years and up. The color die brings the luck factor into the game, and children take a mischievous pleasure if they can snatch a playing piece away from another player.
As soon as children are able to assign colors, they can also play "Paletto."

Please note: "Paletto Plus" comes with its own game instructions, including a color die. It can only be played with the "Paletto" basic game.

The delivery of Paletto Plus consists of:

1 x Game instructions
1 x One 20-mm color die


—description from the publisher

name: Deer Lord!: Socially Awkward
description:
dual EXPANSION to DEER LORD!

Le freak, c’est chic!

GEEK is for brainiacs who would rather interact with popular culture than other people. ASYLUM will take you to the brink of insanity.

This dual expansion favors us *special* people, so play with friends who don’t mind acting, looking or being weird.

The GEEK expansion gives you heated debates over fist fights or dance routines (or anything physical like that), it lets you pummel your opponents with pop culture knowledge. Proclaim yourself the Stephan Urquelle among the Urkels.

The ASYLUM expansion let’s you fly over the cuckoo’s nest to unleash ALL the crazy! No point in playing sneakily with this set of totally absurd cards that will send the game right to the nut house.

Contains
22 GEEK cards
32 ASYLUM cards

-description from publisher's website

name: Deadline
description: A game about news paper reporting, journalism and ads from the world of news papers. It's meant to be played in a classroom with six teams but can also be played with only three people. The first team to the goal wins. Advance by finding information in the paper, answer a quiz question or identify a drawing.

name: Where is Maldova
description:
The outstanding game of chance, knowledge, strategy and more...

A trivia game that uses a map of Europe as the centrepiece.

The object of this game is to gain countries on the game board to achieve a chain of 5 or more connecting countries in the map.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Questions and Answers, Race, Set Collection

name: Hvem bliver godsejer?
description:
Who will be landowner.
Each player own one or more farm, at the beginning of the game, but with out animal, machines, fields or barns.
The player who at the end of the game have the highest value (animal, machines and money) wins the game.
Each player is given 1 or more pawn, 10.000 Dkr and one or more farm (one for each pawn), depending on the numbers of player.
On your turn you roll the dice and move your pawn that many steps.
If you end on an animal or machine, you get that card, either from the bank or if another player has that card, from them. If you have 2 of the same animal, you exchange the card with a double animal card, that you can not lose.
If you end on a farm, that is own by another player, you can exchange animal cards, to try and have a pair
If you end on a field or barn, and nobody own that, you get it, if another player own that field or barn you will pay them 1000 Dkr
If you end on the Bank, you must pay the bank 2000 Dkr
If you end on Rodekontor yopu must pay your taxes 3000 Dkr

The game end when you decide, or after a certain time.
The winner is the player with the highest value (animal, machine and money).
The value for the Horse or cow is 2000 Dkr each, Pig and Sheep is 500 Dkr, Car is 5000 Dkr, Tractor, sowing machine & self-binding machine is 2000 Dkr, the rest is 500dkr.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Ownership, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Yordi 30
description:
Make the best colorful celebration for Yordi's 30st birthday!
It's a microgame played with 30 cards in 5 turns.

Each turn you need to pick (by drafting when playing with two) your cards and choose which you want to use as a letter and which one as a number in your festive decoration. Ideally the sum of the numbers is 30 (because it's Yordi's 30st birthday) while you spell the name Yordi. You can also score for colors to make it more challenging. The player with the most points wins.

-description from designer

name: Monopoly: Blackpink
description: Your classic Monopoly but Blackpink edition for kpop fans.

name: Mítosz: Avatár
description:
Avatár is the first expansion released to the Hungarian CCG Mítosz.
It contains 15 cards per pack from the base game and guarantees one rare and five uncommon items.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Network and Route Building, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mítosz: Ankh
description:
Second expansion to the Hungarian CCG Mítosz and the first one which brings new cards. It introduces the Egyptian Mythology.
With this expansion 129 new cards become available. One pack contains 15 cards from this 129.
It also brings a new card type (maneuver) and extends the core game's ruleset.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Network and Route Building, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mítosz
description:
After 10 years of the original Mítosz a redesigned game with new graphics is available.
The basic game concepts are the same:

you have a deck of (min) 60 cards
you have one Prominent God from one of that four ancient mythology (Celtic, Greek, Norse, Egyptian) in your deck, who gives you unique powers
you must control cards which give you Power Point
whoever first control 12 Power Points, wins
you have to defend your people and attack your enemy's people or leaders


The core set contains 300 cards and also 4 promotional cards were created which were available as awards on competitions.

—user summary
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Network and Route Building, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mítosz: Legenda
description:
Third expansion to the Hungarian CCG Mítosz and second one which brings new cards. It does not introduce new Mythology, but extends all the previous ones.
With this expansion 84 new cards become available. One pack contains 15 cards from this 129.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Network and Route Building, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: ユーテル (YUTERU)
description:
ユーテル(YUTERU) is a Japanese "Ogiri" game.
"Ogiri" is a form of comedy that focuses on improvisation by providing a funny answer on the spot for a question.

For each picture in the theme, the player chooses a dialogue card from his or her hand that fits the situation. At this point, the player must think about "what the person or animal is saying" and play the card that he or she finds most interesting, because only if the parent player likes the answer will the game score points. This is because only if the answer is liked by the parent player will the game be scored.
The player who scores more points wins.

This game was produced in cooperation with "Shochiku Entertainment" and "JELLYJELLYGAMES" in Japan.


ユーテルは、かんたんな大喜利ゲームです。

プレイヤーは、お題の写真を見て、手札から状況に合った台詞カードを選びます。このとき、プレイヤーは"写真にうつる人や動物が何を言っているのか"を考え、最も面白いと思われそうなカードを出す必要があります。なぜなら、その答えが親プレイヤーに気に入られて初めて、このゲームの得点になるからです。ゲームを繰り返し、より多くの得点を獲得したプレイヤーの勝利です。

このゲームは、日本の"松竹芸能"と"JELLY JELLY GAMES"が協力して製作されました。

name: Gemz! Three Corner Card Game
description:
Draw, swap, and switch out colorful three-sided game cards to watch your gem take shape. Uncover all of one color to build a jewel of gemz. Watch out for action cards that speed up or slow down progress. Be first to gather six gemz cards of the same color to win.

Setup involves dealing three gemz cards to each player, face up. If an action card is dealt at this time it is placed back in the deck and dealing continues until each player has three cards.

To start play, everyone lays the three cards they were dealt side by side in a semi-circle. The youngest player goes first by drawing one card from the top of the draw pile. If it's a gemz card they add it to their circle. If it's an action card they follow the instructions. Turn-based play continues to the left and players lay down every gemz card they draw until their circle is full. Players may only have six cards total at a time; once their circle is full, they must choose to discard their newly drawn cards or swap them with an existing piece of their circle.

The game continues until one player has gathered 6 gemz cards of the same color. Luck-of-the-draw and the game-changing SWAP cards make sure that no player can coast to an easy win. The rules are simple enough for younger children, teens, and adults to all enjoy playing together.

Includes: 63 triangle-shaped game cards: 11 each of green, orange, red & blue Gemz Cards; 4 Wild Multicolor Gemz; 15 Action Cards (7 Swap, 4 Lose a Turn, and 4 Lose a Card). Clear, easy-to-read instructions included in a compact game box.

name: Munchkin Promulgation of Promo Proxies
description: This booklet, which features 40 different Munchkin cards, Steve Jackson Games has gathered some of their very favorite promo cards from the archives so that everyone can have a chance to enjoy them! Part of their successful August 2021 Kickstarter campaign, this booklet will liven up all your Munchkin games!

name: Henry's Bar Game
description:
In March 2023, partymeeple ran a roll n write evening in a small bar in Western Australia. To this end, a custom design, paying tribute to the small bar, entitled Henry on 8th, was designed.

A DJ (dice jokey) rolls for everyone in the room and sprukes the result over the PA. Music, gently swirling adds to the atmosphere.

The winner was the first player to score 16 points or who ever had the most points after 30 die rolls.

name: 1862: USA & Canada
description:
1862: USA&Canada is a railroad construction and stock game for 3 to 7 players. The author prefers to play with 4 or 5 players! Historical specifications have been taken into account as far as possible. In other places, history should and must be rewritten. It is based on 1862, set in the same region and with the same companies which was released in 2000.

Players invest in railway companies. They create a rail network with track tiles on the game board and drive these routes with their trains and generate income. The player with the most shares in a railway company is its director. He decides whether this income will be distributed to shareholders as a dividend or whether it will be added to the company's treasury for future investments. With 7 train types from 2 to 8, the progress over time and the technical development is shown.

As with many games in this series, there are similarities within the rules, but many have subtle differences that give each and every 18xx game its character.

1862: USA&Canada has an interesting set of differences described above.

These include: The companies gradually come into play in 3 groups. She can buy back shares, even from players, which is good for the company but bad for your share limit.

Bonus rides and tokens are integrated into the game in a new way. Trains can be bought either as "normal" trains or as E-trains and many other little things!

When developing 1862: USA&Canada, attention was paid to a reduce the playing time. A game lasts about 240 to 300 minutes.

-description from designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Trading

name: ハンプヤード (Hump Yard)
description:
ハンプヤード (Hump Yard) is a game from Japan. The game was originally published by project-ecn, and when that publisher reformed as 636GAMES (ロッサムゲームズ), they republished the game under new box art.

Connect, assemble, and launch freight trains!

This game is based on the theme of the 1960s Japanese National Railways freight depot. Become an employee of the switchyard responsible for logistics in Japan, sort the approaching freight trains, and set off freight trains heading for all over the country.

Departed freight cars score differently depending on their destination. Advance the game to your advantage while reading other players' destinations and moves.
publisher's summary

name: Stone Age Survival: A Solo Roll & Write Adventure
description:
Step back in time and face the unforgiving prehistoric world in Stone Age Survival, a solo roll-and-write adventure where you take on the role of a stone age hunter-gatherer. Utilize your skills, plan your hunting path wisely, and strategically gather resources to thrive in this harsh environment. Beware of fierce predators, natural hazards, and scarce food sources as you traverse the unforgiving landscape.

In this single-page A4 print-and-play game, all you need is a pencil, paper, and a 6-sided die (d6) to embark on a journey filled with strategy, resource management, and primal adventure. With unique character skills, a points-based scoring system, and limited exploration opportunities, Stone Age Survival offers a challenging and engaging gaming experience. Prove your resilience and adaptability as you strive to become the most successful hunter-gatherer in the land!

—description from the designer

name: The Warren Collection
description:
A series of over 70 (seventy) board game prototypes, dated from the late 1980s through to the late 'noughties', from retired Civil Servant and game enthusiast Trevor Warren.

Donated to The Museum of Board Games (Summer, 2022) - along with a file of correspondence with prospective UK-based publishers - the games have been extensively reviewed, catalogued and photographed, forming the basis of an exhibition and a series of BGG blog posts.

While many folks 'dabble' at board game design, Mr Warren's remarkable collection is a tribute to one person's devotion to - and ambition for - his favourite hobby.

The Museum of Board Games intends to publish a number of the games as part of a documentary book package.

name: Thumb Print Armies
description:
Create your own army using the ink pad and cards. Add weapons, headgear, and faces! You can even name them!

Then take your troops into battle against your opponent and try to capture his/her (its) troops. Capture your opponent's general and you've won the game

name: Wind & Waterfalls
description:
Wind & Waterfalls is inspired by the game Snakes & Ladders (originally called Mokshapat or Moksha Patamu).

A fantasy-tinged twist on a classic design, Wind & Waterfalls has travelers making their way up the mountain in a spiral formation. Will you get carried up by a strong wind? Will a waterfall carry you down, hindering your progress? Watch out for wild weather conditions, too.

Friends & Foes in the form of cryptids and creatures of the forest will either help or hinder your progress. Beware the Wild Cards - they may not be in your favor.

Wind & Waterfalls await. Welcome to the Mountain.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Word Magnates
description:
Two rival business magnates are competing to take control of a high-rise office tower.
Each owner operates a business on their side of the building.

Before leaving for the day, each of the owner’s employees pulls the shades on their windows to reveal random letters.

When the owners arrive back to work in the morning, they check to see what words have been made across the windows on their side.
The owner whose side of the tower has the best scoring words, wins that day.

After several days, the owner with the top score will control the building.

Word Magnates is a strategic word game for two players, aged 7+. It is a game of building a tower of two-sided magnetized letters without your opponent knowing what words they are making. It’s a game of secret word creation.

COMPONENTS:
- Lasercut tower with "windows" to view the letters.
- Built-in score board.
- 30 wooden black magnetic tiles.
- 30 wooden white magnetic tiles.

Each set of 30 magnetic tiles is coloured black on white or white on black and have point values (1-5).

SETUP:
1. Insert the tower into base.
2. Spread all the tiles face up.
3. Uncouple any tiles stuck together.
4. Group the tiles by colour into black and white sets.
5. Each player takes 10 black vowels (two each of A, E, I, O, U) and 10 white vowels.
6. Flip and shuffle the remaining tiles upside down within each group. Important: Do not mix the colours!
7. Each player takes half of the tiles from each group, placing them secretive in their own area.
8. Decide who will play which colour.
9. Grab paper and pencils for scoring.

GAME PLAY:
Either player starts by attaching one tile of each colour together and dropping both combined tiles into one of the three tower slots. Take turns attaching and dropping tiles. Make sure you always drop your coloured tile in front of you with the opposite tile as the other colour. Each player can only see their side of the tower. Try to drop letters such that their placement will help you make words and thwart your opponent.

FORMING WORDS:
As letters are dropped, words of three or more letters will eventually be formed in any of eight directions. These can be top to bottom, bottom to top, diagonal, across or backwards.

Keep dropping letters until the tower is full with 24 tiles (12 drops per player).

SCORING:
After completely filling the tower, scoring takes place. Players write down their words formed and tally the letter values. Players validate each other's words. Each player maintains their score on their built-in scoring track.

After scoring, turn the tower upside down to dump out the letters. Separate each set of tiles and detach the magnetic tiles.

BONUS POINTS:
Any player finding one word that their opponent missed will collect those points!

WINNING:
After several rounds, the first player to exceed 200 points (or a predetermined target) will be the winner. In case of a tie, the highest word made in the current round breaks the tie.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Stacking and Balancing, Tile Placement

name: Eye vs Eye
description:
Eye vs Eye, the second set in the episodic Viewniverse card game series, finds the Blinkers separated on the espionage world of Spytopia. Eyenstein and Iris must rescue Hawk who has been captured by his Spytopian counterpart. Their problems escalate as they encounter Silas, Eyenstein's evil nemesis, who is trying to steal blueprints for a device that could transport the Blinkers home. Join the Blinkers as they attempt to rescue Hawk and thwart Silas' evil plans. If the Blinkers escape Spytopia, catch them in the next episode - Prehistoric Park.

The number in the top-left-hand corner of each card indicates the number of Viewpoints the card is worth and the text at the bottom is the action to be performed. In turn, players simply draw a card from the Draw Pile and play a card from their hand into their Field of View.

At the end of their turn players count the Viewpoints of the cards in their Field of View, the first player to collect 100 or more Viewpoints wins. Viewpoint Revisioned gameplay is swift to dive into and deceptively strategic. Each card provides you with Viewpoints towards your objective as well as changing the game state in a variety of ways.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Prehistoric Park
description:
Prehistoric Park, the third set in the episodic Viewniverse card game series, transports the Blinkers to Menagerie, a world that is in the midst of a power struggle between the nefarious Doctor Crichton, a geneticist who has been creating peculiar creatures, and the rebellious Neandeyethal, one of Doctor Crichton's creations. Join the Blinkers as they are forced to pick a side whilst avoiding being eaten by the inhabitants of Menagerie. If the Blinkers escape Menagerie, catch them in the next episode - The Winking Dead.

The number in the top-left-hand corner of each card indicates the number of Viewpoints the card is worth and the text at the bottom is the action to be performed. In turn, players simply draw a card from the Draw Pile and play a card from their hand into their Field of View.

At the end of their turn players count the Viewpoints of the cards in their Field of View, the first player to collect 100 or more Viewpoints wins. An added alternative way to win is to be the first to collect three Regent Creatures. Prehistoric Park gameplay is swift to dive into and deceptively strategic. Each card provides you with Viewpoints towards your objective as well as changing the game state in a variety of ways.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: The Winking Dead
description:
Help Eyenstein and his one-eyed companions, Iris and Hawk, return to their home world of Myclopia after a lab accident strands them blinking around the Viewniverse. Harness the power of the Viewniverse by collecting Viewpoints to help the Blinkers return home!

The Winking Dead, the fourth set in the episodic Viewniverse card game series, sees the Blinkers finally getting a chance to relax on the idyllic world of Paradise. Their respite is cut short when they discover that a Zombeye plague is infecting the citizens of Paradise. Join the Blinkers as they try to eradicate the Zombeye plague. If the Blinkers escape Paradise, catch them in the next episode - Illuminati Wars.

The number in the top-left-hand corner of each card indicates the number of Viewpoints the card is worth and the text at the bottom is the action to be performed. In turn, players simply draw a card from the Draw Pile and play a card from their hand into their Field of View.

At the end of their turn players count the Viewpoints of the cards in their Field of View, the first player to collect 100 or more Viewpoints wins. An alternative way to win, is to be the last player to have seven zombeyes their Field of View and be overwhelmed by the zombeye plague. The Winking Dead gameplay is swift to dive into and deceptively strategic. Each card provides you with Viewpoints towards your objective as well as changing the game state in a variety of ways.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Party Game, Science Fiction, Zombies

name: Feet First Into Hell: Orbital Drop Combat Skirmish Game
description:
Feet First Into Hell is an easy to learn, succinct, squad-based sci-fi miniture skirmish game. It features unique orbital reinforcement rules and high customizability! Prepare to drop!

Feet First Into Hell is designed to get you into the action as quickly as possible. FFIH is built to combine the dramatic action and tension of games with high customizability, for a fast to play, accessible, and most importantly, SUCCINCT wargame.

In FFIH, players recruit their miniature "drop teams,” and then equip them with a wide array of weapons and versatile gear. By avoiding long, stingy army lists, the customizability is in your hands. You want to run a bunch of roided out armored space goombas? You can. Want to run a bunch of cyber-shinobi? You can. Your drop team is your drop team — but the game still maintains a fair balance through point allotment.

Once you have your team, you deploy from orbit, dropping your forces strategically onto the board. FFIH uses a straightforward d6 system to simulate the hectic battlefield. Players have a variety of movement options, including dynamic reactions that interact with the unique cover system that discards hits rather than requiring more math.

Lock, load, drop, roll, repeat.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Twilight of the Divine Right: With Fire and Sword – Eastern European Battles in the Period: 1605-1676
description:
'With Fire and Sword' is a supplement to the Twilight of Divine Right rules and need to be read in conjunction with these rules. It includes the rules, amendments and additions to fight the battle and wars in Eastern Europe in this era.

The players can field Polish-Lithuanian, Russian, Swedish, Cossack, Crimean Khanate (Tatar), Ottoman and other smaller armies in the wars of this era. A series of wars in this era transformed the world and helped shape the modern world.

These rules are accompanied by three scenario books featuring battles across the period.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Twilight of Divine Right: With Fire and Sword – Scenario Book 1: The Rise of Sweden, 1605 – 1629
description:
This book covers the rise of Sweden before their intervention in the Thirty Years War in 1630. It covers the wars of the Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth with Sweden in 1600–1611 and with the Russians in 1609-1618. Also the later war with Sweden in 1626 – 1629 when Gustaf II Adolf transformed the Swedish army. In addition there are some scenarios from the Commonwealth’s wars against the Ottomans in 1620 – 1621.

The booklet features 11 scenarios from 7 historical battles

Battles featured:
Kircholm, 1605
Klushino, 1611
Chochim, 1621
Gniew, 1626
Dirschau, 1627
Gorzno, 1629
Trzciana, 1629
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Twilight of Divine Right: With Fire and Sword – Scenario Book 2: The Deluge, 1632–1660
description:
This second book covers the battles during the period sometimes called the ‘Deluge’. The 'Deluge' period saw the Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth attacked by many armies. The booklet concentrates on the war of 1648 -1657 against the Cossack rebellion under Khmelnytsky. Also the campaigns of 1655 – 1660 is against the Swedes. In addition the Russians war against the Commonwealth in the Smolensk War of 1632 – 1634 is also covered. The first war that Russia started to modernise it's army. It is common for allies to be present on one or both sides in these battles.

The booklet features 8 scenarios from 6 historical battles and campaigns.

Battles featured:
Smolensk, 1633
Pyliavsti, 1648
Berestecko, 1651
Batoh, 1652
Zarnow, 1655
Warsaw, 1656
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Twilight of Divine Right: With Fire and Sword – Scenario Book 3: The Wars for the Ukraine, 1654–1676
description:
The third scenario book concentrates on the shifting war for the control of the Ukraine in the later part of this era but which continue to this day started to exercise some control over the Ukraine. The Thirteen Years War of 1654 – 1667 featuring various combinations of Polish-Lithuanian, Russian, Cossack and Crimean Khanate (Tatar) forces. In addition some of the scenarios are from the Commonwealth's war against the Ottomans and Crimean Khanate as they renewed there attempts to dominate the Ukraine in 1672 -1676.

The booklet features 11 scenarios from 9 historical battles and campaigns.

Battles featured:
Konotop, 1659
Polonka, 1660
Chudow Campaign, 1660
1st Lubar, 14th September 1660
2nd Lubar, 16th September 1660
Slobodyszcze, 1660
Kanev, 1662
Chocim, 1673
Zurawno, 1676
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Rolling Zombies
description:
NOTE! Funding campaign was cancelled on 2023 and campaign might be relaunched at some later date.

In Rolling Zombies, you will find yourself in a post-apocalyptic world, where the living dead roam the wasteland, and five factions battle for survival. Each faction controls a base and sends out their members to scavenge for resources, explore ruins, and fight off zombies and rival factions.

The game is played using mechanics from the popular "Yachts" dice game, where players roll a set of dice to achieve various combinations and scores. In Rolling Zombies, players roll dice to move their characters, collect resources, and fight off
zombies and rival factions.

Zombie hordes spawn randomly and start moving around the map. Players get points for destroying them, but the horde can be also turned to start moving towards another direction.

Victory points are awarded for defeated enemy units. There is also an ancient fortress in the centre of the map and defeating it awards victory points and game end. At the end victory points are given also for the area controlled by each player.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Clans of Midgard
description:
Clans of Midgard is a draft, write, and fight game in which players play as leaders of Viking clans seeking to gain glory!

Conquer territory, fight monsters, sail the seas in your drakkar, collect powerful runes, and honor your warriors who have passed onto Valhalla.

The player who best achieves these goals will earn the most glory and be forever remembered as a Hero of the Viking Age!

Players are dealt a hand of cards and then draft one of the cards and hand the rest to the player on their left. They continue to do this until they have no more cards.

All the players reveal their cards at the same time and then begin marking off their rewards on their sheet.

They will collect Viking Runes, defeat monsters, deploy Vikings, and collect the power of the Valkyries. Each card can give multiple effects.

Areas of the board will be checked to see if a battle ensues, and the player with the most vikings will claim those areas for bonus points. Players whose vikings fell in battle will travel to Valhalla and will be rewarded for their valor.

After three rounds of drafting and writing, the player with the most points will win the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Greater Than Lessons
description:
Players state sentences using the number on the card they flipped, the symbol on the die they rolled, and the numbers on the cards in their hand. The players accumulate cards by putting flipped and played cards in their pile in front of them. Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins!

-description from designer

name: 부동산 거물: 첫 번째 도시 – 한국어판 특별 확장 (Magnate: The First City – Korean Exclusive Promo)
description:
Promo created for Korean Edition features a unique set of 4 new tenant cards and 8 corresponding tenant tokens with a special Korean cultural theme.

Tenants: Fried Chicken Joint, Idol Agency, Examinee, Korean Rice Wine Brewery

name: Six Winters
description:
Six Winters is a cooperative fantasy campaign game featuring dice-based puzzles for one to four players inspired by the Wrath of the Autarch tabletop role-playing game.

Players control Brightdune, a region under threat from the Empire of the Autarch. The Autarch works to achieve a sorcerous apotheosis, which would spell certain doom for Brightdune. The players have six winters to stop this from happening. Each game of Six Winters is 90-120 minutes long and plays out one year in the chronicle of Brightdune.

Each session players select from a rotating cast of unique characters to make progress against the Empire. The same number of players do not have to play each game in the campaign.

During the campaign, new characters and locations may be unlocked, transforming the world and opening up new strategic possibilities.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Variable Player Powers

name: Wanyama: The Zodiac Attacks
description:
Become a candidate for the chief of a clan who can communicate with animals (Wanyama) and borrow their power and win the race to determine the clan's chief with the help of the animals.

In Wanyama: The Zodiac Attacks zodiac animals attack after hearing rumors of a race from rabbits, and race with the help of these animals.

This game is played by gaining points as you draw cards and play them against your opponents, you can play this game in a short time with a steady rhythm.

name: SLOTKER
description:
SLOTKER playing cards are based on a standard 52-card deck of poker playing cards, with each card displaying one of six classic and familiar slot machine symbols (Lemons, Cherries, Oranges, Plums, Bells and Bars), with each card simulating one reel of a 3-reel slot machine.

The goal of most SLOTKER card games is to make the best or highest-ranking 3-of-a-kind hand, with either poker card values (above the card suits) or slot machine symbols (below the card suits), and the games are designed to simulate the action of a 3-reel slot machine, often with progressively-increasing payouts (antes required by players) when a single round of hands results with no winner.

Slot machine symbol rankings are based on the quantities of each slot machine symbol distributed throughout the deck and make a smooth and logical transition into poker card value rankings.

3-of-a-kind poker cards outrank all 3-of-a-kind slot machine symbols, and when two or more players hold the same three matching slot machine symbols, the winner is determined by the highest-ranking 3-card poker hand, using standard poker rankings, from highest to lowest: Flush, Straight, One-pair and High-card hands.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Matching, Multi-Use Cards, Simulation

name: Monopoly: WWE
description:
All your favorite WWE Superstars and Divas in one board game. Step into the ring. Your incredible WWE Superstars, events and technology are all here. Buy mezzanine seats and move to ringside seats, then watch the money rain down. Negotiate and manage your way to the top, but be careful, because there's only room for one.

For everyone else, there's bankruptcy. Market for success, you can own it all!

name: Playworld: Rhyming Snap
description: A Snap variant for young children. Instead of 'snapping' the same cards, players here must 'snap' cards that rhyme. Example: Boat and coat. The one who collects the most cards is the winner.

name: Evolutopia
description:
The situation is critical!

Uncontrolled development and climate change have brought your city to the brink of chaos…

Together, take matters into your own hands and transform your city into "Evolutopia", a city that takes care of its inhabitants and the planet.

Citizens of Evolutopia, it's up to you!

You have to implement changes in the city to make all the existing problems disappear but also to make sufficient progress in 3 of the 5 key indicators. To reach this goal, you will select and assign experts to carry out the evolutions.

But these experts will also have to be used to manage crises which, if they accumulate, will cause you to lose the game.

Each of you will be assigned special powers (roles) and may have access to good plans to help you accomplish your common mission.

Players either all win together or all lose together.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Stratic
description:
Stratic is a 2 player abstract strategy game, played on regular 8x8x8 hex board, requires 40 pieces in two colors, optionally can use additional tiles placed on the board to change its layout.

Players place 2 pieces on the board in their turn trying to take control over goal fields/tiles. Pieces and goals on board have area of influence preventing placement directly adjacent to them unless placed adjacent to own piece. Pieces are captured when adjacent to 3 or more opponent pieces or if there is no valid path (blocked by opponent area of influence and pieces but also goals) to own base. Base is two pieces stack (or dedicated piece) placed by players on goals and as part of initial setup.

—description from the designer

name: Dinosaur Dash
description:
Dinosaur Dash is a game for the whole family.

Designed with simple mechanics for ages 3+ whilst having a depth of choice in gameplay that engages older players up to age 12. Choose which card to play each turn to move yourself forwards and land on bonus movement spaces.

Play competitive or cooperative mode. In competitive mode you race against the other dinosaurs to reach the finish line first. In cooperative mode you must work together to make sure all players make it to safety before the raptors catch you. This game cultivates strategy, decision making skills, cooperation and mathematical skills.

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Girls Edition
description:
The fabulous expansion of the cult game STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN.

The ultimate game block with 23 girly and fun categories for an unforgettable girls' night out with friends. Fun guaranteed!

This game promotes knowledge and creativity!

The GIRLS EDITION includes an exciting variety with 23 different categories.

Examples: Cosmetic product, can be seen at the seaside, fits in any handbag, typical boys, candy, is healthy and many more!

Innovative letter bar against cheaters.

Simply wipe the letter bar with your index finger. When one of your teammates says "STOP", the letter to play with is fixed.

This ultimate game block in A4 format contains 50 sheets. This provides for many extensive game evenings with family and friends.

GAME PROCEDURE:
Each player receives one side of the A3 block and places it in front of them. A time is set for each round (we recommend 2 minutes as a limit). The innovative letter bar helps to determine the letter. Then it is a matter of entering all the terms as quickly as possible. There are 13 terms sought per round.

POINT DISTRIBUTION:

You can't think of a correct term = 0 points
At least one other player has the same term as you = 5 points
No other player has the same term as you = 10 points
You are the only one who can think of a term in the category = 20 points.


In addition, there are so-called FULL POST fields where you always get double the points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die fabelhafte Erweiterung des Kultspiels STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN

Der ultimative Spielblock mit 23 mädchenhaften und lustigen Kategorien für einen unvergesslichen Mädelsabend mit Freunden. Spaß garantiert!

Dieses Spiel fördert Wissen und Kreativität!

Die GIRLS EDITION beinhaltet eine spannende Vielfalt mit 23 verschiedenen Kategorien.

Beispiele: Kosmetikprodukt, sieht man am Meer, passt in jede Handtasche, typisch Jungs, Süßigkeit, ist gesund und viele mehr!

Innovative Buchstabenleiste gegen Schummler.

Wische einfach mit dem Zeigefinger über die Buchstabenleiste. Wenn einer deiner Mitspieler “STOPP” sagt, steht der Buchstabe fest, mit dem gespielt werden muss.

Dieser ultimative Spielblock im DIN A4 Format beinhaltet 50 Blatt. So ist für viele ausgiebige Spielabende mit Familie und Freunden gesorgt.

Perfekt zum Verschenken oder den nächsten Urlaub.

SPIELABLAUF:
Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A3 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Es wird eine Zeit pro Durchgang ausgemacht (wir empfehlen 2 Minuten als Begrenzung). Die innovative Buchstabenleiste hilft bei der Ermittlung des Buchstabens. Dann gilt es so schnell wie möglich alle Begriffe einzutragen. Pro Runde sind 13 Begriffe gesucht.
PUNKTEVERTEILUNG:

Dir fällt kein richtiger Begriff ein = 0 Punkte
Mindestens ein Mitspieler hat denselben Begriff wie du = 5 Punkte
Kein Mitspieler hat den denselben Begriff wie du = 10 Punkte
Dir ist als Einziger ein Begriff in der Kategorie eingefallen = 20 Punkte


Außerdem gibt es sogenannte VOLLPFOSTEN-Felder bei denen man stets die doppelte Punktzahl erhält.

—description from the publisher

name: Galactic Infamy
description:
Galactic Infamy is a competitive, sci-fi themed board game in which players take on the roles of bounty hunters in search of the galaxy's most notorious crime lord.

Fight and capture bounties, then turn them in for rewards of Credits and Infamy. Purchase better equipment and skills to take on more difficult bounties and defend yourself from other players.

The first player to turn in any crime lord triggers the end of the game and the bounty hunter with the most Infamy wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Income, Player Elimination, Re-rolling and Locking, Take That, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Catro Chip
description:
Catro Chip is a strategy game for 2 people. Each player gets the figures, cubes and plates of a color. The figures are placed on the baseline, the rest of the material is placed ready.
From the basic position, 2 fields are pulled with each figure. This basic train can be changed by either putting a cube with a sensible number to the figure or adding a tile that allows a directional dwelling up to a maximum of 90 ° or even uses both. If a figure is on the field on which the train is finished, it is removed from the game. This also applies to your own characters.
You won if the opponent either no longer has any characters or can no longer pull because he has already used up his cubes.

—user summary

name: Namibia "Short Game"
description:
The "short game" is half a 18xx and half a Eurogame.
It playable with the components from the base game.
In addition, a small number of special cards, tokens and the rules are needed. I will soon make the game material available for free download.

name: Farbenbärchen
description:
Children can easily learn colours with this funny game.
Every child has a nice, colorful bear with which they collect some wooden pearls on a track. The child who has collected all 6 pearls at first wins.
In a second variant, the children need to collect the pearls in the correct order.
Whereas in the first two variants, the children are playing with a dice with colours, they use a dice with numbers from 1-6 in the third variant.

name: Das große TV-Quiz
description: The game includes a DVD which features 10 quiz tournaments with interesting questions, images, movies and 4 answers to select from. One tournament consists of 6 questions. The player who answers all of them correctly, wins.

name: Prof. Theo Tausendfüßler's lustige Pantoffelsuche
description:
Theo Centipedes comes home and doesn't remember where he left all his slippers!
Every child gets a board with the sleeping Theo and some places where to put his slippers. All cards are shuffled and put face down on the table. Then the players take turns clock-wise. Each player announces, which card he is looking for - eg. the one with 3 blue slippers - and then takes the next card and puts it face up on the table.- If the card matches what the player announced, he gets the card and put it on his board.
The player who is the first one with all cards on his board wins.

—user summary

name: Apocalypse Meow
description:
A fast and deadly blend of hide-and-seek and press-your-luck! An asymmetrical, hidden movement game with a post-apocalyptic-punk-rock theme. Up to four Mice earn points scavenging high-value food (day-old sardines, rogue cereal bits) from a colorful apartment with a randomized floor plan.

Stay hidden while you scavenge because one player is the powerful Cat, protecting its hoard and earning points for each Mouse it catches. The Cat draws Traits, such as "Hiss-terical," and "Chonky" to get an edge on the Mice, who each have unique abilities to help them stay hidden, scavenge for scraps and escape with their lives!
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: エルフの森、燃えるってよ (The Elven Forest is burning)
description:
The king sent out a request throughout the entire island to find a living elf. The reason remained a mystery, but rumour spread that the king, growing old witouth an heir, was looking for the secret of longevity that elves are believed to possess. The entire nation is in uproar, searching for elves, and your land is no safer from that great ambition. Finding an elf and bringing it to the king would make your land a most prosperous one. However, your ambitions prevent you from helping to achieve your king’s goal. You must find the elves somehow and establish a trade relationship with them. Not only the treasures, but also the resources and maybe the secret of their longevity could be a great help in achieving your ambitions.

In this game, players go through a draft sequence to select the Character Card they will be using for a turn. Players pick between one of two abilities off the character card they drafted to help them in their goal of placing down 6 pioneering card to acquire victory points and win the game. Failure will result in burning down the forest and depending on the ending, points will be calculated differently in regards to the cards placed down on the table.

Will you have what it take to play dirty? Or will you play fair to achieve a prosperous ending?
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hidden Roles, Take That
publishers: 深夜二時のドワーフ (Dwarf at 2 a.m.)

name: Quadros
description:
Whoever can form a square or rectangle first wins. The goal of the game must be reached by turning a wooden plate. If both players reach the goal in the same turn, there is a draw. At Brändi Quadros, the material impresses. It is played on four wooden boards, each with eight wells in which a wooden ball fits. The wooden panels, in turn, are placed on a felt pad. As simple as "Brändi Quadros" seems to be, after a while your head will start spinning - you don't want to give your opponent a finished rectangle.

—description from the publisher

name: José García Saves the Alhambra
description:
During the Spanish War of Independence in the early 1800s, Napoleon's army occupied the centuries-old Islamic fortress and palace in Granada: the Alhambra. When the French finally withdrew before advancing Spanish and allied forces, the French commander ordered the destruction of the Alhambra with explosives. But one Spanish soldier, José García, despite having injury and wounds from a previous battle, raced through the 26-acre complex, disarming bombs and saving this amazing piece of history.

José García Saves the Alhambra is a solitaire game commemorating this story. All you need is a regular deck of cards and one six-sided die to play. Download the game for free from the itch.io webpage.

—description from the publisher

name: Smugglers and Cruisers
description:
Smugglers and Cruisers is a 1930's game where one players plays a smuggler trying to evade the revenue men along the remote Northern Australian coastline. A second player has 5 revenue men to try and surround the Smuggler so he cannot move. If the Smuggler can evade the revenue men and reach one of several caves on the Northern Australian shore he is the winner but if he is trapped by the revenue men then the other player wins the game.

Produced in Australia by the National Game Company in Ballarat and credited as Australia's first large scale manufacturer of board games. The game came in two sizes a larger square box and board and a smaller rectangular box.

name: Brickyard
description:
Brickyard is a pick up and delivery game for two players, where you run a brick supply company trying to fulfill your customer’s orders for the day. Unfortunately, bricks are in short supply at the Brickyard and your competitor is trying to satisfy their customers’ orders as well. It is a frantic race of getting the most bricks in the short amount of time.

You will have four orders to fulfill for the game. With each turn you are moving your dump trucks around the board to different dig sites. Once there, you will load as many bricks tokens as your dump truck can hold. The first player to fulfill all four orders wins the game. Plan your day well, for your opponent is certainly planning theirs.

Game Overview: Players will have 12 action points (AP) to use for their turn. Players then take turns moving their dump trucks around the board to get to certain dig sites. Here they will load up bricks that their customers want. Players will take their loads to the unloading zone and place them on their order sheets. Once unloaded, their trucks will go back into the Brickyard to get more bricks.

-description from designer

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Sport Edition
description:
The dynamic expansion of the cult game STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN around the theme of sports.

The ultimate game block with 23 creative and fun categories for an unforgettable gaming experience among sports fans. Fun guaranteed!

Sports fun for family & friends

The SPORT EDITION includes an exciting variety with 23 different categories.

Examples: Sport, Tennis Pro, Sports Injury, Unsportsmanlike Conduct, Sports Nutrition, Racer and many more!

Innovative letter bar against cheaters.

Simply swipe your index finger over the letter bar. When one of your teammates says "STOP", the letter to play with is fixed.

This ultimate game block in A4 format contains 50 sheets. This provides for many extensive game evenings with family and friends.

Perfect to give away or the next vacation.

GAME PROCEDURE:
Each player receives one side of the A4 block and places it in front of them. A time is set for each round (we recommend 2 minutes as a limit). The innovative letter bar helps to determine the letter. Then it is a matter of entering all the terms as quickly as possible. There are 13 terms sought per round.

POINT DISTRIBUTION:

You can't think of a correct term = 0 points
At least one other player has the same term as you = 5 points
No other player has the same term as you = 10 points
You are the only one who can think of a term in the category = 20 points.


In addition, there are so-called FULL POST fields where you always get double the points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die dynamische Erweiterung des Kultspiels STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN rund ums Thema Sport.

Der ultimative Spielblock mit 23 kreativen und lustigen Kategorien für ein unvergessliches Spielerlebnis unter Sportsfreunden. Spaß garantiert!

Sportspaß für Familie & Freunde

Die SPORT EDITION beinhaltet eine spannende Vielfalt mit 23 verschiedenen Kategorien.

Beispiele: Sportart, Tennisprofi, Sportverletzung, unsportliches Verhalten, Sportnahrung, Rennfahrer und viele mehr!

Innovative Buchstabenleiste gegen Schummler.

Wische einfach mit dem Zeigefinger über die Buchstabenleiste. Wenn einer deiner Mitspieler “STOPP” sagt, steht der Buchstabe fest, mit dem gespielt werden muss.

Dieser ultimative Spielblock im DIN A4 Format beinhaltet 50 Blatt. So ist für viele ausgiebige Spielabende mit Familie und Freunden gesorgt.

Perfekt zum Verschenken oder den nächsten Urlaub.

SPIELABLAUF:
Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A4 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Es wird eine Zeit pro Durchgang ausgemacht (wir empfehlen 2 Minuten als Begrenzung). Die innovative Buchstabenleiste hilft bei der Ermittlung des Buchstabens. Dann gilt es so schnell wie möglich alle Begriffe einzutragen. Pro Runde sind 13 Begriffe gesucht.
PUNKTEVERTEILUNG:

Dir fällt kein richtiger Begriff ein = 0 Punkte
Mindestens ein Mitspieler hat denselben Begriff wie du = 5 Punkte
Kein Mitspieler hat den denselben Begriff wie du = 10 Punkte
Dir ist als Einziger ein Begriff in der Kategorie eingefallen = 20 Punkte


Außerdem gibt es sogenannte VOLLPFOSTEN-Felder bei denen man stets die doppelte Punktzahl erhält.

—description from the publisher

name: SuperSmart Blockhead: Classic Edition
description:
The famous STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN - now in English!


Play block in A3 format in English.
This XXL block is probably the most versatile city-country river of all time. (ENGLISH LANGUAGE]
Do you know a soccer player with M? Or a spice with G?
Do you know a musician with B and quickly think of a vegetable with F?
52 fun categories will make any amateur thinker sweat. Fun guaranteed!


GAME PROCEDURE:
Each player receives one side of the A3 block and places it in front of them. A time is set for each round (we recommend 2 minutes as a limit). The innovative letter bar helps to determine the letter. Then it is a matter of entering all the terms as quickly as possible. There are 13 terms sought per round.

POINT DISTRIBUTION:

You can't think of a correct term = 0 points
At least one other player has the same term as you = 5 points
No other player has the same term as you = 10 points
You are the only one who can think of a term in the category = 20 points.


In addition, there are so-called FULL POST fields where you always get double the points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das berühmte STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN – jetzt in englischer Sprache!


Spielblock im DIN A3-Format auf englisch
Dieser XXL-Block ist das wahrscheinlich vielseitigste Stadt-Land-Fluss aller Zeiten. (ENGLISCHE SPRACHE)
Kennst du einen Fußballspieler mit M? Oder ein Gewürz mit G?
Kennst du einen Musiker mit B und fällt dir schnell eine Gemüsesorte mit F ein?


– 52 lustige Kategorien bringen jeden Hobbydenker ins Schwitzen. Spaß garantiert!

SPIELABLAUF:
Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A3 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Es wird eine Zeit pro Durchgang ausgemacht (wir empfehlen 2 Minuten als Begrenzung). Die innovative Buchstabenleiste hilft bei der Ermittlung des Buchstabens. Dann gilt es so schnell wie möglich alle Begriffe einzutragen. Pro Runde sind 13 Begriffe gesucht.

PUNKTEVERTEILUNG:

Dir fällt kein richtiger Begriff ein = 0 Punkte
Mindestens ein Mitspieler hat denselben Begriff wie du = 5 Punkte
Kein Mitspieler hat den denselben Begriff wie du = 10 Punkte
Dir ist als Einziger ein Begriff in der Kategorie eingefallen = 20 Punkte


Außerdem gibt es sogenannte VOLLPFOSTEN-Felder bei denen man stets die doppelte Punktzahl erhält.

—description from the publisher

name: Tipi
description:
Tipi is a boardgames for kids. The player have 5 indians that he should hide under some plastic teepes. An indian can be hidden only if the teepee is empty. The player has to remember which teepees are empty or full. A wheel will determined how many indians should be hidden in a turn (from 1 to 3) or if all teepees should be mixed.
The payer has to announced if a teepee if empty or not before putting his indian below. If it's empty and the player was right, the indian is hidden. If it's full and the player was right, the indian that was here is expulsed and the player can put his own.
The first player who hides all his indians wins.

name: Fail to Grow
description:
Fail to Grow is a fast and fun game about the many ways life can trigger our fixed mindset, and how we can recognize those moments and respond to them with a growth mindset.

The game is for 4 players who will play cards to build a fixed mindset.

Each player has a hand of cards that are played to develop a fixed mindset by playing Fixed Mindset cards on themselves while playing Growth mindset habits on their opponents.

The winner is the player with the largest total of fixed mindset points. The game is designed to understand fixed and growth mindsets to see what habits encourage both.

Component Details:
1 game board, 4 story boards, 71 story cards, 14 wild cards, 1 large custom 6-sided die, 1 score pad, 2 pencils, 1 game play instructions pamphlet

name: Brain Train
description:
Brain Train is an educational math game where players use math and dice to defeat or hold off an oncoming zombie horde. Player characters add special abilities and allow up to 4 players to join in a cooperative fight.

Each turn, players will roll 3 of their 4 six-sided dice. The fourth represents the player's life total. Using addition, subtraction, multiplication and division, the player will try to match target numbers on the zombie cards in order to stop or defeat the zombies. Players must use all 3 dice each turn. At the end of the turn, the remaining zombie cards move closer and new zombies join behind them. Players beware, if a zombie card moves close enough to attack you will lose one life point from your life die.

The game ends when the player has received 6 zombie bites or when the players have defeated the boss zombie.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Oster Edition
description:
The spring-fresh edition of the cult game STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN around the theme of bunnies and eggs.

The ultimate game block with 26 creative and fun categories for an unforgettable Easter with family and friends.

This game promotes knowledge and creativity!

The EASTER EDITION includes an exciting variety with 26 different categories.

Examples: something green, color for colorful eggs, typical spring, on the picnic blanket and many more!

Innovative letter bar against cheaters.

Simply swipe your index finger across the letter bar. When one of your teammates says "STOP", the letter to play with is fixed.

This ultimate game block in A4 format contains 50 sheets. This provides for many extensive game evenings with family and friends.

GAME PROCEDURE:
Each player receives one side of the A3 block and places it in front of them. A time is set for each round (we recommend 2 minutes as a limit). The innovative letter bar helps to determine the letter. Then it is a matter of entering all the terms as quickly as possible. There are 13 terms sought per round.

POINT DISTRIBUTION:
- You can't think of a correct term = 0 points
- At least one other player has the same term as you = 5 points
- No other player has the same term as you = 10 points
- You are the only one who can think of a term in the category = 20 points.
In addition, there are so-called FULL POST fields where you always get double the points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die frühlingsfrische Edition des Kultspiels STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN rund ums Thema Hasen und Eier.

Der ultimative Spielblock mit 26 kreativen und lustigen Kategorien für ein unvergessliches Osterfest mit Familie und Freunde.

Dieses Spiel fördert Wissen und Kreativität!

Die OSTER EDITION beinhaltet eine spannende Vielfalt mit 26 verschiedenen Kategorien.

Beispiele: etwas Grünes, Farbe für bunte Eier, typisch Frühling, auf der Picknickdecke und viele mehr!

Innovative Buchstabenleiste gegen Schummler.

Wische einfach mit dem Zeigefinger über die Buchstabenleiste. Wenn einer deiner Mitspieler “STOPP” sagt, steht der Buchstabe fest, mit dem gespielt werden muss.

Dieser ultimative Spielblock im DIN A4 Format beinhaltet 50 Blatt. So ist für viele ausgiebige Spielabende mit Familie und Freunden gesorgt.

Perfekt zum Verschenken.

SPIELABLAUF:
Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A3 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Es wird eine Zeit pro Durchgang ausgemacht (wir empfehlen 2 Minuten als Begrenzung). Die innovative Buchstabenleiste hilft bei der Ermittlung des Buchstabens. Dann gilt es so schnell wie möglich alle Begriffe einzutragen. Pro Runde sind 13 Begriffe gesucht.
PUNKTEVERTEILUNG:
• Dir fällt kein richtiger Begriff ein = 0 Punkte
• Mindestens ein Mitspieler hat denselben Begriff wie du = 5 Punkte
• Kein Mitspieler hat den denselben Begriff wie du = 10 Punkte
• Dir ist als Einziger ein Begriff in der Kategorie eingefallen = 20 Punkte
Außerdem gibt es sogenannte VOLLPFOSTEN-Felder bei denen man stets die doppelte Punktzahl erhält.

—description from the publisher

name: Survivor: Broken City
description:
One day in the 21st century the city was destroyed and isolated by a zombie attack. The last nine, who barely survived, must now try to survive on the remaining resources. Of course, things may not go amicably...

Players roll dice to move around the city, enter locations to search for items in the form of cards and use these cards to battle other players and wandering zombies. Players can also raid other player's home bases in the form of their start locations. The last player standing is the winner.

name: Freakz in the Sheetz: The Freaky Fryday Pack!
description:
From back of title card

New Pack, New Rulez, Freakz!

We've added NEW memez and captionz to our Freakz in the Sheetz menu! Play by REVERSE rulez!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Aussie Trivia Challenge
description: Finally play a trivia game that’s all Australian based trivia! Perfect for Australia Day festivities, holidays, camping and fans of the land down under. The first player to complete their boxing kangaroo image wins – find out who the ‘bloody know it all’ is! Watch out for steal cards, someone might pinch a bit of your roo!

name: Yard of the Month (Revised edition)
description:
In the pristine little neighborhood of Gnome Crossing, the competition for the highly coveted award of “Yard of the Month” is fierce. The residents will stop at nothing to win, including sabotage. While some gnomes will beautify and protect a garden, some gnomes will curse it, resulting in quite the eyesore.

Will you be the first to fill your garden with 10 flowers and be crowned “Yard of the Month,” or will you be the laughing stock of the neighborhood?

Yard of the Month is a family-friendly card game for 2 - 6 players, ages 8 and up. In the game, each player (neighbor) is competing to have the best flower garden. You have access to resources to either help or hinder a garden, including the garden gnomes Gnick and Gnack. While Gnick will keep your garden safe, Gnack's goal is to curse it, but that isn't anything a hammer can't handle.

Originally released in 2016, Yard of the Month (Revised edition) offers new art, revised rules and new cards to enhance gameplay.

—description from the designer

name: Race to the Moons
description:
The year is 2169 and mankind has pretty much filled up the Earth. It has been 200 years since man first set foot on the Moon. Now there are cities on the Moon and Mars, and mining communities in the asteroid belt. But our Solar System is just the beginning. It might be home, but Earth is the only truly hospitable planet nearby. However, recent breakthroughs in warp travel mean that interstellar voyages are finally a reality.

There are several extrasolar systems that have been discovered to have planets and moons which appear to be very Earthlike, and likely hospitable. The nearest of these is in the Gamma Leporis tri-star system, 29 light years away from Earth. A series of moons orbiting a gas giant named Yutu show breathable atmospheres, tolerable radiation levels, reasonable temperatures, liquid water, and plenty of land. Now, the race is on. Terran, Lunar, Martian, and Belter organizations are competing to be the first to send humans to one of these habitable moons and establish a permanent human colony. It will take research, determination, and a bit of luck to be the first to arrive. Do you have what it takes to drive the next great space triumph and win the Race to the Moons?

Overview:
Race to the Moons is a worker placement game where 2-5 players (solo variant included) are working to research the technology needed to complete an interstellar mission and be the first to found a human colony on a moon system around a gas planet in another solar system. Players must research technologies that affect different parts of the mission: Journey, Arrival & Landing, and Colonization, as well as Training their crew. Players must also work on building rockets, building facilities (research labs, factories, launch stations, and more), managing money, and improving public opinion. Players race to have their rockets arrive at the destination and set up a successful colony to earn enough points to beat the competition.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Rogue Torney
description:
The city's rogues and thieves prepare for the most famous tournament in the country. The thieves are already meeting in the capital and waiting for the signal to start. The first to get a treasure from the Royal castle wins.

A game for 2 to 5 players where speed of dice rolls and cunning are all it takes to win.

Goal: Be the first rogue to get a treasure by gathering 3 cards of the same treasure.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Re-rolling and Locking, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Escape the Guillotine
description:
It was a routine mission back in time, but everything has gone terribly wrong. While searching the abandoned mansion of a wealthy Parisian, you find yourselves captured by an angry mob who have mistaken you as supporters of King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette. Now, you have been locked up in a shabby prison cell with a view overlooking the dreaded Guillotine. In just over an hour, you are scheduled to be executed before a massive crowd. It is up to you to find a way out of your prison cell, to blend into the crowd of Revolutionaries, and to rescue your fellow agents before it is too late and they face their fate at the Guillotine. Pulling off an escape like this will test the nerve of even the most experienced escape artists. Whatever you do… don’t lose your head.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.
