These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: El Juego de Soria
description: This is a fun family game, for adults and children of the house, which reproduces the day to day life of the city of Soria. Players will have fun going through the streets and trying to acquire establishments and companies that are part of Soria and its daily life. The game of Soria puts the players in contact with the main streets and the most outstanding monuments of the city.

name: Borzoi Borzoi
description:
Collect the longest dogs in this zany, fast-paced game for 2-5 players.

Drafting from rotating hands of five cards, players construct their dogs from matching sets of heads, middles and ends. Longer dogs containing more cards will score more at the end of the game, but only if you manage to complete them.

Will you settle for a bog-standard pooch? Or stretch both your dog and your luck for a chance of a higher score?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Bandido: Agora Vai! (1)
description:
Have you always dreamed of beating Bandido but never managed to? Managed to win a match in 20?

Your time has come. Now go!

To give you a little help in your matches, the "Go Now!" they only have 4 exits (as opposed to the original game where there are 5 or 6 exits) and greatly improve your chance of capturing the bandit.

Use one of the 5 "Go Now!" as the starting card of your game, in place of the original card and try to win with this "little help".

Play with children? Use the cards to simplify your games!

Numbered from 1 to 5, these cards are dealt separately. Collect them all!

name: Bandido: Agora Vai! (4)
description:
Have you always dreamed of beating Bandido but never managed to? Managed to win a match in 20?

Your time has come. Now go!

To give you a little help in your matches, the "Go Now!" they only have 4 exits (as opposed to the original game where there are 5 or 6 exits) and greatly improve your chance of capturing the bandit.

Use one of the 5 "Go Now!" as the starting card of your game, in place of the original card and try to win with this "little help".

Play with children? Use the cards to simplify your games!

Numbered from 1 to 5, these cards are dealt separately. Collect them all!

name: Jogo do Gato e Rato
description:
In the game, each player takes 8 discs from a character (cat or mouse).

The first player places a disk on the table, starting a disk stack.

The second player can choose to place a new disk on the table, starting a new disk stack or place a new disk on top of an existing disk stack or move the disk that is on top of an exiting disk stack

And so it goes on alternating shifts.

Each disk stack can have a maximum of 3 disks.

The first player to have 5 character discs appearing on the table wins the game.

In no time you can look at the disks that are under the stack. When removing a disk from the top of a stack, it is mandatory to move it.

name: Steel Rift: Burning Horizons
description:
Having survived tremendous upheaval following sudden, cataclysmic solar activity, forces still left on Earth and around the solar system vie for control of resources, land and technology.

Pressing out from their makeshift refuges, armed with giant mechs, the remnants of human factions forge new alliances and wage war to survive what might be lurking just over the horizon.

This book contains rules for:

Equipping your HE-Vs with new motive systems
Using new secondary mission objectives
Fielding new support assets like Ultra-Light HE-Vs, vehicles, and infantry squads
Organizing and playing in Steel Rift campaigns


—description from the back of the book

In the near future, in the wake of crippling solar flares, the remnants of humanity fight for resources, order, and sometimes glory.

Steel Rift is a fast paced skirmish game featuring highly configurable mechs called HE-Vs. Played on a 3’ x 3’ table, it’s easy to set up almost anywhere.

Reinforcements have arrived.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Travel Bug
description:
The Travel Bug Board Game (Australian Edition) will take you on a trip of a lifetime.

See Australia by road, rail, air or sea. Collect photos of landmarks, plants and animals, enjoy amazing travels and return home safely. Earn points by travelling and collecting souvenirs.

How to play

Travel around by using different types of transport (4WD, Plane, Cruise Ship, Train)

Score points depending on the length of your trip.

Collect Souvenirs

Score points for collecting different plants, animals and landmarks.

Travel Bug coin

Which travel bug have you caught? – a strong desire to travel (wanderlust) or travelers stomach bug? Toss a coin and find out!

Try Your Luck

Got a Try Your Luck card? – find out if good luck is on your side today! In the Travel Bug game, good luck will bring you exciting travels and more souvenirs, while bad luck could make you face wild crocodiles, spiders, tropical cyclones and even a bushfire.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Lose a Turn, Negotiation, Physical Removal, Point to Point Movement

name: The Last Battle on Earth
description:
A hundred years have passed since the world witnessed the first detonation of an atomic bomb, marking the beginning of a new era for human kind. An era which now has ended as the last atomic bombs ever produced have been used in war. Only a small fraction of the world's population has survived, consisting mainly of various military groups whose days are numbered as radiation poisoning from nuclear fallout, as well as the uncontrolled spread of biological weapons, is quickly claiming the lives of the last survivors.

As a leader of a remaining military faction, you have devised a plan to take the survival of humanity into your own hands. You have set up a base in the northernmost regions of Scandinavia, an area which has been spared from the worst bombings. Before the war, the world's most advanced space faring operations were being conducted here and you have managed to secure a disassembled but otherwise functional lunar rocket left behind from those times. On the Moon's surface, a self-sustainable base was once constructed as part of the Swedish space program, but it has not been inhabited for many years now. If you could get a crew there, that base could serve as a new home for the last humans. And maybe in a distant future when Earth is habitable once more, a return trip could be possible. However, it seems as though your enemies have had the same plan. A race to secure the fusion batteries and rocket components needed to initiate the launch sequence is ensuing, in what will be the last battle on earth.

In order to win, you must balance your time between exploring new territories, investing in resource production, advancing the tech-tree, conducting research, mobilizing troops and attacking your opponents.

—description from the designer
categories: Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Memory, Modular Board, Movement Points, Random Production, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Egyptian Gods
description:
This is a card game for two players.
The order of the cards in each other's field is switched by actions to play a three-way game.
The player who wins 9 times or gets 3 cards of the same pattern first wins.
The game is decided in a short period of time, about 10 minutes.

—description from the designer

name: Wooden-Legged Justice
description:
In Wooden-Legged Justice players take on the role of detectives from the Han City Xiezhi Gate Investigation Division, tasked with solving criminal cases by analyzing highly realistic case files. These files include a wealth of materials, such as autopsy reports, crime scene reports, communication records, and surveillance footage. Players must utilize various investigative techniques to uncover the truth behind each case.

As the layers of truth are revealed, new puzzles and plot twists emerge, keeping the players constantly engaged and on their toes. The game requires one player to assume the role of the "Police Consultant" to facilitate gameplay. In this immersive and thrilling experience, players will not only test their deductive skills but also dive deep into the intricate world of crime and justice.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Team-Based Game

name: The Centenary Game, No.1 Discovering Victoria
description:
The Centenary Game, No.1 Discovering Victoria is a roll and move game that is of historical significance in celebrating 100 years of the founding of Melbourne, the capital city of the state of Victoria, Australia.

The game shows a map of Victoria with major towns and information. Players race around Victoria starting from Portland (first Victorian settlement) to major border towns before finally arriving in Melbourne. Landing on some towns can delay or advance your journey. First to reach Melbourne is the winner.

name: SCP The Board Game: Weapons And Armour Expansion
description:
Adding items and weapons and aurmor to the game players may use to help them complete their objectives.

Also adds four new SCP's players may play as.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Maze
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Kill Steal, Line of Sight, Lose a Turn, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Race, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: 源平奥州六大合戦 (Six battles of the Genpei war)
description:
義経戦記：源平奥州六大合戦 (Yoshitsune Senki: The Six Great Battles of Genpei Oshu) covers battles during the Genpei war in Japan (1180–1185).

The game system is chit-driven and gives a fluid game.
The combat system is simple: roll a six-sided die, add the dice to the commander's combat value. The highest total wins; if the total difference is 4 or more, the enemy unit is eliminated.

In addition, special rules are included for each battle.
In the Ichinotani Battle, an ambush unit under Yoshitsune's command is used.
In Dannoura, when the 'tidal current' chit is drawn, any Heike unit can act in the first half of the game, and any Genji unit can act in the second half. This is to show the change in momentum.
In Yashima, a 'target' chit determines if any Heike unit can act.
In Mizushima, a weather chit is drawn each turn and if the 'eclipse' chit appears, the Kiso army unit is disrupted.

Number of counters: 252 pieces
Maps: 6 small maps
Scenarios: 6 (Ichinotani, Dannoura, Yashima, Uji/Seda, Mizushima, Azugashiyama)
Game scale: Depends on the scenario
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest): 1

(translated and adapted from publisher's Japanese description)

name: Event Match: Halloween
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Conn....Sonar!  Modern Submarine Wargames Rules
description:
The rules originated from a desire to wargame the encounters between submarines and ASW forces portrayed in books such as Red Storm Rising (Tom Clancy and Larry Bond), and in films such as ‘The Hunt for Red October’ and ‘Crimson Tide’. I also was keen to use the 1/700 scale submarine and ship kits I was building as they are such great kits and I couldn’t find any rules! Modern naval wargaming has often suffered from being seen as too complex to wargame on the table top because of the technological complexity and therefore now is thought perhaps best suited to computer simulation. Existing table top rulesets such as ‘Harpoon’, ‘Prosub’ or ‘Modern Naval Battles’ either require detailed calculations and although very accurate, are often not suited to an evening club game or are designed as an abstract card based system that doesn’t allow miniatures to be used.
The difficulties arise because these sets are comprehensive and encompass all facets of modern naval combat with the submarine aspect a minor player. There are in reality several distinct aspects to modern naval warfare. At one extreme, carrier or land based airstrikes or missile strikes can originate several hundred miles away and yet be resolved in seconds, whilst at the other end the stealth and uncertainty of submarine combat can take daring, guile and be enacted over short distances where collisions are a real danger.

By concentrating on submarines and ASW specifically I have tried to develop a playable (I hope), fun and yet challenging set of rules that capture the specific tactics and tension of the ‘aerial dance’ beneath the waves, with variable levels of complexity that can be added as desired. The core rules are unashamedly simple to try and give a playable game on a club night and I have resisted the temptation to add extra complexity. Further rules will follow in subsequent updates.

name: Tell me, Kuflik!
description:
The Tell Me, Kuflik! board game is a creative and interactive game designed to encourage storytelling and creativity in players. The basic idea of the game is for players to create a story in which different characters have different adventures and experiences.

The game requires a board on which the different characters and locations are represented. During the game, players roll dice and choose a character or location from the board according to the result. Each player must then tell a short story involving that character or location.

During the game, players have to invent the stories, so creativity and imagination are one of the most important parts of the game. The aim of the game is to encourage storytelling and creativity in players and help develop communication and verbal expression skills.

The game can be played by 2-5 players and usually takes 30-45 minutes to play. The game is also suitable for younger children, as there is no violence or danger involved, and all players have to do is tell a story. Overall, Tell Me, Kuflik! board game is a fun and creative game that can be an excellent choice for playing time between family or friends.

name: Die neue Dame
description:
The game is played on an ordinary checkerboard. Each of the two players has 12 double-colored pieces or men(one black and white, the other green and red). The players place their men on the black squares of the 3 rows closest to them, so that the dark side (black or green) comes up.
Players take turns advancing their men on the black quares, only one square at a time. You are forced to jump over an opponent's man as soon as your own man touches that of your opponent and there is a free space behind him. Here, the opponent's man that has jumped over is taken along and placed at the bottom on the free space behind it. The jump must be continued if there is another opportunity. With each jump, only one enemy man can be taken as a prisoner. The man captured last is always at the bottom of the board. This is how towers are built. A tower moves or jumps like an ordinary man. If a tower is jumped over, only the top man may be taken and captured. If a man reaches one of the last 4 squares of the checkerboard, it is turned over so that the light side (white or red) comes up. He becomes a king. If a tower arrives on one of the last squares, only its top piece may be turned over. Such a tower moves or jumps like a king. A king may move forward or backward one or more squares or capture.
The game is decided when all of a player's men or kings are captured or when they can no longer be moved. The number of kings of both players gives the number of points with which the game was won.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Supremacy: Arms Race
description:
Supremacy: Arms Race is a space wars boardgame in a book! Everything you need to play the game is included in the one book, including cut out assets, ship standies, game boards and an 8 scenario campaign.

It's 2930 and humanity has found a new home planet, thrown from Earth by a sentient machine system some years ago. However, it wasn’t the only species to flee into space – lycans were the first to run, finding refuge on a distant planet. Now, after centuries of silence, the lycans are resurgent. The machine intelligence on Earth has also been developing advanced weaponry to derail humanity’s hopes of a new beginning.

Are you going to be humanity’s hope or downfall?

Supremacy: Arms Race is a diceless system that runs on 'Action Points.' The faction and commander you choose will determine the amount of AP you will receive each turn and it's up to you how you spread those points across your fleet, either offensively or defensively? But, be careful as attacks also cost AP. So, do you hang back and upgrade your ships or unload a barrage of artillery at your opponent? Do you split your AP and do a bit of both or outmanoeuvre the enemy and board them, ripping their ships apart and removing their upgrades? In the end it's a game of strategy and war!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Book, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Memoria Bluff: Pee-Poo / Vomit promo card
description: A promo card offered during the Ulule Crowdfunding campain. No special effect except telling memories about pee, poo or vomit.

name: Memoria Bluff: Squeaky bed / Condom promo card
description:
A promo card offered during the Ulule Crowdfunding campain.
Allows you to remind and tell a memory about a condom or a squeaky bed (no special effect).

name: どれかな？うみうしる (Which one? Sea Slug)
description:
Reasoning Card Game

Players are divided into [one respondent] and [supporters].
Respondents should cooperate with supporters who give hints in order to find [Atari's Sea Slug] among many sea slugs.
[Respondent] who was able to find Atari and [Supporter] who finally led to Atari got 1 point each.
One round is until the respondent finds Atari or all loses, and the
game ends when the respondent has completed a round for all players (completed all rounds).
The player with the most points wins!

name: Porta das Lendas
description:
Porta das Lendas is a board game that brings together legends from Brazilian folklore. During the game, you will open doors, collect flowers and other items to be the first to assemble a clan of legends. But be careful, not all of them are for fun...

—description from the designer

Porta das Lendas é um jogo de tabuleiro que reúne lendas do folclore brasileiro. Durante a partida, você vai abrir portas, coletar flores e outros itens para ser o primeiro a montar um clã de lendas. Mas tenha cuidado, pois nem todas estão para brincadeira...

—description from the designer (Portuguese)

name: Apple Grove
description:
Get ready to enter the tranquil and picturesque world of Apple Grove! As an apple farmer, you'll roll the dice to determine which types of apple trees you can plant in your own personal orchard. But beware - the unique color wheel mechanic means you'll need to think strategically about which trees to place next to each other to avoid being penalized and forced to build fences.

As you grow your orchard, you'll collect juicy apples and score points by placing trees of the same color next to each other. With the selection of each tree, you'll need to make careful decisions about which trees to plant and where to place them, in order to create the most fruitful apple grove.

With beautiful artwork and immersive gameplay, Apple Grove offers a unique and relaxing experience that's perfect for a fun evening with friends and family. So gather together, roll the dice, and get ready to experience the excitement and challenge of growing your very own Apple Grove!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building

name: Nosferatu is Coming to Town
description:
This is a card (and dice) game for 2-5 players (Solo mode is possible too). Players must travel trough various locations of Transylvania, in order to locate and destroy Count Orlock’s (aka Nosferatu) coffins, a vampire who preys on the wife of his estate agent , before the latter manages to reach the town of Wisborg, bringing with him the plague, the black death. The game is inspired by the 1922 movie “Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror” a silent German Expressionist horror film (now in public domain) directed by F. W. Murnau.

The game is played in rounds with a day and night phase. During the day players play cards from their hand to move, obtain resources and search different locations of Transylvania to find the hidden coffin's. In the night phase however their endeavor becomes dangerous. According to the cards drawn, may be attacked by wild animals, bandits and even Nosferatu himself.

In the same time the vampire travels in the opposite way heading to Wisborg in order to bite and make Helen, Hutters wife, his eternal bride. Nosferatu is accompanied by swarms of rats that will infect the entire town with the deadly black plague.

In order to save their town, players must fight to stop the vampire, retaining alongside their human state. Otherwise they may be coverted to possessed or vampires and attack their fellow players.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Action Timer, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Family Feud Survey Showdown Card Game
description:
Draw a question card, the first player to shout their answer out gets the first chance to win the face-off. Each incorrect answer gets an x card. You win by being the first team to collect 5 Family Feud survey cards.

Contents:
49 Question cards
3 "X" cards
2 Instruction cards

name: Jefe De Jefes
description:
Jefe De Jefes is a Mexican Drug Cartel inspired card game where players run their own cartel and destroy the competition to become the ultimate drug lord. In order to win, players use their action cards strategically, spend loads of drug money, and negotiate deals with opposing cartels. In the end, there can only be one boss.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Economic, Mafia, Mature / Adult, Negotiation
mechanics: Bribery, Delayed Purchase, Income, Kill Steal, Negotiation, Ownership, Player Elimination, Take That, Trading

name: Ravensburger ministeps: Mein erstes Eisenbahn-Spiel
description:
Everyone get in and close the doors! One colorful wagon after the other is attached to the funny animal train. The order is determined by the large colored die. Which train will be the first to leave? Thanks to the exciting game principle and the popular railway theme, the basic colors are memorized in a flash. The extra stable puzzle pieces are perfectly adapted to the needs of children and are also ideal for free play - who puzzles the longest train?

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Dungeon of Norub: a pen & paper dungeon crawler
description:
A pen & paper dungeon crawler for 1 or 2 players. You face a 5 level dungeon, which rooms are filled with monsters, traps and special features.

Main features:


You can even play it on a small notebook
No map drawing
No eraser needed
Fast combat: a single roll could end a fight (if you're lucky enough)
No printer needed: character sheet is very simple


In order to play Dungeon of Norub, you'll need:


a paper sheet: even a notebook is big enough
a pen
some dice: 1d20, 1d10, 1d4, 1d6.


The gamemplay is quick and the inventory management is minimalistic. A full game lasts about 30-45 minutes. It has a roll & write feel, due to the fast nature of the game.

Four levels of difficulty are included in the rules, and you can easily adjust it to your own difficulty level.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Jerusalem: England's Green, Unpleasant Land
description:
Players build up the village of Jerusalem into a Town by placing businesses, public services, recreational facilities, places of worship, extra roads and houses in an attempt to climb the Social ladder the highest (the gaining of 'footprints', which are VPs). Players may be able to demolish each other's work, vote on new Municipal structures (a Cathedral, an Airfield, a Reservoir - giant pieces that overlay whole sections of the landscape) and - generally - create a satirical vision of a typical English Town.

The playing area is a freeform space comprising a river and a Roman road dividing the area into each player's home sector containing their Mansion. Buildings can appear in any sector - the choice of the player guided by their own goals and the goals on shared higher-level buildings.

Jerusalem is a sandbox world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Voting

name: Historias de la mili
description:
El fin de este juego es conseguir licenciarse el primero.

El juego de la mili sigue en orden cronológico el servicio militar: Desde la entrada, pasando por la jura de bandera, ascensos, maniobras, etc... Hasta la licencia.

The goal of that game is getting the first in having the licence.

The mili's game follows a chronological order in millitary service: from entering, pledge allegiance to the flat,promotions, manoeuvres... untill the licence.

name: 1001 Odysseys: A Day at the Beach Microadventure
description:
Promotional 3 card micro adventure given out at GenCon 2022.

From the publisher:
"Sample this 3-Card Micro-Adventure to get a taste of our collaborative science-fantasy game 1001 Odysseys.
In the full version of the game, players operate the mission controls of the spaceship Odyssey to explore ten beautiful planets and read entertaining stories featuring fun, fascinating, and downright weird characters."
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Medieval Hustle
description:
Medieval Hustle is a casual strategy card game of career advancement in the Dark Ages.

In Medieval Hustle, you start as a member of the peasant class, working multiple jobs to make ends meet. To win, you need to be the first player to land a job in the castle.

On each turn, you may choose to either apply to a job or draft cards. To apply to a job, you need to match shields with adjacent jobs in your career track. Each new job unlocks more powerful skills to accelerate your progress.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Race

name: Feixen
description:
The game contains 14 dice in different colours, as well as a description of actions triggered by black dice..
The black dice trigger effects that are useful to the active player or harmful to the other players.
E.g. you can take a dice from another player, reroll all untaken dice and take all 3's.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Bitte schön!
description:
Bitte schön! contains dice in different colours.
The black die is rolled, which determines which number of dice the active player may take. They may re-roll and keep the gained score or lose all new points.
The colours of the other dice allow special actions.

—user summary

name: Error Crash!
description:
Error Crash! contains cards with colours, numbers and symbols.
Similarly to "Mau Mau", careds are placed on top of each other using colour and number.
The symbols trigger effects, e.g. Drawing cards, choosing a suit, sitting out.

The cards are printed on both sides; numbers on one side are black and on the other side, they are white. The cards, thanks to a special symbol, have to change the played side regularly, and hand cards as well as draw and discard piles have to be turned.

There are two variants of the game.

In the first variant, you lose after 10 rounds of not being able to play a hand card.

In the second variant, you play for six rounds; the player with most scored points wins.

—user summary

name: Error
description:
Error contains 60 cards, which show numbers in different colours.
Everyone places one card face down in front of them and one card is revealed from the deck, which is the mission card. Now everyone reveals their discarded cards. The object of the game is to get as close as possible to the mission card.

Each card also contains a symbol, which is processed before comparing the numbers. An arrow, for example, makes all discarded cards move clockwise to the next person, a swap symbol allows to draw a card from the deck and place it on top of any of the discarded cards. In total, 5 different symbols make the game fast-paced and unpredictable.

—user summary

name: Labyrinthians
description:
Adventure alone, together or as enemies through the endless Labyrinth beneath the Highlands of ancient Alhba (Scotland). This pocket-sized adventure will have you and up to three friends or enemies battling ancient Kings for magical weapons, facing down hordes of undead souls and beasts, haggling with the Hag o' the Winter for your very life, using the Labyrinth's everchanging passageways for your advantage, whispering mystic incantations in old Gaelic, standing on the edge of the Eternal Chasm on the brink of being subsumed by Evil itself... and all in your lunch break! If you love the moody storytelling aspect of classic fantasy RPGs, and easy rules that make for fast-flowing action thick with atmosphere, you will adore this game. Best played on an old wooden table under candlelight with a tankard of Scottish ale or honeymead.

For solo gamers, it is most fun to play Labyrinthians with two of the provided characters, who you can use to come to your aid in times of high peril, attain the characters' personal quests, or vie against in moments of merciless betrayal or greed.

For those who want a longer game or want to enjoy Labyrinthians as a multi-session campaign, there are expansions to the core game too. The Labyrinth has three new levels: the sewers, the earthen and the magma levels. And there is a three-part prequel wilderness campaign: The Woodland Way, the Bogs of Moorh, the snowy path to The Secret Tree, where lies the entrance to the Labyrinth itself.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Maze, Mythology
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: The Battle of Malta: Operation Pedestal 1942
description: The Battle of Malta: Operation Pedestal 1942 is a two-player game of struggle of Malta Convoy in August 1942. As the commander of the British fleet, you aim to deliver the convoy to Malta with as little damage as possible. Or as an Axis commander, aim to annihilate the WS21S convoy and its escort fleet. Winning/losing is determined by the number of transport ships that have arrived and the number of escort ships that have been sunk.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Battle of Sandepu, 1905
description:
Battle of Sandepu, 1905 is a two-player game that simulates the Battle of Sandepu, January 25-29, 1905, during the Russo-Japanese War.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sandepu

The unit size of the game is a regiment, and the goal is to recreate the appearance of the battle from January 26, the day after the Japanese army abandoned Sandepu, using simple rules using cards.

One plays Grippenberg, the commander of the Russian 2nd Manchurian Army, who is ordered to attack Sandepu, and the other plays Naofumi Tatsumi of the IJA 8th Division, who is ordered to defend this area.

The Russian commander-in-chief, Kuropatkin, was not very enthusiastic about the offensive due to factors such as the weather, lack of supplies, and when the Nogi's IJA Third Army, which had taken Port Arthur's fortress, would come to help. Therefore, the Russian player needs to proceed with the strategy while looking at Kuropatkin's mood, and the Japanese player has to deal psychological damage to Kuropatkin as one of the strategies.

name: あにまる亭のメイドちゃん (Cafe Animals)
description:
Cafe Animals is a trick-taking game where you want to score the most points.

The game uses a deck of cards featuring several suits and the same range of numbers, as well as a gray suit with higher numbers than the other suits. It is a "must follow" game, but the highest card of the lead suit, or the gray suit, wins.

Additionally, the game includes one extra card for each suit, without a number. One of these is inserted into the deck and will serve as the timer for the hand. The others go next to the deck. The winner of a trick can choose to take the cards played to the trick as points or take one of the suit cards. While the suit cards are visible, the smallest number will win in tricks which were lead by a card of one of those colors. Additionally, taking such a card alters a players scoring calculation.

name: Taira Ships, Minamoto Horses: Genpei Naval Records
description:
Taira Ships, Minamoto Horses: Genpei Naval Records is a board wargame based on naval battles from February 1184 to April 1185 during the Genpei War.

In general, the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan are the focus of attention in the Genpei War, but in this game, the Seto Inland Sea's "Hometown Navy" is the main character.

Both the Taira clan and the Minamoto clan must continue to fight in order to gain their allies, who are sensitive to the consequences of the war.

In naval battles at that time, when neither nautical charts nor systematic information was maintained, it was important to have a deeper knowledge of the "local sea".

In this game as well, you can experience how having a local navy on your side who knows the local sea will greatly affect the outcome of a war.

name: Masakado's Last Battle
description:
Masakado's Last Battle is a two-player game of the Battle of Shii, Taira no Masakado's last battle during the Tengyō no Ran, a brief medieval Japanese conflict from 935 to 940.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tengy%C5%8D_no_Ran

50 counters are divided into 12 Masakado's units, 29 Imperial Government's units, and 9 markers.

Each hex represents about 50 meters. Each unit represents about 300 soldiers.

Issue game of "Bushi Life" #4.

name: Thorny Issue at Jieting
description:
Thorny Issue at Jieting is 5th game of War Drum Games' "pocket war" series. This mini-game simulates the Battle of Jieting in 228, the last battle of Zhuge Liang's first Northern Expedition during the Three Kingdoms period in China.

50 counters are divided into 16 Shu Han units, 25 Cao Wei units and other markers.

Rulebook is online only.

name: Battle of Jutland
description:
Battle of Jutland is 7th game of Kilovolt Design's "mini war" series. This mini-game simulates the Battle of Jutland, a naval battle fought between Britain's Royal Navy Grand Fleet and the Imperial German Navy's High Seas Fleet during the World War I.

The game consists of nine turns. Each turn represents 30 minutes. Each counter represents a squadron, not a warship. And there are "rain & mist" counters which represent a temporal "terrain" on the sea.

name: Second Battle of Kharkov
description:
In May 1942, after winning the defense of Moscow, the Soviet army tried to launch a general offensive against the German army. It assembled six army groups and several supporting troops to form two fronts, the Southwest Front and the South Front, and planned to regain the strategically important Kharkov. The Second Battle of Kharkov broke out.

However, in just 20 days, the Soviet army, which had lost the winter bonus, suffered a disastrous defeat in the Second Battle of Kharkov due to command errors and underestimated the strength of the German army, losing nearly 260,000 people.

The defeat was so crushing that the Soviets tried to hide it or avoid talking about it long after the battle ended.

"Schlacht bei Charkow" is an independent work dedicated by Kuro Neko Design Workshop. After at least 3 years of various physical tests, it tries to restore the most exciting Second Battle of Kharkov.

In the game, one side player will play the role of Bock, the commander of the German Army Group South, and the other side player will play the role of the Soviet Southwest Strategic Trio (Commander Timoshenko, Political Commissar Khrushchev, and Chief of Staff Bagramyan).

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Battle of Tobruk
description:
The Battle of Gazala was the culmination of Rommel's work on the North African battlefield of World War II, and Rommel was promoted to Field Marshal through this. Relying on his inferior force, he displayed an astonishing command art, and finally conquered Tobruk Fortress and opened the gate to Egypt. The victory of the battle marked the climax of the Axis offensive in North Africa and played the prelude to the Battle of Alamein.

This game is a card-driven game. The two players will play the role of the German-Italian coalition commander: General Erwin Rommel, the commander of the African Panzer Army, and the British commander: General Claude Auchinleck, the commander-in-chief of the British Army in the Middle East.

It was the early morning of May 27, 1942. Rommel successfully deceived the enemy, and just led his army to detour to the rear of the Gazala line of defense. The "Operation Venice" is about to start......

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Operation Overlord: Normandy Landing 1944
description:
(translation from the text of MoDian's crowdfunding page)

This game represents a series of decisive battles between the Allied forces and the German forces in the Normandy area of France from June to August 1944 when the Allied forces landed in Normandy and marched inland.

Number of players in the game: 2-4 people
2 players: the German forces player and the Allied forces player.
3 players: the German Panzer Group West player, the German 7th Army player and the Allied Forces player. Or: the Allied British 21st Army Group player, the Allied Twelfth United States Army Group player and the German forces player.
4 players: the German Panzer Group West player, the German 7th Army player, the Allied British 21st Army Group player and the Allied Twelfth United States Army Group player.

This work includes the following accessories:
1 map, about 28cm x 38cm in size
About 70 pieces of cardboard counters
About 10 six-sided dice
There is no packing box and no paper rulebook for this game. You need to scan the QR code on the map to download the game rules.

name: The Dragon and The Bear
description:
The Dragon and The Bear is a two-player wargame of a hypothetical China-Soviet War in 1969.

One commands People's Liberation Army and the other commands USSR Army.

The map describes the Northeast China (ex-Manchuria) and a part of Russia and Mongolia. Each unit represents a division.

The theme and components look like SPI's classic The East is Red: The Sino Soviet War, but all of the components are originally designed.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Namma: A New Path
description:
This world once devastated by what were called the great calamities, was the spectacle of the most devastating actions.

Years passed and since then peace had prevailed, but the sages of today hid the monsters of yesteryear. Secrets, treasures and characters were sealed and ignorance had become the shield of the peoples who survived.

Namma is an exciting board game that provides an immersive and entertaining gaming experience. With captivating storytelling, immersive music, and a collectible card system, this game delivers an unforgettable gaming experience that will keep you hooked for hours.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Exploration, Fantasy, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Order Counters, Relative Movement, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Trading

name: The Battle of Mardavhain
description:
THE BATTLE OF MARDAVHAIN - COLLECTIBLE CARD GAME

During the game, players can embark on a journey to the ancient land of Mardavhain, where peace has been disturbed by evil forces, and battles have been raging ever since. Become the strongest and rule the land!

DIFFERENT MODES


Choose which deck you want to play with. Will you play with the basic deck, a shared deck with your friends, or will you play with your own deck?
Choose your game mode. In each round, you can draw new character cards, or you can play in survival mode, where each player has a set number of cards, and there are no additional card draws


HOW TO PLAY:


2-4 players can play on the game board.
You need to occupy territory from the other players. At the beginning of the game, strategy is important because you need to place character cards for defense and action cards that other players cannot see. Then, the battle for territory begins. The outcome of the battle is decided based on the character cards' health points, attack and defense values, using dice.
The winner is the one who holds the most or even all the territories.


HOW TO WIN

The game lasts until all the character cards from the deck are used up. The player with the most territories wins the game.

SURVIVOR MODE:


In this game mode, the setup is the same as in the regular game, but after battles, players cannot draw new character cards. They must continue to play with the cards they used for the attacks.
In this case, the HP value of the character cards that participated in battle remains the same, and players must continue to fight with these cards.


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Banshee Bedlah and Loincloth Promo Cards
description:
This is a set of promo cards that was given out with the Vitanvox miniature, which itself is not part of the game.

The promo centers on the Banshee Dura special rule. It contains one Banshee Bedlah gear card, which confers this rule to the survivor wearing it, a Banshee Loincloth which strengthens the effect, and one Glossary card that describes the rule.

Banshee Dura X
A special rule. At the start of your act, gain (or lose) howling tokens until you have X of them. During your act or a survival opportunity, you may spend 1 howling token to do one of the following:

Gain [move], which must be spent immediately, limit once per round.
Gain [activation], which must be spent immediately, limit once per round.
Perform a survival action using the howling token in place of survival.
Gain +1 STR token until the end of the round.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: War Factory 1942
description:
The year is 1942 and you are charged with mobilizing your nation and battling to victory in the first fully industrialized, mechanized, global total war.

For the first time in modern history, development of new weapons, manufacturing capacity and global supply chains turned entire national economies into war factories, and every citizen into a military target.

To win, you must allocate your national resources to research, develop, build and deploy the war machines needed to defend your position and conquer the wealth and resources that will power the next step of your strategy.

War Leader 1942 is a map-based strategy game that allows 2-6 players to each control Axis or Allied factions in order to win the Second World War. The game is played on a large map, with detailed markers and counters keeping track of the location and movement of military units. Each player faction has a record-keeping Mobilization card, and all combat is conducted using a step-by-step procedure executed on the Battlespace card.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Modern Warfare, World War II

name: Thundercats
description: A move-along a path game based on the children's cartoon. The game box opens like a book to reveal the board.

name: The Sword and the Flame: Zulu War Action Deck
description:
A dedicated Action Deck for the Zulu War collector and gamer, with special Event Cards representing aspects of the War of 1879, and graphics evoking Isandlwana, Rourke's Drift, and other famous battles.

A sheet explaining the use of the cards in a game is included.

name: The Sword and the Flame: Terrain Effects Deck
description:
This latest Game Deck adds a new layer of challenge—and opportunity!— to your table top actions with either of these classic rules sets.

Instead of one rule to describe the effects of all terrain on movement, cover, and visibility, now with the flip of a card even more excitement and suspense enters the game.

Since when in foreign lands, often tropical, is every stretch of jungle, or hill side, desert, swamp, track, etc, identical in difficulty to cross, or see into, or through, or provide the same cover from fire? And why does every creek, stream, or even river have the same conveniently firm bottom that makes crossing speed predictable?

The Variable Terrain Effects Deck now gives players the hope that a given area of terrain might be easier to march through—but also the risk that it’s tougher than it looks!

More than ever, the use of Scouts to recon the ground ahead takes on new importance--not merely to spot the enemy, but to make sure of the ground you might meet him on.

And life for the Games Masters who host tabletop games definitely gets easier. Now they can layout such trees, hills, and other miniature terrain features as they have without having to suggest just how “thick” the forest is, or any other hints suggesting the degree of difficulty.

When first entering a terrain feature, the British/Imperial Player will draw an appropriate terrain card type--forest/jungle, one of three types of water hazards, swamps, sand/beach, rough ground, or track—and read its effects, from a walk in the park to practically impassable. A simple printed marker (provided for all types) with the number of the card drawn and the terrain type is placed at the entry point for future reference, and it’s as easy as that!

There are 48 individual Terrain Effects Cards, six each of the 8 types, plus 14 cards on which are printed 6 numbered markers with the names of the terrain types on the opposite sides, plus 1 card with instructions for use. The markers are cut out for use in play and may be stored in the same plastic re-closable bag the deck arrives in.

—description from the publisher's website

name: Alto Comando
description:
Two armies battle on a magnetic board to find and destroy the enemy command base.

The game is setup by placing the vertical board between the two players. Then magnetic pieces are placed on the board and moved in turn by the players. When a place is moved on a square in which the other player also have a piece, this one falls due to the magnetic force and it is considered destroyed.

When a player loses his base (the star shaped piece) the game ends and the other player wins.

Every player has:

1 command base (Star)
4 tanks (could only move on ground)
2 boats (could only move on the sea)
2 airplanes (they move everywhere)


—user summary

name: Sky Scouts
description:
Sky Scouts is a wartime board game produced to promote sales of a popular Boot Polish from the Australian company Nugget Pty Ltd.
The game board has 4 players selecting 4 tokens of a famous WW2 allied aircraft. Object is that each player has to get all their aircraft onto their landing strip. This is done by following a path similar to Parcheesi. Certain squares on the path show helpful or detrimental instructions to a players progress.

Winner is the first player to have all of their aircraft on the Aircraft Runway.

name: Warlords in the Last Years of Han Dynasty
description:
At the end of the Eastern Han Dynasty, foreign relatives ruled over power, eunuchs ruled the country, and the Han court was at sunset, and the glory of the past was no longer there. First there was chaos caused by the Yellow Turbans, and then there was the dictatorship of Dong Zhuo, and the world has not had a single day of peace. The times make heroes, and many heroes and heroes emerged at this time, and they gathered in the Central Plains one after another, ushering in the war-torn era at the end of the Han Dynasty.

In 190 A.D., the princes from all walks of life formed a coalition to attack Dong Zhuo, and Dong Zhuo was forced to retreat and move westward to Chang'an. In 191 A.D., the coalition forces were disbanded due to discord, and the princes had ulterior motives in their hearts, and they did not hesitate to fight each other in order to compete for territory. The following year, Dong Zhuo was killed and Lü Bu fled. Beginning in 191 A.D., the seven forces in the Central Plains have gradually developed into powerful heroes through conquests and mergers. Lu Bu, the flying general who is unparalleled in the country, Yuan Shu who proclaimed himself emperor in Huainan, Liu Bei who took over Xuzhou, and Liu Biao who sat on the sidelines. Father and son of Sun Jian and Sun Ce, Cao Cao, the hero of troubled times who fought a decisive battle in Guandu in 200 AD, and Yuan Shao, the overlord of Hebei......

Warlords in the Last Years of Han Dynasty can accommodate 2-7 players to play the game at the same time. It is divided into 8 historical scenarios, 2 instructional scenarios and 1 hypothetical scenario. Because the Romance of the Three Kingdoms, one of the four great classics, has a huge influence on later generations, the game design is based on official history and supplemented by romance, so as to avoid players being difficult to adapt for a while. In the "advanced rules", more realistic optional rules are provided, which will simulate the history of the end of the Eastern Han Dynasty to a greater extent.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Events, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Rauf - rum - runter!
description:
Each player puts a meeple on a black dot on the turntable und pays a coin to the large yellow dot in the middle of the turntable. The players take turns to roll the die and move the turntable accordingly in any direction. If a meeple gets in front of the dot in it's own color, it leaves the turntable and has to beginn anew. On the roll of a 6 the turntable isn't rotated and the player gets a coin from the yellow dot.
A player wins the game, if he is the last one on the turntable.

name: Enquêtes et Filatures
description: Enquêtes et Filatures is a rummy like card game in which players try to build a feasible criminal investigation, that could be lead to a murder or a suicide.

name: 800 Fighting Englishmen: Sudan Action Deck
description:
Specifically designed for fighting the Mahdi, his Ansar, and the fanatical "Fuzzy Wuzzy" against British and Egyptian Units. The deck consists of 48 full color cards.

—description from the publisher

name: 800 Fighting Englishmen: Northwest Frontier Action Deck
description:
Perfect for use in your games on "The Grim," this Deck is illustrated with images of the 2nd Afghan War battles and famous--and infamous!--personalities.

—description from the publisher

name: 800 Fighting Englishmen: Zulu War Action Deck
description:
Illustrated with authentic images of the Zulu War of 1879, including samples of Zulu Regimental Shield Designs, as well as famous characters from this dramatic conflict, this Game Deck will even make Isandlwana seem like an "Arts Thing!"

—description from the publisher

name: 800 Fighting Englishmen: First Boer War Action Deck
description:
Using many contemporary illustrations from the 1st War (not the 2nd!), this Deck provides views of key personnel, Majuba, Boer Weapons, and more.

—description from the publisher

name: 800 Fighting Englishmen: Egyptian War Action Deck
description:
Loaded with fine illustrations from the period, including the bizarre as well as the standard contemporary press views of key personalities and events of this short but sharp campaign.

The Egyptians were the only standing, National Army the British fought in the Era of TSATF, and while their higher leadership failed to stand up against Woolsley, many junior officers and units fought cleverly, professionally, and with unquestioned bravery. The Egyptians were not a "walk over" opponent in fact--nor on the table top, either!

—description from the publisher

name: 800 Fighting Englishmen: Boxer Rebellion Action Deck
description:
The Boxer Rebellion Deck is "weighted" to represent the mix of Allied and Chinese units/factions which characterized the conflict. Including the usual Command Bonus cards, the 800FE Boxer Rebellion Action Deck totals 56 Cards, 8 more than in the other 800FE Decks.

The Chinese are represented by 12 cards cuing Boxer units to Move/Fire, plus cards for units of the four Chinese Armies engaged between Peking and Tientsin. There are five cards each for units of General Nieh's "Tenacious Army," General Sung-Ching's "Resolute Army," General Tung-Fu-Hsiang's "Kansu Braves," and General in Chief Yung-Lo's Manchu Bannermen.

For the eight combatant Allies, the Action Cards are provided in the same proportions as each nationality comprised the total forces engaged (prior to the arrival of the German East Asia Brigade). Consequently, there is one card each for the Italians, Austrians, French, and Germans, two each for the British, American, and Russians, and five for the Japanese.

If any of these contingents are not represented on your table top, the otherwise unnecessary cards may be used to cue Movement/Fire of other, more numerous units in your collection. Similarly, European and Chinese Army units not present may have their cards removed from the Deck prior to play.

By this arrangement, the Players on both sides will not only have to deal with the usual uncertainty of order of Movement and Fire of their own and the enemy's units, but must allow for each "faction" of his forces having their own say when they feel like, rather than as the C-in-C might-- exactly as in the real conflict.

—description from the publisher

name: Dungeon Exit
description:
Dungeon Exit is a fast-paced, family-friendly puzzle game in which players must simultaneously optimize the placement of their tiles to form a path to the exit of the dungeon. Very easy to pick up, the game will challenge you with its endless challenges. Play in competition and be the quickest to make your way through!

—description from the publisher

name: Poland Lightning War
description:
The background of the story is set in World War I, when Germany was defeated. After Hitler came to power, he reorganized his armaments at a very fast speed and took Poland as the primary attack target. Although Poland was promised by Britain and France to maintain the integrity of Poland’s territory, the German army entered Poland smoothly due to the “concession” after the negotiations between Germany and the Soviet Union. The territory, and won a lightning-fast victory, and later historians have dubbed it a successful example of "blitzkrieg".

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Case White
description:
The scenario of "Blitz Poland" in the game tried its best to restore the crushing trend of the German army in history. The unique combat mechanism and fast-paced advancement speed (in a lightning-fast way, the duration of a single round is shorter), which strengthened the attacking experience of German players, enough for players to experience the fun of the Blitz game.

During the game, players can support, move and fight in each turn. It allows players to experience the joy of restraining each other. Whether it is a strong attack on a point or a siege to aid, as long as it is a tactic you can think of, you can experience it in this miniature war and plan a strategy!

The game also sets up imaginary scripts and entertainment confrontation scenarios, and also supports single-player solo scenario to meet the psychological needs of mass players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Swords: Cut The Deck
description:
Swords: Cut the Deck is a tabletop role-playing card game based on the award-winning webcomic, SWORDS. In this game, a variety of odd heroes use funny and fearsome weapons in epic skirmishes. Who will prove their skill with the blade? And who will die by the sword?

Cut the Deck brings a full roster of fantastical heroes into the fray wielding dozens and dozens of strange and mystical swords! With tens of thousands of unique builds, it cuts different every time you play.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting

name: Battle of the Bulge
description:
Solitaire game of the Battle of the Bulge, published as a special supplement of MC Axis #61.
The player plays the role of German Army commander, aims to break through the allied front lines, capture important bases, and break through to Antwerp.

name: Battle of the Coral Sea 1942
description:
Solitaire game of the Battle of the Coral Sea, published as a special supplement of MC Axis #65.
The player plays the role of Imperial Japanese Navy commander, use Shōkaku, Zuikaku and Shōhō to attack Yorktown and Lexington, and aims to invade Port Moresby.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sblocca la Porta: Storia
description:
Sblocca la Porta: Storia is an escape room for children.

Lots of riddles to solve with wit and logic and clues to discover in order to complete the adventure. An original and modern game that will involve young and old in a whirlwind of fun! A puzzle adventure and a journey to be enjoyed by recovering all the clues and solving the puzzles while training the mind and lateral thinking.

Included in the box are 3 adventures set in 3 historical periods: the Middle Ages, Ancient Greece and Ancient Egypt.

name: Generic Board "Checkered" Set
description: A set of the board and pieces for checkers, its variants, and abstract games that require a checkerboard. The board is available in two sizes, 8 x 8 squares on the front and 10 x 10 squares on the back. The set includes rules for English Checkers and International Checkers, descriptions of many other traditional variants of checkers, and rules for the designer's three original games Zong-Heng, Binary, and Incorrect Checkers.

name: Rolling to La Moncloa
description:
Rolling to the Elections is a roll and write game based on draft mechanics and dice rolling to obtain majorities. The game is designed for two players, although it supports a solitaire or multiplayer game mode.
In Rolling to the Elections, each player play for being the president of a country by taking the role of one of the two candidates, either from the left-wing or the right-wing . To win the game, the player must obtain the majority of seats in the parliament.

There are five versions of the game: Spain ("Rolling to La Moncloa"), Germany ("Rolling to Kanzleramt") France ("Rolling to Elysee"), United Kingdom (Rolling to Downing Street) and USA (Rolling to the White House). In each version different rules are applied, adapted to the electoral model of each country and its regions, and they can be played independently.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Ariol le Kolektor
description: Ariol le Kolektor is a card game for 6+yo children. It theme derives from the French Cartoon series Ariol. Goal is to collect 4 Chevallier Chaval vignettes. Therefore players draw and play cards. Each card has an card effect either collecting cards or interacting with the other players.

name: スーマの森 (Forest of "Number Spirits")
description:
In Forest of "Number Spirits", players fulfill contracts by placing certain patterns onto the forest map (such as forest cubes, rock squares, or water ovals). The fulfillment of the contracts grants the players special effects and lets them cross of certain digits on their bingo cards. Players earn points by completing bingos and certain contracts.

The game takes place over two rounds and the player with the most points at the end of the second round wins.

name: ワールドバケーション (World Vacation)
description:
World Vacation is a game which takes place on an inflatable globe and a player's travel record form. The game sets the players as millionaires with too much time and money who set about traveling around the world.

Each player is assigned a starting city, which will also be where they end their trip, and a checkpoint city. They are incentivized to visit certain cities, and not travel over 4000km. Each player marks the legs of their flights on the globe with a roll of tape.

At the end of the game, players earn points for the total distance traveled and types of sights seen; they lose points for crossing the paths of other players and taking too long of flights.

name: Franky Rock 'n Vegas: Mini-Expansion
description:
This Promo consists of one card and one red dice (d6).
It replaces the normal rules for red Frankys.
When scoring, any number of red Frankys may be assigned to the red dice. These red Frankys may then be re-rolled. Each dice that shows a red Franky again may be rolled again (until it no longer shows a red Franky). Each dice that now shows a lightning bolt is worth as many points as the red dice shows.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Cunning Thieves
description:
Cunning Thieves is an exciting card game for 2 to 5 players in which you are going to test your perception, cunning and strategies to get more treasures tan the others thieves before the night ends.

Each turn players do the following:

May use an action card.
May discard a treasure card, if so, Draw 2 cards from the deck.
End the turn and draw 1 card from the deck.


To make a treasure a player must have 3 treasure cards with the same picture.

—description from the designer

name: Dioses del Nilo
description:
Dioses del Nilo is a strategic and tactical board game for two players based on Egyptian mythology. The objective of each player is to defeat their opponent by skillfully moving their pieces on the board.

How to play?

The game is divided into two phases: the placement phase and the combat phase.

Each player's field is divided into two: vanguard and rearguard.

Each player must make a movement in each phase in an orderly manner and alternate with the opponent.

Placement phase:
In this phase the players both take 2 tiles from their tile column (the bottom two tiles). Then in turn (starting with the one with the clock on their side of the field) Place a token inside the field on any space you want.

Tokens that are placed in the rear can be placed face down.
Tiles placed in the vangauard are always placed face up.
Once a player places a token, he passes the other player's turn by sliding the clock card to the other player's side.
Once all the players have placed their 2 tokens, we proceed to the combat phase.

Combat phase:
Starting with the player who has the clock on his side of the field, he can make one of the following moves:

Move a soldier to an adjacent square (left or right, up or down) The soldier cannot be moved diagonally.
Attack an enemy square.
End the turn.
Once a player has made a move, it automatically passes to the other player and the clock moves to their side of the field.

Attacking and Defending
When a soldier attacks an enemy square, if there is an enemy soldier on that square, then both fight. The higher number wins.

The losing token "perishes" and is placed on top of its face-up god card [Graveyard]. Tokens that have perished in battle can be consulted by the opponent at any time. If there is a tie, both pieces perish.

The winning soldier must recharge energy, so he places himself at the top of the face-up token column, waiting for his turn to return to action.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Square Grid, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Negamco Professional Bowling
description:
Negamco's Professional Bowling Game.

Card and Dice based bowling game. Bowler cards represent bowlers from the 1970's. A die roll result is cross referenced to a pin results table to obtain the results.

Very similar to APBA bowling.

name: Ramar of the Jungle: Big Game Hunt
description:
This game is a spin and move game where the object is to capture valuable animals in the jungle. The game board is filled with face down animals and by spinning a spinner and then moving your playing piece onto one of those animals you capture it. When a player lands on an animal, his playing piece remains on that spot until his/her next turn and other players cannot land on or move over that spot. They must use their roll number to move around the opponents piece.

The game continues until all of the animals have been captured. Turning over each animal reveals a value attached to that particular animal. The player who captures the most valuable animals wins the game.

name: Feud
description:
Feud takes inspiration from popular RTS video games such as Age of Empires. Designed for 2 or 4 players (1v1 or 2v2), Feud allows players to take on the role of a king who must gather resources, build structures, train armies, and engage in battles with other kingdoms to expand their empire and defeat their enemies.

Gameplay in Feud is a mix of resource management, city-building, and military strategy. Players must collect resources like food, wood, and gold to build structures, train units, and research technologies.

As the game progresses, players must make strategic decisions about which technologies to research and when to attack their enemies. Each player’s ultimate goal is to be the last king standing and control the most territory. The game is won by the player who has conquered the most territory and eliminated all of their opponents.

Another feature of Feud is that it incorporates an element of bluff. Each player’s stronghold is kept secret until it is scouted by their opponents. This means that players can create elaborate feints and ruses to deceive their opponents into thinking they have a strong or weak position.
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: DIE-Minions
description:
DIE-Minions is a strategic dice drafting game where players compete to secure control of four different factions. Each turn, players will move their mad-scientist on the 3x3 board to a new location where they will capture (i.e., draft) 1 die if there are at least 2 present. Based on the die taken, a die from an adjacent location is removed, re-rolled, and placed into the reserve pool. If there are dice in the reserve, the player then place 1 die on any location with an opening for that faction (i.e., color).

Game play continues until each location has 1 die only (9 dice on the board). The player with the highest total influence (sum of dice) in each faction wins control of that faction. Controlling a faction at game end grants a player victory points equal to the sum of the faction dice left on the main board. That is, only the 9 dice left on the board score points for any player.

Players must carefully draft the right dice to gain control of the faction while also ensuring that any faction they control has high scoring dice on the board at the end of the game.

-description from publisher


Truly, it was a GREAT Idea!

World domination was waiting; all you needed was a few extra hands. What could be the harm in collaborating with those other mad scientists? You’ve got this! Honestly, it was a good idea. Experimental substances, electricity, a little weird science, and presto! a multitude of minions to do your bidding. There’s no such thing as free will, right?

Actually, it was a bad idea. That much applied genius was bound to have unintended consequences. How could you have known that your perfect minions would split into four personalities that refused to get along? It was clearly that other guy’s fault!

Really, it was a terrible idea. Your grand plans must wait while you correct this complication. But getting back to your proper glory requires sacrifice…

DIE-Minions - it’s not only what you need for victory, but what must be done!
-from the back of the box
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Dropper
description:
Rules.

1. The game is played on an 8x8 board, but it can also be played on boards of different sizes.

2. The first player places 1 stone at their discretion on the empty board.

3. The second player places 2 stones according to a protocol in 2 moves: 1Drop - 1Free.
Drop move: the player places their stone in place of an opponent's stone, moving that opponent's stone to a free adjacent square that is diagonally or orthogonally adjacent.
Free move: the player then places their own stone in a free square that has no stones adjacent diagonally or orthogonally.

4. Players take turns placing their 2 stones according to the 1Drop - 1Free protocol on the board until it is no longer possible to place Free moves. At that point, players proceed only with Drop moves.

5. When placement possibilities are exhausted, the groups sizes for each player are counted. The player with the largest
group wins, in the event of a tie, the size of the second largest group is counted and so on.

"Groups" refer to a single stone or a set of stones of the same color adjacent orthogonally.

—description from the designer

name: Corporate Life
description:
Corporate Life is a worker placement and area control game with special actions. Each turn players choose an ACE card from a hand of 3 and then select 1 of 3 possible actions:

A: Authorized Action - to place or move workers within the organization.
C: Claim Credit - to score points with the board on your journey to CEO.
E: Executive Event - Seize opportunities created by well meaning, but ill-advised executives.

Positioning Cubers into key organizational positions grants a player access to department bonuses. Some departments protect your Cubers from actions and events, some augment Claiming Credit, and others alter a player's hand. Leveraging these department actions is key to getting ahead of your competition!

Play continues until one player gains access to the CEO's office (25+ Promotion Points). All players take an even number of turns and the player with the most promotion points is appointed the new CEO and wins the game.

This is not a business simulation! It is a lighthearted poke at office politics, bizarre corporate structures, and the underhanded action of those that subscribe to the lifestyle of Corporate Life.
-description from publisher


Welcome to Corporate Life…

You’ve always known you should be in charge. When it comes to directing others, Hollywood’s titans would be wise to seek your advice. That’s why you joined the Inc.Co LLC team - to seize the CEO reins. Unfortunately, your understanding of how it’s supposed to be and that of the Board of Directors is a wee bit out of alignment. Somehow, you’ve landed in a mailroom job. But things are about to change. All you need is the right Cubers (Cubical Workers) in the right position and the company will be yours!

'Corporate Life is a game of competitive manipulation and control. Players vie to maneuver Cubers into key department positions, seize credit for the work of others, and pursuit of that coveted CEO promotion.
- from back of box
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Slide/Push, Take That, Worker Placement

name: PRISM: Trick the Light Fantastic
description:
PRISM - Trick the Light Fantastic is an 18 card trick-taking game in which players aim to capture cards containing 3 colors with the goal of collecting many cards with one color and/or completing sets of cards that contain all 6 colors.

The 18 card deck consists of cards valued 0 to 7 with an uneven distribution. Each trick, a target card is displayed that players will compete to capture. The highest card played wins the target, except a 0-card beats a 7-card. No player may play a card of the same value as already played in the round. The trick winner claims the target card and the card they played becomes the new target card for the next round.

A game lasts a fixed number of tricks based on the number of players. At game end, players score for their best color and for complete card sets that contain all 6 colors.
-description from publisher


Trick the Light Fantastic…

A single white light enters the PRISM and exits as a rainbow of colors. Now it’s up to you to capture those colors as quickly as possible before they fade away. Should you focus on just one specific color or attempt to capture the full spectrum? You’ll have to decide quickly because your options – much like the colors – will vanish.

'PRISM is an ultra-fast trick-taking game for 1 to 5 players using just 6 colors and only 18 cards. Players have only a few turns to trick the light fantastic and claim their victory!
- from back of box

name: The Franciscan Diamond
description:
The Franciscan Diamond is an 18 card trick-taking game played with an asymmetric deck of 4 suits. Each suit has a different number of cards. The game starts with players taking a hidden role and proceeds over 8 rounds.

Each round begins with 3 draft passes where cards are exchanged between all of the players. After the drafts, play consists of tricks where players attempt to capture cards aligned to their secret role while avoiding collecting cards aligned to their role's nemesis. To help keep roles secret, scores in all four suits are kept for each player until the end of the game.

At the end of the game, players score points only for their role cards and lose points for any their nemesis cards obtained. Cards acquired from the other two suits do not gain or lose the player any points. The player with the highest total score wins.

The Franciscan Diamond requires players to play differently based on their assigned role. It is important to try to uncover the roles of others so that the drafts can ensure the right cards end up with the right players to create tricks that are favorable to a player's goals. This manipulation must then be balanced against keeping your secret role hidden. The result of this mix is an unusual trick-taking game that fans of noir mystery can enjoy.
-description from publisher

The Crime of the Century…

…is about to be committed. A Master Thief has set her eyes on The Franciscan Diamond and is plotting to steal it, but an equally talented Private Eye is on her trail. Seeking to distract the gumshoe and working her own angle is the Femme Fatale. But it’s no cake walk for her either because The Cops are hounding her every move, all while trying to avoid being played the fools by the Master Thief. Who will emerge victorious from this caper is a mystery!

'The Franciscan Diamond is an 18-card trick-taking game starring four classic characters of a Noir Mystery: the Master Thief, the Private Eye, the Femme Fatale, and The Cops. Players start the game with a secret role and aim to win tricks that score their objective cards while avoiding collecting cards linked to their nemesis. After 8 scenes, the case is closed and the player that best played their role emerges as the victor!
- from back of box
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Trick-taking

name: Six Ways 2 Sunday
description:
A game of Six Ways 2 Sunday is played over 2 rounds consisting of 6 tricks each. The catch is that the six tricks in each round are not played in sequence, but collectively. That is, a player might play a card to any of the 6 tricks on a given turn. Each trick is limited to 1 card less the number of players, thus not all players will participate in all 6 tricks. The tricks are only resolved when the last card valid card is played and all 6 tricks are completed.

Each trick is won by either the highest or lowest card played depending on the individual trick. Playing a losing card to any trick enables the player to take the special action associated with that trick's day:

Monday: Lets a player move a previously played card.
Tuesday: Lets a player immediately take another turn.
Wednesday: Lets a player change the win condition (high vs Low) for any trick.
Thursday: Lets a player remove a card that has been played.
Friday: Lets a player swap the cards between any 2 tricks.
Saturday: Lets a player draw an extra card into their hand.

All players have an identical deck of 13 cards from which they will draw a hand of 4 cards. The game ends when the second round is completed. Players score points for each trick taken and additional points for capturing other players' highest and lowest valued cards.
-description from publisher

Every win comes with opportunity costs. Make a move to secure one goal and you might find yourself out of luck everywhere else you look. Every loss invites possibilities. Lose ground on one objective and you might just find new options emerge. Can you balance these factors to secure a win?

'Six Ways 2 Sunday is a tricky trick-taking game about gaining control and seizing opportunities. In each of two rounds, players play to and compete in 6 tricks simultaneously. It takes more than winning tricks, though, because players also score for capturing their opponents’ best cards. Careful timing and crafty play can turn the tables in the blink of an eye. Players must consider all options because there are Six Ways 2 Sunday and even more to victory!
- from back of box

name: Boiling Point!
description:
Justice is about to be served - HOT, fresh, and brimming with tears.

The tables have turned when a group of crustaceans at the mercy of some dastardly chefs gained the power of a vengeful spirit. Now they’re fired-up to exact revenge and claw their way out through anything – or anyone – before reaching the Boiling Point!

Take control of crabs, lobsters, and shrimps climbing over each other to the top in an attempt to fight back the chefs and escape.
