Play cards to climb, claw, push and pull your way through to the top of the pot. Drink the tears of your enemies to gain powerful boosts. Collect the most points across two tracks: ‘Escape’ and ‘Revenge’ by getting crustaceans out and taking down the chefs. The player that is the best at satisfying both the taste of freedom and vengeance wins!

The taste of victory is sweet but paired with vengeance it’s even sweeter! Gain points for crustaceans rescued, fingers pinched and sous chefs clinched to go down in crustacean history.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Race, Set Collection, Take That, Track Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: New Jersey (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Ticket to Ride: New Jersey is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride series created by Alan R. Moon. This expansion introduces a whole new board, and a new ticket mechanic. It is designed for players who are already familiar with Ticket to Ride’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

Ticket to Ride: New Jersey is designed to be played with up to 6 players.

Self-published as a craft-it-yourself set for non-commercial use. All rights reserved to the Ticket to Ride name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or play-tested this expansion.

To play with this expansion, you will need to provide some components taken from Ticket to Ride or Ticket to Ride Europe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Kitten Kingdoms
description:
Kitten Kingdoms is a delightful and engaging card game that transports players into a whimsical world where adorable kittens rule over various realms. There are four distinct factions: Fluffington Aristocats, Purrville Innovators, Clawtopia Rogues, and Whiskeria Ambassadors. Each faction offers unique abilities and strategies, allowing players to craft their own style of play and outwit their opponents.

Fluffington: Focuses on drawing cards
Purrville: Focuses on rotating kittens
Whiskeria: Focuses on playing recruitment cards
Clawtopia: Focuses on disruption and chaos in the game

This game is a deck-building style game where players build decks of cards to recruit their own or opponents' kittens with a unique rotation mechanic and recruitment mechanic.

There are a few types of cards in the game:

Kitten Heroes - These are the cards you are trying to recruit.
Kitten Lords - These are powerful leaders of the factions that give high scores and excellent bonuses for those players that recruit them.
Recruiters - These attach to Kitten Heroes and give bonuses.
Motivators - These are cards you play during your turn to motivate kittens to join your cause.
Pounce - These cards can be played at any time and are usually for disrupting your opponent.

The game ends when 6 of the 8 Kitten Lords are recruited. Scores are then tallied, and the player with the highest recruitment score wins.

Games usually last 30-35 minutes but this is highly variable as 6 of the Lords need to be found.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Advanced Dungeon Hero (fan expansion for Dungeon Hero)
description:
Expand your adventures furhter, with this 10 page supplement for Dungeon Hero and AdvanceQuest!

This expansion includes rules for Resting, Healing, Magic Items & Potions and content generation meant to be used alongside the game's adventures.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Trick of Chicken
description:
Trick of Chicken is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players. The game uses an irregular deck of 3 suits. It is a must-follow game, but the winner will be the person who played the lowest ranked card in the suit with the highest sum in the trick - with some special cards, such as the 2 which doubles (x2) other cards of its suit.

Cards from tricks are placed around a central disc showing the three suits. Specifically, the winner will take their card face down in front of themselves, but the other cards from the trick go face down next to the wheel in front of the spot for the suit which won the trick. The winner of the last trick takes all of the cards from the sector of the wheel which matches the card they won the trick with, setting them in front of themselves face up.

Players score points for face down and face up cards. The game takes place over several rounds and the player with the highest total score wins.

name: The Fellowship of Bones
description:
London, 1893. A prominent paleontologist has been murdered, struck down by a fossilized dinosaur bone. A group of naturalists, gathered to hear the victim speak, provide an abundance of witnesses and potential suspects. The Royal Society is in an uproar and Scotland Yard is at a loss. Only the world’s greatest consulting detective, Sherlock Holmes, can unravel this mystery.

his case folder contains the following components:

An entry from Dr. John Watson’s personal diary
Details on Sherlock Holmes’ hand-picked investigators
A special section of The Illustrated Police News, a Victorian tabloid featuring reporting on the scandalous murder
“Welcome to Burlington House,” a brochure and map of The Royal Society’s headquarters (and scene of the crime!)
A list of Holmes’ personal contacts and informants throughout the city
Full-color 18×24″ map of 1893 London
A 36-page city directory with over 500 residential and business locations
Log sheets for tracking investigator movements
Sealed ‘Solve Envelope’ with questions for the end of the investigation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: The Bloom of Hollywood
description:
Los Angeles, CA, 1948. A young starlet is found murdered in her own home. The LAPD has a strong lead and a likely suspect, but the girl’s mother wants no stone left unturned. Are the police correct in pursuing a gangster, known for harassing actresses and not taking no for an answer? Should they look closer at her hot-blooded matinee-idol ex-boyfriend? Or even the rising Los Angeles District Attorney who nearly lost his job and marriage after his affair with the starlet went public?

Study the clues. Send out your team. Solve the case.

This case folder contains the following components:

Transcript of initial interview with the client, Rose Fitzgibbon
Details on the Knight Detective Agency’s investigators
A section of The Los Angeles Times featuring reporting on murder
“While You Were Out” notepad message
List of expert contacts and informants throughout the city
Full-color 17×23″ map of 1948 Los Angeles
30-page City Directory with over 500 residential and business locations
Log sheets for tracking investigator movements
Sealed ‘Solve Envelope’ with questions for the end of the investigation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Su o Giù?
description:
A dynamic party game with lots of 3-level questions!
In Su o Giù? one player answers the question on the card and the others have to bet whether the correct answer is higher or lower. Play bonuses, score points and win after 3 rounds.
So many questions with different themes, impossible to know them all.

name: Brändi DOG Plus 3
description: An expansion that allows for playing with three players.

name: Thorgal: The Board Game – Companion Cards
description:
Embark on a journey through the land of Thorgal with a cast of diverse and dynamic characters by your side. Each companion brings unique abilities and strengths to the table, allowing you to tackle challenges and defeat enemies easily.

Includes: 8 cards

name: Sprawdzian
description:
Sprawdzian (Test) is an educational game for 2–4 players (or teams). It contains a booklet with 1080 questions and answers from categories like biology, geography, physics, chemistry, history, Polish language, sports, mathematics, culture and English and German languages.

The goal of the game is to fill all the fields on a player's board with matching cards. Cards can be acquired by correctly answering the questions — 1 cards per 1 correct answer. The winner is the player who fills his board first.

name: Global Mining
description:
Global Mining was conceived and developed by real miners who are also fans of board games. It is a turn-based strategy game whose goal is to get the best result consisting in creating a global company dealing with the exploitation of all minerals and raw materials. The map of the main game is a map of the earth with a representation of actual resources. The game will be produced in 4 versions:

Full Edition: 180 map tiles,
North and South America: 60 map tiles.
Europe and Africa: 60 map tiles.
Asia and Australia: 60 map tiles.


Each edition will contain a basic set of pawns for each player: Geologist, Mine, Pipeline, Seaport, Railroad, Oil Rig and a proportional number of resource pawns: Oil Barrels, Gas Barrels, Coal, Gold, Silver, Copper, Iron Ore, Rare Earth Metals, Nickel, Magnesite, Stone.

Global Mining is a turn-based game, the winner is the player who scores the most points within a certain time. Points are earned by: discovering natural resources such as Gold, building mines, building pipelines, building railways, building seaports, establishing transport lines for ships.
Global Mining is based on linguistically universal symbols. The game manual in the first edition will be translated into: Polish, English, German, Spanish, French, Czech.
categories: Economic, Educational, Environmental, Exploration, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Political, Puzzle, Territory Building, Transportation

name: Spelet om Allsvenskan: Säsongen 2023
description: Spelet om Allsvenskan: Säsongen 2023 is the first expansion of Spelet om Allsvenskan. It adds new teams, new rankings, new schedules, and two new deck of cards to replace the content in the basic game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Chaining, Communication Limits, Negotiation, Prisoner's Dilemma, Simulation, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Munchkin Legendy 2/3: Faunie Igrzyska
description: This expansion, released only in Polish, contains the contents of both Munchkin Legends 2: Faun and Games and Munchkin Legends 3: Myth Prints.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Munchkin Zombie 3/4: Ręka, noga, mózg w kanale
description: This expansion, released only in Polish, contains the contents of both Munchkin Zombies 3: Hideous Hideouts and Munchkin Zombies 4: Spare Parts.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Calçada
description:
There is a lot of activity on the Portuguese sidewalks. The first bars open and numerous people swarm out. Children scamper around happily, couples in love stroll through the alleys, while older passers-by relax on park benches in the shade following the hustle and bustle.

In Calçada, players take turns drafting pavement-tiles from the general display onto their player board via a mancala-inspired selection mechanism. Once someone completes a certain area, they get points based on the value of that area. This value then decreases. At the end, everyone gets extra points for connected objects or groups. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Skeptics: Promo Pack 1
description:
The first print run of Skeptics included a Ten Card promotional pack as a thank you for helping our first project succeed. This was included with all Kickstarter copies and the rest of the copies during the first print run.

The Exclusive Ten Card Promotional Pack includes the following:

x1 Special Item Card - Thurible
x1 Museum Environment Card - ORB
x1 Asylum Environment Card - Cold Spot
x1 Common Environment Card - The Other Side
x1 Item Card - Music Box
x4 Clue Cards - Old Vase, Ghostly Presence, Coffer, Under Pressure
x1 Promotional Pack Rules Card

name: Squeaky Clean
description:
Solo, in-hand, 24-card, puzzle-y game about money laundering.

Name's Carmen
Friends call me Suds
spose no one's called me Suds in years
...
This town is dirty
The money. The streets. The fuzz.
Organized grime
...
I'm getting too old for this
You've got a laundromat. Grit. Patience.
Soon you'll have cash in hand
as long as you stack the deck in your favor

—description from the designer

name: Tilting at Windmills
description:
Tilting at Windmills is a 17-card, hand-management, charming, puzzle-y game.

Life is nasty, brutish, and short when your nose is to the grindstone. There is wood to chop; grain to mill; cloth to weave. Sure, you've got six (seven? who can keep track?) dependable if not-particularly-bright children who help with the chores. But then some misguided nut comes along and tears a hole in your sail with his lance. Use your limited energy wisely to keep your windmill from falling into ruins, season after season.

—description from the designer

name: Antares
description:
In the 14th solar month of the year 2235, the merchant ship Antares encountered an unknown alien entity.

During their return trip home, the crew diverted from their heading to investigate an archaeological find on a distant moon, orbiting a small binary system, outside the Alpha Centauri cluster. The site was found to contain artifacts from an ancient race that had long vanished from that system. Among the ruins the crew uncovered an alien chrysalis. Believing it to be one of the artifacts it was unknowingly taken on board.

Six days after their departure from the moon the alien was released from the chrysalis, and it was free and roaming the ship. The crew made preparations to abandon ship, believing that the alien was hostile. They were correct in their assumption.

Using the collected audio and video surveillance data from on board the ship the events that followed have been pieced together.

This is the record of the events that occurred on the Antares while the crew tried desperately to abandon ship.

Play out the crew's final hour as they attempt to abandon ship. Antares is geared for easy solitaire play, but can be expanded to up to 7 players.

Antares is a thematic, space horror game. The actions of the crew are up to you, and the choices you make may well determine who survives, and escapes the doomed vessel Antares, and who falls victim to the alien lifeform.

Antares is the first game in the Antares series. Telling the first chapter of the story of the doomed ship Antares, and its alien cargo.

Antares is playable solo or co-op.

Game play

Build the Antares using the Cabin and Corridor tiles. The ship must have all corridor ends connected to Cabins. Different builds of the Antares offer different levels of difficulty.

Choose your crew selecting one side from each of the seven crewmember cards. Each crewmember has their own unique ability and choice of two starting locations.

Complete the Navigation, Reactor, & Mainframe Access objectives. Spending an action in the Bridge, Reactor Room, or Mainframe Access cabins will advance the matching counter 1 spot forward. Use of the Air Ducts can expedite movement through the ship, but the alien lifeform has found them to be useful as well.

Collect enough O2 Canisters and Spacesuits for any surviving crewmembers before they head to the Escape Craft. Flame throwers may be found in the Cargo Hold, and can be used to ward off an alien attack. Each encounter with the alien lifeform can cause the crew to experience Fear, Terror, or Paranoia.

Avoid the alien lifeform. As the crew complete objectives and collect precious items they are constantly at risk of attack from the alien. After each action performed a Scan card must be drawn which will indicate if the alien attacks, or if the crew is safe for one more round.

Escape if the crew manages to complete all objects they may regroup in the Escape Pod, and execute the Delta Launch Code to escape the doomed Antares merchant vessel.

—description from the designer

name: Title Wave: The AI Movie Game
description:
We asked an AI to create NEW titles for popular movies (henceforth referred to as clues). The AI created our clues using aspects of the movie’s plot and characters, but it's not obvious what the AI “knows” about these movies, so we’re never sure about what it’s going to spit out. Some clues go off script and bits of the real world creep in, with the names of actors, directors, or aspects of the movie’s critical reception. And sometimes the computer tells us things that come out of nowhere, like an incorrect movie quote or a #badhashtag. This unpredictability add an element of randomness, and hilarity to the game.

Players win by guessing the original movie title based on the AI generated clue.

With 6 distinct ways to play and the potential for many other "house rules" and customization. Title Wave offers replayablity and creativity that many triva-style games lack.

Example clues

"Defying the Orders of the USS Enterprise and the USS Cougar" ~ Top Gun
"Eliminating He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named: A Regulus the Animagus & Gryffindor Co-Op Study" ~ Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
"A Study of Humanoid Individuality: 'You’re Welcome' When Stepping Into Your Own Story" ~ Moana


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Coffee Time
description:
King Tea has infiltrated the Realm of Time. Help Cup Joe and his Coffee Time friends stop King Tea from making it Tea Time permanently across the 5 Worlds; or sound the trumpets and join the crumpets (King Tea’s mindless minions of mayhem). "The fate of the 5 Worlds hangs in the balance as you decide whether to side with Cup Joe and or King.


Choose to play as one of four Coffee Time Heroes: Cup Joe, Thermos, Little Miss Hot Shot, or Donette. Or, join the crumpets and play as one of two villains: King Tea or the zombie crumpet named Roamer.



Coffee Time is an introduction to strategy games for 2-6 players and ages 8+. Players take turns following the instructions on their unique player cards.


Heroes, begin by using or trading item cards, then they move forward toward the activation chamber by rolling dice. At the end of each move heroes draw from the Journey Deck where they can be launched into a battle, suffer at the hands of the Duchess or gather valuable items.

Roamer tries to knock heroes back to start and prevent them from reaching the Realm of Time, and steals valuable item cards from heroes. King Tea spends his turns changing the World Clocks and sending out his royal guards to thwart the heroes.


Heroes make their way to the Realm of Time to try to defeat royal guards and King Tea. If they can successfully defeat all 5 guards and King Tea, then the heroes win the game.



The Roamer and King Tea have extremely powerful cards that they can utilize strategically, once per game, to thwart the heroes or turn the World Clocks more quickly. If the tea characters change all 5 World Clocks to Tea Time, then the villains win the game.



Coffee Time is a fast-paced game that takes under an hour to play. Coffee Time is brewed espresso-ly for families and friends with fun infused into every detail.


—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Music, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Role Order, Variable Player Powers

name: NecroMansters
description:
In NecroMansters, players create piles of overlapping monster-themed cards onto their play area or bench in order to attack and defend. Card stacks need three distinct types in order to attack or defend: health, special ability, and attack. Once a stack has all three types, players can boost the power of their stacks by topping them with special cards.

Players seek to eliminate opponents by attacking undefended lanes, but may also switch active and benched stacks to protect themselves.

Each card has unique flavor text and illustration, with no two cards being exactly alike.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Layering, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: To the Point
description:
This is 2 player game for young adults, family’s or children that are ready to play tactical games.

The goal of the game is to reach the other side of the game board by placing tiles on a grid. These tiles contain circles that determine where your pawn can move and where it can not. Moving is done by playing cards that show directions and players can also move their opponents pawn.

To the Point is a tactical move-and-card game that takes about 30 minutes to finish.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Paria
description:
You are an outcast. The society you were part of turned its back on you and disowned you. They say you committed a heinous crime or, perhaps, were accused of a mistake too serious to be overlooked. You were cast out of your life, denied help and ostracised.

Now, you walk through a hostile world trying to regain the shreds of your lost dignity. You are willing to risk your life in an almost impossible mission to vindicate yourself in the eyes of those who were once your own. But life alone is very difficult and the challenges you face threaten to overtake you with every step you take.

In Paria, by Cezar Capacle, we will live the intense experience of a solitaire role-playing game that proposes us to enter a setting that we can create completely at random. Dare to explore a world that you will have to create as you build your character and guide his or her steps through an emotional story that is aimed at deciding if you will achieve redemption or if you will be lost forever in solitude.

Create your own game world by rolling on the setting tables and with the help of the oracle tables.
Develop each scene by delving into your character, the causes that led to him or her becoming an outcast, and the elements that appear in the narrative.
You can replay Pariah as many times as you like, as your own imagination, the world creation system and the oracles will ensure that your story never repeats itself.

name: Fire Noodle Eating Champs! The Dice Game
description:
The Annual Fire Noodle Eating Contest is about to begin!

Contestants are battling it out in this 1 V 1 Noodle Eating Contest to be crowned the Fire Noodle Eating Champ!

The first to eat all their bowls of noodles and grab the trophy wins!

Fire Noodle Eating Champs: The Dice Game is the dice game inspired by the video game from Wombok Games.

Contestants will be racing to eat noodles as fast as possible. In real-time, they will be rolling and matching dice of various noodle toppings on their Spicy Fire Noodles cards. Once the noodles have their appropriate toppings, they're ready to eat. But don't let the noodles burn on the way down!

—description from the designer

name: The Mechanic
description:
The Mechanic is a very compact card game for 2-6 players (4+ ages), you can learn how to play it in less than 3 minutes. In the box you can find 84 cards: 12 special engine cards, 66 gear combinations cards and 6 mechanic character cards.

The mechanics of the game is similar to Mexican Train. Each card has a combination of two gears, one on each end. Each player builds their own mechanism by matching and connecting the gears by type and color. The goal is to be the first player to play all of their gears.

Special engine cards are used to begin the game, but also to split the sequence into two, so players will have the opportunity to play on more than one side of the mechanism, giving them more options to get rid of all their cards. Gears can be arranged in several ways to build different mechanisms

-description from designer

name: SWARM
description:
The Swarm savors flesh and circuit; it merges and couples and corrupts in a wetware nightmare where neurons and tissue become logic gates in its petahertz cycles. The Swarm is viral, and when it has consumed everything on planet Ramses, it will look for another host.

You will take the role of a colonist attempting to escape the planet Ramses. You must take your character to the only known zone of safety, where you can rendezvous with a rescue ship. It will not be easy. Like locusts to wheat, The Swarm is compelled towards machines — the very machines you will rely on to get out alive. And The Swarm and its manifestations are not the only hazards on Ramses.

—description from the designer

name: Wrong Answers Only
description: A trivia game where you are trying to get players to fall for your wrong answer!

name: M.A.A.S. Impact
description:
M.A.A.S. IMPACT is a tactical level game of man-to-man combat in a dark future. Players manage a squad or full platoon of heavily armed and armored soldiers as they navigate through blasted terrain to accomplish their mission. This could be to capture or hold terrain, break through the enemy lines, or simply destroy enemy soldiers.

Each soldier is tracked with his or her own data card, allowing the capabilities of each to be hidden until engaged. Ten different soldier types, each with its own abilities can be selected as part of a squad, through twelve different scenarios across ten different tabloid-sized (11x17 inch) geomorphic maps, allowing for hundreds of different battlefield configurations. An included “design-your-own” system makes it easy to create your own scenarios.

The game's action is managed through the use of a deck of "action cards" that provide quick combat results as well as random events.

Also included are guidelines on how to play M.A.A.S. IMPACT using miniatures, either with or without the map sheets.

Components include:


Rules Manual
Geomorphic Map Sheets (10)
Scenario Cards (12)
Player Aid Cards (3)
Counter Sheets, double-sided (3)
Soldier Cards, double-sided (126)
Action Cards (72)
Sheet of Hidden Setup Cards
Movement/Range Gauge (for miniatures)


In addition to the print-and-play components, the option to purchase a set of professionally printed soldier cards is available. This deck of cards also includes hidden setup cards as well as a “marker test” card that can be used to test the ability to remove wet-erase or grease pencil marks from the cards before possibly damaging the soldier cards.

NOTE: Testing on cards purchased from WargameVault indicate that "ultra-clean washable markers" (such as those available from Crayola) or "china pencils" are the best options. Dry-erase markers should NOT be used as the ink stains the cards.

Fire your powered armor, heat up your weapon pack, and prepare for mayhem in the wasteland with M.A.A.S. IMPACT!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: このねこはうさぎですか? (Is this a cat or a rabbit?)
description:
You are a worker working at a rabbit cat sorting area. Let's do our best today to sort the rabbits and cats.

The rabbit has long ears and a short tail, and the cat has short ears and a long tail. Everyone knows it. But this is difficult.

In this game, the lead player plays any one card and declare whether it’s a cat or a rabbit. Afterwards, each following player must player a cat (long tail, short ear) or a rabbit (long ear, short tail) accordingly. If they cannot play the required animal, they either play a rabbit/cat to lose a trick and hands black chips to other players or play a new species and make a trump in order to win the trick. The card with highest trump or highest responsibility value wins. If all player can play a card of the needed animal, bonus points (2 white chips) will be given.

At the end of a round, the single player with the most collected black chips do not score points; otherwise, each white chip scores 1 point.

Thus, in this game, the player would like to declare an animal that every other player can follow.
publishers: やすものゲームズ (Yasumono Games)

name: Flora: the flowery card game
description:
Game idea
The flower fairy Flora is desperate: All the beautiful colors have disappeared from her neighboorhood. With seed balls that grow colorful flowers, she wants to make everything colorful again. But she needs your help to do so.

Can you manage to make your flowers bloom? The brave bird will protect them from the hungry snail and the rainbow will shine, but beware when the heatwave comes or the whirlwind messes everything up ...

Aim of the game
Collect the different seed ball cards and place them on top of each other in your neighborhood in the order 1 to 5. If you don't have any matching cards, Flora the flower fairy will help you. A bird can protect them against snails and the whirlwind threatens your flowers as they blossom. Survive the heatwave together and be happy when the rainbow makes your flowers grow faster.

Watch the seed sprout and grow into a beautiful flower – the neighborhoods finally become colorful again.

The first with 3 fully grown flowers wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Metal Melee
description:
Metal Melee is a multiplayer card game for 2-4 players that uses AI-generated artwork and strategic card abilities. Players use cards depicting Robots and Mechanical Titans to assemble an army and fight each other on the battlefield of Mechs. The objective is to defeat all other players' Bots and collect the most Power Shards from the Bots and Titans you destroy, emerging as the Metal Monarch and the champion of all things metal.

Featuring 176 playable cards, where no two Bot, Titan, Utility, and Pilot cards are the same, all with beautiful artwork and abilities geared for maximum mechanical mayhem. Metal Melee is for avid players of competitive card games and new players alike. Our mission is to develop a game with enough depth and variety to keep you coming back for more, all with a short and comprehensive rulebook so that you can break it out even at your more casual game night and introduce new players to a match of robot fisticuffs.

The first to collect 12 Power Shards from destroyed bots is the winner unless a player is the first to raise an army of 6 Bots and 1 Titan. Players start the game by selecting between three game modes and building their decks in either a random build, grid draft, or one collectively shared deck. Players then choose a Power Plant, which has unique abilities to be used throughout the game and generates Energy for you to use each round. Improve your Energy Production by drawing Energy Crystal cards from a stack of cards adjacent to your deck called your Power Mine and then attaching them to your Power Plant. Alternatively, you may discard them from your hand to your Junkyard for a faster boost of Energy to be used that same turn. Play Bots and Titans from your hand onto your field to assemble your army. (Your field is made up of a front row that can hold 3 Melee Bots, and a back row of 3 Ranged Bots, with Support Bots that can go in either row. Titans are placed adjacent to these rows in their own designated space.) Utility cards can be played to help you maintain an edge over your opponents and protect your own field, and Pilot cards can be attacked by your Bots or Titans to grant them extra strengths or new abilities. Combat damage is determined one card at a time, with each card on your field selecting to do a basic attack or use any activated abilities. The player who reduces an opponent's Bot or Titan to 0 Health Points earns Power Shards equal to the value indicated on the destroyed card. Metal Melee is easy to pick up and learn, but challenging to master with its wide range of card interactions where no two Bot, Titan, Utility, and Pilot cards are the same.

While we celebrate the advancements and achievements of modern artificial intelligence and have made it a feature of the AI Edition of our game, rest assured, this could not have been developed without the countless hours of testing, iteration, prototyping, and the most essential ingredient; flesh-and-blood (with some sweat and tears too). We are also releasing Metal Melee: Pixeled Edition at the same time, with handmade art in the style of 80's arcade-style gaming featuring pixel-art-themed cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Coverage, Open Drafting, Stat Check Resolution, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Mia and Me: Mia Mia das schnelle Kartenspiel
description: Card game on the theme of "Mia and Me".

name: Flight Plan
description:
Flight Plan is a card-pulling, investment, and market strategy, squeeze-your-eyes-tight-and-hope-for-good-luck game. Players use strategy to try to dominate the global airline industry by developing a network of routes, acquiring fleets of aircraft, and establishing hubs around the globe. But the daily briefing cards insert an element of chance, so even the best-laid strategy can be overcome. The daily briefing can increase your revenue, make you pay penalties, or end your turn. A few can ruin your airline.

The world is separated into six operating regions: North America (NA), South America (SA), Europe (EU), Africa (AF), Asia-Pacific (AP), and the Middle East (ME). 100 Routes connect 57 cities. 15 Cities have been identified as hubs. You can win in one of three ways:


Be the first to provide service to all six regions using a network of connected routes; connections to multiple regions can go through a single city.
Establish a hub in any three of the six operating regions.
Own all the short-haul routes in two adjoining North/South regions: [North America | South America], [Europe | Africa] or [Asia-Pacific | Middle East].


—description from the designer
mechanics: Income, Investment, Market, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Ownership, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move

name: Foxpaw
description:
The gates of FOXPAW are still closed.
But not much longer... stay tuned & be ready.

Magic awaits!

name: Jeu du Skating-Rink
description:
Jeu du Skating-Rink represents another form of Goose variant: the introduction of two tracks, each of 63 spaces. The players divide themselves into two opposing teams, each playing on a different track. Additional interest is provided by crossing the tracks: at these points, if the two teams come together, they ”come to grief and fall” and both must start the game afresh. Other hazards are marked by red or blue numerals on the respective tracks, both tracks having the same set of hazards, though not in corresponding order. The hazards are illustrated by scenes near the space’s number. For example, "skater taking a rest - wait twice his turn to throw the dice" occurs at space 43 blue, and space 10 red; ”a player who asks for a match and passes one turn” occurs at blue 35 and red 47; while "lost his purse - each player pays him 2 to help him out of his difficulty" occurs at blue 27 and red 28. The game is won by reaching or surpassing space 63, so reverse overthrows are not played. There are no spaces in which the goose-doubling rule applies; in fact, the track length is the only connection with the classic Goose game. The firm of Saussine was one of the major French manufacturers of games between its founding in 1860 and closure in the 1960s. Their games are often original (the founder, Leon Saussine, held several patents) and are always attractive, making good use of chromolithography, as in the present exhibit. As well as catering for the French market, they aimed at an international clientele, here indicated by the fact that the separate rule sheet is printed in both French and English.
(Adrian Seville)

name: Monslaught in Warpurgis
description:
This game is the new deck building game. The player can select and take the new cards in the hand from the discarded pile at the end of the turn. No random.

The players collects the monsters from the field.
Their monsters are added to the deck.
The Boss round is happened every three rounds.

Each cards has the points. After 12th round, the winner is the player with the most points.

This is the series of "Monslaught".
The rule is changed at some points from Monslaught in Halloween.

name: Cubano
description:
Cubano is a territory placement game, using cubic dice and wooden sticks. This nice and clever material can also be used to play several other games.

In the main game, "Cubano 2 dice", each player has a color and tries to form the biggest set of connected dice of his own color through three phases. At the beginning of the game, all the cubes and sticks are put in a common reserve.
During the first phase, each player rolls two dice and take from the reserve sticks and cubes according to the dice rolled (own color = 1 cube, other colors = 4 sticks).
During the second phase, which starts when there is no stick left in the reserve, players can collect cubes, place cubes and sticks on the board (a cube must be surrounded by sticks) and also steal cubes and sticks from other players stocks.
During the third phase, which starts when the reserve is empty, players tries to place their remaining sticks and cubes, and can also turn cubes already placed on the board on their own color. The game ends when the last cube is placed, and the player with the most connected cubes wins.

—user summary

name: The Sword In Africa: Safari Event Deck
description:
First appearing in the 20th Anniversary Edition of TSATF, The Sword In Africa (TSIA) helped establish "Darkest Africa" as one of the most popular new theaters of Colonial War Games allowing for exciting and exotic skirmish gaming on the Dark Continent.

A total of four (4) Game Decks are provided for TSIA, the first two ideally suited for Campaign and Map Movement Games.

The "Safari Event Deck" provides random occurrences that happen while trekking toward whatever goal the Party may have. Besides animal encounters, there are Native Tribes--hostile and friendly--unmapped terrain, rain forests, trackless veldt, good hunting and bad, food, water, and issues with your Bearers, and the inevitable calls for Hongo (tribute) from the people whose lands you cross.

It's never a dull moment when you know that most anything can happen at any time when on Safari!

This Event Deck consists of 30 unique cards, as ever in full color with period art and graphics for even more "atmosphere". An extra card lists ideas for use so players may find their own comfort zone before letting the cards determine their fate!

—description from the publisher

name: The Sword In Africa: River Event Deck
description:
As the title suggests, this is the Riverine partner to the TSIA Safari Deck.

Whenever a party of Explorers, Hunters, Soldiers sets out to travel up or down any of Africa's many rivers and waterways--whether by raft, canoe, or steamer--there are special risks and opportunities. Sudden rapids, waterfalls, swamps, Native ambushes from the banks, attacks by fleets of war canoes, encounters with hippopotamus, crocodile, elephant, and the ever present risks of submerged obstacles, engine troubles, damages to the vessel and its parts, risks of capsizing, loss of stores--and people!--are only some of the things that make for games the likes of which you've never played before.

This deck has its own special "ambiance" with particularly appropriate contemporary art and other graphics, as well as the obligatory "extra card" with ideas for use.

—description from the publisher

name: Death in a Meeting
description:
A humorous card game for 1-6 players. Play the cards you're dealt, score the most points, and leave before Death enters the meeting, ending the game.

Players are stuck in a tedious corporate meeting. The kind that keeps them from doing important things and bores everyone involved. The only way to leave is to play the cards in your hand. Take a coffee break, show a Powerpoint presentation, answer your phone, and more. Any excuse is a good one to get points and exit. When Death shows up, no one is safe.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: The Sword In Africa: Action Deck
description:
As with those for other TSATF games, this 52 card Action Deck prompts the order of movement and fire, as well as severity of casualties, from “Lightly Wounded” to “Dead.”

But, TSIA’s rules call for use of a standard deck of playing cards to be read in ways different from the traditional TSATF game model. However, this dedicated Action Deck eliminates all need to consult the rules on how to read the cards, and includes special rules frequently overlooked in the heat of play (such as hits on previously wounded figures, and the risk of death from poisoned weapons). There are also six special cards to cue rolling in the basic game for "Random Episodes."

More unique period graphics and an extra card with simple instructions and options for use of the Action Deck round out the set.

—description from the publisher

name: The Sword In Africa: Battle Event Deck
description:
In TSIA, the rules call for using a standard card deck, of which six cards cue the players to check for “Random Episodes” by rolling dice on one of 5 different tables. But the new Battle Event Deck eliminates all that, and includes almost half again as many “episodes” as appear in the original rules. Now there are fifty Event Cards, most of which have variables practically guaranteeing no two games can ever be alike.

Some of the original “Episodes” have been retained; others modified in a variety of ways, and still more are entirely new. From army ants and African killer bees, to encounters with Elephant, Cape Buffalo, Rhinoceros, and more, to up close confrontations with snakes, Pygmies, flash floods, mysterious strangers, traitors, mutineers, The “King” and “Queen” of the Jungle, and more to make your wild fights in the forest/bush/veldt even wilder!

An advantage of the Battle Event Deck over the original tables is that once a card has been drawn, it cannot be repeated. But for those who still like that possibility, there is an optional “Reshuffle” card requiring all previously used cards to be returned to the deck!

Still more unique and unrepeated period graphics and photos decorate the cards, and there is that indispensable card with printed suggestions for more uses of the Battle Event Deck.

—description from the publisher

name: Master Udo Vs. the Four Martial Arts Masters
description:
You are Master Udo, a martial arts master. To prove that you are the best martial arts master around, you must sequentially challenge and defeat four other martial arts masters.

Master Udo is a puzzly game about making combos. You start with 10 basic cards in your hand. Each card is separated into 2 halves: a condition and an effect. By placing cards covering the previous effect, Udo increases the length of their combo. This makes the combo stronger. However, as the combo gets larger, it gets harder to build due to the conditions. Some conditions include "Odd" (can only be played in an odd position in the combo), "MAX 3" (can only be played in a combo of length 3 or less), and "No right" (cannot be played in a combo with "right arm" or "right leg").

There is no partial damage in this game, which means that it is often important to store up "charge" that can be spent to increase the length of a combo at critical moments. Charge can be gained by blocking attacks and by playing certain combos.

It is important to be efficient with card play because the top card of each combo gets discarded once that combo resolves. Additionally, failing to block an attack results in a specific card being discarded. If the player discards all their cards, they lose. Additionally, if they can't discard or exile (remove from discard) the correct card when getting hit, they lose. Once Udo defeats 4 masters, they win. Udo can choose to challenge weaker or stronger masters in any order, but choosing to challenge weaker masters may reduce the overall glory earned at the end of the game. Defeating a master allows Udo to learn their signature move, improving Udo's strength in future battles.

—description from the publisher

name: Mining Inc
description:
Mining Inc is a 2-4 player game where competing mining agencies are trying to find great treasures buried deep in the ground. There are 4 legendary treasures, each with a different win condition once discovered. Each player can only obtain 1 win condition, and players do not know which one they will get until they find it.

This game is all about upgrading things. Players get cards and slide paperclips to track how far their upgrades have progressed. They must spend energy and/or money to upgrade stuff. Upgrades include things such as energy generation, cargo capacity (hand limit), drill (allows mining deeper), hull (allows selling of hazards), and the scanner (allows looking at the top cards of the deck).

The mining is represented by 4 decks of levels 1-4. The deeper levels require upgraded drills and more energy, but have better rewards. Players can sell their loot to gain more money, which is then used to upgrade their operation further.

Since players do not know their win condition in advance, there is an incentive to find it early and start working towards it, but this comes at the cost of being able to amass certain upgrades that are expensive but can quickly snowball.

—description from the designer

name: Kaninspil
description:
Setting up the game:
Place the rabbit house in the middle of the table, and press down the roof to activate the spring. Place the rabbits in a pile beside it.
The youngest player starts. He/she rolls the dice and then carefully places a rabbit on the roof in the colour shown on the dice. Then it is the next player's turn. If there are no more rabbits on the colour shown on the dice, the player rolls the dice again. The player who blows the roof off and makes the rabbits hop loses.

name: Gridwave
description: Upcoming wallet game from Button Shy.

name: Kingdom Come: Four suits
description:
Kingdom Come is a battle-strategy game where players will pick one of four decks (referred to as kingdoms) to defend themselves against their opponent. Each kingdom contains seven character and nine weapons. Any character within your kingdom can use any of the weapons within that kingdom, but there will be one weapon that will grant each character a special ability.

You can place three characters on the board at a time. The game is over when you have either defeated all seven of your opponents' characters or managed to defeat all of your opponents' characters on the board in a single turn.

We have incorporated nostalgic elements such as dominoes, card suits, and candy-land like characters into our game to give players a bit of nostalgia as they our brought into our world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Connections, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Physical Removal, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: The Horus Heresy: Book Nine – Crusade
description:
The Horus Heresy Book Nine – Crusade focuses on the war for the Eastern Fringe between the Dark Angels and the Night Lords. As well as detailed background on the Thramas campaign, the book includes in-depth lore about both of the Legions involved, new army lists, and a series of missions to let you recreate some of the most bitter battles of the civil war.

Within the leather-bound, 210-page book, you’ll find detailed background information on the Thramas Crusade, told across six chapters from The Edge of Ruin to The Heavy Toll of Victory, describing the vicious battles between the Dark Angels and the Night Lords in and around the Thramas system. These conflicts were some of the bloodiest seen in the entire heresy, with no quarter given on either side.

As well as detailed background of the fighting and the sides who took part, this book includes interlinked missions that let you replay the Thramas campaign. There is also a brand-new army list for the Dark Angels Legion and an updated one for the Night Lords Legion.

Full background for the forces involved is included: on the side of the Imperium you’ll find the Dark Angels Legion and the Legio Victorum. On the side of the Warmaster you'll find the Night Lords Legion.

The Horus Heresy Book Nine - Crusade is a complete expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 game – it requires the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook, the Legiones Astartes Crusade Army List and the Mechanicum Taghmata Army List books to use all of its contents.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Sword and the Flame: Northwest Frontier Action Deck
description:
The Action Deck for fans of the 2nd Afghan War and/or "punitive expeditions" with those unique factors adding up to make this theater "The Grim" of legend and history. Period graphics suggest the period of the 2nd Afghan War, and the cards allow for the presence of Afghan Regulars, as well as Afghan and Pathan Tribesmen.

—description from the publisher

name: The Sword and the Flame: Mahdist Wars Action Deck
description:
If a day with Fuzzy on the rush is your idea of table top action, and if you like to form squares against hordes of Ansar racing in for the kill, this is your Deck! Representing British and Egyptian forces, as well as "Fuzzy Wuzzy's" and Ansar, these Cards will heat up your battles faster than the gun barrels of your Gatling!

—description from the publisher

name: The Sword and the Flame: First Boer War Action Deck
description:
Now you have another reason to be afraid to go back into the bush-veldt! Contemporary art and atmospheric graphics will add to your proper inclination to keep your head down in Johnny Boer's neighborhood!

—description from the publisher

name: The Sword and the Flame: Egyptian War Action Deck
description:
One of the slickest, yet riskiest, campaigns of the entire period, Egypt was a "gateway" that pitted the best of Victoria's Battalions/ Regiments against the Egyptian Army of Arabi Pasha, only to lead on to involvement in the Sudan. The often under rated Egyptian Army had brave soldiers and excellent Engineers, and made for the most nearly equal foe that Tommy met until Johnny Boer came along!

—description from the publisher

name: The Sword and the Flame: Boxer Rebellion Action Deck
description:
The Boxer Rebellion is easily the most colorful and exotic of all the late Imperialist adventures, the only time a military coalition of the US, Britain, France, Germany, Austro-Hungary, Italy, Russia and Japan took the field together against a common enemy.

The Boxer Rebellion Action Deck is itself unique in that for the first time in this series "dedicated" cards are provided to cue the Movement and Fire of units of the individual members of that coalition. Thus, there are cards specifying Imperial German, Japanese, Russian, and British units, as well as those of the other participants. These are apportioned roughly to match the troops committed by each member, so that British, Russian, and Japanese, and US cards abound, while Italy, Austria, and France are proportionally fewer.

Their Chinese opponents, however, had their own divisions and factions, and these are represented by cards specifying Boxer units (the largest group), as well as others for Imperial Bannermen, the Kansu Braves, and those units from the various "Westernized" units with more modern weapons and training.

In effect, using the cards as played guarantees that both sides will find it harder to stick to any joint plan and end up going their own way, as was exactly the case so often.

Using authentic Boxer and Manchu flags for the period, as well as the Colors of the Coalition members and other period illustrations, the cards are especially atmospheric and will help to put your games notches higher for drama, excitement, and speed of play.

—description from the publisher

name: The North West Frontier Event Deck
description:
The heart of the Deck is content of each Card. The challenges to the players on both sides of the Crags are sharper than ever, but are still "even" for both sides. As with all TVAG Event Decks, these are not your Monopoly "Chance Cards," nor are the effects of each the same from game to game--severities and benefits vary across a wide spectrum.

And the whimsy is still there... and the fun and a hint of Hollywood, too, but never so much as to spoil the game.

If playing in Afghanistan, Native Reinforcements can include Regular Foot, Horse, or Guns--but not so if elsewhere on The Grim. If the battle is in Winter, Blizzards and Frostbite can affect both sides, but the Imperials worst of all. British troops can even be introduced to the charms of the Camel Spider, the Pathan Rock Fall, and Jezail armed Snipers, while Afghan/Pathan Tribesmen can find their Black Powder is soot and ash sold them by an Infidel Dog, or that their Mullah's have one battle plan and their Hill Chieftain another, or that the Gurkha's facing them are going to blood their Kukri's today, no matter the cost!

And besides these and so many more jolly moments that could never appear in a standard war games scenario, there is a new feature in the NWF Event Deck added as a tribute to the late author of The Sword And The Flame

These six Cards, randomly distributed throughout the Deck among the others, bear the likenesses of some characters all Colonial War Gamers will know from beloved films, characters whom Sgt. Brom has encountered on the edges of the battlefield who carry special Intelligence for the British C-in-C concerning Reinforcements for the Imperial or Native Forces. Their numbers, type, the time of their Arrival and Entry Points will be reported some number of Turns in advance. For the first time with these Event Cards, the British Players can attempt to coordinate the time and place of new Units with their current forces to defeat the Hill Tribes, or, if it's the Afghans/Pathans who are about to be reinforced, move to prevent their arrival causing a disaster!

—description rom the publisher

name: Waynesboro-opoly
description: A Monopoly-like game set in the Borough of Waynesboro.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Competition Sudoku
description:
In Competition Sudoku, 2 players race to solve the same puzzle. Instead of a timer putting pressure on you, or an app counting your moves and giving you a performance rating, here you have an opponent trying to beat you to the solution (and the only rating that matters: WINNER!)

Simple instructions essentially teach how to solve Sudoku puzzles (for the uninitiated). The color-coded setup rules together with the ability to use numbered tiles (which are physically placed on the board) makes for a very forgiving system (for those who occasionally make missteps in their logic)—no messy erasers required! And everyone benefits from the ability to choose (from 4 levels of puzzle difficulty) the challenges that are right for their level of experience.

FROM THE PUBLISHER:
Be the first to complete your board and win!
No paper and pencils needed...play Sudoku with cards and boards!
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: No Cap
description: A party trivia game where you have to name as many correct answers as possible until someone yells "cap!". If your last answer was factually correct you score a point. If it was a lie, the player who yelled cap wins.

name: Letter Scrambler
description:
The description for Boggle reads: "Can you find words no one else can see in the letter grid?" As in Boggle, players race to build words using dice imprinted with letters, but unlike Boggle, it's okay if everyone finds the same words! Instead of knocking out your opponents finds with your own, in Letter Scrambler, players individually score the words they find, based on the printed scoring table in the rules, which awards points according to the length of the words they have written down. Over the course of several rounds, players build up their scores (to a predetermined number), and best of all: there is no timer ticking away at you while you try to think! Letter Scrambler is also unique from Boggle in that it uses a clever mechanism (the namesake scrambler) to both house & roll the 7 letter dice.

—user summary

Roll the mixer on your hand and place on a table.
Race against others to form words using the letters showing.
The longer the words, the more points you score.
You never lose the dice with the handy Magic Mixer,
which fits in your pocket for on-the-go fun.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Word Game

name: Monopoly Prizm: NBA Edition – 2022-2023 Booster Box
description: Monopoly Prizm: NBA Edition – 2022-2023 Booster Box serves as an expansion for Monopoly Prizm: NBA Edition, with the box containing six packs of trading cards, with each pack holding four random cards. Add these cards to the game for new drafting possibilities as you're building your team.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Red Bean: Dragon Slayer
description:
Red Bean: Dragon Slayer is a single-player role-playing card game on a poker deck.

It has the sequential story of a comic book, the possibilities of a video game, and the physical form of a poker deck.

Read through the cards like in a comic book. Follow a young adventurer named Red Bean through a fantasy world. Journey from the Overworld to the Caverns and back on a quest to slay evil monsters.

Use the system of arrows and tabs to navigate through the deck. Decide what Red Bean does by following different arrows.

The whole game is a regular 52 card deck. Each of the cards has a poker suit and number so you can also play standard card games.

—description from the designer

name: Action!
description:
In 1998, could people remember the movie plots & top-billed actors from the 40's, 50's, and 60's? That would have been but a tiny challenge when this game was published, because fewer than 10% of the cards in this game rely on a familiarity with the likes of: Rex Harrison, Humphrey Bogart, Charleton Heston, and Cary Grant.

Action! leans HEAVILY into the popular movies of the 80's & 90's, so the question today is: can YOU remember the movie plots & top-billed actors from the 80's & 90's? (Were you even alive then?!) If so, you're going to love both showing off your movie knowledge and laughing at yourself when you get stumped over the things you should totally have known. Each movie has 3 clues given which make the right answer increasingly more obvious BUT worth fewer points. (This is where all of those hours of movie watching finally become "an investment", rather than "a waste of time".) 15 points wins the game.

The tagline for this game says: "It's a party in a box!" Remember when movies came in boxes too? If so, you need to take this party OUT of the box & have a great time with it...you may even want to rewatch a few classics after the "action" stops.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Questions and Answers

name: Natural-Selection: Combine & Create
description:
The party game Natural-Selection: Combine & Create contains two decks: Picture Cards and Prompt Cards. Each round, every player draws up to five Pictures Cards in their hand. One player will reveal a Prompt Card and become the judge for the round. The other players will combine two Picture Cards in their hand to create a creature that best fits the prompt Card and place them face-down. Going clockwise from the judge, players will reveal their creatures and describe why it best fits the Prompt. The judge will award the Prompt Card to their favorite creature. The player to the left of the judge will become the new judge for the next round. The first player to be awarded 5 Prompt Cards wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Political Parties Game
description:
The Political Parties Game is a negotiation and hidden role game for 5-20 players. In it, each player takes on the role of a politician representing one of five different political parties:
The Economic Party
The Animal Party
The Technology Party
The Food Party
The Fire Party

Negotiate with your fellow representatives for their vote and their support on your bills. Create factions of like minded individuals for greater power over the vote… and stab them in the back when it benefits you the most… like a good politician.
The Political Parties Game is ready and searching for the right publisher to get it into players hands just as real world politics comes back into the limelight.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Political, Print & Play

name: Multiverse
description:
Easy board game for 2-6 players takes 20-30 minutes. You try to set a combination of colours which meets some of the opponent´s worlds. However, that kind of meeting brings (besides the winning point) also a quantum leap – an event that will bring the two players with a certain probability into different universes. Although the game may seem complicated at first glance, the opposite is true. Even children from the age of 7 can handle it without any problems. The version in a handmade bag really fits in your pocket, making it the ideal travel companion.

—description from the publisher

name: Kitten Capers
description:
Kitten Capers is a simple strategy card game designed for younger audiences. It is colorful and animated to entice younger players.

The game uses a 50-card deck.

On each turn, players can either:

Draw 2 cards, or
Draw the top card from the discard pile.


Players can then play up to 2 cards from their hand and activate kitten abilities if they wish to do so.

Card Types:

Kittens - Cards that are played in front of the player and have an ability. This ability can be activated, but the kitten goes to sleep afterward and needs to be woken up to use it again.
Treats - Scored between 1 and 3 points, these cards are played on awake kittens to earn points.
Skips - Make the next player lose their turn.
Sabotage - Send a kitten to the kitten shelter (a discard pile for kittens).
Rescue - Rescue a kitten from the kitten shelter.
Surprise - Cancel a card an opponent plays.
Swap - Swap one of your kittens for an opponent's kitten.
Wake-Up - A card that wakes kittens up.


The game continues until one player accumulates 20 points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Lose a Turn, Once-Per-Game Abilities

name: Shepherds of the Fall
description:
Shepherds of the Fall is a competitive card, dice and domino game focused on collectively responding to the ecological collapse brought on by climate disruption. In this game, you are scientists and researchers exploring a map of cards representing four different ecosystems of the Pacific Northwest, each of which is facing the distinct and violent effects of extreme climatic changes. Your team of meeples spends time discovering the land, finding threatened dice species on the verge of collapse. Using dominoes to determine your actions and movement, you gather these species up and deliver them to field hospitals or back to pristine ecosystems where they can heal on their own and support the biodiversity of nearby ecosystems. The winner of the game is the team with the highest reputation points for healing and reestablishing these species on the map.

During the game, you have the opportunity to train your advanced workers, research to gain new special skills, exchange species in certain locations or with opponents, receive much needed supplies and transport from helicopter visits and, most important, bring the species you collect to the rehabilitation and restoration locations to ensure their very survival.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Worker Placement

name: Space Racers
description:
"A fast-paced chase through outer space!"

A race to determine the fastest spaceship in the universe is on, right here in the Milky Way! Choose your machine--one of four UFOs with totally different handling--and take your places at the startling line.

Each turn, use your "paths" to move closer to the finish line. You might move in arcs, zigzags, or even loops! But examine the racetrack closely before you choose a path to use. If you crash into a star, you won't get to move! Get in your opponents' way and make them work to pass you, or accidentally help them out by clearing out a comet from their path.

Space Racers brings the tactile fun of movement templates to a fast and simple game that can be enjoyed with almost anyone.

—description from the designer

name: Team Digger
description:
Team Digger is a cooperative game that teaches sequencing, spatial, reasoning, and early coding skills. No screen required!

Playing together, cooperatively, players play cards from their hands to create five-card sequences to turn and move their dog pawns from one dig site to another on the game board. They can stop and dig to explore a spot by digging up what is buried there. Dig locations are visible on the board.

Players win as a team when they find all four bones before they dig up five of the unwanted objects.

name: Night Owl
description:
Night Owl is our latest roll and write about being a fledging owl, or Owlet. As an owlet, you've been used to your parents bringing you food, but now you're ready to enhance your traits and begin hunting in the forest at night all on your own. Players earn points for each prey animal they hunt in majority scoring, set scoring, and individual scoring as well as points for each trait they have enhanced.

Night Owl is a print and play game, meaning you will receive the printable files for the game. This includes a shared game sheet and standees. Players will need to bring 3 six-sided dice for each player and a writing utensil for each player.

The game is played in two phase: Day and Night.

In the Day phase, players will roll their dice and if they choose, use the die values to enhance their traits. Players can discard one of their dice to set the remaining unused dice to any values.

In the Night phase, players will use any remaining dice to hunt prey animals in the forest. Players will use their die value to move on the shared forest map. Player's traits will be assessed to determine if their hunt was successful.

Players will also gain dice manipulation actions each time they gain a certain number of each prey animal.

Players will find plenty of challenge on the shared map as the player with the lowest dice total value each turn is the starting player allowing them first pick in a shared space.

—description from the publisher

name: Survival Kitchen
description:
You're survivors of the apocalypse. Whatever your survior guests bring to your diner, you should consider using in the kitchen!
Survival Kitchen is a cooperative card game with app support about taste, texture and poison management.
Each player contributes ingredients from their hand to the ordered dish, scanning the ingredient card with the device's front camera. It all goes into the cualdron. Compare your ingredients and tools. What can you offer to the kitchen? Can you, as a team, set the right amount of food, and give it the ordered texture. Will, you be able to play the right amounts of the 4 types of taste? Will you be able to cook your dish in just the right temperature to maximize taste? Cooking aint easy! Luckily, your guests will not be picky!

Unfortunately, some ingredients are toxic. Your "survivors" won't survive your toxic recipes unless you act strategically and cook with caution.

The app (for Android and iPhone devices) guides you through the story and the rules, so you don't even need to touch a rulebook!

Survival Kitchen includes two playing modes:
In roguelike mode, you face different situations, each with its own challenge. You unlock and find new cards and make your diner larger and more successful, or at least, don't let it go abandoned, for as long as possible.
There is also a quick game mode, that allows for a shorter play time.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Push Your Luck

name: Numeroso
description:
With Numeroso, numbers visually come alive in our card battler game, along with a variety of games inspired by classic card game mechanics.

Numeroso Cards are based on a powerful Natural Structure of Numbers: prime factorization. Prime factorization is like the DNA of numbers, each number is made up of a unique collection of prime factors. Numeroso cards show the unique structure of each number visually.

In the title game, Numeroso, the prime number cards are used to bring composite number cards into play that contain them in their prime factorization. The composite cards act as creatures with attack/defense strength and special abilities. Players do battle until their life points hit zero.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction

name: Thorgal: The Board Game – Character Set Expansion
description:
Three new Characters with miniatures, boards and cards (3 Skill and 3 Item cards) ready to join your game.

Product description:

Petrov is an adventurer and mercenary travelling through lands and seas. He is a courageous warrior and thanks to his powerful stature, he is not afraid of wounds that would kill weaker people.

Tjahzi is a dwarf who has been friends with Thorgal for years. He has a strong connection to magic and has extraordinary knowledge about this, as well as about other worlds.

Vigrid is one of the minor deities residing in Asgard. He was banished from Odin’s court for his mischief, and only Aaricia’s help allowed him to return. His unique ability is shape-shifting—he can take the form of a dragon, a winged horse or even a spider.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Multiple Maps, Pattern Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: The Pacific Air Race
description:
The Pacific Air Race is an Aviation roll and move game where players travel along a path with tokens of Empire Flying Boats. The game was produced early during the war years before the Japanese Invasion of the South Pacific.

The path goes up to 100 that covers an area of the South Pacific including Australia, New Zealand, the South Pacific Islands and South East Asia. The numbered path consists of Green and Yellow circles, with the Green circles having instructions to follow, such as "Thick Cloud - Miss a Turn". First to reach the Circle marked 100 is the winner.

—user summary

name: C'est pas d'jeu
description:
C'est pas d'jeu is a card game set in the "Gaston Lagaffe" comics universe.
In the game, each player tries to collect the different parts of short stories of Gaston from a hand of 6 cards. It is also possible to play Boom or Attack cards in other players boards to stop them until they play a Parade card (like in Mille Bornes).
Each game round ends when a player has completed a least one story and has played all the cards of his hand, and every player score points according to their cards palyed. The game ends when a player reaches 500 points.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Brein Breker
description: With 4 number dices you must try as fast as possible to create certain math exercises. You must try to calculate from 10 to 100 within a set time, first to 100 wins.

name: Thorgal: The Board Game (Gamefound Edition)
description:
The Gamefound edition contains gameplay elements which will not be included in the retail edition:

- 3 additional adventures and their respective adventure sheets (Winter Demon, Labyrinth, Seeking Gamma)
- 30 additional pages in the Book of Tales
- 3 additional characters (Wolfcub, Tjall the Fiery, Arghun "Tree Foot") each coming with a miniature, character board, and skill card
- wooden First Player token
- Frigg's Cat (miniature and card)
- 10 additional Event cards
- 16 additional Terrain cards
- 8 additional Enemy cards
- 7 additional Action cards
- 15 additional Item cards
- 10 additional Finding cards
- 8 Gladiator cards

Thorgal: The Board Game is a cooperative storybook adventure game for 1-4 players aged 14+ designed by Joanna Kijanka, Jan Maurycy, and Rafał Szyma. Players take on the roles of Thorgal, his wife Aaricia, their son Jolan, and Kriss—a deadly female warrior—, and go on a series of adventures.

The game consists of 7 (10 for the Gamefound edition) stand-alone scenarios, each taking roughly 90-120 minutes of play. Scenarios do not form a campaign nor have any legacy features, so they can be played by different playgroups and over an extended period of time.

Thorgal: The Board Game comes with a book of maps. Each scenario is played on a different map that players explore while fulfilling scenario goals and promises completely different adventures, hidden opportunities, and vivid characters. Players are free to choose whether they travel in one group or split to cover more areas at the same time. They also perform side quests that might help them win a scenario.

Another important feature in the game is the storybook containing narrative descriptions of the encounters that Characters make in each scenario. The adventures described in the book are specific to each scenario and Character, yet a lot of them are randomized within a scenario, offering higher replayability and allowing for repeated play. There are also Side Plots players can pursue to gain benefits and reveal additional pieces of the story.

Thorgal: The Board Game, while having a strong narrative element, offers a brand new, unique action selection mechanism. In this new mechanism, actions have varying power depending on which other actions have already been taken. Players carefully plan their strategy and sequence of actions taken, as this directly impacts the strength of the effect of each action. This creates an interesting decision space and makes each turn important for everyone at the table.

Another important mechanic involves Character development. Each character gains experience during the game and advances their abilities. This dynamic progress allows players to make meaningful decisions about how to develop their hero in the game. Characters gather resources and craft objects to help them survive in the dangerous world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Multiple Maps, Pattern Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: De Pyme a Superempresa
description: De Pyme a Superempresa is a business simulation game that develops a simulation of the dynamics of operation of a small company that stumbles every day due to incidents, lack of time and, above all, lack of knowledge. The objective of the game is to learn to manage time, solutions, acquire knowledge and improve productivity.
mechanics: Events, Market, Resource to Move, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Assassins The Hotel
description:
Assassins the Hotel is set in modern times but with a slight time line detour. It is based off the Blood of the Raven Skirmish Rules and is all about you playing as an elite Assassins completing their assignments!

To the outside world, you appear normal along with having an everyday 9-5 job. You get up every morning and waive at your neighbors as you collect your morning paper to read while drinking a fresh cup of coffee. As you sit and read the paper, you have a smirk on your face because you see your work from the night before as part of the unsolved investigations. The cops have no fucking clue where to look and will never find the answers they are searching for. Even if they did, they couldn’t fucking touch you since you are part of an elite secret assassination organization that brings death to anyone willing to pay for it. To all others, you are just a normal everyday businessperson but to your targets…you are an elite assassin from Angelus Mortis.

name: Comme Gaston
description: A simple roll-and-move game themed after Gaston Lagaffe, published as an attachment to Spirou magazine.

name: Neo-G Racing (Clear Duels Series)
description:
The year is 2123 AD. Neo-Gravity Racing has become the biggest sport in the world. Get on the track. Hit the boost pads — but watch out for attacks! Do you have what it takes to cross the finish line first?

Neo-G Racing (Clear Duels Series) is a futuristic combat racing game for 2 players (competitive) that combines hand management, route building, sealed bidding, racing, layering, and grid coverage in a fun way. It consists of 36 cards (18 Clear cards + 18 Standard cards).

This game is part of our Clear Series, more specifically our Clear Duels Series, which focuses on competitive games for 2 players and combines Clear cards and Standard cards in many surprising ways.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Puzzle, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Connections, Constrained Bidding, Finale Ending, Grid Coverage, Hand Management, Layering, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Race, Square Grid, Take That

name: Volldampf voraus
description:
The game is played by two players, each of whom takes turns to move. Each of the two players takes over a fleet. A fleet consists of six ships: two ships of the line, recognizable by three ship towers, two large cruisers, recognizable by two ship towers and two small cruisers, recognizable by one ship tower. The winner is the player who destroyed the enemy fleet except for one ship and rescued at least two ships from his own fleet.

After each hit a ship loses a tower and if a ship without tower is hit, ist's eliminated from the game. The sturdier ships are also the slowest. There is also land based artillery at the edges of the game board. A ship is hit, when it gets into the crossfire of two enemy shops or artillery.
