The game was patented in 1903 and produced till at least 1909. In 1908 twenty games were purchased by the German emperor for the German navy.

—user summary

name: Zammar!!Wars
description:
'Zammar!!Wars' is a batting game in which the number of fingers specifies the dungeon to go to and the treasure to be obtained.
If you want to go to a dungeon with a higher reward, increase the number of fingers.
However, only the player who goes to the dungeon alone can get the reward.
In other words, if you go to a dungeon with a high reward, you may clash with your rivals, and as a result, you may not get the reward at all!

name: Carol Vonderman's Sudoku DVD Game
description:
With over 400 challenges and more than 20 hours of gameplay
Play with all the family and against Carol!
Whatever your level. Join Carol Vorderman and play the Sudoku DVD Game with your friends and family.
Special Feature - Carol's Sudoku Secrets
Carol reveals her tricks and tips for beginners and how to approach and quickly solve any puzzle for more advanced players
What you need to play this DVD Game: Television, DVD Player (to print additional game sheets, your PC or Mac system must be equipped with DVD drive and Adobe Reader 5.1)
Contents: DVD, 120 Puzzle Sheets, 4 Pencils & Instructions.

name: Adella
description:
Adella is a 2 player abstract strategy board game played on a stone tablet.

The pieces are cast from marble dust and represent medieval tall ships and the three fates (known as tides).

Players take turns rotating the tides to advance their ships and wreck or broadside their opponent's. Players use the ports to build fleets and armadas creating defensive and powerful formations.

To win a player must sink all their opponent's ships.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Mancala, Pieces as Map

name: Film Klischee Bingo
description: Many cards with film cliches, everybody selects some and tries to find them while watching the movie.

name: Swords and Penguins
description:
Swords and Penguins (S&P) is a simple PRINT AND PLAY game where you create a hero, buy weapons, fight enemies and attempt to save the town of Friendsville! All is needed to play is 7 printed letter sized sheets, a pencil and 2 six sided dice!

GAME STORYLINE:
Friendsville is a penguin town in the north pole where everyone are friends. A walrus by the name of Gus however didn't feel accepted, so him and his team stole 3 eggs, one of the them being the kings. You, as the hero penguin, must be trained and then go on a quest to get the eggs back to safety.

HOW TO PLAY:
Once you create your hero and place your player token on the map, you then make your way across the landscape moving from space to space. Some spaces contain enemy's, chests, places to heal and shops to buy new weapons! You collect the stolen eggs by landing on the spaces where they lay, however the kings egg is protected by Gus, the final boss. Combat is done by chucking 2 dice with the bonus of your weapon and comparing it to the enemy defense.

Will you lose all your health and give up or will you retrieve all the eggs and save Friendsville?!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Exploration, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Finale Ending, Kill Steal, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Le Sorcier met la Zizanie (fan expansion for Les Charlatans de Belcastel)
description:
This expansion does not change the basic game. It is a supplement that is played between the potion preparation phase and the scoring phase.
"The wizard takes a dim view of the activity in the bazaar of Belcastel.
His servants discreetly slip enchanted scrolls
into the Charlatans' belongings.
While trying to prepare a potion, a Charlatan reads one of the recipes tampered with by the Wizard.
The unpredictable consequences ripple out to the other Charlatans and stir up trouble among them."

This expansion allows for more interactivity between players. It is compatible with the official expansions but they are not required.

name: Kingdom of Thieves
description:
Welcome to the world of Kingdom of Thieves, where aspiring thieves from across the city gather to compete in the annual Tournament of Thieves. This quick paced card game blends cunning strategy, chance encounters, and a visually enchanting world. Players must outwit and outmanoeuvre their opponents to collect the most impressive treasures and earn the privilege of joining the prestigious Guild of Thieves.

Kingdom of Thieves combines strategy, chance and deception as players draw cards from the deck or even snatch them from their opponents' hands, seeking the perfect balance of treasures and action cards to propel them to victory. With a diverse array of fantasy themes, including pirates, goblins, elves and dwarves, players will experience an enchanting world where diverse characters and fantastical creatures take centre stage.

Players take turns drawing cards and playing treasures or actions, with the goal of accumulating five treasures and the highest score in victory points. Treasure cards are played face down, with some containing hidden traps to challenge opponents. Action cards allow players to execute strategic moves that can impact the game's outcome, adding unexpected twists and turns.

The game ends when a player starts their turn with five treasures in play. At that point, victory points are tallied, and the player with the most points is declared the winner. With bonus points awarded for collecting multiple treasures of the same suit or even five trap cards, Kingdom of Thieves offers endless strategic possibilities for players seeking to claim the top spot among the city's elite thieves.

-description from designer

name: WXRDS: Crossword Connections
description:
WXRDS is a fast-paced, crossword-style word game where players collect letters that match words from specific categories. After collecting a set of letters, players form crossed words on their individual game boards.

COMPONENTS:


99 letter tiles with point values 1-5
6 gameboards with built-in scoring tracks
web app.


SET UP:

Flip all tiles face up between players.
Give each player a game board and set the scores to 0.

GAME PLAY:

Start the web app to reveal a category.
Players call out words that match the category and grab the first letter of their word. For example, if the category is "In the Kitchen", someone could grab the letter "K" for knife.
The app sets a 30 second timer to encourage rapid collection of letters. In case an identical word is called out, the first player grabs the respective letter.

Ten category rounds are played in order to collect ten letters.

After ten categories, players then have three minutes to use their letters to form crossed words on their game boards (Scrabble-style).

SCORING:

After three minutes, players score their words. Letters placed on bonus positions get 2x and 3x points. All words must be found in the dictionary to be valid. Invalid words are removed. Any letters not on the board have their points deducted from the score. Each player marks their score on their scoring tracks.

After validation and scoring, return the letters to the common draw pile and start the app again.

WINNING:

After several main rounds, the first player to exceed 99 points causes the game to end. The player with the highest score is the winner. In case of a tie, play another round.

—description from the publisher

name: Amerika Trips
description:
America Trips is a travel game across North America and Canada. The 2 - 4 players roll their 4 game pieces - the small travel group - across the game board and try to reach their travel destinations (the respective fields of the same color). On the way, they collect rings that give them advantages and letters that are drawn from a bag in order to form as many travel-related terms as possible at the end of the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: DER TOUR - Deutsches Reisebüro GmbH, Herzblatt-Spiele

name: Bonn Tour
description:
BONN TOUR - on the road in the federal capital - is a dice game for 3 to 6 players. The players have the exciting task of guiding a small group of visitors through the federal capital on foot, by bus, by S-Bahn or U-Bahn and by boat.

There are 4 different movement options, which are always done with a die. There are question fields on the game board where a question card is drawn that has to be answered.

At the beginning, each player draws 3 destination cards. The order in which they approaches these targets is up to the player. The first player to reach their goals still has to get to the Bundeshaus to win the game.

The manufacturer of the game is: Bouvier University Bookstore, Bonn

name: Auf leisen Sohlen ...
description:
Auf leisen Sohlen ... is a "sneak game" from the carpet company desso.
The 2 to 4 players each receive 4 figures: a mouse, a cat, a dog and a child in one colour. The figures are moved across the board by rolling the dice. "Small pieces" are beaten by stronger pieces, including your own. The players try to get all their pieces into their own loophole (=goal) after going around the game board.

name: Dog Daze
description:
Dog Daze is a card drafting game for 2 to 6 players where every player is the owner of a dog walking business hoping to be the highest rated gig in the city. During the game, you will hire 6 dog walkers and assign each of them a dog to walk. While the dogs are cute and cuddly, the dog walking business is ruff and far from friendly.
​
Players will draft their dog walkers from hands that are passed around the table. Whomever you don't hire may end up working for your competition.

Whenever a walker takes a dog out for their afternoon stroll, the owner will leave a review on your website. The better the match, the better the review! Some owners primarily want an inexpensive option. Some dogs will only be happy with top shelf treats. Match up your walkers with dogs strategically to get the best ratings possible. The player with the highest online rating wins!

-description from designer

name: Side Quest Caverns
description:
You're nearing the end to your Quest. All that's left is to defeat the pig-faced, thief king...

But No!

They’ve lured you to the caverns and taken your hard-won gear. Until now, you’ve ignored their small-time needs. You’ve avoided their minor missions. But now, you have no choice…

You must collect the bugs, find the mushrooms, round up the chickens, and more!

You’ll also fight some monsters and collect treasures, of course!

Side Quest Caverns is a two-player game of adventure and survival.

The game includes two main types of cards: Cavern Cards and Item Cards.

The 33 Cavern Cards have an open cavern entrance, a blocked cavern entrance or a locked cavern entrance. On their reverse side, these cards may hide monsters, characters with Side Quests, or other surprises. One of these cards is the EXIT.

The 36 Item Cards have the swords, keys, bombs and quest items you’ll need to survive the caverns. You also have two Hero Cards (red and green), one for you and one for your opponent. You use these cards with the two hearts (heart-shaped blocks) to track the number of shields you have.

Some Item Cards include Magical Items that give your Hero an extra edge!

As you and your opponent choose your path through the caverns, you fight monsters, collect items, and solve side quests. You also collect jewels and as you complete side quests you earn unique items that can help you in your journey. Trade with your opponent to help you both on your path.

Earn the most jewels to WIN!

—description from the publisher

name: Site of Soldiers
description:
This game was designed with the mechanics of chess in mind. This can be seen in the seven-crest structure; where the player represents the king, and the seven crests represent the other pieces. It can be seen in the Warrior advantage positions; these positions mimic how chess pieces move. And it can be seen in the need to gain eight tokens to win, where the tokens represent the eight square length of the board.

This game has five different character types: Monarchs, Bastions, Clerics, Huntsman, and Scouts. The Seven Crest Structure forces the players to only be able set 1 Monarch, 2 Bastions, 2 Clerics, and 2 Huntsman face-up to empty positions on their field. When playing these character types, Monarchs are played in a player’s back row, disrupting and pressuring the opponent from afar, Warriors (the term comprising Bastions, Clerics, and Huntsman) are played in a players front row to battle the opponents Warriors, and the Scouts are played in the opponents front row causing light disruptions to the opponent.

To add another layer of complexity, there are three types of Tactic cards. Each type is played at different phases of the game and give bonuses according to their type. Offensive Tactics are played during a player’s Set phase and give offensive bonuses, Defensive Tactics are played during a players Defense phase and give defensive bonuses, and Assistive Tactics are played during both the Set and Defense phase and give general bonuses.

name: Monopoly: Urbanus Edition
description:
The classic board game Monopoly in a fun Urbanus jacket
(Re)discover the best jokes, most iconic movie scenes and the funniest songs by Urbanus in this special Monopoly edition.

Buy a house in the Hittentitsesteenweg, visit the Maurice Potteke Pisplaats, sucker in the Gladde Iolensloot or maybe you will be fined for cleaning your doorstep with mayonnaise.

It's all possible in this Monopoly edition: explore the world of Urbanus!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Le métier secret
description:
Each player draws a picture card secretly showing a profession. Alternately, they ask each other yes-no-questions to eliminate all other professions. The player who gets the solution first wins the game.
All cards show a male and a female person. The purpose of this game is to learn that independently of sex all people could join any profession.

—user summary

name: Klattschen: Mädelsabend
description:
With the official expansion of the cult drinking game klattschen of the brand DENKRIESEN you have the perfect game to experience a humid and cheerful evening with your friends. The deck consists of 60 playing cards with 58 new instructions and unique tasks.

Those who don't follow the instructions or make a mistake in their execution will have to drink (called 'gossiping' in the game).

Also, all players must abide by the 3 basic rules throughout the game:


do not use the word 'drink' (also do not use: drank, drank, drank, etc.)
always drink with the left hand!
do not swear!


—description from the publisher (translated)

Mit der offiziellen Erweiterung des Kult-Trinkspiels klattschen der Marke DENKRIESEN hast du das perfekte Spiel um einen feucht-fröhlichen Abend mit deinen Freunden zu erleben. Das Kartenspiel besteht aus 60 Spielkarten mit 58 neuen Anweisungen und einzigartigen Aufgaben.

Wer sich nicht an die Anweisungen hält oder einen Fehler bei der Ausführung macht, muss trinken (im Spiel ‘klattschen’ genannt).

Außerdem müssen sich alle Spieler während des gesamten Spiels an die 3 Grundregeln halten:


Nicht das Wort ‘trinken’ benutzen (auch nicht: getrunken, trank, trinkst usw.)
Immer mit der linken Hand trinken!.
Nicht fluchen!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Klattschen: Männerabend
description:
With the official expansion of the cult drinking game klattschen of the brand DENKRIESEN you have the perfect game to experience a humid and cheerful evening with your friends. The deck consists of 60 playing cards with 58 new instructions and unique tasks.

Those who don't follow the instructions or make a mistake in their execution will have to drink (called 'gossiping' in the game).

Also, all players must abide by the 3 basic rules throughout the game:


do not use the word 'drink' (also do not use: drank, drank, drank, etc.)
always drink with the left hand!
do not swear!


—description from the publisher (translated)

Mit der offiziellen Erweiterung des Kult-Trinkspiels klattschen der Marke DENKRIESEN hast du das perfekte Spiel um einen feucht-fröhlichen Abend mit deinen Freunden zu erleben. Das Kartenspiel besteht aus 60 Spielkarten mit 58 neuen Anweisungen und einzigartigen Aufgaben.

Wer sich nicht an die Anweisungen hält oder einen Fehler bei der Ausführung macht, muss trinken (im Spiel ‘klattschen’ genannt).

Außerdem müssen sich alle Spieler während des gesamten Spiels an die 3 Grundregeln halten:


Nicht das Wort ‘trinken’ benutzen (auch nicht: getrunken, trank, trinkst usw.)
Immer mit der linken Hand trinken!.
Nicht fluchen!


—description from the publisher

name: Klatsschen: Das Brettspiel
description:
Klattschen is a great party game for a sociable and (un)forgettable evening with friends.
You compete in teams and have to draw or pantomime funny and naughty terms.
The team partners then have to guess the term correctly.
Only the winning team may advance and the team that reaches the finish line first wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das klattschen-Brettspiel ist ein großartiges Partyspiel für einen geselligen und (un-)vergesslichen Abend mit Freunden.
Ihr tretet in Teams gegeneinander an und müsst witzige und unanständige Begriffe zeichnen oder pantomimisch vorführen.
Die Teampartner müssen den Begriff dann richtig erraten.
Nur das Gewinner-Team darf vorrücken und das Team, welches zuerst das Ziel erreicht, gewinnt.

—description from the publisher

name: Keenograms
description:
Keenograms combines the word-spelling of anagrams with the gameplay of keno/bingo.

Each player gets a 5x5 card with 25 letters of the alphabet on it. (There are 6 cards in the Popular edition, 16 in the Deluxe edition.) Player agree on length of the word allowed, e.g. 3 letters, or 5 letters, etc. The dealer then shuffles the deck of 26 letter cards -- one for each letter -- and turns them over one at a time, giving players time to place a marker on that letter on their card, if they have it. Once a player can spell a word of the required length with the letters they have on marked on their card, they call out and win the round.

A "mystery word" version has each player write a word of the agreed-on length on a slip of paper and place it under their card. When they can spell their word with the letters called out, they win.

Other modes are similar to traditional bingo: cover a row of 5, or all 4 corners, or the periphery, or the center, or an aggreed-on alphabet shape.

name: Wonderfully Witty Word Games
description:
[Adapted from the box back and instruction sheet.]

Here is a magnificent mound of fun games that you can play, all of which will help children develop their spelling skills. This pack consists of instructions, and 100 small (42 x 62 mm) cards with letters, letter values, and illustrations by Tony Ross from David Walliams's book Awful Auntie. Also included is a list of words that are drawn from the [British] government's notes for Key Stage 1 and 2 spellings.

Games include:

CROSSWORD: Players take turns playing letters from their hand and a draw pile onto a growing crossword on the table, scoring the sum of the letters' values in the new word. When the deck runs out, the highest score wins.

WORD CHASE: Players each choose a 7-letter word from the word booklet, and then take turns in rummy-like play until they have the letters for their word in their hand.

WORD GRAB: All 100 letters are face down. Players take turns turning up one letter. When someone sees a word that can be spelled, they call it out, collect the letters, and spell the word in front of them. You can also claim others' words by calling an anagram of their word, or by making a new word by adding new letters. When the cards are all face up, the player with the most letters wins.

GRID LOCK: 16 cards are placed in a 4x4 grid, and players write as many words as they can spell from those letters. In GRID LOCK II it's the same but with the requirement that letters be in an adjacent chain like Boggle.

SPELLBOUND: Four letters are placed on the table. In a turn a player places a letter on one of the four columns, at the top or bottom, and says a word that includes the letters in that column in that order. The first to empty their hand wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Escape From Atalix
description:
Players are astronauts that have crash landed on an inhospitable planet called Atalix. A rescue shuttle is sent from your space station, but with difficult terrain and unpredictable storms near the crash site the closest the shuttle can land is several miles from the crash site. Unprepared for the harsh planetary conditions your team must gather resources and collect parts of their crashed ship in order to survive. Players are encouraged to write their own story as they make decisions about how to survive. The game presents players with real, impactful choices that change the course of the game including their objectives, strategies, and challenges as the game progresses.

Escape from Atalix is a cooperative deck building game where players work together to survive and complete projects on the harsh surface of a distant planet. Each player manages their own deck of cards which they will use to move around the board, harvest resources, battle with hostile aliens, research the planets ecosystem, and upgrade capabilities with new cards.

Cards also represent energy, the more cards you have the more turns you can take before the ending the round forcing you to return to what's left of your ship. Each round that passes brings you closer to the brink of destruction. Researching the planet can help you upgrade your tools and increase your capabilities including the ability to retain cards between turns and add cards to your free play selection.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Mushroom Foray
description:
After several days of rain, commercial pickers, hobbyists, hippies, and other back woodsy folk gather in hope for fungal treasures!

Outmaneuver your fellow misfits to forage for goodies, satisfy chef requests, and heal the earth. Grow and consume mushrooms to level up your abilities. You must hurry because increasing pollution and destruction will damage your foraging grounds.

In Mushroom Foray, 5 decks of cards representing regions are positioned randomly in a horizontal line. Below the regions, players drive their run down vehicles laterally to forage the regions and swap treasures at trading tents. On their turn, players can either stay in their region to forage for 2 cards or move 1 space in either direction to forage for 1 card. Then, players can play action cards, trade, or grow mushrooms.

There are two types of action cards: Victory Cards and Ability Cards. Victory cards are played face up in front of the player who satisfies the mushroom requirements displayed on the card. For example, “Save the Bees!” card requires 1 Reshi mushroom tincture to play the victory card. The first player who plays 8 victory cards wins the game.

Chef Requests are a type of victory card that are satisfied by gathering the mushrooms needed for recipes. Deforestation, Contamination, and Plastic Waste are special victory cards called destruction cards that are randomly drawn from the burn, forest, river, and plains regions. After these cards are drawn, they must be placed face up on their associated region deck until a player can satisfy the restoration requirements. All players lose if the burn, forest, river, and plains regions all have unresolved destruction cards for a full turn.

Ability cards grant players special skills. Each player can only play 3 ability cards, so the players will need to choose the ability and timing carefully. Each ability card can be played after discarding the required mushroom icons representing the specific regions where the mushrooms were foraged. Magic mushrooms can satisfy any mushroom icon (plains, forest, river). Magic Mushrooms can also be spent to reactivate any 1 played abilities. The player immediately performs the ability card action after playing the card face up on the table. Then, the player can choose to perform any of their previously played abilities in any order. Finally, in turn order, any opponent sharing the same space of the player who played an ability can choose to perform any 1 of that player’s abilities.

On their turn, players can also exchange cards from their hands with the trading tents. Tents are split into 2 halves with a number or symbol on each side. One half of the tent is always covered by cards. The numbers and symbols represent the required number and type of cards that can be traded for the cards presented on the other half of the tent. A player can place the required cards on one side of the tent to take the available cards.

Players will need to grow mushrooms to satisfy some of the victory cards. Each player has 4 cards arranged as a grow chamber: Prepare, Grow, Grain, and Tincture. At the start of the game, each of the grow chamber cards are greyed out. Players must satisfy the requirements to flip cards to activate each phase in the grow chamber. First, players must place a cultivatable mushroom (indicated by a mushroom icon) onto the Prepare card. Then, the player must discard the requirement cards to flip the Grow card. Now, the player will receive 1 mushroom token each turn onto the Grow card. Each mushroom token inherits the characteristics of the prepared mushroom card. Finally, the player can discard the requirements for the Grain and Tincture phases to flip their mushroom tokens into colonized grain or medicinal tinctures. Grain and tinctures are requirements for some victory cards.

The game immediately ends when a winning player has played 8 victory cards or when the burn, forest, river, and plains regions all have been damaged by destruction cards for a full turn. All players lose if the second condition is met.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Exploration
mechanics: Action Drafting, Contracts, Hand Management, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Thorgal: The Board Game – Promo Box
description:
The Promo box contains all components that did not make the voting poll for the stretch goals.

Contains:
- Muff (1 pet miniature and card)
- Avrenim (1 pet miniature and card)
- 42 plastic enemy tokens (12 minor, 12 moderate, 12 major, 6 massive, and 6 mystical)
- 12 translucent 'frosted' dice

name: Monopoly: Sankt Augustin
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Sankt Augustin, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Chicken Rush
description:
Players compete to build the biggest, successful chicken farm in 11 rounds or less. Foxes are a constant pest, but so can be your neighbors.

The aim is to reach the winning number of chickens before your opponents. You can do this by building, buying or stealing farm components, eggs and chickens themselves. Event cards can help or hinder your efforts.

Managing your egg production is key, but there isn't just 1 way to building a successful farm. You decide what works for you.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Farming
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stock Holding, Take That

name: Matilda: Splendid Spelling Games
description:
A collection of 3 word games to encourage fun and creativity in spelling. Working with guidelines for Key Stage 1 & 2 these games will help children develop spelling and word building skills, whilst maintaining the enjoyment of a card game.

Contents:
100 letter cards
40 Bookworm cards
1 minute timer

-from the back of the box

---

The games are:

Matilda's the Bookworm: With a hand of 7 cards, each player in their turn asks another player for a letter, who must give it to them if they have it, otherwise they draw a card. Then they spell a word from their hand or discard 3 cards, drawing to replace the cards. They get 1 bookworm card for a word of 3 letters, 2 cards for a word of 4 letters, and 3 cards for a word of 5 or more letters. The first player to have 10 or more bookworm cards wins.

Matilda's Wordgrid: Deal out cards to make a 4x4 grid. Players have 1 minute to write down all the words they can spell using the letters in the grid. The player with the most correct words gets 1 bookworm card. Repeat until a player has 5 bookworm cards and wins.

Matilda's Wordstock: One card is dealt to each of 5 columns on the table. From their hand of 10 cards, a player in their turn plays cards to a column to make a new word, using or covering previous cards, or discards 3 cards; cards used are replaced from the draw pile. Players get 1, 2, or 3 bookworm cards depending on the length of the word made; the first to 10 book worm cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: The BFG: Whizzpopping Letters
description:
A collection of 3 word games to encourage fun an creativity in spelling. Working with guidelines for Key Stage 1 & 2 these games will help children develop spelling and word building skills, whilst maintaining the enjoyment of a card game.

Contents:
100 letter cards
1 Spinner

-from the back of the box


The cards have a letter on one side and 1/8 or a picture of the BFG (big friendly giant) on the other.

The games are:

Build a BFG: Each player has a 5 card hand face up on the table, and there is a 3x3 grid of cards in the center. On their turn, a player either spells a word from their hand with up to 1 card from the grid, or discards 3 cards; all cards use are replaced from the discard pile. The cards of the word are flipped, and the player keeps all parts of the BFG picture they lack. The first to finish their picture wins.

BFG Crossword: On their turn a player plays cards from their hand to a growing crossword on the table. They get 1 point per letter in the word they make; the first to 20 points wins.

BFG Grab the Word: All 100 cards are placed letter-side down / BFG picture part side up. On their turn a player spins the spinner and flips over a card with the picture part selected. When anyone sees a word they can spell from the revealed letters, they shout the word and collect the cards. After all cards have been revealed, the one with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory: Marvellous Maths Games
description:
A collection of 3 math games to encourage fun and help with learning mathematics. Working with guidelines for Key Stage 1 & 2 these games will help children develop skills in addition, subtraction, division and multiplication, whilst maintaining the enjoyment of a card game.

Contents:
87 number cards [numbered 1-10, colored purple or yellow]
13 Golden Ticket cards
4 playing pieces
2 dice

-description from the back of the box


The games are:

Charlie's Golden Ticket: Five golden ticket cards are on the table, and each player starts with one number card. On their turn a player draws a number card, and if they can combine the numbers in their hand to equal a golden ticket card, they claim that card. The 5 table cards are replenished when they run out, and the first to get 4 tickets wins.

Charlie's in a Spin: The number cards are laid out to form a spiral playing track. Players start their pawns on the start card. On their turn they roll a die, move that many spaces, and say what the product of the new card's number and their die roll is; if incorrect they go back. The first to reach the center card by an exact roll wins.

Closest to Zero: Players start with 2 cards in hand. Yellow numbers are positive, purple numbers are negative. Players can request an additional card up to 3 times, then the player whose cards total closest to zero wins a golden ticket card. The first to have 4 tickets wins.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Trio Play Tarot Deck
description:
The Trio Play Tarot deck is actually three decks in one.

First and foremost the Trio Play Deck is a (78 card) tarot deck with a design that highlights the ruling elements of each suit/card within the deck. Red is used for cards ruled by Fire (wands/clubs), Blue for Water (cups/hearts), Yellow for Air (swords/spades), and Green for Earth (pentacles/diamonds).

The Trio Play Tarot Deck can also be used as a standard deck of playing cards. The Knights and the Major Arcana cards have a design that readily distinguishes them from the cards you need while playing games like Gin Rummy or Poker. These differences in the design allow them to be easily found and removed when you are ready to play.

Thirdly, the design of the Trio Play Deck allows for it to be played as a color/number matching game similar to public domain games such as Crazy 8's created in the 1930's and Mau Mau created in the 1950's or other popular multi-color matching games like Uno created in the 1970's. The Trio Play is a shedding type card game in which the player's objective is to empty one's hand of all cards before the other players have a chance to.

The Trio Play deck uses action cards similar to the German game Mau Mau where you can inflict penalties on the other players forcing them to skip a turn, change/switch the order of play, or force the next player to draw two to four cards. Wild cards have also been borrowed from traditions such as Joker's Wild or 8's being Wild in Crazy 8's, allowing you to use those cards in place of any color/number card you might need to continue your hand without adding more cards.

—description from the designer

The rules for the Trio Play deck are not in the card deck box, but available online.

The designer, Matt Green, is a graphic designer who also did the graphical design of the cards.

—user summary

name: Unspoken Words
description:
Unspoken Words is a card game designed to encourage meaningful conversations within your immigrant family.

Each box holds 120 cards:

100 question cards prompt conversations around 5 topics: Culture & Immigration, Relationship, Identity, Reflection, and Childhood.
20 action cards help break the ice and add a fun twist to the game.


Ways to Play

Take Your Pick
Take turns drawing a card from a category of your choice. Each player then answers the question or performs the action accordingly.

If I Were You
Draw a uestion card from a category of your choice, then have the other player(s) answer as if they were you. The player whose answer is closest to your would-be answer wins the round.

Shuffle and Draw
Shuffle the deck and have everyone draw a different card. Then take turns answering each player's question cards. Play action cards as a group.

Speed It Up
Shuffle the deck. Each player takes turns drawing cards and answering as many question cards as possible in 45 seconds. Skip any action cards that come up.

—description from the rules

name: Zarot
description:
You are priests of Zarot tasked with building Temples. Play your cards to build temples or be a heretic by hoarding them. Keep an eye on the calendar as each discard shortens the time you’ll have to score.

In Zarot players are trying to score the most points by using their cards to form patterns called Temples. Each round a different suit is used to start a Temple. The players with the highest score after 5 rounds wins the game.

Discarding is optional, but all discards are placed around a Calendar card in the center of the playing area. Once the calendar is full the round is over so discard carefully.

You can also choose to score by being a Heretic. This means you are forsaking your duty to build Temples and simply hoard cards. At the end of the round, If you have no Temple card in your hand or in play, then you may add up the number values from all of your cards and that total is your score for this hand.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Pattern Building

name: Roda de Samba
description:
A light card game, yet strategic and planned,
Buy cards or download an instrument in hand.
Match the suits at every turn,
And spread the samba for all to learn.

With a good combination, you'll get ahead,
Instruments of strings and percussions to be led.
Spend an action to invite a sambista friend,
And with them, build up your score to no end.

In your samba circle, you have autonomy,
But be careful not to break the harmony,
For a crossed samba is a big irony,
It hinders strategy and melody.

Last but not least, keep your eyes open wide,
For the malandros* who bring along an interesting side,
Adding interaction and excitement to the ride,
Making the game even more of a pride.


An specific kind of "trickster", in Brazilian culture, associated to marginalized population from suburbs where the samba grew.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: New Yankee Letter Cards for Word Building
description:
NEW YANKEE LETTER CARDS
FOR
WORD BUILDING

AND PLAYING ALL THE OLD LETTER GAMES
TOGETHER WITH THE FOLLOWING NEW ONES

Word Building
Out in the Cold
Puzzle Your Neighbor
The Traveling Letters
Patchwork
Yankee Loto
The Spelling Match
Syllabication
Speculation
Letter Pool

—description from the box

The box has over 200 letter tiles about 3/4" square.

Unfortunately the rules are missing. But undoubtedly the "old letter games" included Anagrams, which was very popular in the late 1800s and early 1900s.

—user summary

name: Hell of a Run
description:
In Hell of a Run, you'll embark on a wild and hilarious journey to become the next king of Hell. With your unique deck of cards based on the seven deadly sins, you'll race against other princes of Hell to reach Heaven first. The game is filled with strategy and surprises as players play cards to move closer to their goal while also sabotaging their opponents.

But it's not just about winning the race - it's about having a hell of a good time. With its immersive theme, creative gameplay, and engaging mechanics, Hell of a Run is a hit with board game enthusiasts and casual players alike. Get ready for a devilishly fun time!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That

name: Space Engine: Card Deck
description:
How the Space Engine Works

Your space engine is responsible for powering four key systems aboard the ship:

Propulsion (red) – Without it, your ship won’t move.

Life Support (green) – Without it, your ship’s crew must be placed in stasis.

NavComm (blue) – Without it, your ship’s navigation computer won’t know where to go.

Sci/Ex (yellow) – Without it, your ship’s science and exploration equipment array will fail causing you to lose earth funding.

The Space Engine card deck opens up new possibilities for card games. This deck includes instructions for 5 games exclusive to the Space Engine.

This game includes:

52 System Cards - Cards with up to 3 systems working at various levels.

2 Quadrillithium Cards - The mysterious Quadrillithium can power any system.

Instructions for 5 games. Download the instructions for free!
publishers: The Game Crafter, LLC, True Territory Games

name: We Only Kill Each Other (Second edition)
description:
Expanded to 112 pages, We Only Kill Each Other has improved text and some clarified rules, but the real change is the addition of two entirely new sections.

"Hood's Life" provides rules that allow players' Characters with activities not directly involved with the crimes they commit, but rather ways to fill their time away from the "job." Gangster, Hoodlum, or even Cop, his or her "Reputation" can be vital to success, and must be built and protected to increase authority and bring greater rewards. Police can even win Medals! "Friends and Foes" will inevitably be made, people to keep close, and others to keep closer as they can aid your climb in the Underworld or Law Enforcement--or bring you down. And what do you do with your crime generating money? "Living Within Your Means" provides the incentive to keep making more money--especially when it's running short. But that same money permits a crook the opportunity for "Living Large"--enjoying that flow of cash and helping build the kind of Reputation that serves him best. Not exactly a pastime, but giving "The Look" is an Underworld tradition that can cow enemies without direct use of violence. Other rules include how to conduct "Extortion" through the threat and use of violence, the effects and results of facing "Prosecutions," including conviction, prison time or even The Chair, and "Wound Recovery" so that injuries suffered in a previous game can determine how long to heal--or how quickly they prove fatal. Finally, there are extensive rules for the effects of Newspapers on careers, as well as how a Reporter/Photographer can participate in raids and gun battles between Law Enforcement and Gangsters. All of these rules allow players to determine the fate of their Characters through their life in crime.

The other new section is "Dillinger Days--Life On The Run," rules for organizing one's own career as a bank robber, and even building a gang of his own. From starting with their "Wheels," to choosing a Hideout, planning and executing a bank heist, and making a getaway only to plan the next one, everything is there. New Game Maps provide the "Tri-State" area in which to conduct your own Crime Spree, with "Risks of The Road" and the chance of The Law in "Hot Pursuit," using a new Game Card Deck (sent free for the asking), while racing through city streets. Figuring and dividing "The Take," "Hiding Out" while "The Heat" is on, and always the danger that you or one of your gang will be "Fingered," bringing Law Enforcement down on you.

In short, WOKEO is the most complete set of miniatures wargame rules on the subject of Crime and Law Enforcement of the era ever.

WOKEO has been in development for over fifteen years with an emphasis on "realism," rather than Hollywood and legend. It's a fast-paced game of criminal-on-criminal violence with the possible involvement of law enforcement. Other rules make no distinctions between three distinct "theaters" in this era of criminal enterprise with the common denominator of violence--"Beers Wars," (1920-1933), "Dillinger Days" (1934-35), and "Mafia Wars" (1931-35). Each has distinctive features making it unique regarding characters and possible games.

Characters are generated in detail by types/classes (but don’t think of D&D!)—gangsters, hoodlums, police, detectives, FBI and Treasury Agents, each with the opportunity for skills, areas of special knowledge, and even weaponry by period and subject. Distinguishing Features, including Peculiarities/Personality Quirks/Addictions/Compulsive Behaviors, Speech Impediments, as well as detailed physical attributes and Criminal Records, are just some of the descriptors that will apply.

WOKEO recognizes that such criminals are not soldiers, responding to orders and formal leadership. They tend to be violent, under-educated, and commonly unintelligent, striking by stealth and surprise, rather than seeking stand up battles. "Discipline and duty" do not characterize them, while opportunism and fear of retaliation does.

Combat rules are fast and deadly, with a wide variety of basic weapon types available—but players can rarely make the choice. Tommy Guns, and BARs are "terror weapons," and far more rare than Hollywood pretends. You won't find one often, but when you do, watch out!

A "Director" can create the episode, but “pick-up”games are easy--just use any of the pre-generated Characters that come with the game, or roll up your own. Play is card driven, cuing individual Characters to declare and carry out their Actions. Almost everything--use of "Mitts," "Pins," "Moxie," "Brains" and "Brawn"--is determined successful or not by a single D10 roll with limited modifiers—no combat results tables, no formulae, just down and dirty quick results with a system quickly learned. No written orders, just a few items to mark off on each Character Record Card.

Players normally play one Character, but up to four are possible. Rules for "Extras"--simplified Characters operating in groups--can allow larger games, but most games need fewer than a half-dozen figures to a side, though police can show up in numbers if a crime is still in progress.

There are detailed rules for Drive By Shootings, Automobile pursuits and Collisions, Tear gas, explosives, body armor, brawling, "gun molls," and optional rules for specific Wound Location/Effects, Rescue of the wounded, use of the garrote, and more make WOKEO a complete package.

WOKEO also recognizes "Square Johns"—civilians who can as easily fall victim to the police as the criminals--as key elements. Pedestrian and Vehicular “Panic” rules guarantee chaos in the streets with the very real risk of them becoming unwitting targets--and not just of the criminals. But Law Enforcement bullets are just as deadly!

Police, FBI and Treasury Agents all have their own rules. Police use of "The Third Degree" during interrogations can be part of the game, as well as the competition between "G-Men" and local police. And if you think the "G-Men" were Supermen from the start, think again. WOKEO does not depict things the way Mr. Hoover would have wanted it to!

“We Only Kill Each Other," (unlike the author’s own “Gangbusters” from TSR eons ago), makes no attempt to include the economics of organized crime. It is strictly for flying lead, racing automobiles, and blood on the sidewalk. WOKEO literally allows players to "cut to the chase" and engage in all the mayhem Prohibition and Depression era crime has to offer. With all the gory details, this is easily the grittiest miniatures game of criminal violence yet.

The rules come with three introductory Scenarios, one for “Beer Wars,” one for “Dillinger Days,” and one for “Mafia Wars.” Each provides full information on necessary Characters, figures, sets, vehicles, and more. There are schematics, photos, tables, information for each side, as well as "secret" information for the Director. No Scenario can play the same way twice.

WOKEO also addresses the urban environment central to crime of the period. Police call boxes, sirens, alarms, police whistles, auto and pedestrian traffic (varying by neighborhood and time of day) all are part of the mix when perpetrating or confronting crime in the streets. The rules are designed for use with model buildings like those from Old Glory, Reviresco, and TVAG's own “Mean Streets” and “Mean Sets," but the use of 2D maps of the players' own devising is covered.

Street Schematics are provided for planning of hits and/or law enforcement raids, and a full page city street map of “Newcago,” locating key addresses, public buildings, and businesses provides the wider environment where Bootlegger gangs can vie for control through beatings, bombings, and shootings.

Other features include a comprehensive list of 28mm gangster/law enforcement figures manufacturers, as well as buildings and vehicles. There are also lists of useful Websites, movies of particularly inspirational value, and a section showing how easy--and fun!--designing your own scenarios can be.

—description from the publisher

name: Otter Space Race
description:
3-2-1 Blast Off! With Mudpuppy’s Otter Space Game launch your rocket and land on a color-matching planet to score and win the game. Perfect for family game night!

—description from the publisher

name: Hüpf-O-Fant
description:
What is this mess? An elephant jumping like a frog? A chicken roaring like a donkey? Surely that has something to do with Felix-Fauli and one of his funny games! Just join in and look for the right part of the cat or think about where the snake has hidden. But beware! If you make a mistake, it's time to imitate the movement and the sounds of the crazy animal combination together.
Who will find the most pairs of animals at the end of this animal fun?

—description from the publisher

name: Dummbatz
description:
The hopeless party game is the third game from the party fever series by DENKRIESEN and has 300 cards with a total of 1500 different terms on board. A fellow player slips into the role of the clueless DUMMBATZ and tries to guess the term he is looking for based on clues from the other players. But be careful! All players must try to unmask the DUMMBATZ and lead him on the ice. This game is tactical, exciting, fast and loose and provides rousing party fun for the next game night. Thanks to the included writing boards and foil pens for up to 8 players, nothing stands in the way of instant fun.

Gameplay

The first player first gets all the boards, draws a DUMMBATZ card and chooses one of the five terms. Then he writes his chosen term on the empty player boards. The person sitting next to him shuffles the remaining player boards together with the DUMMBATZ board and distributes them among the other players. The player who got the DUMMBATZ board is the DUMMBATZ this round. Now the player who chose the term names the rubric and the teammate to his left is the first to name a descriptive tip that has anything to do with the term on his board. Then the other players follow one after the other with their tips. The DUMMBATZ now tries to guess which term is being searched for on the basis of the tips given. When it is the DUMMBATZ's turn, he must also try to describe the term he is looking for without being recognized as a DUMMBATZ. The other players try to determine who the DUMMBATZ could be based on the tips.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das aussichtslose Partyspiel ist das dritte Spiel aus der Partyfieber-Serie von DENKRIESEN und hat 300 Karten mit insgesamt 1500 verschiedenen Begriffen an Bord. Ein Mitspieler schlüpft in die Rolle des ahnungslosen DUMMBATZ und versucht, den gesuchten Begriff anhand von Hinweisen der Mitspieler zu erraten. Doch Vorsicht! Alle Mitspieler müssen versuchen, den DUMMBATZ zu enttarnen und aufs Glatteis zu führen. Dieses Spiel ist taktisch, spannend, schnell und locker und sorgt für mitreißenden Partyspaß für den nächsten Spieleabend. Dank den enthaltenen Schreibboards und Folienstiften für bis zu 8 Spieler steht sofortigem Spielspaß nichts im Wege.

Spielablauf

Der erste Spieler bekommt zunächst alle Boards, zieht eine DUMMBATZ-Karte und wählt einen der fünf Begriffe aus. Dann schreibt er seinen gewählten Begriff auf die leeren Spielerboards. Der Sitznachbar mischt die verbleibenden Spielerboards zusammen mit dem DUMMBATZ-Board und verteilt sie unter den Mitspielern. Der Spieler, der das DUMMBATZ-Board bekommen hat, ist diese Runde der DUMMBATZ. Nun nennt der Spieler, der den Begriff gewählt hat, die Rubrik und der Mitspieler zu seiner Linken nennt als Erster einen beschreibenden Tipp, der irgendetwas mit dem Begriff auf seinem Board zu tun hat. Danach folgen die anderen Mitspieler nacheinander mit ihren Tipps. Der DUMMBATZ versucht nun, anhand der genannten Tipps zu erraten, welcher Begriff gesucht wird. Wenn der DUMMBATZ an der Reihe ist, muss auch er versuchen den gesuchten Begriff zu beschreiben, ohne dabei als DUMMBATZ erkannt zu werden. Die Mitspieler versuchen, anhand der Tipps festzustellen, wer der DUMMBATZ sein könnte.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Gemeinsame Sache: Block Edition
description:
This ultimate game block is the official new edition of the popular daredevil party game! The object here is to find the "common thing". Each player writes down a matching term for a category. The most mentioned term is the "Common Cause" at the end and leads to victory. But beware! With risky bets you can increase your points, but you can also lose everything. Sometimes crystal clear, but often surprising and hard to grasp, this creative game block will be an exciting highlight at your next party. Unpack and start playing right away, because you can bet on this game for sure!

Gameplay

Each player writes down a matching term for a category. The most mentioned term is the "COMMON THING" at the end and leads to victory. But beware! With risky bets you can increase your points, but also lose everything. Sometimes crystal clear, but often surprising and hard to grasp, this creative game block will be an exciting highlight at your next party. Unpack and start playing right away, because you can bet on this game for sure!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser ultimative Spielblock ist die offizielle neue Edition des beliebten, waghalsigen Partyspiels! Hier geht es darum, die „Gemeinsame Sache“ zu finden. Jeder Spieler schreibt zu einer Kategorie einen passenden Begriff auf. Der meistgenannte Begriff ist am Ende die „Gemeinsame Sache“ und führt zum Sieg. Doch Achtung! Mit riskanten Wetteinsätzen kannst du deine Punkte zwar ausbauen, aber auch alles verlieren. Manchmal glasklar, doch oft auch überraschend und kaum zu fassen wird dieser kreative Spielblock zum spannenden Highlight auf deiner nächsten Party. Auspacken und direkt losspielen, denn auf dieses Spiel kannst du garantiert setzen!

Spielablauf

Jeder Spieler schreibt zu einer Kategorie einen passenden Begriff auf. Der meistgenannte Begriff ist am Ende die „GEMEINSAME SACHE" und führt zum Sieg. Doch Achtung! Mit riskanten Wetteinsätzen kannst du deine Punkte zwar ausbauen, aber auch alles verlieren. Manchmal glasklar, doch oft auch überraschend und kaum zu fassen wird dieser kreative Spielblock zum spannenden Highlight auf deiner nächsten Party. Auspacken und direkt losspielen, denn auf dieses Spiel kannst du garantiert setzen!

—description from the publisher

name: Stars versenken
description:
We have spiced up and revolutionized the old and somewhat dusty ship sinking game in a cool design.

There are exciting special fields and rules that can quickly turn the game around, such as the flop shot.

The XXL ANTI-SCHUMMEL AUFSTELLER ensures that your opponent can not look at your game sheet. So cheating is a thing of the past.

GAME PROCEDURE:

Each player receives one side of the A5 pad and places it in front of them. Place the XXL-Anti-Schummel stand between you. Then agree on which names (and thus stars) you want to sink. The first one to sink all the stars wins. But beware! There are exciting special fields and rules that can quickly turn the game around. This keeps the game exciting until the bitter end. STARS VERSENKEN is a great, entertaining and communicative pastime for children and young-at-heart adults.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Wir haben das altbekannte und etwas eingestaubte Schiffe versenken in coolem Design aufgepeppt und revolutioniert.

Es gibt spannende Spezialfelder und Regeln welche das Spiel schnell umdrehen können, wie zum Beispiel der Flopschuss.

Der XXL ANTI-SCHUMMEL AUFSTELLER sorgt dafür, dass dein Gegner nicht auf dein Spielblatt schauen kann. Somit gehören Schummeleien der Vergangenheit an.

SPIELABLAUF:

Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A5 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Stellt den XXL-Anti Schummel Aufsteller zwischen euch auf. Dann einigt euch darauf, welche Namen (und damit Stars) Ihr versenken möchtet. Wer zuerst alle Stars versenkt hat, hat gewonnen. Doch Achtung! Es gibt spannende Spezialfelder und Regeln welche das Spiel schnell umdrehen können. Dadurch bleibt es spannend bis zum bitteren Ende. STARS VERSENKEN ist ein toller, kurzweiliger und kommunikativer Zeitvertreib für Kinder und junggebliebene Erwachsene.

—description from the publisher

name: Ex-Freunde versenken
description:
We have spiced up and revolutionized the old and somewhat dusty ship sinking game in a cool design.

There are exciting special fields and rules that can quickly turn the game around, such as the flop shot.

The XXL ANTI-SCHUMMEL AUFSTELLER ensures that your opponent can not look at your game sheet. So cheating is a thing of the past.

GAME PROCEDURE:

Each player receives one side of the A5 pad and places it in front of them. Place the XXL-Anti-Schummel stand between you. Then agree on which names (and thus stars) you want to sink. The first one to sink all the stars wins. But beware! There are exciting special fields and rules that can quickly turn the game around. This keeps the game exciting until the bitter end. STARS VERSENKEN is a great, entertaining and communicative pastime for children and young-at-heart adults.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Wir haben das altbekannte und etwas eingestaubte Schiffe versenken in coolem Design aufgepeppt und revolutioniert.

Es gibt spannende Spezialfelder und Regeln welche das Spiel schnell umdrehen können, wie zum Beispiel der Flopschuss.

Der XXL ANTI-SCHUMMEL AUFSTELLER sorgt dafür, dass dein Gegner nicht auf dein Spielblatt schauen kann. Somit gehören Schummeleien der Vergangenheit an.

SPIELABLAUF:

Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A5 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Stellt den XXL-Anti Schummel Aufsteller zwischen euch auf. Dann einigt euch darauf, welche Namen (und damit Stars) Ihr versenken möchtet. Wer zuerst alle Stars versenkt hat, hat gewonnen. Doch Achtung! Es gibt spannende Spezialfelder und Regeln welche das Spiel schnell umdrehen können. Dadurch bleibt es spannend bis zum bitteren Ende. STARS VERSENKEN ist ein toller, kurzweiliger und kommunikativer Zeitvertreib für Kinder und junggebliebene Erwachsene.

—description from the publisher

name: Nachbarn versenken
description:

There are exciting special fields and rules that can quickly turn the game around, such as the flop shot.

The XXL ANTI-SCHUMMEL AUFSTELLER ensures that your opponent can not look at your game sheet. So cheating is a thing of the past.

The first one to sink all neighbors wins. But attention! There are exciting special fields and rules that can quickly turn the game around. This keeps it exciting until the bitter end. SINK NEIGHBORS is a great, entertaining and communicative pastime for children and young-at-heart adults.

—description from the publisher (translated)

NACHBARN VERSENKEN ist ein toller, kurzweiliger und kommunikativer Zeitvertreib für Kinder und junggebliebene Erwachsene.

—description from the publisher

name: Melbourne Cuo Racing Game
description:
The Melbourne Cup Racing Game is simple spin and move horse race. Players select one of 5 plastic horses that have a base that is slotted into the board. The board is glued into the the game box base. It appears that the game play and layout is identical to that of the Whitman Kentucky Derby game

Players take it in turns to spin the Spinner which has 5 horses name. The horse name that comes up advances that horse one space down the slotted track. This is repeated until a horse crosses the finish post first and that player is the winner.

Of historical interest is the plastic horse names which were Melbourne Cup winners between 1951 and 1955. The Melbourne Cup is the richest 2 mile horse race in the world, first held in 1861.

—user summary

name: Hangman: Classic Edition
description:
This ultimate game block is the innovative new edition of the well-known game classic "Hangman" and offers 160 tricky terms for lightning-fast lightning-fast guessing fun with family and friends.

GAME FLOW:

The HANGMAN says a letter and crosses it off the alphabet. The LETTER MASTER now says whether the letter is contained in the solution word and reveals the corresponding position in the solution word. The HANGMAN now enters the letter in the correct position. If the letter does not appear in the word, the HANGMAN must color in a body part. The game is over as soon as the HANGMAN has guessed the solution word correctly or all body parts have been colored in. Should the HANGMAN name a wrong solution word, a body part must be painted out as a penalty.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser ultimative Spielblock ist die innovative Neuauflage des bekannten Spieleklassikers „Galgenmännchen“ und bietet 160 knifflige Begriffe für blitzschnellen Ratespaß mit Familie und Freunden.

SPIELABLAUF:

Der HANGMAN sagt einen Buchstaben und streicht diesen vom Alphabet weg. Der BUCHSTABENMEISTER sagt nun ob der Buchstabe in dem Lösungswort enthalten ist und verrät die entsprechende Position im Lösungswort. Der HANGMAN trägt nun den Buchstaben an der richtigen Position ein. Kommt der Buchstabe im Wort nicht vor, muss der HANGMAN ein Körperteil ausmalen. Das Spiel ist vorbei, sobald der HANGMAN das Lösungswort richtig erraten hat oder alle Körperteile ausgemalt sind. Sollte der HANGMAN ein falsches Lösungswort nennen, muss ein Körperteil als Strafe ausgemalt werden.

—description from the publisher

name: Hangman: Experten Edition
description:
This ultimate game block is the sophisticated HANGMAN edition and offers
160 tricky terms for 'lightning-fast guessing fun with family and friends. Fun guaranteed!
Thanks to the predefined terms, the game can begin immediately. Per sheet you can always choose between 2 predefined, tricky terms.

The game is over as soon as the HANGMAN has guessed the solution word correctly or all body parts have been colored in. Should the HANGMAN name a wrong solution word, a body part must be painted out as a penalty.

—description from the publisher (translated)

160 knifflige Begriffe für´blitzschnellen Ratespaß mit Familie und Freunden. Spaß garantiert!
Dank den vorgegebenen Begriffen kann das Spiel sofort beginnen. Pro Blatt könnt ihr euch immer zwischen 2 vorgegebenen, kniffligen Begriffen entscheiden.

—description from the publisher

description:
This ultimate game block is the kid-friendly HANGMAN edition and offers
160 kid-friendly terms for lightning-fast guessing fun with family and friends. Fun guaranteed!
Thanks to the predefined terms, the game can begin immediately. You can always choose between 2 predefined, tricky terms per sheet.
This ultimate game block to fan out contains 80 sheets. So for many extensive rounds of play is ensured.

description:
This ultimate game block is the naughty HANGMAN edition and features 160 badass and naughty terms for lightning fast guessing fun with friends. Fun guaranteed!
Thanks to the predefined terms, the game can begin immediately. You can always choose between 2 predefined, tricky terms per sheet.
This ultimate game block to fan out contains 80 sheets. So for many extensive rounds of play is ensured.

—description from the publisher

name: Loony Joe
description:
Loony Joe is about being the first to recognize which animal is depicted exactly 3x on a card.
The action cards include many different tasks and fun competitions.
Reactivity, observation skills and dexterity make you the winner in this game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Bei Loony Joe geht es darum, als Erster zu erkennen, welches Tier genau 3x auf einer Karte abgebildet ist.
Die Aktionskarten beinhalten viele verschiedene Aufgaben und lustige Wettkämpfe.
Reaktionsfähigkeit, Beobachtungsgabe und Geschicklichkeit machen dich in diesem Spiel zum Gewinner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Jammerlappen
description:
For once, this dramatically funny card game is not about winning! Use your action cards cleverly against your fellow players and get rid of your cards as quickly as possible to avoid being the whiner.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Bei diesem dramatisch lustigen Kartenspiel geht es ausnahmsweise mal nicht ums Gewinnen! Setze deine Aktionskarten clever gegen deine Mitspieler ein und werde so schnellstmöglich deine Karten los, um nicht der Jammerlappen zu sein.

—description from the publisher

name: Ranklotzen: Erweiterungsset
description:
More fun in a large group! This expansion set for our DENKRIESEN game RANKLOTZEN is perfect to expand your game group with 10 blocks by 2 players. Treat yourself to an epic game night with friends or family. On the blocks, get set, go!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Mehr Spaß in großer Runde! Dieses Erweiterungsset für unser DENKRIESEN Spiel RANKLOTZEN ist perfekt um deine Spielerunde mit 10 Klötzen um 2 Spieler zu vergrößern. Gönn dir einen epischen Spieleabend mit Freunden oder Familie. Auf die Klötze, fertig, los!

—description from the publisher

name: Amazing Auction
description:
Amazing Auction is an auction game where the items you bid on are a combination of cards from two decks - one based on adjectives (e.g. used or mediocre) and one based on nouns (e.g. impressionist painting or sock). Together, each pair of cards show a number which determines the value of the item up for auction.

The noun deck is formed from cards which each player sees some of privately. Part way through the game, this deck stops being revealed until the item has been auctioned.

Players start the game with 10 coins and cannot gain additional money.

The player with the most points when all items have been auctioned wins.

name: Bear Adventure
description: Roll the dice to move up the board and climb levels until you reach the top. The first to reach the top gets the flag and is the winner.

name: Freedom Five: Community Team-Up Pack
description:
Two new playable Heroes (Parse and The Scholar), including their Ability Cards, Player Boards, Personal Task Cards and any special tokens. Includes character standees or KS Exclusive miniatures!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: Arcane Wonders, Greater Than Games, LLC

name: Tree Hugger
description:
Tree Hugger: Strategic and educational game of tree survival
Climate events, habitat events, human events, oh my! Combine tree superpowers, ecology, and strategy to build a resilient forest.

Grow a forest to capture the most carbon points. However, your trees must overcome several environmental challenges to survive; these include, climate events, habitat events, and human events. Featuring 12 North American conifer trees and their unique superpowers, you will strategize where to plant, nuture their growth, and devise ways to protect each tree for your forest to thrive.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Iocaine
description:
“What you do not smell is called Iocaine powder. It is odourless, tasteless, dissolves instantly in liquid, and is among the more deadly poisons known to man.”

. - Vizzini (former Sicilian criminal mastermind)
.

Iocaine is a devious little “battle of wits… to the death” for 2-players, played with just 18 cards in 5-15 mins.

Six of the cards display either Poison or Elixir - it is your goal to employ the 3 suits (Skill, Strength and Wit) to manipulate your opponent into taking tricks containing 3 Poisons or 3 Elixirs, thus proving who is right... and who is dead.

name: O Bom, o Mau e o Mexicano
description:
Welcome to The Good, the Bad and the Mexican! Travel to the past and be the fastest trigger in the wild west!

The Good, the Bad and the Mexican uses an innovative card draw and discard mechanic, which requires decisions and risks for you and your opponents! Plan your moves with a mix of Uno to get ahead or complicate the lives of other players.

But remember, you are not alone in this duel! Your opponents also aim for victory, and will make your way a real challenge!

DRAW, PILGRIM!

How to play?
Each player starts with four cards, and the object of the game is to collect five cards of the same color or value. On the player's turn, he draws a card from the top of the deck or the top card from the discard pile, and must discard another card from his hand. When discarding a card, the text of the card is activated, such as skipping the next player's turn.

—description from the designer

Bem-vindo a “O Bom, o Mau e o Mexicano”! Viaje para o passado e seja o gatilho mais rápido do velho oeste!

“O Bom, O Mau e o Mexicano” usa uma inovadora mecânica de compra e descarte de cartas, que exigem decisões e riscos para você e os seus adversários! Planeje suas jogadas com um misto de “Uno” e “Cacheta” para sair na frente ou complicar a vida dos outros jogadores.

Mas lembre-se, você não está sozinho neste duelo! Seus adversários também almejam a vitória, e farão do seu caminho um verdadeiro desafio!

—description from the designer (Portuguese)
categories: American West, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Lose a Turn

name: Tabernacle of Yahweh
description:
Tabernacle of Yahweh is a resource and worker placement Board Game based on a defining period in the history on the nation of Israel. Described in the Bible from the Book of Exodus 25 the Tribes of Israel, after the Exodus from Egypt, are called to bring voluntary offerings to construct a Tabernacle (Heb: Mishkan) or Dwelling Place for Yahweh, the God of Israel, and all the objects pertaining to it:
“And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, 'Speak to the children of Israel that they bring Me an offering. You shall take an offering from every man that gives it willingly with his heart. And this is the offering which you shall take of them: gold, and silver, and bronze, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair, and rams' skins dyed red, and fine leather, and acacia-wood, oil for the light, spices for anointing oil and for sweet incense, onyx stones, and stones to be set in the ephod and in the breastplate. And let them make Me a Sanctuary, so that I may dwell among them.' ” (Exodus 25:1-8)

Each player takes control of a Tribe, and beginning with three, will collect resources by either rolling each Tribe member's die or placing their die on the Action Board and use those resources to expand their tribe and fill requirements for the construction of the Tabernacle. Resources have differing values and will receive varying points by placing them on the Tabernacle Board, thus bringing the game to an end when all spaces are filled. Through strategic use of resources and a bit of luck, the Tribe with the most points at this time will be declared the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement with Dice Workers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Not so pink
description:
In this game, you decide together what will happen in a young woman's life. Your character is going to encounter different situations that women face every day. It’s up to you how you choose to react, but remember that these choices have different consequences... The game is created to ignite discussions about gender equality. And maybe you disagree with something in the game...? Or it encourages you to share your personal experiences...? Let’s explore together what being a WOMAN means to you!

Gameplay

Choose one player who will be a narrator.
Take the first card from the Childhood pile. The narrator reads out loud the title of the card, the description of the event and possible choices: A and B. Discuss them within your group and decide together - How do you react in this situation? Try to be unanimous. If it’s impossible, you may vote, but always share your arguments.
Turn the card and read the consequences of your choice. Add or subtract the appropriate number of points on your mini boards.
The next player becomes the narrator, picks up the next card and reads out loud for everyone. The game goes on like this.
If the last card in your pile is the special card - it will tell you what to do next.
If your points drop to “zero” on one of the mini boards - flip the mini board over and read the text on the back of it. Bring new rules to the game.
If it’s written to draw a special card - take it, read it out loud and bring new rules to the game.

The end of the game
It’s a LOSS if your points on two mini boards drop to “zero”.
You WIN if you finish the pile of Motherhood or the pile of Career cards.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Move Through Deck, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling

name: WOGO
description:
We wanted to come up with a game where conversations are the main focus. Because we think that young people learn best from each other. With those thoughts we created WOGO.
WOGO is a conversation game where you win by coming up with the best/funniest/most different... answer to one of the questions about the 17 SDG’s.
The questions are about sustainability and the 17 world goals. We came up with the title of the game by merging the two words “WORLD” and “GOALS” - which is exactly what the game is about.

name: Natural-Selection: Combine & Create – zieodalis Expansion Set
description:
Create over 1,000 new creatures featuring art by zieodalis. This expansion set contains 54 brand new creature cards and 1 prompt card.

The party game Natural-Selection: Combine & Create contains two decks: Picture Cards and Prompt Cards. Each round, every player draws up to five Pictures Cards in their hand. One player will reveal a Prompt Card and become the judge for the round. The other players will combine two Picture Cards in their hand to create a creature that best fits the Prompt Card and place them face-down. Going clockwise from the judge, players will reveal their creatures and describe why it best fits the prompt. The judge will award the Prompt Card to their favorite creature. The player to the left of the judge will become the new judge for the next round. The first player to be awarded 5 Prompt Cards wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Natural-Selection: Combine & Create – Swell Guy Expansion Set
description:
Create over 1,000 new creatures featuring art by Swell Guy Customs. This expansion set contains 54 brand new creature cards and 1 prompt card.

The party game Natural-Selection: Combine & Create contains two decks: Picture Cards and Prompt Cards. Each round, every player draws up to five Pictures Cards in their hand. One player will reveal a Prompt Card and become the judge for the round. The other players will combine two Picture Cards in their hand to create a creature that best fits the Prompt Card and place them face-down. Going clockwise from the judge, players will reveal their creatures and describe why it best fits the prompt. The judge will award the Prompt Card to their favorite creature. The player to the left of the judge will become the new judge for the next round. The first player to be awarded 5 Prompt Cards wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pearwood House Rules of Combat
description:
You and your opponents step onto the platform, weapons ready. Everyone at the prestigious Pearwood House is watching, evaluating. Victory may go to the last fighter standing, but it may also go to the most aggressive fighter, whether or not that fighter is conscious at the end, so do not back down.

Pearwood House Rules of Combat is a card-driven martial-arts-style combat game with a unique focus on positioning and fighter-fighter interaction. Your every attack, every defense, every push and shift will move you and your opponent around the platform. Your opponent's responses will set up new positions for you to consider. Smash your foes into obstacles, throw them off the platform, or send your weapon through their defenses and send them stumbling.

You must manage your supply of move cards, build up focus by employing the proper stance, rid yourself of seemingly never-ending fatigue cards, and, ideally, keep your endurance above 0 to stay conscious. Amass aggression tokens to win... or you could just knock everyone else out, but with only 4 rounds to do so, you'd have to go hard.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hexagon Grid, Multi-Use Cards, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Pandamonium Game
description:
A basic roll-and-move game, where you are trying to discard four pyramid tokens to win the game.

On a player's turn, they roll the die and move their pawn around the board. Depending on the space they land on, the player may lose a turn, be allowed to discard a pyramid token, or be trapped on a panda space. When trapped on a panda space, players cannot move until at least 2 other players come to the spot to free them.

Once a player as discarded all four of their pyramid tokens, and reached the Pyramid of Power space, they win the game.

—user summary

name: Ecucation
description:
The world is changing and climate change is an ever-increasing problem for nature and humanity. Now it is up to the players whether they want to save the world or sacrifice the earth’s future for profit.

The aim of the game is to save the climate as a group. At the same time, the players have to keep an eye on their money reserves and invest them efficiently and strategically.

However, natural disasters such as floods, desertification, or forest fires keep putting obstacles in the way.

The challenge is to earn enough money to avoid going bankrupt, but also not to focus on making too much money, otherwise, you will damage the climate and lose out. In addition, you have to focus on innovative ideas, which are a bit more expensive than CO₂ cards, but more climate-friendly. For every 5 monetary points you gain, you will be credited with one climate point at the end. In the end, whoever has collected the most climate points wins.

name: Wildstyle: Objective Tile Promos
description:
Two two-sided tiles with 4 additional objectives.

Tile 1
Wake the Neighbors: Score 4 VP per set of 1 Downtown, 1 Residential, and 1 Shopping icon within a cluster.
Back
Paint the Town: 8 VP per set of 1 Park, 1 Industrial, 1 Downtown, 1 Residential, and 1 Shopping icon withing a cluster.

Tile 2
Terminal Tagger: Score the number of Train Stations you've tagged. 1 = 3pts; 2 = 6pts; 3 = 10pts; 4 or more = 15pts.
Back
Rail Rider: Score the number of Railways you've tagged (rounded down). 3 = 5pts; 5 = 10pts; 7 = 16pts; 9 or more = 25pts.

name: WAZZO!
