description: Five dice are split into pairs and a single, with very high or low results being most desirable. The pairs are recorded in one section and the single in another section. Whoever combines their dice well and gets the highest points wins.

name: Silk & Venom
description:
Silk & Venom is a press-your-luck game about spiders building webs, catching bugs, and avoiding the rain. Build your web as big as your dare but be careful -- the rain might come and wash away all your work. Inspired by the Itsy Bitsy Spider, this game is for all ages and includes basic and strategic rules. Advanced rules add set collection and end-game scoring.

On your turn, you can choose to build your web, catch bugs, or collect bugs from your web. If your web gets too wet (either from rain or drops on your web) it'll break. The bugs you collect might have additional effects that will increase points but also add risk. In the end, the player with the most points wins. How much will you risk for the biggest meal?

Silk & Venom is the second game from Binxadinx and the first in a new nature universe of games from them. Game design is by David Bock (Rocket Ranchers) with illustrations by Lianne Pflug.

-description from designer

name: Radio
description:
This is a simple race game based on the "newest invention [that] has spread, in a very short time, all over the world." Players roll a die and move flat metal standees of various citizens (a violinist, a maid, etc.) from space to space. The scenes between the spaces depict people around the world, all of them listening to or performing for the radio.

Some spaces allow players to follow radio waves, moving forward or backward as in Chutes and Ladders.

The rules of the game suggest "if you are tired of listening to your radio...the game will give you a nice change."

—user summary

name: Brain Scan
description:
Manipulation rummy with words.

There are 52 cards, 2 for each letter of the alphabet, and a wild Brain Card. In their turn a player may play words from the 5-card hand, or extend existing words by adding letters to them, or take cards from existing words (as long as they leave a valid word) to make other words.

Points scored are:
100 for 5 letter word from dealt hand. (All hands are redealt after that
70 for a 6 letter word
60 for a 5 letter word
10 per letter for words shorter than 5 letters
10 per letter for extending an existing word
50 for using the Brain Card
-10 per letter for an incorrect word

The winner is the first to reach 500.

If a player can make a 5-letter word from their starting hand they score 100 points and new hands are dealt to everyone.

—user summary
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Sub-Zero
description:
As a faction of Arctic animals take over territories and stockpile food to survive the winter. Fight the cold, avoid humans, and escape the polar bears!

In Sub-Zero, you lead a faction of arctic animals chosen from Walrus, Goose, Musk Ox, Bald Eagle, Arctic Fox, and Lemming.
The first player of the turn rolls a set of dice indicating the actions available for that turn, the players in clockwise order choose which dice to use and remove it from the pool available to the others.
From the season's black dice set, you can then place your animals on the board, collect food from a territory and lower its value, use your faction's special action (each faction is different from the others), spend a point to choose a specific action of the dice
From the blue die of the season, freeze a territory by lowering its value, grow grass on a territory by raising its value, place a human scientific expedition on a territory, collect food, or send a Polar Bear against the animals of the other factions.
The game takes place in 15 rounds divided into 3 seasons: spring, summer, and autumn.
At each change of season, the actions guided by the dice make the game more and more "tiring" for the animals, decreasing the proliferation of animals, reducing the possibility of collecting food, increasing the possibility of the presence of ice, humans and bear attacks Polar

Food points are earned by maintaining a majority in territories, collecting food during the game, and collecting components for game objectives, which are selected at the start of the game.

At the end of the 3 seasons, the player with the most points will have won the game and let his faction's pets get through Sub-Zero's cold winter!
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: TOTO
description:
This is a betting game in two parts: a colorful board with circular spaces and a small shaker "card" with three holes. The original version was probably the one themed around horse racing, but there are other variants, as described below.

Players put stakes (colored counters) on one of ten colors on the board - each representing a different horse - to either win or place in the race. Then, the player nominated as Banker shakes up the card, rearranging the colored chits inside. The first-, second-, and third-place horses are revealed in the shaker holes by color, and flipping the shaker over reveals numerical odds against them (also randomized). The Banker then pays out stakes multiplied by the odds, plus bonuses listed on the board.

The game comes in at least four near-identical varieties: the original horse race version with simple "Win/Place" spaces on the board; one themed around baseball, with baseball terms on the spaces (hit, foul, bunt, etc.); one themed around animals, with animal graphics on the colored spaces; and one themed around flowers, with flower graphics on the spaces. Each version includes an appropriate illustration on the box lid/shaker.

—user summary

name: Niche Pitch
description:
The uproarious party game where players create zany businesses to solve peculiar problems in niche markets! Ideal for 4-12 players, ages 12+, each game lasts 10 minutes per player.

Creativity is key as players discover obscure market issues in the Market Research phase, devise ingenious businesses to tackle them in the Pitch Phase, and invest in the best pitches in the Investment Phase. The player with the most investment by the end of the game wins!

MARKET RESEARCH PHASE:
Draw 3 Market Research cards, and from those cards choose an interesting prompt and niche.

PITCH PHASE:
Formulate a business that would solve the problem found in the Market Research phase, take up to 3 minutes to think of a pitch, and finished with a 3 minute pitch to sell your sizzle and steak!

INVESTMENT PHASE:
Issue two Greenback cards to your favorite pitch, and one Greenback to the runner-up. The founder with the most investment by the end of 3 rounds winds!

With endless combinations of markets and problems, no two games are alike. So, gather your friends and dive into the wacky world of Niche Pitch, where the most outlandish ideas win big!

—description from the publisher

name: 12 Games of Christmas
description:
An assortment of 12 Christmas-themed games. Most are party-type games of one sort or other. They are

Christmas Pairs- a basic memory matching game using a deck of cards with Christmas themed illustrations

Festive Guesses- a musical game where players try to guess a Christmas song while someone is humming it on a Kazoo

Santa's Letters- Player try to come up with answers that fit a category, with each round requiring use of a particular letter. Scoring is done for answers that no one else wrote down. Think Just One meets Facts in Five

Merry Quizmas- Trivia game with the twist that the answers are multiple choice and players need to contort their bodies into the letter of their choice. Trivial Pursuit and Twister have a baby

Santa's Sports Day- See how many players complete the 10 dexterity challenges.

Panto or Picture- Players guess what someone is either acting out or drawing. Smash up of charades and Pictionary.

Reindeer Hoopla- Dexterity game where players toss rings at another player who is wearing inflatable antlers

Clutch the Kazoos- Players try to collect seats of cards. When someone does they grab a kazoo from the middle of the table and the other players then also try to grab one. There is one kazoo fewer than players and the player who doesn't have a kazoo loses a "life." Play continues until all but one player have lost 5 lives.

Santa's Hat- Players write the name of 3 people or characters on a piece of paper and put them in Santa's Hat. Players are split into two teams. Each team takes a turn drawing a name and trying to figure out who it is. There are three rounds with rules like Time's Up.

White Lies- Bluffing game using the Christmas Pairs card. Each player in turn will discard cards face down saying what quantity and number they are discarding. The next player either "raise" the discard or calls out the previous player. The player who is wrong has to take the discard pile. the object is to be the first to run out of cards.

Christmas Characters- A 20 questions-type game where someone will be asked yes or no questions about who or what they have chosen.

It's Snow Joke!- Two players sit across from each other and try to keep a straight face while each one reads a joke from a card to the other player.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Music, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Drawing, Matching, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Questions and Answers, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game

name: A.O.L.S.: An Office Life Simulator
description:
Buy Weapons, Beat Monsters, Earn a Promotion!
Experience the thrill of battling monsters and shopping for office supplies in A.O.L.S., an office life simulator where you and your coworkers must help in the recapture of subjects purposely released as part of an emergency release exercise, all while vying for Workers Points to impress the higher-ups and earn a promotion.

Summary
The game A.O.L.S. (An Office Life Simulator) is a board game where players are employees who are tasked with helping in the recapture of subjects that were purposely released as part of an emergency release exercise by their company's new owner, the Super Cool Place. The game has a cyclic pattern of shop phase, battle phase, and a "coffee break" phase. In the shop phase, workers point coins can be spent in the company shop in exchange for items, equipment, coupons, and even performance bonus cards. In the battle phase, players fight one monster from the monster pile using their equipment and office supplies card. Players will have a certain number of rounds to beat the monster, and the player with the most worked hours this week goes first. The game rewards workers points to those who excel in the assignment and perform the best, with the possibility of a promotion.

Lore
You are an ordinary office worker. The office building next door, dubbed the Super Cool Place, started the day by running a planned emergency release exercise of important monst- er, “Subjects” kept there. As a part of this planned emergency release exercise, the Super Cool Place has temporarily bought out your company and all of its employees. With new management comes a restructuring of the chain of command. Help in the recapture of these subjects to earn Workers Points. Spend these Worker's Points at the company shop to obtain office supplies to help in the recapture of another subject. Sell equipment and items earned in battle to obtain more Workers Points. The employee who impresses management the most after 4 battles will finally earn the promotion of their dreams! (Wins!)

So I asked Chat GTP what the "best" part of this game was...
"As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences or preferences like humans do, so I cannot determine what the best part of the game is. However, I can tell you that the game seems to have a variety of mechanics, such as collecting cards, equipping equipment, battling monsters, and using office supplies, which could provide players with different ways to strategize and interact with each other. The game also seems to have a currency system, workers points, which can be used to buy items from the shop or gain performance bonus cards, providing players with another layer of decision-making. Ultimately, the best part of the game would depend on the individual player's interests and preferences."

—desription from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Kill Steal, Market, Simulation, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Fire in the Hole: The Salty Seadog Exxxpansion Pack
description:
The Salty Dog is a set of forfeit tiles that sit in the ship's squares. A forfeit MUST be completed whenever yer cannonball lands in a tiled square.

Includes 2 sets of instructions for a drinking version and a non-boozy version.

name: Math-Tac-Toe
description: The game comes with several 3X3 grids in three levels of difficulty. A number appears in each of the nine spaces of a grid. Each player chooses a grid. Players take turns rolling four d12 PlaySmart Dice (two with 3 through 8 twice, and two with 4 through 9 twice) and then using mathematical operations to combine one or more of the numbers on the dice to equal one of the numbers in the grid. A chip is placed on the grid number, and the first player to complete a pre-selected pattern in the grid with his chips is the winner.

name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Cedar Mountain
description:
The Battle of Cedar Mountain, August 9, 1862.

Jackson moves against Banks corps of the Union Army of Virginia, waiting for him near Cedar Mountain.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game system of battles of the American Civil War. Cedar Mountain is the tenth battle in the system.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to its size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and tables; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, 336 2-sided counters, and a Battle/Scenario booklet.

Cedar Mountain's Battle Book includes two Scenarios; August 9th, the historic set-up of the battle; and An Earlier Start; A set-up earlier in than day than the historic battle, making the battle a meeting engagement and giving player more turns of play.

The map measures 16" x 18" at a scale of 250 yards per 3/4" hex.

Because of it's small map and low counter volume, and it's involving infantry, artillery, and cavalry; LFM:Cedar Mountain make for a good introductory game to the Last Full Measure system, and print-and-play wargaming.

The full game is available for download at: http://UhlanGames.us
as are Vassal modules and ZunTzu gameboxs for all LFM games.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Hunt A Killer: Earth Break – Omega Protocol
description:
Five years after the aliens released a deadly virus, those who are immune have taken up shelter in what was once an underground government facility. Welcome to NACS: North American Communications-facility. You are the most recent and last survivor to join NACS and you are contacted by an anonymous resident to investigate strange events.

Decode ciphers and solve puzzles to understand the true motivations of your fellow residents. Be the main character in a Sci-Fi adventure!

Difficulty: 5/5 - Hard

name: Hunt A Killer: Earth Break – Frequency
description:
Welcome to the surface, survivor, where one wrong decision could mean the difference between life and death. After the events of Omega Protocol, you find yourself guiding a group of rangers through alien-controlled territory. Use your cunning and limited resources to keep your team alive and discover the secret to destroying the invaders.

WARNING: Earth Break: Frequency contains spoilers for the events of Hunt A Killer: Earth Break – Omega Protocol

Difficulty: 4/5

name: Hunt A Killer: Murder On Ice
description:
Murder On Ice is a Membership Exclusive that is only available to Hunt A Killer subscribers.

Figure skater Sofia de la Torre is, you could say, on thin ice. After her coach of over a decade is found murdered, Sofia is the police’s prime suspect.

When Nathan LaPalma is found dead on the ice rink one day, everyone has the same question: why would someone kill a figure skating legend. Nathan, an Olympic-medalist-turned-coach, is famous both in and out of the skating community for his style, talent, and unbeatable coaching. And yet, someone had it out for the skating superstar. Could one of his own proteges be the killer?

You’ve been called in by Nathan’s student Sofia de la Torre to unspin the mystery of her coach’s death. And for good reason. The police are close to pinning Nathan’s murder on Sofia herself, and she’s desperate to find the real killer. Can you break into the competitive, and often secretive, world of figure skating enough to vindicate Sofia and track down the icy murderer?

To catch the killer and bring justice to Nathan and Sofia, you’ll have to:

Prove to the police that Sofia is innocent. You’ll have to prove that she’s innocent before you can move on to finding the real killer!

Unravel whispered secrets that the evasive skaters don’t want you to know.

Track clues and evidence across multiple episode boxes to build a complete picture of the crime.

Puzzle out secret messages, ciphers, and codes to unlock additional clues to the killer’s identity.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Hard

name: Double Quick!: The Card Game
description:
You are racing against the sand timer to build your own crossword. The other players are trying to beat you to itin building their own.

Every round you draw new cards and add them to your crossword.

When you get a letter that doesn't easily fit, you can always pass it to nobble your opponents.

The first player to use up all their cards ends the game and the player with the highest scoring crossword wins!

name: Meet MahJong
description:
Meet MahJong is an introduction for new players to the tile-based strategy game played all around the world. Learn the history and basic rules of both Chinese MahJong and the American variation. Beginners will build strategy and confidence as they play again and again!

Meet MahJong is designed with new players in mind and is easy to learn and play. Included in the instructions are alternate advanced rules for more of a challenge and recommended resources for learning more about MahJong. Players will build a foundation for learning the full game of MahJong with ease!

—description from the publisher

name: Cryptid America
description:
“Survive, thrive, dumpster dive.” In a world overrun by humans, you play as one of 12 Cryptid tribes just trying to live the unseen life. Gather resources, evade threats, and gain territory using your abilities as either a Relict (Bigfoot, Jackalopes, Mole People, Yeti, or Skunk Ape), a Supernatural (Chupacabra, Werewolf, or Jersey Devil), or an Extraterrestrial (Aliens, Corn Dwellers, Mothman, or Flatwoods Monster).

With 90 Resource cards and 21 Threat cards, plus picture dice and dragon dice, and a few minor expansions, you can play up to six players for 1-3 hours. Rules include basic and advanced play, which centers around special missions for each cryptid, from the benign (Bigfoot’s ecological mission to protect habitat and wildlife) to the horrible (Mole People’s revenge scheme to blow up the Yellowstone caldera).

Fun stuff: Ally Species—make friends with animals!
Ally Cryptids—NPCs: Wendigo, Uk’tena, Hodag, and Fresno Nightcrawler
Hoax Cryptids: Saucer Drone, Bigfoot Hoax, Huge Owl, Crazed Razorback

Expansions include: Military Ruse, Zombie Outbreak, and Dinosaur Hunt! Also more human threats and more resources!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Flex Deck
description:
Preparing for a trip to the Grand Canyon, the designers wanted games that were light, fun, and travel friendly. To save weight and space, they put them all in one deck.

The Flex Deck combines:

traditional playing cards (suit and rank in top left corner)
double-9 dominoes (middle of card)
letter/word games (letter in bottom left corner)


The main goal of Flex Deck is to let the owners play with it any way they want. Their website was a place where people could post rules to games they have invented for the deck.

The deck includes rules to one omnibus game, Pick How You Play. In each round, players play either All Fives Dominoes, or Rummy, and the first to 200 points wins. Between each round, players play a word game where each makes a crossword from their hand of 15 cards, with the player using the most cards choosing whether to play dominoes or rummy for the next round.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Game System, Word Game

name: Wizards of Valendar
description:
Four mages face each other on the battleground. They have to learn spells and fight each other. Like every battle royale game, only one can stand in the end. Choose your spells wisely and create your ultimate mage.

Wizards of Valendar is a strategic and tactic game which enforces the players of thinking about every move they will make. The positioning in the battle arena is key to hit your opponents with the right spells at the right time.

Let the battle begin and be the last one standing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Drawing, Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Pieces as Map, Variable Set-up

name: All In One Deck
description:
This intuitively designed deck boasts 4 different game elements on each card face:


Card Games. The top-left corner has a full standard deck of 52 playing cards + 3 jokers for all of your favorite card games.
Letter Games. The center circle has a full alphabet including 3 wild cards, for any word- or letter-based games.
Dominoes. The dominoes in the center edge to make a full Double-Nine dominoes stack. Play with only the red and blue cards and the 5-6 and 6-6 jokers to make a full Double-Six stack.
Matching Games. The corner shapes -- 14 shapes in 4 colors -- can be used for matching and memory games.
Travel Bingo. The deck also comes with 4 double sided cards with a 4x4 array of commonly seen objects for spotting games like Travel Bingo.


This deck is designed to let you play what you want, when you want. The company's goal was to make the ultimate travel game, so the cards are washable and durable.

Rules for games to play with the deck are at the company's website.

—description from the publisher and the rulebook (Adapted)
categories: Card Game, Game System, Word Game

name: Worm Hole to Uranus
description:
An un-traditional mashup of traditional role playing and drinking games for any casual get together or rawkus turn-up.
Role play a variety of hilarious space movie's cliche characters: Bounty Hunters, Androids, Aliens, etc.

Complete awkward physical challenges to help your crew or roll a 6-sided die to finish various tasks.
Failing missions results in real consequences and even... death.

Drink until you are far.. far.. gone.
Perfect for novice gamers and has very moderate (but not required) drinking.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: THEIA: The Millennial Wars
description:
THEIA is a dynamic and engaging board game that brings the excitement of the tactical wargame to life. The game features an assortment of fantasy races, including Humans, Earthbound, Dark Walkers, and Marlock, each with its own unique army and lords. In THEIA, the ultimate goal is to lead your army to victory by vanquishing your opponents' forces on different battlefields.

To achieve victory, you'll need to master a vast array of tactical options. You'll have access to powerful spells from 4 different magical schools, each with its own strengths and specialties. You can also customize your heroes with a wide range of items, from weapons and armor to magical artifacts, to create an unbeatable combination of skills and abilities.

THEIA offers different experiences in one game, making it accessible to players of all levels of experience. At its simplest, THEIA is a basic, card-driven chess-like strategy game that is easy to pick up and play. The game mechanics are straightforward, and the focus is on using your forces to outmaneuver your opponents and gain the upper hand on the battlefield.

For those who crave a greater challenge, THEIA also offers an advanced tactical tabletop experience. This version of the game is more complex and strategic, requiring careful planning and execution to emerge victorious. With the double-sided map tiles, you can craft a unique strategy each time you play. This advanced version of THEIA is sure to test your skills and strategic thinking.

—description from the publisher

name: Survivors: A Dystopia Rising Game
description:
The zombie apocalypse has ravaged the world for generations. Survivors like yourself band together, forming settlements to protect against the undead, mutated, and marauding gangs. A horde of zombies has overrun your home, forcing you and your followers to pack up a caravan and race to safety. Lead them through unique landscapes, overcome story-based challenges, manage your resources, and try to find a new place to put down roots before your fuel runs out and the Horde catches up to you.

​Over 100 unique story encounters challenge 1-5 players to work cooperatively in the Wastes. Manage the safety of your survivors and resources while trying to find a new home. The game ends with the foundation of a new settlement on one of 36 terrain tiles. The group scores based on their final location, remaining resources, survivors, and how much of the Horde is still chasing them.

—description from the designer

name: Hostel After Dark: Enhancements 'N' Events
description:
Expansion pack containing:

5 Unique translucent Accessories cards;
9 Unique Events cards;
9 additional Weapon cards;
7 Enhancements cards (Kickstarter Stretch goals).

name: Bad Opinions
description:
Each round, the active player expresses their opinion on a wide variety of topics – movies, music, celebrities, politics, etc. Once they are done, play continues around the table with each player choosing to either draw a card and pass to the next player OR to pick up the gauntlet and deliver their own red-hot Rant on the topic!

Once both players have delivered their impassioned opinion on the subject, the rest of the players vote on which Rant was the best.

The RANTMASTER who delivered the more popular Rant receives a point, and any players who voted for the more popular Rant also earn points. The first player to earn 7 points is the WINNER!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Storytelling, Turn Order: Claim Action, Voting

name: Willie Winkle's Wedding
description:
A card game / parlor entertainment based on the concept we know today as Mad Libs. One player, designated the "reader," reads the provided comical story with several missing phrases. The other players, among whom small cards with non-sequitur phrases have been distributed, are called upon to fill in the blanks with the phrases in their hand: "a salt mackerel," "a box of gum drops," "a long-eared donkey," etc.

The game directions do not state how the winner is determined. However, in other very similar Parker games of this kind (i.e. "How Silas Popped the Question"), the winner is the player who laughs the loudest.

The game debuted in the 1929 Parker Games catalog and seems to have been discontinued by the next edition.

—user summary

name: Mind Match-1
description:
Are you having a party and looking for a fast, fun and clever cooperative game? Play Mind Match to test how well your mind matches with the minds of your friends! Within 5 minutes, solve the puzzles together using surprising and amusing means of communication. Three different mini-games test your communicative skills and intellectual bonding whilst you’re having a good time!

Mind Match is a collection of dynamic cooperative games with many puzzles you need to solve together before the time runs out. Each puzzle consists of 2 types cards ― each card stands for a part of the puzzle: a Question and an Answer. You have to find a player with the other half of your puzzle and solve it together! The more pairs of cards you match before time runs out, the more victory points you receive. Are you ready to make a mind match?

In Mind Match-1 you’ll find 3 mini-games: Icons, Emojis and Pattern Lock.

You can combine Mind Match-1 and Mind Match-2 to have more puzzles and fun!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Matching
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Mind Match-2
description:
Are you having a party and looking for a fast, fun and clever cooperative game? Play Mind Match to test how well your mind matches with the minds of your friends! Within 5 minutes, solve the puzzles together using surprising and amusing means of communication. Three different mini-games test your communicative skills and intellectual bonding whilst you’re having a good time!

Mind Match is a collection of dynamic cooperative games with many puzzles you need to solve together before the time runs out. Each puzzle consists of 2 types cards ― each card stands for a part of the puzzle: a Question and an Answer. You have to find a player with the other half of your puzzle and solve it together! The more pairs of cards you match before time runs out, the more victory points you receive. Are you ready to make a mind match?

Mind Match-2 includes 3 mini-games: Labyrinth, Tetris and Cars.
You can find more mini-games in Mind Match-1.

You can combine Mind Match-1 and Mind Match-2 to have more puzzles and fun!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Matching
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Piggy Bank Game
description:
This is a very simple spinner-based game that teaches children basic change-making skills.

Each player gets a card showing a piggy bank with a different colored background and a handful of realistic metal coins in different denominations (five nickels, three dimes, and three quarters). Every turn, the spinner will tell a player whether to put 5, 10, 15, 20, or 25 cents in the piggy bank, which may require them to make change with the bank. The first player to put all their money in the piggy bank first wins.

—user summary

name: COAL
description: Sixty-four square tiles display eight shapes, eight tiles for each shape. Four tiles are dealt to each player, and one tile is turned face-up. On your turn, add one or more tiles to a line of face-up tiles so that either all the shapes in the line are the same or all are different. Score one point for each tile in a line of different tiles, and two points per tile in a line of identical tiles. Double your score for a line of eight tiles. Replenish to four tiles at the end of your turn. Play until the tiles run out. Most points wins.

name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Trevilians Station
description:
Phillip Sheridan, on a raid with the Army of the Potomac's cavalry corps to cut the supply lines to Richmond meets with the Army of Northern Virginia's cavalry corps under Wade Hampton at Trevilians Station.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game system of battles of the American Civil War. Trevilians Station is the eleventh battle in the system.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to its size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and tables; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, 256 2-sided counters, and a Battle/Scenario booklet.

Trevilians Station's Battle Book includes two Scenarios; June 11th, the first day of the battle and the start of the campaign game; and June 12th, the second day of the battle.

The map measures 28" x 24" at a scale of 250 yards per 3/4" hex.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: SAMMAXABEZOE
description:
Players take turns rolling dice and placing tiles of their color onto one of the nine squares that comprise a Minor Board. The nine Minor Boards are 3X3 grids that get added one at a time to cover one of the nine squares of a much larger, 3X3 Major Board. A die roll determines which of three symbols the played tile must display. Players score for winning a Minor Board (3 symbols on the board in one of many designated configurations, not merely 3-in-a-row), winning the Under (three Minor Boards of one player's color in a row), and winning the Over (3 won Minor Boards in a row). Play to 18 points or until all Minor Boards are won, in which case most points wins.

—user summary

name: The Real Radio Game
description:
This is an unusual game from Parker Brothers that involved a detailed map of the United States as the game board, lined with letters of the alphabet that were used to make radio call signs.

The game is supposed to begin in the players' home city, at their local station, and a spinner is used to contact other stations. That sounds like a normal race game, and apparently the player who achieves the greatest combined distance wins. However, the game also involves "special pins" and a "measuring device" which are not obvious at all. Multiple copies of the game board have been found with pinholes across their surface.

The game appears as "new" in the 1927 Parker Games catalog, but it has disappeared by 1929.

—user summary

name: Empire Star Battles
description:
In a sub-light combat duel, out-thinking, and out maneuvering your opponent is the task of starship command. Between attack, defense, and movement, careful power management is essential. Your decisions as the starship Captain determine whether the crew lives or perish. Will your race emerge more powerful or vulnerable at the conclusion of the battle? Come and find out….
Empire Star Battles attempts to capture the danger and excitement of starship battles in our own galaxy. Skills, risk, and luck are tested as two or more players manage their starships in ever-changing conditions. Unique advanced movement, energy management, and record keeping make Empire Star Battles the game you hoped for in interstellar space combat.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Wonword
description:
The game can be played competitively or cooperatively. Word cards are laid out in a 4X4 grid in Codenames fashion. Challenge cards come in six types. A player gives clues to his teammates to try to complete a challenge.

Examples of challenges are: use a designated word in the grid in a sentence that describes a targeted word on the challenge card; use an internet meme or emoji to describe a word in the grid; use a simile or metaphor to identify a word in the grid; and draw a sketch or act out a scene that will describe a word in the grid. Discard used grid words and replenish the grid.

Once a team has completed 4,5, or 6 challenge types (depending upon how difficult the players want the game to be), that team attempts a Final Word Duel in which one of the discarded grid words is secretly chosen, and three clues, based on a die roll, are given about the word. The clues will be to state a synonym or antonym of the word or to designate the position of a vowel or consonant in the word. The first team to succeed in the Final Word Duel wins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Finale Ending, Team-Based Game

name: MAVENS
description: Players take turns displaying a card that depicts a work of art. A player chooses one of four words that he thinks best describes the work. The other players guess which of the four words he chose. Match half or more of the other players and put the card in the WIN pile; otherwise, put it in the LOSE pile. Players collectively try to win more often than they lose. Play a chosen number of rounds.

name: Spellbound The New Word Spelling Game
description:
Spellbound The New Word Spelling Game is an exciting word spelling game for word game enthusiasts. There are 86 cards in a deck. 5 vowels each, 3 consonants with the exception of Q and X, which are 2 each. Each card has 1-10 points, with no two copies of the same letter having the same points.

The object is to spell words by building a word one letter at a time. The strategy is to see a word before your opponents do. Each player has options to add a letter, replace a letter, or discard and draw, to set up to spell or complete a word for the win. There is an opening bonus round just to put points on the board. Spellbound The New Word Spelling Game is more of a leisure game. If you have a strong vocabulary this is the game for you. If you like a challenge play Spellbound The New Word Spelling Game!

This game is actually 30 years from creation to completion and packaging. It started with 2 friends kicking ideas around back in 1992. Then we designed it. One friend printed a prototype. The other friend took the idea and made it a dream come true when the prototype was sent for manufacturing. The game was printed and packaged in 2014 for sale. Since then it’s been marketing and playing the game with many friends.

—description from the publisher (adapted)

name: Sunset Limited
description:
Sunset Limited was released as one of six in Milton Bradley's "Radio Series" of inexpensive race games costing 15 cents each. It debuted in the Bradley Games catalog of 1927 and was sold through 1933. A slightly larger but cheaper edition, at 10 cents, appeared in the 1943 catalog.

This is a simple spin and move game in which a player wins by making a round trip, either to or from the "Golden Gate" at the center of the board and back again. The directions start with the following missive:

"Every boy likes trains and engines and hopes some day to have an opportunity to ride in the cab, and perhaps pull the throttle of the great locomotive. In this game of Sunset Limited, each player represents an engineer striving to bring his train safely and "on time" to San Francisco, the City of the Golden Gate."

It is suggested that if two players play, they may each wish to play with two "trains" (counters). If so, they only win by completing the round trip with both trains.

—user summary

name: Radio
description:
Radio was released as one of six in Milton Bradley's "Radio Series" of inexpensive race games costing 15 cents each. It debuted in the Bradley Games catalog of 1927 and was sold through 1933. A slightly larger but cheaper edition, at 10 cents, appeared in the 1943 catalog.

This is NOT the same game as the slightly more complex/expensive "Radio Game" published by Milton Bradley in 1925.

This is a simple spin and move game in which players represent radio announcers moving from station to station across the USA. There is a "blue line" stretching from Bangor, Maine to San Francisco, California, which is the route followed by the first/third player(s). There is also a "red line" stretching from Miami, Florida to San Francisco, which is the route followed by the second/fourth player(s).

—user summary

name: Monopoly: David Bowie
description:
Relive the fame and take things over in a special edition of the fast dealing, property trading game that pays homage to the Thin White Duke! MONOPOLY: David Bowie gathers the ultimate collection of the rock superstar’s greatest records for fans to buy, sell, and trade albums such as The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and The Spiders from Mars. Build Arenas and Stadiums atop Bowie’s discography with six custom sculpted tokens representing memorable studio albums: Major Tom, Black Star, Black Tie White Noise, Aladdin Sane, Diamond Dogs, and Ashes to Ashes. Sound and Vision cards will take you on the musical journey to be the furthest above the moon with any money to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monkey Life
description:
Monkey Life is a fun friendly game made for families, kids and groups ages 7 and up. Experience time in the jungle as a monkey, encountering predators, who will try and steal your bananas, and poachers, who will try and trap you. They are both trying to prevent you from reaching your goal to get 12 Monkey Points. Be the first Monkey to climb to the tree of life, and become King of the Jungle!

Standard & Teams - Play Modes:
Monkey Life is a competitive card game for 2-6 players. In the "Standard" game, each player plays against each other. If you have 4 or 6 players, you may play in "Teams" mode. Either 2 players against 2, 3 against 3, or 3 Teams of 2 players each.

Magnetic 3D Monkey Pawns & Board:
To begin a game, each player will pick one of the six colored Monkey Pawns and place it on the Scoreboard, at the bottom of the tree.


Quick to Learn:
The youngest player randomly selects one of the "Top Banana" cards, to reveal the strongest Banana Color for that Match.

Each player will collect the number of cards indicated in the "Setup" section of the game manual, and then the game will start.

Monkey Life is a strategy card game consisting of Rounds and Matches

The Round will start with the youngest player playing a card from their hand and placing it face up on the table. Play continues in a clockwise direction, with each player playing a card. The Round ends after all of the players have completed their turn.

At the end of each Round, the winner collects the cards. Winning strategies and rules are illustrated in the game manual.

A new Round begins with all players replenishing their cards, and the player that won the previous round will play first.

The game will continue until there are no more cards left in the draw pile, and players have no more cards remaining in their hand. That will end the Match.


How to Win:
At the end of each Match, players will count their points, and move their Monkey Pawns up the tree, to mark their total number of Points.

The first player to gain 12 Monkey Points, over a number of matches, will win the game and be crowned King of the Jungle.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deduction, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Real-Time

name: High Seas Economy
description:
2-5 players play as captains who try to accumulate wealth and avoid losing their ships over sea and land.

The players use gold coins to buy crew and resources that allow them to sail the high seas where they encounter adventures and hazards marked on the map, while also fight or trade with other players.

Players can lose up to 3 ships and the game end when only one captain survived with his ship,

During game play each player in thier turn at sea place a compas to indicate direction of travel and roll 2 dices one indicate speed of travel and the other the sea conditions. Based on the results the player move thidr boat over the hexagon map.

If players ship land over a "JOLLY ROGER" markings they will roll the fate dice and either draw a Hazard or Adventure card that will tell a story and provide or remove crew , resources and gold.

To play at sea each player needs a minimum set of resources otherwise they will be drifting and if not recovered after 4 turns they will lose thier ship. After losing 3 ships players are out of the game.

While traveling at sea players can attack or trade with other players if their ship meet. A black flag ship indicate fighting intention.

While at bay players can trade or buy resources and crew.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Worker Placement

name: PROMISLAND
description: In this game, you will assume the role of a treasure hunter on a cursed island, where your mission is to explore the island, uncover clues, and ultimately locate the treasure chest before your opponents do. In the course of your exploration, you may engage in strategic maneuvers against your opponents, forge alliances with the locals, earn their favor or face their retribution, and avoid the ghosts, which are possibly monsters you created along the way
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Action Queue, Map Reduction, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Snowbound
description:
Assume the role of Sheriff Ambrose King, and see if you can catch a murderer while snowbound at Big Elk Lodge!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Золотой ключик, или Приключения Буратино (The Golden Key, or the Adventures of Buratino)
description:
Золотой ключик ("The Golden Key") is a simple draw-and-move race game for children in "senior preschool," based on the classic Russian children's novel of the same name by Alexei Tolstoy (itself an adaptation of the Italian novel "Pinocchio"). It is a variation on a more common roll-and-move game with the same theme, but this is the only version to feature art by A. Barsukov.

In the game, players are trying to get to the Lightning Theater. On their turn, each player draws a card to see how they will move. The cards are portraits of Buratino and other characters from the book, along with a colored circle and a number. If the card shows a blue circle, the player moves their counter that many spaces forward. If it shows a red circle, they move that many spaces back. If it shows a yellow circle, the players lose a turn.

Similarly, landing on a space with a blue star allows players to hop forward to the next blue-star space. A yellow-star space forces players to lose a turn.

The game includes a three-dimensional toy theater element. At the end of play, the winner is encouraged to set up the three included standees - Buratino, Pierrot, and Malvina - in a little scene in the Lightning Theater.

—user summary

name: Global Warning
description:
Twenty solution cards are dealt evenly among the players. Four problem cards are placed on the board to start the game, and a new one is added at the beginning of every player's turn.

On his turn, a player rolls a die to earn money, draws a solution card, and then resolves one or more problem cards by (i) discarding one or more solution cards that are the same color as the problem card(s) and whose sum of numbers equals or exceeds the sum of the numbers on the problem card(s); and (ii) paying the cost shown on the problem card(s). The resolved problem card(s) are worth victory points to the player.

After every round of turns, advance the Global Warming Index a distance equal to the values on the unresolved problem cards. Play until one player wins by reaching a certain number of victory points based on player count. Everyone loses if, before that happens, the Global Warming Index reaches 75.

name: What Was I Thinking?
description: Each card in a deck has a green side that displays an adjective and a black side with a noun. Orient the deck green-side up, then flip the top card to create a two-word, green-black phrase. Each player writes down a thought that the phrase brings to mind and scores one point for each other player's thought that matches his. Play until an agreed-upon stopping point.

name: Academia: A Game of Administrative Bloat
description:
Academia: A Game of Administrative Bloat is an engine-building, action-management game about running a university that uses a unique action-selection mechanism.

Players are the boards of directors of their universities, choosing the big strategic initiatives from year to year. Each turn represents an academic year in which the player will choose one of four strategic focuses (actions) for their university. When selecting a focus, players choose one of the four offices at their university. Each ready staff member in that office works, triggering its effect. Each focus requires players to exhaust staff, meaning the game is about managing which staff are ready and when, and over the course of play players develop Ph.D. programs, raise endowments, use committees, hire staff, promote individuals, increase the size of the student body, and so on.

Every four years, students will graduate and affect their university's reputation: star athletes improve athletics reputation, high performers academic reputation, and so on. Players then admit new students, and begin again. After three cohorts of students have graduated, players score prestige from reputation, communications efforts, faculty committees, and size/popularity, then the most prestigious university wins.

—description from the designer

name: Village War: The Artefacts
description:
Village War: The Artefacts is a spinoff of Village War and is set in the same fantasy world based on Nigerian mythology.
There is a draw pile on the table, consisting of cards showing different artefacts with different abilities. The game lasts until the draw pile is gone. Whoever drew the last card, loses; of the others, the player with fewest cards in hand, wins.
On a turn, a player can play an artefact from their hand and use its power, discard a card, or draw a card. The artefacts' powers range from forcing others to draw cards, moving cards to other players, etc. The goal is to force someone else to draw the last card while having the least cards in yoyur hands yourself, but not all cards count the same at the end, so a bit of uncertainty remains.

name: MAGIWANDER
description:
When science and magic intersect, an intense battle story begins!
MAGIWANDER is an action game in which players compete in multiple competitions by manipulating coins with a wand; the main attraction of MAGIWANDER is that it extends the experience of magnetism, which acts instantly and produces clear results, and allows players to experience magnetism itself as a magical force for extended periods.
Roll a Magical Coin around on your desk and you will discover that many of the magnetic forces you use in your everyday life are extended in ways you may not have thought possible! You may even discover that it affects the gaming field as well.
We hope you will enjoy your own magical experience with your family and friends.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Party Game, Real-time, Sports

name: I'm Pretty Savvy
description:
I’m Pretty Savvy celebrates creativity, wit, and cleverness! It provides engaging entertainment and encourages you to approach the world with a fresh perspective.

Deliver creative answers to random questions and see how many cards you can answer in 1 minute. Your opponent can quickly get away with incorrect answers if you are not careful. So, pay attention and be ready to challenge impractical or incorrect responses.

—description from the publisher

name: Das Kölner Heinzelmännchenspiel
description:
"Heinzelmännchen" are a mythical race of creatures, appearing in a tale connected with the city of Cologne in Germany akin to gnomes, or elves.
According to a die throw, players move in turn on an abstracted board of Cologne to visit specific spaces (craftsman's workshops). For the first 4 spaces, the earlier they arrive, the fewer points they are rewarded, for the last space, the reward is the other way around and the players are rewarded more points.
If 2 players are in the same quarter of Cologne (a "Veedel"), they must fight by throwing a die who may stay and who must return to his home base.
After the first player arrived at the 5th space, one of 4 cards are drawn to trigger finally the end. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tacopocalypse: A Tactical Bombardment of Queso! Promo Card
description:
A promotional card for the card game Tacopocalypse which adds a "take that" flair to the game.

The card's text says: "When this card is revealed all other players lose one Combo Plate without scoring it."

This promo card was available in Game Trade Magazine # 279.

name: Nab 'Em
description:
Nab 'Em is a quick play card game for 2-5 players. Players secretly add Villains "onto the streets" then attempt to beat out the other heroes and capture them. A game plays in about 15-20 minutes. The rules are simple and easy to learn but challenging enough to keep the game interesting.

—description from the publisher

name: EMPIRE: Famous Monsters
description:
Play against your opponents to win the battle for classic horror supremacy!

In this action-packed game, your mission is to collect the six monsters needed to complete your horrific Empire: Dracula, Frankenstein, King Kong, The Bride, The Mummy, and The Wolf Man.

Be the first to gather your Empire, using action cards to manage your hand while lynching opponents' monsters! The trick is to have one of each monster AND NOTHING ELSE in your hand to win! Plan carefully!

This engaging, fast-paced game is for 2-4 players and takes about 20 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher

name: EMPIRE: Fantasy Quest
description:
Play against your opponents to win the quest for Fantastic supremacy!

In this action-packed game, your mission is to collect the six assets of the Fantasy Empire: an Elf, a Mage, a Dwarf, a Fae, a Castle, and a Dragon.

Be the first to gather the Empire, using action cards to manage your hand while destroying opponents' assets! The trick is to have one of each of the assets AND NOTHING ELSE in your hand to win! Strategize, use your wisdom and guile and ye shall be TRIUMPHANT!

This engaging, fast-paced game is for 2-4 players and takes about 20 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher

name: Admiral Pampero
description:
The figures (ships) may be moved back and forth on the lines from space to space. Crossing spaces can be moved forwards and backwards in all directions, but only to the next space.
At the beginning of the game, each party has to occupy their own ports and those of their colonies with at least one of their own ships. The ports of all states not involved in the game are neutral and may not be stormed by the warring factions, but can be occupied by any faction. The parties set up their remaining ships step by step. When all access lines to an enemy port are closed, it is said to be blocked. If the opponent manages to encircle enemy ships, these encircled ships are also considered captured and are eliminated from the game.
If a party has occupied the 5 nearest spaces in front of an enemy port, the port is considered captured and the ship in the port must be eliminated from the game and the besieging party must occupy the captured port.
A game is over when you manage to occupy at least two-thirds of all your opponent's ports, or when you have taken three quarters of your opponent's ships, or you have surrounded him so that he can no longer move.

—user summary

name: RoadGame
description: Each player moves his road paver around a track according to the throw of a die. According to the color of the space landed on, draw one or more material cards. Most of the spaces are linked with a project or event card. The latter are to be followed, the first may be acquired if the required material components are spent. Drawn cards are replenished. Sometimes, you may trade components with other players. In the end, each project cards and corresponding sets of them are rewarded with victory points.
mechanics: Contracts, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: WaterGame
description: Players take turns moving down a river a distance that equals the roll of a die. Some river spaces cause you to lose water, others to gain it. A player must have at least 10 gallons of water to take his turn; if he is short, he can take water from a community cistern that all players voluntarily contribute to. The player with the most water when all players have reached the end of the river wins. However, if one or more players has/have fewer than 10 gallons of water when the other players have finished, then everyone loses.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Space Is Unforgiving (And So Is This Game)
description:
A space-based cooperative multiplayer experience; a 2-4 player survival game where outrunning a supernova is the prime goal, all while managing food and fuel reserves, maintaining a ship, as well as player health. While doing so; you will encounter hardships from space giraffes to pirates that will work to prevent you from progressing.

You begin with a randomly selected ship, that may or may not have everything you need. You'll work together as a team to determine the best course of action. Do you need more food or fuel? Or is the Supernova right behind you, and you need as much distance as possible? Do you have to leave someone behind in order to save the other three crew members? And who brought onboard the radioactive sugar gliders?!

With plenty of randomized events, each and every turn is full of action and suspense, and no game will be the same! You can expect the average playthrough to be between 45 to 60 minutes in length; that is, assuming you live that long. Space is unforgiving, and so is this game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: Barton in Bloom
description:
In "Barton in Bloom" players play the role of a member of an English village, all vying to become the most prestigious resident. They will do this by buying, planting, growing and harvesting plants, all so that they can help decorate the village cenotaph and have the best kept garden in time for the summer fête.

On a players turn they will use one of the shared worker dice to take one of the actions. This will increase the cost of that worker for all future actions. If actions are taken by the specialised worker they will take an enhanced action.

Rather than taking a normal action with a worker, a player may instead rest the worker gaining a benefit based on it's current cost and resetting it's cost back to 1.

Players will continue taking turns until one player has completely filled their garden using flowers and ornaments. At this point the players' gardens will be judged against a set of judge cards played throughout the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Contracts, Different Dice Movement, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Tile Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Forsaken: Dante's inferno
description:
Plunge into a unique horror racing game set in Dante's Inferno that will keep you on the edge of your seat! With 20 beautifully sculpted miniatures representing historically infamous characters, a 3D board to manipulate, and spooky and terrifying baroque artwork, this semi-cooperative game will make you question what you would be willing to do to escape hell.

In Forsaken, the objective of the game is to escape from hell with the highest amount of FAITH (victory points) earned from benevolent acts, such as helping the player in last place. However, players can also choose to continue committing misdeeds and earning SIN (negative victory points) to reach the exit faster. Special milestones await players who risk earning SIN to advance ahead of the others.

At the start of the game, players will each receive a diary. Inside, you will have to create a tableau of cards to plan your day in hell. By adding these cards, you will establish your current and upcoming actions. When each day comes to an end, turn the page of your diary, and witness new actions unfold right before your eyes, leading to a fresh turn/day.

The main actions are:

Movement (clockwise or counterclockwise), triggering events, traps, or milestones.
Drawing: Stack cards on the right page of your agenda for when you turn the page.
Help: Assist the last player on the board, helping them, and gain FAITH (VP).
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Novel-based, Racing
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Hand Management, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Programmed Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Thistleden
description:
Guide the animal folk of the forest from their humble beginnings in the village of Thistleden as they explore new lands, develop tools and abilities, and ward off predators and dangers in this civilization-building game for 1-5 players.

Each player has a 3x3 card tableau representing their Den. During the planning phase, each player chooses a Denizen card in secret to add to their Den. Then all cards are revealed, and players place their Denizens cards in their grid, and activate all the cards in that row or column, each of which grants actions based on its type: Harvesters, Builders, Scientists, and Explorers.

At the end of the round, if the row is full, the player discards two of the cards from their active row (keeping only the one they played). Discarded cards are placed in their Legacy tableau, and adding strength to future actions as their civilization grows in age and knowledge.
Players compete to explore new areas, build new Dens, research new technology, attract helpful Denizens and Leaders, and to defend Thistleden from threats.

-description from developer

name: Kamigami Battles: St. Valentine
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

St. Valentine is promo card # KBP-002

Act: Shuffle a Warrior in the Netherworld into the Warrior Deck.
Act: 1 Energy: Change the Chaining Color of the last Warrior played to a color of your choice.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kamigami Battles: Cupid
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

Cupid is promo card # KBP-003

React: Defense 2. Choose an Attacker and put it in your Discard Pile.

Includes randomizer, card separator, and 5 copies.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kamigami Battles: St. Patrick
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

St. Patrick is promo card # KBP-004

Act: 1 Energy: Banish a Disciple II in any Discard Pile.
Act: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, put one into your hand, and Banish the other.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kamigami Battles: Jeanne D'Arc
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

Jeanne D'Arc is promo card # KBP-005

React: 1 Energy: If a Warrior is banished, put it in its owner's discard pile or the bottom of the Warrior Deck if there is no owner.
Act: Put a Disciple III on top of your deck from your Discard Pile.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket – Starter Set 1
description:
ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket turns the popular zodiac cursed family into a strategic tile placement game. Comprise your team with various members of the Soma family who have been possessed by the Japanese Zodiac animals and take family rivalry to a whole new level!

Players can capture tiles thought compatibility matches or battles. The first to collect 12 zodiac animals to join their banquet wins the game. To achieve this, players will place their tiles down in combination with actions and battles.

This ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket 1st Edition comes with a ton of components and limited run Kickstarter items! The tiles and other components feature the fantastic artwork of the Fruits Basket animated series!

Each Set has everything you need to start playing right out of the box. There are 2 decks in a Starter Set for a total of 6 Soma family members per Set. Players strategize to obtain points through battle or by mending family relationships and matching everyone's compatibility with one another. Earning enough points will break the curse of the Japanese Zodiac and allow members to finally become free.

Keep adding to the collection with Zu Tile Slabs, which are found in ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket – Booster Pack! Each starter set comes with one booster pack.

Starter Set 1 consists of the Rabbit, Boar, Ram, Dog, Horse, and Tiger tiles.

Starter Set 2 consists of the Dragon, Snake, Rooster, Rat, Ox, and Monkey tiles.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket – Starter Set 2
description:
ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket turns the popular zodiac cursed family into a strategic tile placement game. Comprise your team with various members of the Soma family who have been possessed by the Japanese Zodiac animals and take family rivalry to a whole new level!

Players can capture tiles thought compatibility matches or battles. The first to collect 12 zodiac animals to join their banquet wins the game. To achieve this, players will place their tiles down in combination with actions and battles.

This ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket 1st Edition comes with a ton of components and limited run Kickstarter items! The tiles and other components feature the fantastic artwork of the Fruits Basket animated series!

Each Set has everything you need to start playing right out of the box. There are 2 decks in a Starter Set for a total of 6 Soma family members per Set. Players strategize to obtain points through battle or by mending family relationships and matching everyone's compatibility with one another. Earning enough points will break the curse of the Japanese Zodiac and allow members to finally become free.

Keep adding to the collection with Zu Tile Slabs, which are found in ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket – Booster Pack! Each starter set comes with one booster pack.

Starter Set 1 consists of the Rabbit, Boar, Ram, Dog, Horse, and Tiger tiles.

Starter Set 2 consists of the Dragon, Snake, Rooster, Rat, Ox, and Monkey tiles.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket – Cat Beast Promo
description:
This Cat Beast Promo was released to Japanime Games patreon.

Str 6 Int 1
Place Cat Beast on any CAT. Gain control of the CAT. As an A, Cat Beast can move up to 2 empty spaces. After the current player's next 2 turns, discard Cat Beast and return control of the CAT to its previous controller.

Promo THD-FB1e1p
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Puzzle
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: ZU Tiles: Fruits Basket – Booster Pack
description: Keep adding to the collection with Zu Tile Slabs, which are found in booster packs! Each slab features extended art tiles, foils, alternate arts and more that can be collected or punched out and used in game. There are 5 random slabs per booster pack and 12 booster packs in a booster box.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Puzzle
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Cowbell Card Game
description:
For 2 to 4 players, ages 7-107, Cowbell is an easy to learn, fast-paced card game made up of cow characters in four different scenes. The object of the game is to be the first player to go out, but you can't go out without the Cowbell - and there's only ONE Cowbell Card in the deck. You must have this card in order to play your last card and win the game, so everyone is trying to get their hands on the Cowbell Card and then go out of the game while they have it. Players can steal the Cowbell from each other and the Cowbell can be rotated into or away from your hand depending on action cards played during a round.

The 57-card deck is made up of crazy cow characters like Cowabunga, Holy Cow, Cow Poke, Mad Cow and more! Action cards include the Horseshoe Magnet, Don't Have a Cow, Cow Tippin', Milk It and Beef It Up - all with different actions that keep things mooooooooving right along!

Games can last anywhere from 2 minutes to 10 minutes - simply deal 7 cards to each player to start the game and take turns discarding matching scenes, characters, magnets or wild cards. Get the Cowbell and try to go out before someone steals it from you. If you don't have a play, draw until you do...it's sheer cow madness!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Drawing, Matching, Move Through Deck, Pattern Recognition

name: Hazard Miner
description:
Embark on an extraordinary odyssey as a humble coal miner entrusted with the perilous mission to delve into the depths of the ancient Hazard Cave, where treacherous dangers and boundless treasures intertwine. With unwavering determination, carve three mineshafts in pursuit of hidden gold, defying the fate that has befallen countless others. Your quest is to emerge triumphant, laden with the greatest riches ever unearthed, and etch your name as the revered Hazard Miner.

Each turn you will take a set of three actions: Draw a new card, Place a card in a mineshaft, or collect gold from the a mineshaft. You must balance the risk of hazard cards with the reward of mining for more gold.

The game ends either when the mineshafts are completely full of cards or the player has collected 6 times. You will then rank the amount of gold you have collected against the other miners scores to see where you rank on your quest to become the hazard miner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Pieces as Map, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Malédiction de Bastet
description:
November 1970, an auction of Egyptian antiquities brings together the cream of the art world, in a hotel in the Swiss Alps.

The centerpiece: a statuette of the goddess Bastet.

But the day before the sale, everything rushes. A snowstorm prevents all communication with the outside world, a jazz concert takes an unexpected turn, tensions arise, not to mention the threat of an ancestral curse.

In the atmosphere of a luxury hotel, you will go in search of evidence. Thanks to a wallet of Swiss francs, you can buy certain information (staff testimonials, translation of certain documents, access to certain rooms or documents of the hotel), and even search the rooms of suspects!

During your investigation, you will have to solve puzzles and decrypt coded messages in collaborative mode to access additional clues.

This will allow many interactions between the players and will spice up the evening even more because the culprit will have to discreetly defeat this mission, without being unmasked.

Contents:
6 character booklets including press articles, map of the hotel, tickets, biography, agenda, advice and tips, etc...

1 organization booklet including:
- a notice & advice section
- an outcome and solution part
30 large-format cards (testimonials, clues, search of the hotel, chapters of history)

1 guide for the perfect investigator

1 mini Art'cheo magazine

Access to the collaborative mission section on our website.

-translated from Kickstarter campaign

---

Novembre 1970, une vente aux enchères d'antiquités égyptiennes réunit tout le gratin du monde de l'art, dans un hôtel des Alpes suisses.

La pièce maîtresse : une statuette de le déesse Bastet.

Mais la veille de la vente, tout se précipite. Une tempête de neige empêche toute communication avec l'extérieur, un concert de jazz prend une tournure inattendue, des tensions se dessinent, sans oublier la menace d'une malédiction ancestrale.

Dans La Malédiction de Bastet, tous les invités sont suspects mais leur identité est confidentielle.

Vous incarnerez des personnages venus des 4 coins du monde.

Un homme, britannique et élégant

Un femme, franco-égyptienne et romancière

Un homme, égyptien et ambitieux

Une femme, suisse et émotive

Un homme, suisse et opportuniste

Une femme, égyptienne, froide et hautaine
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Events, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Rainbow Dragons
description:
How are Rainbows made?? Magical dragons race across sky chasing storms and leaving rainbows in their trail.

Rainbow Dragons is a fun set collection game with 6 color dice that is great for kids but has the strategic depth for adults too.

The game plays 3-6 players, setup is fast, games are quick, easy to learn and makes a great filler game at 25-45 minutes.

On your turn you roll a single rainbow die. It will show one of 6 colors that you can collect and create sets. If you like the die you put it down on your score card.

Otherwise you can offer the die to another player. If they say yes then you give them the die and they add it to their score card. After they accept your die you then roll 2 dice. You can now add those dice to your card or trade them for even more dice.

Players have to use strategy to know when to offer a die, when to say yes and when to say no. If a player says no the die goes back to the dice pool and it is lost to the player who rolled it. A player can continue to roll dice as long as the other players are willing to trade.

Once on your turn you can turn in a set of dice for points. You will get more points for higher sets of dice with the largest reward going to a complete rainbow (1 die of each of the colors). Your score is impacted by your neighbors dice so you are always watching what the other dragons are doing.

When you turn in a set you advance your marker down the scoring track towards the win. First player to the end wins the game immediately. The game also ends with the 3 rainbow or when there are no more dice when a player needs to roll. At this point the player with the most points wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scrambled Word Game
description:
A Boggle-like game made for a classroom setting. Large letter cards are placed in a pocket chart that can be hung on a well, placed in a 3x3 or 4x4 grid. Students then write as many words as they can see in the grid. Each word must start with one letter and then use adjacent letters in sequence, not using any letter card twice in the same word.

—user summary

name: ABC / Animal Bird Fish Mini Card Games
description: This is a set of two Ed-U-Cards games -- A B C Mini Cards, and Animal Bird Fish Mini Card Game -- in a single plastic carrying case. They both use miniature cards, 57 x 40 mm (2 1/4" x 1 9/16").
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Number, Word Game

name: Neón y Acero: Sombras de Ankar
description: Expansion for Neón y Acero, from NB Games. Introduces 63 new cards, with 3 hero cards, 40 resources cards, 10 exploration cards and 10 unique cards. Also, lets play games of four players with a single copy of the game.

name: Quiz Battle
description:
Minimum of three players-one quizmaster and two players to answer the questions.

The quizmaster draws from the pile and rolls the dice to select which question will be answered.

Then the quizmaster reads out the appropriate question fro the teams to buzz in and answer.

Once the number of pre-agreed questions have been asked, the cards are tallied. The player(s) with the most cards wins

Includes 240 challenging questions on the arts, history, tv & film, food, celebrities, general knowledge.

name: Ridley's Games Room: General Knowledge
description:
Take turns asking each other general knowledge questions. Each correct answer is worth 1 point. First player/team to 20 points wins.

Includes: 140 cards, rules

name: Factory 42: Specialists & Golems
description:
The Factory 42: Specialists and Golems Expansion will introduce five new elements.


Specialists - In a community where everyone is equal, the Specialists are just a bit more equal. Due to their extraordinary skills, they don’t have to wait in line, nor are they subject to the arbitrary rulings of the Commissariat. They are the crème de la crème of all the workers of Odrixia.



Cargadors - These massive metal golems operate tirelessly to serve and improve the community. They are excellent at any work to which they’re assigned but cannot deviate from a given task without supervision. Every Odrixian citizen is proud of their Cargador which is widely acknowledged as the best that technology can offer.



Patriot Box - Every good citizen knows that informing the Commissariat of illegal activity is encouraged and such diligence is rewarded with food.



Calendar Clerk - What the clerk gives the clerk can take away. The Calendar Clerk meddles with the Event cards.



And the sixth player, complete with meeples (in stylish silver) and all required components. A sixth player makes the competition even tenser and forces players to think of alternative ways to achieve their goals since some locations will now be full quite early in the placement phase.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Cube Tower, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: Forest Guardians: Island Expansion
description:
Island Expansion pack. This expansion features a full 68x40 cm (27x16 in) game board that depicts the island of Taiwan. With this expansion, players can complete the panorama as the game goes on.

The board maps out some of the most important parts of the Taiwanese landscape: the Central Mountain Range, Huadong Valley, and Chianan Plain. Players can place terrain tiles following the original natural wonders' locations, or create a new version of the island on their own.

Aside from the game board, the Island Expansion pack adds in new animal species and real-life disaster situations for players to contend with. Players will also face the notorious typhoon disaster or East Asia.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Map Addition, Matching, Multi-Use Cards, Physical Removal, Pick-up and Deliver, Pieces as Map, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: #TalkItOut
description: A conversation game that plays a bit like Uno, with cards which cause reversals in order of play and other surprises. The first player to get rid of their cards wins.

name: 490 Cards
description:
Prepare for a gaming experience like no other with 490 Cards! Combining dice, cards, and coins, this innovative game challenges players to forgive their debts and drive them down to zero.

In this exciting world, each player starts with 490 debts-to-forgive ("D2F"). The objective? Be the first to reduce your debts to zero and claim victory. Utilize dice rolls, multiplication factors, and strategic decisions to decrease your D2F or increase your opponents'. To simplify calculations, we've designed the 490 Cards® Scoreboard, a free app available this fall on your favorite app store.

The comprehensive 490 Cards Starter Kit provides everything you need to dive into the game.
