With 252 cards, including Inventory cards, Doubters and Disciples Domain (D3) cards, Grace cards, Grudge cards, and more, the kit ensures a varied and immersive gameplay experience. Eight dice of different types, including the custom 12-sided block dice, add further depth to your strategies.

But that's not all! The Starter Kit also includes 12 Compel Coins, allowing you to influence other players' actions and introducing additional layers of strategy. With the Simple Start Card, Comprehensive Rules Booklet, Scorepad, and Rigid and Tuck Boxes included, you'll have everything you need to enhance your game night.

Additionally, 490 Cards is not just a standalone game. It's a TCG/CCG with a booster box containing 36 packs of 12 cards. Collectors can amass the full 490 cards associated with the Alpha Instantiation release. The Full Series I boasts an impressive 1200 cards, with subsequent releases, Beta Invasion and Gamma Illumination, expanding the possibilities and rounding out Series I.

490 Cards. It's All About Forgiveness... No Trivia. The Possibilities are Endless. & There's a card for that...

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Educational, Humor
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Demon Ship: Survivor 01 – Witty
description:
Unfortunately for Witty, this isn’t the first time that she’s had to crush demons with her bare hands, but unfortunately for the demonic forces on board, she has a pulse blaster and combat mace this time around. A Warrant Officer on the ship Hades Hold, Witty made herself useful in many areas particularly in communications, fitness training and combat exercises. Her competitiveness, physical prowess and strength allowed her to show up many others on board in tests of skill, but she always maintained strong bonds and cared for those around her. Inspiring a community of like minded individuals who encourage and lift each other up, Witty found herself in a position of a leader of sorts for many on board, just by being herself. When the incursion happened, it was a terrible familiar feeling. Witty didn’t hesitate to rush into the depths of the ship to see if she could save anyone, and brutalize any creatures along the way.

In this official Demon Ship expansion pack you will receive:

1 resin printed Witty Survivor
1 Base
Fun rules to use her in your games of Demon Ship!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Demon Ship: Survivor 02 – Malev
description:
He's here to sneak around the ship!

In this official Demon Ship expansion pack you will receive:

1 resin printed Malev Survivor
1 Base
Fun rules to use him in your games of Demon Ship!

name: Battlecards Royale
description:
Experience the thrill of Battle Royale with this card game. Be the last player alive, eliminating the rest of the players that you will find on the map. To do this, players will have to explore places and equip themselves with weapons, equipment and accessories on a map that will reduce its exploration area during the course of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Map Reduction, Player Elimination

name: Solar Fleet Skirmish
description:
Solar Fleet Skirmish is a simple ruleset to get you playing a fleet-based spaceship skirmish game in a matter of minutes. While the rules are quite simple, they allow for a surprising amount of depth and replayability.

For fans of Star Trek, Battlefleet Gothic, Battlestar Galactica, or any kind of naval fleet game.

SFS allows you to develop a fleet with matched play of a variety of ship types, armed with various weapons, armour, and equipment.

SFS also includes several scenarios to get you playing right away!

-description from publisher's website

name: Sabretache Napoleonics: A Game of Generalship and Tactics for the Napoleonic Wars
description: Command & control dominated rules for Corps level and above games. The units are the traditional ones- infantry battalion, cavalry regiment and artillery battery- but they are controlled in brigade groups by orders given with a few keywords. These are factored into a Tactical Engagement Chart that determines the type of engagement and frees the player from low level tactical decisions, allowing him to concentrate on the overall strategy.

name: Defend Megatropolis
description:
"CALLING ALL HEROES!...Calling all heroes!"

Defend Megatropolis is a Solo (single player) ‘City Defense’ card game, with action selection and hand management.

In Defend Megatropolis, you will move your superhero around the city discarding Power Cards to defeat Threats, all while trying to foil the Villain and his Doom Device, the DoomBot! You win if you locate the Villain and defeat them! You lose if there are 4 DoomBot cards out on the playing area at the beginning of your turn OR a Location is destroyed. Careful! This will be no easy task and the Villain is sure to have a Plot Twist or two when you think you are close to bringing them to justice. Heed the call, and Defend Megatropolis!

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Run Me
description:
RUN ME is a fast-paced, strategic card game that is based on the popular rummy gameplay format, with a unique Linux command theme. It is played with a custom deck of 54 cards. The objective of the game is to win by forming valid combinations of cards.

The game's core cards are 20 command cards that represent Linux terminal commands. The 18 Option cards add more options to the game, and the 12 Path cards provide different ways for players to complete their combinations. The four Special cards increase the game's complexity.

The gameplay of RUN ME is simple, yet challenging. Each player is dealt five cards, and the remaining cards are placed face down to form a draw pile. Players take turns to draw one card from the draw pile and either discard a card from their hand and play a valid combination of cards. The game develops as players strategically discard or keep cards in hand, making calculations based on the cards they have, as well as the ones they still need to form a valid combination. It’s perfect for Linux enthusiasts and rummy fans alike.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: 2000 km Auto-Rennfahrt durch Deutschland
description:
The players take turns to spinn and move. The Race starts and ends in Baden-Baden. The distance between cities on the track is 40 km. The red numbers on the spinner determine the speed of the cars, while black numbers show the time needed for repair and maintenance. The white half-ring around the spinner with the green spaces symbolizes repair stations A und B. If a player gets on a black space (city), he puts a second meeple on space A or B. and move the second meeple (according to the black numbers on the spinner) to space 12 before he may move his firs meeple (racing car) further.
The first player to complete the round course and arrives back in Baden-Baden wins the game.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: PARTYtur
description:
Assume that you are musicians in an orchestra. The conductor takes his place at the stand right before the rehearsal starts. You wait with slight trepidation: This rehearsal will decide, who is going to win the golden PARTYtur - a special price, handed out to one of extraordinary knowledge about orchestras in general, the Neue Philharmonie Westfalen (NPW), composers and symphonies. Every section is convinced to win the price. The race is on!

The board does show a track with different categories all around symphonical music, composers and instruments. Some categories require you to play an appropriate track of the enclosed CD (or streamed via a QR-code). You might need to identify the instrument you hear playing or answer questions on the piece you heard. The knowledge category tests your musical knowledge and the conductor category sees you conducting an appropriate beat. You advance 1-3 fields if you answer or solve your task correctly.

First player making it to the finish wins the golden PARTYtur.

In a solo game you play against the conductor and need to reach the finish before the conductor finishes the rehearsal (measured by metronome tokens)

name: Company of Heroes: Captured Panther Pack
description: Gives each faction the chance to play with a commander that allows for: vehicles to be harder to destroy; a couple of vehicles to be spawned in for free; Panthers to be deployed, which are heavily armored vehicles that can spot camouflage and effectively fight both infantry and other vehicles; and for the Panther as well as units adjacent to it to move faster.

name: Pit Bash
description:
You are a Pit Boss controlling blindfolded gladiators in a foul corner of the post-apocalyptic future. Your half naked, armour clad and masked fighters will blunder about in an attempt to kill or be killed. All the while avoiding the vicious mutant pit beast!! For two-four players. In two player mode players can control one or two fighters. At the start of each round you will roll dice for attack, defend and hear your opponents. Avoid your enemies when you know yo can’t attack them this round, try to position yourself for a strike, collect special skills, weapons and surprises, avoid traps and barriers, and use every trick to win the life of your fighters for one more day. Comes with miniatures, traps, a unique pit beast dice, tokens, fighter and gear cards and a 3D resin game board!!

—description from the designer
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

name: Le Millionnaire
description:
The object of the game is to raise money:

by buying securities, to benefit from the advantages they provide (dividends, bonuses, etc.)
by drawing certain "instruction cards"
by playing horse racing and roulette


The winner is the first player who manages to total one million francs, or who has the most money, his opponents having gone bankrupt.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Events, Investment, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Space Odyssey: Journey Home
description:
In the year 2350, humanity's exploration fleet finds itself stranded in an inhospitable and alien galaxy, far from home. As the commander of this stranded fleet, you stand at the edge of a wormhole that, if piloted correctly, can bring you back to Earth's solar system. However, navigating this wormhole is no easy task, as it is fraught with peril and unforeseen challenges. Only the most courageous and strategic commanders will be able to steer their spaceships through the wormhole and lead their crews back home. Are you prepared to prove your commanding skills and seize the opportunity to return home?

Your fleet comprises substantial motherships representing Earth, the Moon, and Mars, along with smaller companion spaceships. Your objective is to chart a course through the wormhole, aiming to land on a planet or dock at a space station within our home solar system. But beware, a cosmic storm looms, and once all spaceships have ventured into the wormhole, any that remain unlanded, undocked, or outside the safe zone will face destruction.

Can you rise to the challenge, emerge triumphant, and become the commander with the highest glory?

At the start of the game, you have the option to choose between a short, a normal, or a legendary game, which determines the number of missions you will play.

At the beginning of each mission, one starting condition card, one special rule card, and one victory point card are drawn. The starting condition card indicates the composition of your fleet for the upcoming mission, specifying which ships and how many are available to you. The special rule card modifies the game mechanics in a specific way. The victory point card determines the glory point values assigned to different types of ships.

During your turn, you select one of your ships (represented by discs) and flick it, aiming to successfully land the ship in a valid location.

The mission concludes once every player has played all of their ships (flicked all discs). At the end of a mission, each player tallies their glory points. The player with the highest glory points emerges as the winner of that mission. After completing a number of missions equal to the specified requirement for the chosen game mode (best of 3, best of 5, or best of 10), the player who has accumulated enough victories to secure an insurmountable lead becomes the ultimate commander and wins the game.

–description from designer

name: Mombatuk The Adventurer
description:
Mombatuk The Adventurer, Journey Into The Underworld Of Borneo’s Folklore is a roll and write game.

Journey into the underworld of the Island of Borneo’s folklore as you play as a fictional character called Mombatuk. Mombatuk the unwilling hero must travel into the depths of hell to rescue his beloved from the clutches of the Evil “Pulan” ruler of the underworld. In this adventure, takes the player through the first level out of seven levels of the underworld. Fight, find items and survive the first level and beat the big baddie at the end (the gate keeper).

—description from the designer

Official link to game
https://thekealf.itch.io/mombatuk-the-adventurer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fire Rescue Mages
description:
The capital of Avalon is currently at the center of Fire Magic discovery. Mages from all over the land come to the capital to learn about Fire Magic and find new ways of spell casting in the Burning Tower of Avalon. As such, there are many disasters caused primarily by novices practicing their spell casting. To remedy this situation, an experienced group of mages known as "FIRE RESCUE MAGES" was formed by the Council of High Magic. Their role is to combat these accidental fires and rescue anyone trapped within the fiery tower.

Your task as a Fire Rescue Mage is to: Enter the burning tower, Rescue all trapped mages (Victims), and Lead them out of the tower safely. Unfortunately, fire creatures are very attracted to magical fires and can even be summoned by accident, so you will need to be cautious and prepared to combat these creatures while keeping your survivors safe.

—description from the designer

Official link to game
https://thekealf.itch.io/fire-rescue-mages
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Last Full Measure: The Battles of Kernstown
description:
The Battle of First Kernstown, March 23rd 1862.

Jackson moves against a force he supposes he outnumbers and is defeated at Kernstown. The defeat causes the US to not pull forces from the Valley to reinforce McClellan at Richmond, so, in the end, it's a strategic victory for the Confederacy.

On July 24th 1864, Early on his way to Winchester meets Crook's Army of West Virginia at Kernstown, defeats him, and the Federals retreat across the Potomac as Early launches his raid to Chambersburg PA.

Both battles use simple victory-points for elimination to determine who wins.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game system of battles of the American Civil War. Kernstown is the twelfth battle in the system.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to its size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and tables; Eliminated Units card, 2 Order of Arrival cards, 307 2-sided counters, and a Battle/Scenario booklet.

Kernstown's Battle Book includes Set-ups for both the 1862 and 1864 battles.

The map measures 18" x 23" at a scale of 250 yards per 3/4" hex.

-description from designer
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Time Track, Zone of Control

name: Marble-Pong
description:
Marble-Pong is played by two players, each sitting at the opposing end of a table. Each player has a container with and incline, which contains space for 10 marbles. Players take turns trying to shoot marbles into their opponent's container. First one to fill all 10 spaces in their opponent's container, wins the game.

It is possible to play with teams.

name: SlideCore 6
description:
SlideCore 6 is an abstract strategy game for 2 players of at least 8 years of age, with an average playing time of 30 minutes, where players try to form the biggest group comprising of discs of their colour. It is played on a hexagonal board, consisting of 91 spots, 6 on each side. Players place discs of both colours on the board, while keeping in mind the Core.

—description from the designer

name: El Lavarropas: Modo Desafío
description: Challenge mode for El Lavarropas, delivered in the May 2023 Ludoty Box.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Memory

name: Library of Jakkarth
description:
Library of Jakkarth is a magical dungeon crawler labyrinth adventure for two to five players. You take on the role of Spellcasters who venture into the dark halls of the library and search the numerous rooms for rare spells and mysterious items. Your goal: find 5 magic keys of the same kind and be the first to use them to open the gate and win the game!

During your turn, you can perform up to 3 actions. The fundamental action is movement. Throw two dice and walk up up to as many fields as you rolled. When you reach the edge of a room, reveal the next room card and place it adjacent to yours. In each room you'll find bookshelves - when standing next to one, perform the loot action and draw up to two cards from the pile. You can loot not only the aforementioned keys, but also spells, instant spells and different magical relics.
Another basic action is casting spells: play one of your spell cards and perform its effect. There's a wide variety of spells. You can for example steal 2 cards from other players, teleport to a specific room, switch places with other game pieces or create fire in a room of your choosing. Other minor actions include equipping a relic card for a permanent buff or manipulating an obstacle in the nearby labyrinth.

But not only the other adventurers will use magic to obstruct your quest and try to win the game before you. The library itself is protected by something ancient - the guardians. Once their room cards are unveiled, they will focus and you and hunt you down. The more you discover the library, the more numerous and powerful they become. For each active guardian in the game, they gain an additional die for their walk actions. So, run away, use spells and obstacles to slow them down or shift their focus to your competitors.

The game ends when one of you manages to escape the library by opening the gate of knowledge with the five keys required. Or, the guardians catch all of you and trap you in the labyrinth for all eternity.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Professor Brainstorm Word Challenge Card Game
description:
A collectible card game where the players combat each other with words.

Each card has a letter, point value, ability, illustration of the being it represents, and attributes that influence its strengths and vulnerabilities. Blue-backed cards are consonants, and orange-backed cards are vowels and effects.

Each player starts with a deck of 50+ cards with no more than 3 copies of any card; it's recommended they have at least 20 orange cards and 30 blue cards. Players shuffle the blue and orange decks separately, play 5 blue cards and 3 orange cards to the table, keeping 3 orange cards in their hand.

The roles of Effector and Protector alternate each round. The players lay out a word from their cards, Protector first, and then attack the opponent's cards with their cards, Effector first. Then each player adds the points of their surviving cards to their total. The first player to 50 points wins.

The setting for the game is the World of Aura, and each card represents (in addition to a letter) a character from one of Aura's four kingdom/continents:

Terra: Earth-like creatures
Dragonia: Dragons
Hydra: Sea creatures
Industria: Robots


—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Word Game

name: Professor Brainstorm Equation Invasion Card Game
description:
A collectible card game where the players combat each other with mathematical equations.

Each card has a digit or operation, its point value, ability, illustration of the being it represents, and attributes that influence its strengths and vulnerabilities. Blue-backed cards are the digits 2-9, and orange-backed cards are the digits 0 and 1, and arithmetic operators (+-x÷).

Each player starts with a deck of 50+ cards with no more than 3 copies of any card; it's recommended they have at least 20 orange cards and 30 blue cards. Players shuffle the blue and orange decks separately, play 5 blue cards and 3 orange cards to the table, keeping 3 orange cards in their hand.

The roles of Effector and Protector alternate each round. The players lay out an equation from their cards, Protector first, and then attack the opponent's cards with their cards, Effector first. Then each player adds the points of their surviving cards to their total. The first player to 50 points wins.

The setting for the game is the World of Aura, and each card represents (in addition to a letter) a character from one of Aura's four kingdom/continents:

Terra: Earth-like creatures
Dragonia: Dragons
Hydra: Sea creatures
Industria: Robots
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Math

name: Happy Doggo
description:
Happy Doggo is a (typically) 2-4 player game of chaotic point collection! Pick your Doggo's and use your cards and abilities to bury as much treasure in your yard as you can before it's all gone! House rules are encouraged!

At the start of the game, each player will pick their favorite Dog character card to represent them and draw 3 cards from their deck, which is split up from the main deck included between each player. Each Dog has a once per game power they can use to get an advantage. Each turn, you will either play a card OR do what's called a Tug of War to try and steal other players cards. On your turn you may also use your Dogs power as well as playing a card or initiating a Tug of War.

There are 2 kinds of Action cards, red and blue cards. Blue cards represent positive Paw points and will always be played in your own Yard (the space in front of each player is a yard) while red cards will always be played in opponents yards.

Each card does something, so when played, resolve it's action and then pass the turn or use your Dog power. When, if for any reason, there are two copies of a card in someones' yard, resolve the card if it's being effect is being used, then immediately Bury the cards by flipping them over and putting them under your Dog card. At the end of each turn, you draw back up to 3 cards.

Tug of War's are done by picking a face up card in another players yard and saying you want to Tug of War for it, which means that the challenging player and the opposing player both reveal the bottom of their decks and compare who has the higher number. The highest number wins and whoever wins gets the card and the effect of the card is used again.

When a player can't draw a card, the game ends and each player counts up their points to see who is the winner!

-description from publisher'
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Party Game

name: Bob-o-link and His Friends
description:
This is a simple "quizzing" game for children that includes 24 pairs of cards, each highlighting a different bird, such as the Scarlet Tanager or common Crow. One card lists simple questions in black text, relating to the physical characteristics or habits of the bird, while the other lists answers in red text.

The game seems to have been sold by Parker Brothers from 1897 to 1903.

name: The Game of Brer Rabbit
description:
This is a simple children's card game played along the same principles as "Old Maid." It includes 19 pairs of cards, each featuring a character from Joel Chandler Harris' Uncle Remus stories - Brer Fox, Brer B'ar, Brer Buzzard, Brer Gater, Brer Tarrypin, and so on — as well as a single Brer Rabbit card (the equivalent of the Old Maid).

The cards' modern appeal lies primarily in the beautifully lithographed color illustrations.

This NOT the same game as Roberts Brothers' 1910 game of the same name. However, Parker sold this game simultaneously under two titles at different price points/quality levels: "The Game of Brer Rabbit" for 30 cents, and (starting in 1901) "The Game of Uncle Remus" for 25 cents.

—user summary

name: Harry Potter: Seek the Deathly Hallows
description:
One player is the searcher. They leave the room, and the other players hide their Deathly Hallows cards somewhere in the room.

The searcher now has to find those cards. The other players take turns to give hints about the location of the Deathly Hallows. The type of hint they can give, is determined by the top card of the hint card deck.

When the searcher finds one of the Deathly Hallows during a player's turn, that player is eliminated. When just one player is left to give hints, the searcher must find the last Hallow within the next 8 hints. If they do, both the searcher and the other remaining player win the game. If they don't, it's a draw
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blitz Bag
description:
A diceless miniature battle game. Use color and a deck of cards to battle. Compare colors to deal with damage and use the deck to help out with figuring out rules.
The colors go into a bag and your deck build and battle.

Players draw a card and then collect colors.
Afterwards, they perform a main action then a free action

Most of the time players chose to attack.
Play a card and it will tell you how many colors you pick from the bag. Then compare colors to deal damage and resolve cards and damage

The game ends after 6 rounds.
Whoever kills the most models or scores the most points wins.

It's a small miniature scrimmage battle.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cube Tower, Hexagon Grid

name: Evocabulary
description:
Evocabulary is a word and engine building game where building an efficient engine is more important than having a large vocabulary.

Players will take turns to create words from a hand of cards, activating the "team" responsible for working with a word of that length, allowing them to draw cards, gain points, recruit new team members and more.

On future turns a player can modify the word by adding, removing and rearranging letters to activate the same or a different team.

Once all the letter cards have been drawn, and no player can create any new words, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

-description from designer

name: Goat on a Boat
description:
Introducing Goat on a Boat, the rhyming charades game with the ever-so-slightly-strange sounding name. Inside this box, you’ll come across all sorts of weird and wonderful rhyming charades.

From “Moby Dick using his selfie stick” to “Angelina Jolie eating ravioli”, “King Kong playing ping pong” to “Bob Marley riding a harley”.

Your job is to describe these rhymes to your team by either acting them out, reading a riddle or explaining them without using any of the words on the card. Each round, you’ll have 30 seconds. Get your team to successfully shout out three rhymes and you’ll get to hunt for one of the matching rhyming pairs which lie face-down on the table. At the end of the game, the team that uncovers the most matching pairs, wins!

So if you’re looking to mix-up the traditional family games night and watch your grandpa mime out ‘Frankenstein drinking a bottle of wine’, then this might be the game for you. Although, just a reminder: this is a game about shouting out all sorts of strange rhymes... so you might want to give the neighbours a heads-up first.

name: Omicron Protocol: Critical Condition – Extra Card Pack
description:
1 new scenario, 2 new Forage Cards (2 copies each), and 1 Solo/Coop "Extraordinary Tactic" card for the CyMS! Add more replayability to your game with this Kickstarter exclusive pack!

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: 24: Vaillante vs Leader
description:
2023. 100 years ago, the very first edition of the 24 Hours of Le Mans, the greatest car race in the world, was held.

100 years ago Jean Graton was born, the creator of the greatest driver of all: Michel Vaillant, multiple winner of the 24 Hours of Le Mans.

To celebrate this event with dignity, we propose a game in which you will be the one without whom victory would not be possible: the team manager

24 : Vaillante vs. Leader is a racing team management game. You will have to lead your team on the highest step of the podium by taking the right decisions, by asking your drivers to accelerate or, on the contrary, to take their foot off the accelerator, and to go back to give up their place to one of their teammates. You will have to take risks to stay ahead. That’s the price of victory.

24 Vaillante .vs Leader uses a stop-go mechanic accessible to all, elements for a total immersion in the universe of Le Mans, all served by the illustrations of Jean Graton. What more could you ask for?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Track Movement

name: The Sun of Icarus
description:
Icarus Sun is a board game for 1-4 players.

It is a steampunk inspired game of airship adventure through the sky.

To win：
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points wins.

How to play：
1. Each player selects a gadget to use.
2. Each player receives a "deep blue ore" as fuel.
3. Players flip through their deck to see how much fuel they need. If they can pay, they follow the instructions on the card. If not, the adventure is over for this round.
4. The player repeats flipping the deck until he/she cannot pay the required amount of fuel.
You can use the gadget of your choice at any time during the phase indicated on the gadget.
5. Spend the gear (which serves as money) acquired as a result of the adventure to add a card of your choice to the deck.
6. Repeat the above process for approximately 8 rounds, calculate the victory points, and determine the winner.

name: Lauf, Entchen lauf
description: One player after the other rolls a die and moves their own duck figure so many fields further to collect flower chips. Once a player has three different chips he jumps into the water once he reaches the jetty and wins so the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crazy Candy
description:
"Oh no!
The candy jar fell! The first player to find find a color match with one of the candies, can keep the candy card.
But watch out! If there is no match, the candy goes to the Crazy Candy monster..... Delicious!!!"

name: Scryper
description:
The aim of Scryper is to win three-game sets. The first player to place a brick on the opponent's back line wins the set. You must choose how many of your 16 bricks to deploy in each set. The four types of bricks have different features and strengths, and each can only be used once in a game.

These simple rules open up for gameplay that requires strategic and resource planning; are you aiming for a quick 3-setter, or do you try to wear out your opponent in a long 5-setter? It also requires social skills to read your opponent's moves and make appropriate adjustments, such as making the opponent over-invest resources on set, so you win the next with fewer resources.

The tactical gameplay in each set requires that you read how your opponent plays and opens up for bluffing, creativity, and outsmarting your opponent, which means that it is never pre-determined who will win a set with the preselected bricks.

Scryper is easy to learn and challenging to master, which means the game remains fun, as each game's dynamic is different.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Moving Multiple Units, Square Grid

name: SOLO
description:
A logical thinking game for kids and grown-ups.
It is part of F.X. Schmid's Logiplay game series. Logiplay 4.
A 2-player game, advertised mainly for children (and "TV-tired grown-ups") by the German publisher F.X. Schmid in cooperation with Austria's Piatnik publisher.

Goal of SOLO is to move one of your pawns to the opposite end of the board. Moving and skipping (of own or opposite) is allowed. It has similarities to Chinese Checkers/Halma and Salta. The moved pawns create obstacles that can create shortcuts for the opponent.'

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: HIPP
description:
A simple strategic game from F.X. Schmid's old Logiplay series (probably 1970). Logiplay game 3.
two players - two colours. Goal is to move all (!) of one's meeple's from one end of the board to the opposing end - in a row. It is similar to Salta and Halma, but much simpler and thus suitable for primary school children. No skipping allowed, only straight directions.
It teaches strategy gaming to kids.

—user summary

name: The National Hockey League Game
description:
"It is a game of strategy and skill which can be playing by young and old, by anyone who likes hockey. It is intensely interesting, but simple, and although dice are used, you will find that skill and not luck usually decides the winner. The National Hockey League Game offers endless changes to develop plays on attacks and defense, just as in the real game played on the ice." - From intro of rulebook

Players control their Forwards (3), Defensemen (2) and Goalkeeper (1). The players are simultaneously attacking and defending. Forwards try to get across the goal crease line past the defense and the goalkeeper. This will score a goal but 2 forwards must be past the blueline for this to count, otherwise it is offside. The defense can "check" the forwards by landing on the same square occupied by a forward which sends them back to their starting location. Goalies are restricted to movement inside the goal crease only and can make saves by "blocking".

All movement for the game is done with dice. The game's length can be set beforehand between both players but it is recommended to do a "best out of ___" style game of 3, 5, 7 etc goals.

name: Pooff
description:
The game comes with an octagonal board, 4 Pooffs (rubber bulbs), 2 small cork or rubber balls and a carry bag. The ball is placed in the center of the board. Players secure their Pooff in the metal rings in the board and squeeze them to provide puffs of air to propel the ball into the "home circle" of the opposing players.

Players play simultaneously. The game ends when a player has reached 10 points or a time limit is reached. The other players then compare their scores and the player with the lowest number of points wins.

Pooff boards are handmade, The publisher tag in the center of the board varies (some with city/state, some without). 2 player version requires players to control 2 Poofs at once ; 4 player version is preferred.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Da Vincis Schnappszahlen-Spiel
description:
In Da Vincis Schnappszahlen-Spiel every player gets 5 cards. Every player has to play a card in order and determine the sum of all card values on the table. If the value is a special number such as 11, 22, 33, 44, ... the player wins two step on the board. If the player skips such a special number he has to jump one step back if possible. After playing a card the player draws another one.

There exist some special cards such as the value 13 in which case the sum is reduced by 1 instead of increased by 13. For the card with value 12 the player can decide to add or subtract 1 or 2.

Winner is the player who first reaches 18 steps on the board.

name: flugdomino
description:
This game is a kind of Pachisi played on a flexible domino board which changes its layout tho whole game.

As a players turn one rolls a die and moves one of his initially 6 figures as many fields as was rolled. The start position are two special domino stones with the players color. Each domino stone consists of exactly 3 landing points which are moved on at the players turn. If the figure of a player stops at the middle point of a stone this stone can be rearranged to a different position.

If a opponent figure can be captured it has to be done in which case this figure is removed from the board and can not enter again. The same happens if the number of required steps cannot be performed.

The player who has at least one surviving figure wins the game.

name: Magic Spelling
description:
The Instructive Game of
MAGIC SPELLING
with
Bewitched Letters

The game has 22 large cards with a picture of an animal, its name, and its point value. It also has a large quantity of smaller letter cards, with which to spell the animals' names.

Each player starts with one animal card face up, and the letter cards are dealt out equally to each player for their own face-down stack. Each player in turn reveals the top letter card of their stack and places it face up on the table. When someone sees that they can spell the name of an animal card on the table with the letters on the table, they call out that animal. They collect its card, and it's replaced with a new animal card. At the end of the game, the player with the most points in the animal cards they have collected wins.

name: To Hell and Back
description:
Your loved ones soul has been taken by the ever envious Death himself, and you've made the brave decision to delve into the depths of the underworld to bring them back! The gameplay can almost be described as the love child of games like Mini Rogue and Escape the Dark Castle. The underworld is dark and full of danger. You'll be illuminating the paths in front of you, pushing you luck, managing your resources, and determining your odds before venturing further.

You'll also encounter many foul ghosts, ghouls, and creatures of the dark along the way. Combat involves its own unique system of rolling die simultaneously against your enemies, and using your arsenal to swiftly defeat your opponent while reaching your desired battle outcome. Each level of the underworld is protected by a Deaths fiercest minions. You'll have to get past them to continue advancing further into the unknown.

The game is full of immersive flavor text that help paint a story of your unique adventure. The artwork is meant to be dark and gritty, but also playful and approachable. It's sprinkled with bits of humor to remind you that although the theme is dark, its still fun.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sthenos
description:
In the fantasy realm of Luthasun, the winds of war are blowing and the warring factions are preparing for battle. Armed with strength and fortitude and encouraged by the high priests' wise guidance, they are ready to fight for Goddess Misthral's favour.

With Sthenos, you will live fantastic epic battles with fearless knights and valiant archers, who are always ready to strike, faithful priests, who instil courage and pray for divine intervention, and you, as the brave and wise leader that you have to lead your army successfully into battle.

Sthenos is an innovative game since it has adapted the Command and Colors system as created by Richard Borg into a card game of low complexity for two players, which requires a maximum of 15 minutes to set up and explain the rules, but promises 60-90 minutes of fun, with critical strategic decisions and high replayability.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Hand Management, Line of Sight

name: The Gemstone Collector
description:
The Gemstone Collector is a fun quick turn-based card game for 2 to 6 players. In the game, each player tries to be the first to collect 3 gemstone cards of the same kind.

The game starts with the deck of cards in the center, face down. Each player takes a turn picking a card from the pile. That card can be a Gem (12 different gems) or a special card (attack, defense, joker card). Depending on the card, the player may wish to use it immediately (e.g. change the gem type they are collecting, add it to their existing collection if it fits, play it against others etc), keep it for later (for non-gem cards only), discard ("burn") it or put it at the bottom of the pile ("stash").

The game ends when someone collects 3 same gem cards, or if the pile runs out. In the latter case, the winner is determined by the number of gems they have, the number of attacks they successfully thwarted and/or the number of attacks they didn't block. If all else fails, the winner is determined by the type of gem they were collecting when the pile ran out.

One game will typically run for about 10-20 minutes, depending on how fast the players are, and how many players are in the game. It is easy to grasp, fast-paced, with quite a few hints of strategy, but luck also plays some part.

—description from the designer

name: Mech Command RTS: Advanced Recon Stealth Pack
description:
The Advanced Recon Pack adds
2 x 14 new cards. Cloak Generators, Stealth Disruptors, Smart Missiles, Smart Guns, ECM Missile Jammers, Corrosive & Ion weapons, the Assassin Blade and its Elite Variant "Moonlight".
2 x 1 new stealth mechs

—description from the publisher

name: Mech Command RTS: Tactical Warfare Pack
description:
Tactical Warfare Pack adds
2 sets of 14 cards. Turret Launchers, Mine Layers, Construction Arms, Drone Launchers, Shield Arms, Reinforced Armor packs, Extended ammo racks and more.
2 sets of an engineer mech

name: Jasper's Dice Game
description:
My 8 year old, Jasper, designed this dice game while we were traveling from home to Target. Happy to share it with you. It fits on a single card (rules included), so you can keep it with you wherever you go! You just need a bunch of dice, but I'm sure you (like us) carry dice everywhere you go anyway. Enjoy!

SETUP

Place the card between yourself and your opponent. Each player receives 1d6, 1d8, 1d10, 1d12, and 1d20. Each player places their token on the START space facing them.

HOW TO PLAY


Both players roll their corresponding die at the same time. For example: if a player's token is on the d8 space, they roll a d8.
The player with the lower value moves their token closer to the edge of the cliff.
If both values are a tie, nothing happens.
CRITICAL HIT: If the value rolled by a player is the highest value possible for their die, their opponent moves their token closer to the edge of the cliff unless they are on the last space (d20).
CRITICAL MISS: If the value rolled by a player is a 1, they move their own token closer to the edge of the cliff unless they are on the last space (d20).
First player to reach the SKULL loses!


—description from the designer

name: Alphabet Air
description:
Fly your airplane across North American airports to collect lost luggage. Fill your plane with 26 pieces of A-Z luggage to win the game.

Setup

After assembling the map puzzle into a gameboard, players place an airplane at a random airport, then each grab three destination cards, a luggage card and dry erase marker.

Gameplay

On each turn, a dice roll provides the flight range for all players. Players simultaneously decide upon a destination airport on their route and move their plane to the city’s airport (maximum of dice roll hops).

Using the first or last letter of the city name, players mark a matching letter on their luggage card.

Players discard any matching destination card. Upon filling their luggage card with A-Z matches and having no more airport cards, that player wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Educational, Travel, Word Game
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Matching, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Worker Placement

name: Armoured Storm: The Eastern Front 1941-1945
description:
Armoured Storm: The Eastern Front is a quick-playing, simple-to-learn game of tank-versus-tank combat in World War Two. The rules are intended for battles between 15 and 30 tanks per side, plus 4 or 5 HQ tanks. This means, in game terms, that each player will command one or more companies of tanks organized into several platoons.

In Armoured Storm, you take the role of a commander first and a gunner/driver second. Your ability to give the right orders at the right time and bring your available firepower to bear more efficiently than your opponent, are more important at the level of command you’re representing. Out-thinking your opponent by being clear about your goals and through clever use of the Tactics Chart will bring you success.

THE ‘YOU COMMAND’ SERIES
‘You Command’ is a series of light wargames by Daniel Mersey. When you play a ‘You Command’ game, your goal is to defeat your opponent by out-thinking them tactically using the innovative Tactics Chart, and then by out-fighting their model army on the tabletop battlefield.

Please note that all Armoured Storm titles share the same basic rules; optional rules and tank stats are different according to the theatre of war.

—description from the publisher

name: SPLAT!
description:
A game in which players race on a colorfully-painted game board. The object is to be the first player to successfully move their painter from the outside edge of the board to the painting ladder in the center. Occasionally, players will have the chance to swing the big rotating brush mounted on top of the ladder, in an attempt to knock over the painters of opposing players. If a player gets their three painters to the ladder first, they win.

—user summary

name: Kung Fu Panda: The Board Game – Masters
description:
The Masters Expansions comes with new miniatures and player boards (Shifu, Oogway, Ox, Croc, Rhino, Chicken and Bear with their player boards, and more!)

Includes unlocked Stretch Goals from the Kickstarter and the Po Kick Symbols.

name: Find the Fish
description:
Roll the three dice and find the fish with the right shape, colour and pattern. Who is the fastest each time?
If the game is a little too tricky, put the dice to one side and play by drawing cards.
Who will be the first to find the fish on the card?
The many different variations means this game will never fail to delight!
This game requires logic and the ability to make links, meaning it is highly instructional.

name: Érase una vez... Los exploradores
description:
A little board game about mondial geography.

Players can choose and agree betweeen three different difficulty levels: Easy, medium and hard.

There are some special squares like North or South: Guess if one place is on northern or southern from another one.

The winner will be the first play arriving to the end of the circuit while everybody played the same number of turns.

name: Érase una vez... El Hombre
description:
A little board game about worldwide mankind History.

Players can choose and agree between three different difficulty levels: Easy, medium and hard

There are some special squares like Before or After: Guess if a Historical event happened before or after another one.

The winner will be the first play arriving to the end of the circuit while everybody played the same number of turns.

name: Mercurial: Alchemia
description:
Set 12 years after Mercurial, Mercurial: Alchemia puts you in the shoes of an aspiring Alchemist in the thriving allied hub of Concordia. During nights, you'll cultivate a personal terrarium brimming with fantastical flora and fauna, harvesting them to unlock their potential for crafting elixirs. During the day, you'll explore the bustling Taliq'ir Bazaar to acquire seeds and eggs to introduce into your growing ecosystem. You’ll also visit Runaliths — colossal crystalline structures — to bestow enchantments on your terrarium. Chance a meeting with rival alchemists and their companion Arcanas, and you may forge collaborations amid competition.

As you brew experimental potions to sell to the Guild, your choice of ingredients used is vital. Their distinct qualities can enhance or negate each other, with your mastery and skill determining whether strides in magical advancement are made... or utter failure.

Embark on an alchemical odyssey where your magnum opus awaits... or perhaps even discover the fabled Philosopher's stone!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Follow, Hand Management, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Pyramid Dice
description:
A mysterious number in the room where the treasure sleeps.
After rolling the three dice, add, subtract, multiply, and split. Once you create the room number, you will get the treasure and a new room will appear. Let's capture the mystery of the pyramid with the power of the Egyptian gods!

name: ドワーフの城塞 (Dwarven Citadel)
description:
You are a dwarven patriarch of twenty brethren. Let's develop the fortress while fighting against enemies approaching one after another!
Score attack how many monsters to defeat.

name: Zodiac Go!
description:
Zodiac Go! card game system is our best companion during gathering, party, coffee break or any casual time . 
Zodiac Go! is design with oriental universe concept : Yin yang, five material elements and 12 zodiac time zone.
This game series consist of various games as following.
Every year, designer will released some new games by using the same card system.

Zodiac Go! (生肖乐园)是大家休闲连谊派对欢聚的良伴。这遊戏取材東方宇宙观,卡牌内容包含陰陽，五行金木水火土和 12 生肖时辰。
Zodiac Go! (生肖乐园) 卡牌遊戏系列包含以下遊戏。
每年，設計師都會使用相同的卡牌系統發布一些新遊戲。

1.) 福满人间 The Rite of Fortune
2.) 十月的庆典 The October fest
3.) 时光魔术师 Time travelling machine
4.) 宠物旅店 The pet hotel
5.) 双人Bingo Bingo for 2
6.) 五福临门 Give me five
7.) 招财猫进行曲 The March of Fortune Cat
8.) 偷光猫猫帝国 Pirates in the Cat Kingdom
mechanics: Bingo, Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Push Your Luck, Race, Set Collection

name: Day on the Lake
description:
You have a full day ahead of you. It's going to be just you, the lake, and a bunch of fish-like creatures waiting to join you on your journey for the most relaxing day ever. Day on the Lake is a light dexterity game that has you throwing a die in a lake print-and-play arena, catching fish, earning money, and upgrading your equipment. Will you be an angler champion this day on the lake?

—description from the designer

Roll a die and check the fish you caught. If you passed the criteria for success then you gain money. Try and collect the most money from different shaped fish in ten turns. If you have extra money you can upgrade your die, giving you much better odds at fishing.

name: The Soft Underbelly, 1943-1945
description:
At the end of 1942, with the operation TORCH large American forces poured into the Western Mediterranean. In a short time, thanks to their efforts, Italy was ousted from the conflict and the Allies returned to European continent, definitely arresting the expansion of the Axis.

This game allows to recreate events which took place between 1943 and 1945, when this area became the epicenter of some of the most bloody battles of the WW2.

The game uses wooden cubes, square counters and circular
markers together. It is for two players and lasts about an hour on average. The map is zoned.

The game lasts 8 rounds divided into impulses; with each impulse the players take turns moving and fighting with their specialized forces, blocks and counters.

Whoever controls the majority of areas marked with a star (Rome, Tunis, Naples, Munich and so on) wins the game.

The blocks can be converted with specialized units, like tanks and aircraft; each with its own conversion cost.
The combat mechanic is very simple: at the end of the movement I place one of the three attack arrows and start rolling the dice, one for each attacking cube; if a 6 is rolled then he inflicts a loss on the enemy. If tanks also participate in the attack, the result for hitting drops to 5; if there are also planes involved it drops to 4.

Players can play some events: Arrival of reinforcements, Additional impulse (which allows you to extend the turn), Arrest battle (allows you to immediately end a battle), partisans, etc. But the event markers are generic, it is the player who must decide where to place them on a special track to trigger that type of event. And he can do it at any time...

-description from designer

name: Quatsch!
description:
Quatsch! is a German language learning Party Game consisting of different vocabulary cards, Nouns, Verbs, Adjectives, and a judgement die. Players shuffle the Noun and Adjective decks together, and keep the verb deck separate.

Players take turns judging sentence submissions which are often nonsensical or silly. The judging player rolls the judgement die and plays one card from their hand, the other players will then create a sentence, incorporating the card played by the judging player that most closely matches the feeling of the result of the judgement die. The winning player then wins the vocabulary card presented by the judging player.

Players continue playing until the verb deck runs out of cards, the player with the most cards won from judgement is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Harvest Fair
description:
Harvest Fair is a tabletop game for 2 to 4 players aged 8+ which takes about 30 minutes to play. It recreates the excitement of a traditional community 'harvest fair' at which the players exhibit the produce they've grown that year and are awarded prizes.

In the game, each season tokens are drawn from the bag and allocated to Garden Centres. Eventually a player visits a Garden Centre to claim tokens. After three seasons the players have acquired their tokens, which represent various kinds of fruit, vegetables and flowers. As the game ends trophies and rosettes are awarded at the Harvest Fair, depending on a player’s tokens. The winner of the Grand Trophy takes the victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Finale Ending, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Fish On!
description:
My name is Mike McKinstry and I am the host of the award winning TV show, ”The Bassquatch Hunter” where we take out guests from different industries and sports that followed their dreams to do what they love just like I did with fishing!
 Now we have a board game to help spread our love for the sport and inspire others to FIND THEIR BASSQUATCH!

We started this game because there was a big gap in the market for teaching kids how fishing tournaments work, fish identification and size expectations and also a fun way to share what the awesome sport of fishing is all about!

This game is not just about fishing. This is the story of Seth being brave enough to meet his first human, learn how to fish and then use his passion for the sport to teach everyone he meets about how much fun it is to hunt for your own Bassquatch!

Fish On! is a chance to fish in Seth Squatch's world as Seth. You can catch a Largemouth bass, Smallmouth bass, Blue Gill or a Northern Pike when you land on a "FISH ON!" spot. 

You could also catch Seaweed (grass bass), Sticks (tree pounder) or get hooked on a stump if you do not pull a fish card or any of the other obstacles mixed into the deck. 

You can circle the island and hit all of the best fishing spots until a player decides to cross the finish line and end the game. At this time, each player adds up their fish either by inches or pounds to see who has the largest amount of size or weight in their nets! 
This game will help with basic math skills, Fish identification, size expectations and a very fun adventure for kids. The Fish On! game is also a big hit for adults to play against their buddies! The competitive trash talking begins after the first roll of the dice usually. This game operates very similar to a fishing tournament so even if you are a non fisherman, it will be fun, competitive and educational for all!

You never know, your next adventure could lead you to be the next Bassquatch Hunter!

name: Lost & Found
description:
Lost & Found is a historical strategy card game of community, family, and lost and found objects. Build your community, take care of your family, avert disasters, and don’t let any of your neighbors go destitute. Any or all can win—or if you are not careful, all can lose.

In medieval North Africa, towns are built by families like yours. Show your strategic and collaborative skills in Lost & Found, a historical strategy game of balance between community and family needs. Take on one of five roles in a struggle to address dilemmas, overcome crises, and avert disasters that threaten to destroy everything you know and love. Look out for your family, but be sure to collaborate with your neighbors as well. Any number of players can win, but if anyone goes destitute, everyone loses.

This, the first edition of Lost & Found, explores how a code of law called Mishneh Torah addresses lost and found possessions. Written in the 12th century by Maimonides, a great physician, philosopher, Jewish scholar, and sage, the law gives guideposts for behavior, but you decide how to solve dilemmas. Explore the ways in which this medieval religious legal system helped to hold society together and keep neighbors cooperating with each other.

Will you follow the laws of lost and found possessions? Will you break them? Will you go above and beyond the law? Find out in Lost & Found!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Educational, Medieval, Religious

name: Lost & Found: Order in the Court
description:
Lost & Found: Order in the Court – the Party Game is a humorous and historical storytelling game of objects lost and found.

“The court rules that if the bird drops meat on your field, you may keep it.” How did this case get to court? It’s up to you. In Lost & Found: Order in the Court – the Party Game, you’ll need to think fast to create accurate and humorous scenarios in a quest to explain religious laws as they were written in medieval Fustat (Old Cairo). Show off your on-the-fly storytelling skills in this easy-to-learn, yet mentally complex card game.


Pretend you are a medieval Egyptian! Work your way backwards from the legal ruling to the original dispute. Whether you try for historical accuracy, humor, or presentation skills is up to you.



You be the judge! Award points for the best story when it’s your turn in the judge’s seat.


Order in the Court, a new game in the Lost & Found series, explores how a code of law called Mishneh Torah addresses lost and found possessions. Written in the 12th century by Maimonides, a great physician, philosopher, Jewish scholar, and sage, the law gives the basis for many interesting court cases. Try to figure out how they might have gotten to a court in the first place! Explore the ways in which this medieval religious legal system helped to hold society together by explaining rulings in the law. Why can’t three people simultaneously read from the same scroll? Why is your lost basket more important to return than your teacher’s? Tell your story with Lost & Found: Order in the Court – the Party Game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Medieval, Party Game, Religious

name: Tank Chess: Portable
description:
Coming with a smaller board than the base game, Tank Chess: Portable is a standalone expansion ideal for traveling, playing in reduced spaces, or in a time constraint. The games played on a 12 x 12 square board play out quicker, the gameplay is usually more dynamic, and tense, as the Command Tank's escape is looming from the first few turns, and clashes and first casualties can be expected, basically, from turn 2. You’ll want to pay close attention to corridors closing due to vehicle destruction at all times, as you don’t want to block your own pieces from preventing a quick escape of the opponent's Command Tank.

The box measures 15.5 x 15.5 x 4 cm, and it contains a double-sided board that measures 29 x 29 cm; both the box and the board are made out of thick cardboard – the same as the Standard box and boards. Inside, there is the same set of pieces and flags as in the Standard version (2 x 16 pieces), so you can create many completely different custom setups and get an infinitely replayable game out of this single expansion.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Tank Chess: Extended
description:
Tank Chess: Extended is a standalone Tank Chess expansion featuring a 24x24 board, that provides longer games, filled with thorough thinking and calculation at every stage. In general, in games on a board this large, with a lot of pieces, the battle phase is usually divided into more segments, as engagements take place in several areas on the board, and each player tries to shift the focus to the side where he has a better chance of gaining an advantage. The endgame tightly depends on the outcome of the battles, as the player who prevails in complex tactical battles usually has a free path for their Command Tank, or a clear opportunity to surround and destroy the opponent's Command Tank.

The games on the Extended, 24x24 square board games are more demanding in terms of space, and also long-lasting, with more elaborate initial strategies, and a lot of tactical maneuvering and depth. In addition to the pieces from the base game, TC Extended set also contains Super Heavy Tanks, Recon Tanks, Heavy Bulldozers, and Light Howitzers. The set contains these additional tanks in 4 colors, so if you combine the content of TC: Extended with the base game, you will have the possibility to play 4-player games with a full set of pieces.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Tank Chess: Fun Set Plus
description:
Tank Chess: Fun Set Plus is an expansion that represents the continuation of the content-expanding line started with Tank Chess: Fun Set, which was the original Tank Chess expansion.

The Fun Set Plus expansion is focused mainly on new vehicles that allow even more diverse games, but there are also new obstacles added and the road feature, which speeds up movement.

The pieces featured in this expansion (non conclusive) are: 2 x Tankette; 1x Flamethrower Tank; 1x Heavy Tank Destroyer; 1x Smokelauncher Tank; 2x Infantry Tank; 1x Minelaying truck; 3x Landing craft; 2x Gun Boat; 1x Fast Boat and 2x Pillbox, in each color.

Given that Fun Set Plus contains wide water areas, as well as many amphibious vehicles and armed boats, the character of the game changes a lot as it provides additional opportunities for an extremely varied gameplay. There will be some interesting board setups with lots of water surfaces provided in the brochure, which can be used as an inspiration for creating even more custom setups.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Mobs of Mayhem City
description:
Mobs of Mayhem City is a tabletop game for 3 to 5 players aged 8+ which takes 10 to 15 minutes to play. Each turn, one of the players takes the set of Mayhem Tiles and drops them onto the table so they land on or near the bag, which represents Mayhem City. The players then have five seconds to decide what action to take. These include prospecting, cattle rustling, a bank heist, or an ambush. Everyone decides secretly and at the same time. When time's up, everyone reveals their decision and the actions are resolved. Rewards are paid in gold nuggets and gems from the pool, or are sometimes stolen from other players. When the pool is exhausted the game ends, and the richest player wins.

—description from the designer

name: Tank Chess: Airborne
description:
Some newly added Tank Chess pieces feature a new mechanic, which makes them stand out from the pieces in the Fun Set Plus expansion. That is why there is a special Airborne (mini) Expansion. It contains a total of 12 pieces (6 in each color): 2x Airborne Light tank; 2x Armed Off-road vehicle (airborne), and 2x Anti-Aircraft tank.

Airborne pieces can, under certain conditions, land on almost any square. The main landing condition is that there are no Anti-Aircraft tank pieces nearby, as they deter planes carrying airborne pieces. This way, the game gets a completely new dimension, and, literally, it is the third dimension, because the players have to keep in mind that the opponent can at any moment drop a piece from the skies and change the outcome of the game. That is why the Anti-Aircraft tank pieces are of particular importance, especially when in vicinity of the Command Tank, defending it.
The brochure for this expansion will feature many obstacle setups (for all board sizes) in which the Airborne pieces play the central role.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Appaloosa: Pony Race
description: An exciting obstacle race - The race has begun and the riders are on the course! Can they beat the obstacles or will some of them fall back in the race? Who will get a head start and who will be the first past the finishing line? The tension lasts until the very last move due to the costant exciting back and forth movement of the ponies!

name: Escape: Family Box
description:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple is a cooperative game in which players must escape (yes...) from a temple (yes...) which is cursed (yes...) before the temple collapses and kills one or more explorers, thereby causing everyone to lose.

Escape is played in real-time, with all players rolling dice and taking actions simultaneously. You must roll the right symbols to enter a room, and if you're at an open doorway, you can roll to reveal the next tile in the stack and add it to that doorway. Some rooms contain combinations of red and blue symbols, and if you (possibly working with other players in the same room) roll enough red or blue symbols, you "discover" magic gems, moving them from a separate gem depot onto that tile.

The family box comes with the 2 modules found in the original base game (Treasures and Curses) plus 7 Queenies (The Pit, Doomed, The Fountain, Quest Chambers, The Maze, The Dungeon, and The Maya Calendar)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Real-Time

name: 鬼来 (Onikuru)
description:
A hidden role game in which players are children trapped in a house around which an Oni is lurking. But some of the players are puppets sent by the Oni who will try to lure the players into a false sense of security. A player will move to one of three types of locations: Rooms to search and obtain item cards, Hidding place to be safe from Oni and the Entrance, where a player can "peak through the window" (aka look at the top card of the Oni deck) to know which card will be moved in front of the entrance or place an item card under the current Oni card in front of the entrance.
At the end of the round, the card in front of the entrance is revealed. If the card is an Oni, every players outside a hiding place will be devoured. The card is then removed and the next card on the Oni deck is placed face down in front of the entrance.
The children win by placing a talisman at the entrance the turn an Oni will be revealed.
The Oni's Envoy win if there are less children alive remaining than them.

Translated game introduction;
Today, the same room, the same friends, the same people.
"What do you want to do?" "I want to play."
Such an ordinary day is suddenly disrupted.

Suddenly, It is pitch black outside the room that was brightly lit just a moment ago.
You hear a noise coming from the living room, which is supposed to be empty. Gently, You take a peek.
What is that? Is that...? Not a person, with horns? An Oni?
Your companions peek outside the room, livid and trembling.

If we continue to hide, we will be eaten eventually. It's obviously dangerous outside, but we must somehow find a way to get rid of the demon.

Working together with your friends, you are going to bring back that ordinary but happy life!

But...? There seems to be impostors among your friends... Something doesn’t add up...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination

name: Breached
description:
Step into the thrilling world of Breached, where two cunning thief squads find themselves holed up in a heavily fortified bank. But beware! Two relentless Emergency Response Teams are on their way, breaching the bank's defenses to capture the invaluable vault. In this high-stakes game of strategy and wits, every decision counts.

Prepare for the ultimate showdown as you and your squad delve into the heart-pounding action of Breached. Before the chaos unfolds, carefully select your arsenal, side arms, and the type of leadership that best suits your tactical style. Choose wisely, for the fate of your squad depends on it. With Breached, programming your moves is key to outmaneuvering your opponents. Each turn, you must strategically program three of the four powerful cards you possess.

Anticipate your adversaries' next moves, devise clever strategies, and prove your brilliance by staying one step ahead. Will you sabotage their efforts or rally your team to victory? Collaboration is vital in Breached. Work together with your fellow thieves or response team members, exploiting the unique advantages of your skills and weapons. Teamwork and coordination will unlock new levels of strategy, leading you closer to the ultimate prize—the coveted vault.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Modern Warfare, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Tetra Master
description:
Tetra Master is a card game that originated in the wildly popular video game Final Fantasy IX.

It was a digital card game that allowed players to collect, win and trade cards with non-plaver characters within the game's universe. The cards all feature iconic characters and monsters from within the game's vast and creative world. Player reception to Tetra Master was't great, as many people felt like there was too much randomness and battles relied heavily on hidden and cryptic in-game calculations. For this physical version we've tried to eliminate some of the more frustrating experiences (primarily by changing the complex and confusing mathematical calculations with more easily understood die rolls) to make the experience fun while being reminiscent of the Tetra Master experience in Final Fantasy IX.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Number, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Dice Rolling, Score-and-Reset Game, Square Grid, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Miezi & Mopsie
description:
Miezi & Mopsie is about placing 4-in-a-row cat or dogs discs on a variable playing grid out of cards. It's a game of cats (Miezis) against dogs (Mopsies). Each player has to place 4 of his discs in a row, possibly in multiple places or in rows longer than 4. Depending on certain conditions on neighboring/underlying grid fields, cat discs can be stolen (removed by the opponent), and dog discs may award bonus points at the end of the game.

—user summary

name: Squadron Leader: Bomber & Balloons
description:
Bigger. Tougher. A fair bit slower.

This expansion adds 2 new game pieces to the game, and you guessed them:

Bombers and Balloons! (and a surprise third, the Bomb token)

—description from the designer

name: Mech Command RTS: The Armory and 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
The Armory: An additional set of all mech models, weapon arms, item cards, mech boards, gems and punch-board tokens. For advanced players, an extra set of everything will allow you to spawn highly specialized combinations like dual missile mechs

5-6 Player Expansion: This set includes all unique components for the White and Violet mechs including white and violet versions of the LED Bases, 80 acrylic damage cubes, support unit miniatures, player tokens, and damage dishes.

name: トリック喫茶レトロベリー (Trick Cafe Retro Berry)
description:
Trick-taking x Bingo x Retro Cafe

"Bid prediction" hit and get points. In addition, you can get a bonus by "achieving the goal"! And grab the victory with "Bingo established"!

Fashionable cute designs and themes. However, the appearance is sweet, but the game is not...! ?

name: Little Memo: Garden
description:
These turtles are mischievous and they love to eat! They have fun hiding lovely fruit and vegetables for their snack, but where is the carrot?
In this visual memory game, children have to remember what's underneath the tortoise or which tortoise is hiding which food to collect as many cards as possible and win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Moon Squad
description:
Your mining company has found rich ore on this small moon, but you need buyers. Connect your mine to all 3 surface settlements, and hire squads to defend your mine and attack your rival.

Moon Squad is a connection game in the family of Hex and Y. It includes a capturing mechanism which adds drama and dynamic positional play. It also incentivizes players to deviate from standard connection game tactics. Moon Squad was inspired by Christian Freeling's Knightvision.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Connections, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: The Treasure of Montecristo Island: The Thief and the Purple Sapphire Expansion Pack
description:
This Expansion Pack continues the story from the Treasure of Montecristo Island base game. With the altars still built and lit, the monks of the island disclose that gold is not the only treasure there. The Thief, now a character of their own, has a newly inspired thirst for besting your crew.

Included in this chapter is a host of tools at the Thief’s disposal; two sabotage tokens, a rope trap, poison, a bear trap, and a kidnap token.

Dear Adventurers,

There is a Thief on the Island of Montecristo and they have targeted your band of Adventurers. Recognized only by a tattoo of a skull and snake and a scar across one eye, this thief is known throughout the lands for being equally resourceful and greedy. They are a master of crafting traps that will hinder your quest to discover the secret of Montecristo Island.

After failing to steal the first Treasure of Montecristo Island from you, the Thief is doubling their efforts. They will stop at nothing to obtain the Purple Sapphire and escape the island with this priceless gem.

The Thief’s ship was previously damaged while attempting a stealthy approach, so, to complicate matters they will also rob you and your team for resources in order to repair their ship. Once the Thief has repaired their ship, there is nothing to stop them from stealing this new treasure and disappearing into the horizon.

If the Thief successfully repairs their ship and returns to it with the treasure, the game is over and the Thief is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Team-Based Game

name: Zellord
description:
The heroes of the four crests conquer new territories, build up their houses and fight for a legendary artifact that will wake the dragon and allow the owner to conquer other crests.
A randomly generated game board in each new game session.
Build up your domain wisely to get the most out of it and strengthen your crest.
Fight squads of medieval armies and fantasy giants. Over 200 warriors in a box. Heroes participate in battles and give their units an advantage.
You never know what resource you will have this time and what strategy you will need to choose to win.
Discover, grow and conquer!

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, King of the Hill, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: The Crows of Coppershell Bay
description:
You were desperate and you were foolish. You borrowed 50 gems from the infamous Crows gang and now they want it back, with interest, within 3 days. You're a lowly skinner at the local maggot farm, there's no way you'll earn that kind of money in time, and the Crows aren't known for their flexibility.

Fortunately, there's gems waiting for someone with the right amount of skill, ambition and luck. You could go fishing at the beach and sell your haul to the local fishermen or forage in the glade for ingredients and craft exotic brews. You could scavenge in the local dump for materials to make tools or shoplift from the market.

If you're feeling lucky the carnival has come to town. If you're feeling brave the miner's guild has no shortage of quests that need completing in the nearby pits.

This solo adventure game is the first in a planned series of Small Tin Tale games. It takes place in Brighthelm, the world first brought to life in Paupers' Ladder.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Events, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Race, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Word-Go-Round
description:
INTRODUCTION: Word-Go-Round is a game of strategy and skill that can be enjoyed by anyone old enough to spell. All players stay involved throughout the game since each player is competing not only with other players to accumulate the largest sum of money, but also with himself in striving to make the best possible words from his available letter tiles.

OBJECT: The object of Word-Go-Round is to accumulate the greatest amount of money possible by filling one’s individual word card with as many well paying words as possible. Words are formed from letter tiles which are bought when a player’s marker lands on the letters on the playing board. Players earn money with each word successfully spelled out on their individual word cards.
mechanics: Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Spelling

name: Bananya: The Card Game – Exclusive Expansion Pack
description:
The Exclusive Expansion Pack contains 9 cards (Zombie Bananyas x 2, Meowteor x 2, Robot Nyanko x 4 and a reference card) that you can swap into the base game for different play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Five Minute Fight: Monster
description:
