Five Minute Fight: Monster is a rock-paper-scissors card battler for 2-4 players. Each player represents a "Master Monster", summoning other monsters to fight on their behalf. The last Master Monster standing wins.

Each round, one player will reveal a location card for the fight, which may offer bonuses for certain monsters. Then, all players secretly select which monster(s) they will send into battle. Finally, the monsters are revealed. Red beats Green, Green beats Yellow, Yellow beats Red, and Blue trumps all. The winner deals damage first to their opponents' minions and then to their Master Monster. Play continues likewise until only one player remains.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: キスまでの階段 (Stairs to Kiss)
description:
In Stairs to Kiss, the players play a climbing game about watching a couple go through the first 9 of Sachiko Takahashi's 12 Stages of Intimacy.

The first player to play all of the cards from their hand wins.
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: PKイレブン (PK Eleven)
description:
PK Eleven is a card game in which two players simulate the penalty kick procedure at the end of a soccer game.

Each player has an identical set of 11 cards. The cards have one half showing the strength and direction a kick is made, and a second half showing the strength and direction the goalie blocks.

Players lay out their cards in a line and flip the left most one face up. They can peak at their next next. One player is designated to kick first and both players simultaneously point to either their revealed card or the face down one next to it.

If the kicker kicked in a different direction than the goalie defended, they scored. If the directions were the same, compare the strengths. Then, switch roles and if one player used their face up card, they reveal their leftmost card.

Repeat this procedure until the cards are used and the person with the most goals scored is the winner.

name: Book Jockeys
description:
A game in which everyone is jockeying for the top spot in the competitive world of book publishing!

In Book Jockeys, the goal is to present the most appealing book proposal to the publisher (aka, judge), in hopes that he or she will select your book proposal as the book “Most likely to...(fill in the blank).” In some cases, you’ll be aiming high (i.e., for the most appealing book), and in others, you’ll be aiming low (i.e., for the least appealing). Each author (aka, jockey) will use a combination of nouns, verbs, adjectives, and numbers to create their book proposal before taking turns pitching their proposed title (& accompanying plot). The author/jockey who earns the most successful pitches wins.

—description from the designer

name: UNO Ultimate: Convention Promo – Thanos (Enemy card)
description:
Hey Gen Con! There are exclusive Thanos foil cards up for grabs with the purchase of any UNO Ultimate Marvel product only at the Mattel Games booth.

Card text:

Thanos

When Flipped
All players burn 4 cards.

While Attacking
When a player plays a “!” (Danger Deck card), the burn 2 cards

To Defeat: See Reference Card

------

“Reference Card”

When Flipped
Place the card Next to the Danger Deck for everyone to see. Thanos attacks all players.

While Attacking
When a player plays a card with a “!” they must Burn 2 cards.
Note: A player can be attacked by both an Enemy and Thanos. If a player is being attacked by another Enemy, they most resolve their enemy first, then Thanos.

To Defeat
All active players must Burn one Wild Card from their hand. At the beginning of a player’s turn, they may propose the above and if each player agrees and is able to do so, then Thanos is defeated and played in the Danger Discard Pile.
Note: No other method of defeating an Enemy can defeat Thanos.

Note: Only 1 Thanos Card can be played per game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Number
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Matching, Take That

name: Diving Bell
description:
In late 1686, Sir William Phipps convinced investors to fund an expedition to what is now Haiti and the Dominican Republic to find sunken treasure, despite the location of the shipwreck being based entirely on rumor and speculation. In January 1687, Phipps found the wreck of the Spanish galleon Nuestra Señora de la Concepción off the coast of Santo Domingo. Some sources say they used an inverted container for the salvage operation while others say the crew was assisted by Indian divers in the shallow waters. The operation lasted from February to April 1687 during which time they salvaged jewels, some gold and 30 tons of silver which, at the time, was worth over £200,000.

Diving Bell takes the players on a journey to the bottom of the sea to find various treasures. But it is not a walk in the park to find them - various threats exist to stop the players from doing so.
Diving Bell is a cooperative game that players will use a unique way of choosing actions to get their ships ready for diving. A diving bell is also an option to help with the success of each dive they are used. Spatial thinking, action selection, resource management, and other mechanisms are available for the players who wish to conquer the deep.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: Cross Roads: A Game of Buildings and Blocks
description:
In the game of "cross roads" each player becomes one of the builders of a "town". The center of the Playing Board is a map of the Blocks and Crossroads of this "town". The Blocks are divided into square lots and are zoned in color as to the type of buildings or landscaping that is permitted on each lot. The "town" is divided into two, three or four lot Blocks.

The object of the game is to be the player with the highest total of bonus money when the game ends.

—user summary

name: Lone Sherman and The Fields of Normandy 2: Two Solitaire Wargames
description:
Lone Sherman puts you in charge of a single Sherman Tank and its crew somewhere in France in World War II, and tasks you with navigating your Sherman through varied and challenging Missions. Whilst this game is not a ‘narrative driven’ game as such, with a little imagination it will provide memorable stories. The Missions allow the Player to invent any kind of back-story they like in order to enhance the feel of the game. Some events are randomly generated, but the Player always has at least some degree of control over the level of risk they wish to take and how vulnerable they leave their Tank to these Events.

The Fields of Normandy 2 (the sequel to The Fields of Normandy) is set in Normandy, France in 1944 and reflects loosely the conditions and situations faced by the US VIII Corps of the United States Army as it pushed inland as part of Operation Cobra. The fighting was intense and incredibly violent. German units were very well dug in and protected by artillery and mines. In the game, you will be controlling small groups of soldiers from a platoon, consisting of three Rifle Squads, a Machine Gun Team, a Bazooka Team and a Mortar Team. As the platoon Lieutenant, it is your job to command these squads and teams in order to clear the German defensive positions.

The aim of this book is to present two clear, accessible, and quick to learn war games, so that players can get into the action quickly. It does not try to replace more complex wargames which often take many hours to learn and to play. Each of the Missions can be played in around an hour and the game provides plenty of 'replayability'.

This games in this book are solitaire hex and counter style wargame. You play the games, and the enemies are controlled by the game book (or the Artificial Intelligence or ‘AI’). You will need to bring at least 5, but preferably 7, standard six-sided dice. Full colour 'Mission Maps' are included. Methods to play the game include:

Cut out or copy the counters provided on the final page of the book, stick them to card and cut them out with a good quality craft knife or pair of scissors.
Photocopy the maps and draw/write on the pages lightly in pencil and erase when necessary. You can use any annotations you choose for the units, that make sense to you.
Lay the book flat (it’s well-bound, it can stand it!) and use cubes, miniatures, or similar tokens for the units.
Use some kind of acetate and dry-wipe markers.


Take a photo of the maps on a tablet and use the “edit” function to draw and erase.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Cayley HamiDElton
description:
Cayley HamiDElton is a competitive game about accounting shenanigans, as you try to report a lower income in order to pay less taxes, but could get caught.

The game consists of a deck of cards which show your profits on one side and the potential fine on the other. In a round, each player puts out one card, profit side down, and the players have an auction of decreasing bids, to declare how low of a profit you're willing to claim.

Once there is only one person left, they take on the title of accountant, and slowly reveal the cards everyone played. If the sum is less than the declared amount, everyone takes their own card as points and the accountant also takes a bonus card. If the sum is more, the accountant takes all excess cards as penalties.

The person with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Bremen Formation
description:
In Bremen Formation, each of the players takes on the role of an animal, trying to be the one to catch the hen. Players get a hand of action cards (e.g. move forward 1 space) and each animal has a special action.

The game play takes place on cards showing three spaces in a line, which form a loop. Players simultaneously choose a card from their hand and reveal it. Once each action is resolved, an item card takes effect. The players see a queue of the next two item cards which will occur, and they have effects such as placing the hen on the animal on top of a stack, causing the top animal to pick up their used action cards, or eliminating a player from the game.

The first player to catch the hen twice wins.

name: Towards Gut Alley Card Game
description:
Towards Guy Alley Card Game is a trick-taking game where players will play some of their cards twice. Specifically, the winner of each trick will take their own card as points, but the losers will place their cards face down in a special stack. Once a player is out of cards, they pick up the cards they lost with, turn them over to a different rank range, and continue playing.

At the start of the round, players bid for how many points (not tricks) they will take. These bids must be formed by the sum of two cards, numbered 0 to 7. A player also has the opportunity to play one of these two bid cards to a trick.

Players earn points for hitting their bid exactly and will otherwise lose points. The person with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

name: Monster Workshop
description:
In Monster Workshop, you are a (slightly mad) scientist. Scour your lab to assemble the best available parts, and create the ultimate combat monster. Take your monster to battle and defeat the opposition! Be fastest, be strongest, be luckiest -- be victorious!

OBJECT OF THE GAME: Build the strongest complete monster you can before your opponents do, by drawing and discarding cards. Then defeat your rival in combat! To complete your monster, collect cards depicting 1 head, 1 torso, 1 left arm, 1 right arm, and 1 pair of legs. The first two players to complete their monster will send their creations to battle to see who emerges the victor. Lay your best card hand on your individual player board to “bring your monster to life”! The first player to bring their monster to life has the advantage of striking first -- roll the included 20-sided die to achieve a winning score. Win two battles, and you win the game! Your gameplay can range from simple to monstrously strategic. Create a monster and fight with your friends in this electrifying card game.

—description from the designer

name: Wakfu Stories: Extension Lance Dur
description:
Around a campfire, a group of aging adventurers reminisce about their adventurous past...
Count Lance Dur and his allies join your tale! Your verve will be put to the test, as their legendary feats demand to be narrated with passion!

name: Splatter Face Battle
description:
This Splatter Face Battle game is sure to keep children entertained at home on rainy days! Simply squirt cream or put a wet sponge on the pie splatting hand, rest your chin on the ledge, and take turns twisting the spinner. Relax, keep your cool and prepare yourselves, as the two of you will get a big surprise of cream in your face! The question is… who will it be? Watch your friends squirm as they play to face their fate! Either player could get splattered at any moment!

—description from the publisher

name: Point Masters
description:
Shadowboxing - you’ve likely seen it on social media, watched friends do it, or even played yourself. It’s the game that quite literally blew up the internet.

Since we like games (and things that blow up) we, too, joined the TikTok trend and shadowboxed All. The. Time.

After a while, we began to think about how we could make the game more chaotic - in a way that everyone could enjoy.

After years of revisions, ideas, and arguments, we’ve created the perfect blend of fast-paced fun and strategy into a game that everyone loves!

It’s easier on your neck, too.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Drawing

name: Chestack
description:
A new multi-layered card game that fuses chess and fantasy
Divided into black and white camps, you rotate your cards alternately one turn at a time, defeating and absorbing your opponent's pieces, sometimes merging with your allies, summoning your opponent's cards, etc., and in the end, whoever takes the opponent's king wins.Included in anomalous Chess Variant.


By stacking (absorbing or merging) other cards, the movement of the stacked cards is also added and becomes a complex movement, so deep insight is required.
Stacked cards can become opponent's cards if you are not careful, and they may expand rapidly.
The hurdle is high, but by summoning cards, you can turn the tide at once.


—description from the designer

name: Professor Brainstorm Equation Invasion Card Game: BrainForce Expansion 1
description:
The first and only expansion for the Professor Brainstorm Equation Invasion Card Game. It has 20 cards -- 9 blue, 11 orange -- and a data sheet on the members of BrainForce, each of whom is represented by a card in the set:

Arnee the Amazing Toad
Boltz the Robot
Gwendolyn, a human teen from Earth
Risky Racoon
Rumble the Hillfar Giant
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math

name: Legions: Fantasy Board Game
description:
Legions - Fantasy Board Game is a unique turn-based strategy war game. It has the aspects of a trading card game mixed with a tabletop. You will use your Legion to defeat your opponent(s) on a battlefield. You will use your Legion led by your General, who will have unique buffs and abilities, leading your units to victory.

Our game will feature multiple modes to allow our players to have a wide variety of game experiences. Classic Mode - Is set up to get new players into the game or for those who just want to play casually. Legions Mode - Is set up for intermediate players who have played a variety of card or board games.

Gameplay typically takes up to 30-60 minutes to play, where you can play with up to 2 or 8 people. Featuring 4 unique decks with the bloodlines of Human, Elf, Inferna, and Celestia. Each deck contains 35 card decks each containing 1 General, 3 Officers, and 31 Action cards. A double sided game board with a 2 player battlefield, and 4 player battlefield. With 92 Diamond tokens, 8 sets of 10 multi-colored for units, 3 sets of 4 multi-colored for officers, and a rulebook.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Variable Phase Order

name: Ghost Busting!
description:
Ghost Busting! is a solitaire, worker placement & push your luck game
In New Jesselton ghost are running rampant, despite the city denying the existence of ghost. As a newly established Ghost Busting business, your crew have been cleaning up the town from the nasties; but you have stumbled upon a doomsday prophecy that the city is in peril from 3 apocalyptic size ghost.

This solo game roll and write game will have players managing their rooster of 3 ghost hunters to attend to haunted sites in the daily classifieds to bust some evil spirits that is haunting different premises. The work will earn money, provide intel and experimental slime which can be use to purchase and produce more useful equipment or hire an extra ghost hunter in preparation to the final face off with the final ghost boss.

Do you have what it takes to save the city from eminent disaster?

—description from the designer

Official link to game
https://thekealf.itch.io/ghost-busting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Asteroid Miners
description:
In Asteroid Miners you lead your crew of fellow belters in mining the asteroid belt, excavating valuable minerals in the cold of space.
It is a 2-player dice-rolling game where you excavate precious metals using a precision drill and upgradable mining equipment, digging deeper and deeper into a series of asteroids.
You will use a dice pool to manipulate your drill components to match the minerals in your current excavation section.
After successful excavations you may sell your minerals to a fluctuating Metal Market, trying to earn more profit than your competitor to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Beyond Sector X
description:
Beyond Sector X is a tactical strategy game for one player.

Amidst the vast emptiness of space, you take on the role of a lone explorer, venturing forth on a perilous mission. When a ruthless band of extraterrestrial foes abducts your trusted companion, you must summon all your courage and cunning to infiltrate the enemy mothership, battle the monstrous creatures within, collect all the Energy Crystals throughout, and save your comrade from certain doom.

Use your skills and abilities to navigate through two corridors of the enemy spacecraft. In the first corridor, search for useful items to aid you in your mission. In the second corridor, race against a ticking clock to safely teleport out. Your ultimate goal is to defeat the hostile extraterrestrial beings hiding Beyond Sector X.

Will you emerge victorious, or fall victim to the dangers lurking in the darkness?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Events, Hand Management, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Circle of Blood
description:
Circle of Blood is a cooperative wargame, for two to four players, that uses 32mm miniatures and scaled scenery to recreate the tactical confrontations of one or more groups of adventurers, called guilds. The game also allows to play solo, for those adventurers who prefer to live the Gormalak experience by themselves. Or competitives one.

In Circle of Blood you take command of a guild made up of three adventurers. You can design them to your liking or use the predesigned characters (which we recommend to get started).
Game sequence
The first thing you have to do in order to play is choosing a mission. We recommend playing "New in town," featured in the complete manual.
Each player sets up their three models within the area specified by the mission. Then, one of the players starts the turn by activating one of their adventurers. Next the other player chooses one of their adventurers and activates it.
NPCs are always the last models to be activated (regardless of whether they are allies or not). Thus, after each guild has activated one adventurer, it’s the NPCs turn, who must activate the model that is the closest to an adventurer.
Remember to place an activation marker next to each model once it has been activated so you don't activate it again until the next turn.
This same activation order is repeated over and over again until there are no more models left to be activated, at which point the turn ends and we move on to the next one. Remove all activation markers at that time.

Game system
When activated, each model has a number of Action Points (AP), which is usually 4. Most of their actions (such as moving, jumping, or attacking an enemy) cost it 1 AP, though some may cost more. The model can repeat the same action a number of times equal to half its total AP (usually two). The only action that a model can freely repeat is to move.

Movement (MOV)
For each AP that the model uses to move, it will cover a distance equal to the one indicated in the MOV box of its template. When you move, the model can be facing in any direction you want.

Checks
Many actions are not automatic and require checking certain values from the Adventurer Sheet or creature template. Look up the value in question (which will range from 1 to 20) and roll 1d20. If the result is less than the number indicated on the Adventurer Sheet, the check is a success. If the result is exactly that number, it is a critical success. If the result is greater than the required number, it is a failure. Regardless of the final result of the check and whether it is successful or not, it always consumes the AP required to perform the action.

Penalties
External factors, which we call 'penalties', can negatively affect the course of a test. The sum of all the penalties changes the final value to be obtained in the check.
For example: A 2 penalty on a skill of 12 requires a d20 roll between 3 and 12.

Offensive actions
There are three types of offensive actions (melee, ranged, and magical).

Melee: This type of attack requires base-to-base contact with the enemy model. The attacker rolls his Combat Skill (CS) and suffers a penalty equal to the opponent's Defense (DEF).
Ranged: The target of the attack must be within the range of the weapon used. The attacker rolls his Shooting Skill (SS) and suffers various penalties (adjustments for long range, cover, movement, etc.).
Magical: The target of the spell must be within range. The attacker rolls his Magic Skill (MS) and suffers penalties depending on the difficulty of the spell and the Magic Resistance (MR) of the victim.


When the offensive action succeeds, it will deal an amount of damage indicated on the weapon or spell’s description. This is subtracted from the victim's Armor (ARM) and the final result is subtracted from their current Hit Points (HP). When the model loses all of its HP, it will be defeated and must be removed from the game.
Reaction
If a model has not been activated yet, but suffers an offensive action, it has the chance to react. During a reaction, the model has access to only half its normal AP and can only attack the model that caused the reaction.
To determine who acts first, both models make a Dexterity (DEX) check. Whoever rolls the highest on a d20 wins. Alternate the actions of the models involved until they consume all their AP.

NPC Behavior
All the NPCs act according to the objective they must fulfill in the mission (attack, defend, secure an area, etc.). Each objective describes how the model must me moved during the scenario and what actions they will perform.
When another model or game circumstance “bothers” them (for example, attacking the NPC or making it impossible for them to fulfill their objective), we must consult their personality trait (rational, aggressive, or passive). This will determine their behavior, for example, causing them to run away from the model responsible, ignore it or even attack.

NPC combat
When they decide to fight, NPCs look for the most effective way of attacking based on the attributes of their weapons (CS, SS or MS). They always use the one that allows them to attack the greatest number of times taking into account, for example, if they are in base-to-base contact or further away from their enemy.

These are the most important mechanics in Circle of Blood. Now we invite you to take a look at the final manual to see everything that this narrative action wargame has to offer. Battle dozens of different enemies, gain fame and riches, and discover the sinister secret behind Gormalak!

—description from the publisher

name: Oghmu: Age of Discordance
description:
Oghmu-Age of Discordance a fast-paced, dice-driven boardgame of skirmish battles in which each player choose a Faction and pits them against their rivals in battles across the ethereal demi-plane of Oghmu.

Each time you play the game you and your opponent each has to choose a Faction from the available 6 Factions. A Faction is a collection of Heroes from the same race, fighting for the same goals. Each Faction has its distinct characteristic and always consist of the same Heroes, identified by their Hero Sheets and represented by their individual tokens. Each hero can make Base Actions, Special Actions during the game, each Hero has a unique Innate Ability and each Faction has a Faction Ability which gives several options to the players in every round and make the battles very diverse.

You also need to choose one of the four available Battlefields to fight on. Each Battlefield is divided into hexes, which are used to determine the position of Heroes, and the distance between them.

The goal of the game is to eliminate all Heroes from the enemy Faction.

-description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Slide/Push

name: Make Your Choice!
description:
A game that predicts the percentage of cards that will be put into play.

The parent player declares the winning move (to be scored), such as Big (majority) or Small (minority).
Then, everyone puts out their cards at once. Then, check the percentage of cards that came into play, and all the players who put out the cards corresponding to the declaration score!
　
There are cards that have different ratios from the beginning, and there are cards that change the ratio, leading to unexpected developments!
Who can predict the most!?
publishers: クードゥーラパン (Queue de Lapin)

name: Mombatuk's Quest
description:
Mombatuk's Quest is a solitaire, roll and write dungeon crawl.

Journey into the Island of Borneo’s folklore as you play as a fictional character called Mombatuk.

Mombatuk’s Quest is a solo dungeon crawl write and roll game. Plays as Mombatuk the warrior as you take a quest to defeat the biawak leader (indigenous Lizardman) that has been terrorizing the village. You will have to search an abandon” long house” (abandon village) for the secret key to a secret hideout to defeat the biawak leader! Fight your way through numerous biawak soldiers and other dangerous mystical creatures. Gather items and find the traveling merchant and trade for weapons and Elixir for healing to help you on your quest.

—description from the designer

Official link to game
https://thekealf.itch.io/mombatuks-quest
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: DoomRoll
description:
DoomRoll was made for every Gamer that wants to have a ton of fun with their miniatures. DoomRoll is for every Gamer that doesn’t have 5 people around to play but, can always find one. For every Gamer that thinks Warhammer is unbalanced. It was made for every Gamer that wants to play, but doesn’t have the entire day.

DoomRoll was made to improve roll play. To make it simple. To make it fast. To make it fun. Combat is based on percentage. Damage is based on 10 sideds. Armor is subtracted from the total. Each unit class has unique traits allowing game play and strategy to become unlimited. Every game becomes unique.

DoomRoll is balanced and creative. Allowing an infinite selection of landscapes to be created on the Battlemat. With conditions to Victory that go beyond a war of attrition. You can play Capture the Flag in DoomRoll. You can play DoomRoll on a timer. You can play DoomRoll with teams.

—description from publisher

name: From Muskets to Rifles…: Fast Play Wargame for 19th Century Conflicts
description:
From Muskets to Rifles… is based upon C’est la Guerre: Fast Play Wargame for the Age of Muskets. This system was designed to provide a fast yet satisfying game play, not necessarily a “realistic” simulation of battle recreation. Bases or ‘Units’ in the game do not represent a certain number of men or artillery pieces but are abstract representations of force.

From Muskets to Rifles… uses:


a simple command structure to manage battlefield movement without dealing with morale or having the players issue orders,
a troop grading system so that better trained more effective troops can have an advantage over poorly trained less effective troops, and
a method to account for casualties and losses without an overly complicated accounting system.


At the beginning of the 19th Century European armies were mostly armed with smooth bore muzzle loading muskets and bronze smooth bore muzzle loading artillery. These armies fought in dense formations of infantry, and they relied upon the gallant cavalry charging in mass to break enemy lines. Not so very different from the weapons and methods used two hundred years before.

By the end of the 19th Century we see the introduction of machine guns, breach loading and bolt action repeating rifles, metal cartridge ammunition, accurate and powerful rifled artillery, and even the occasional airplane flying through the skies. We also see the mass production and industrialization of warfare that made these new technologies cheap, uniform, and abundant. This period of dynamic change, between the age of the musket and the ‘modern’ mobile warfare we see today, began at some point after the end of the Napoleonic Wars and came to its culmination during World War I. So that will be how we define the time period of ‘19th Century Warfare’ – 1820s to 1910s.

(publisher description)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Frozen Nights
description:
Its been decades since the deadly glaciation which wiped out most of humanity. Now, the Vaults which hosted the remaining survivors are opening, starting a new age for humankind. As the leader of one of these Vaults, your job is to reclaim the ice sheets, along with lost technology and infrastructure. You aren’t the only one who returned to the surface though, and conflict may be brewing in the shadows…

Frozen Nights is a solo civilization game, in which the player will be able to build structures, research technologies and fund the war effort. To win a game of Frozen Nights, the player can either go for the Military Victory, by winning 2 wars, or for the Technology Victory, by completing the tech tree.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Busted Barrel Racing
description:
Busted Barrel Racing is a madcap card game that involves mad tasks and zany challenges. It's a game of card collecting, tile laying, and simple track building. Fans of Rodeo style competition and horse riding will especially enjoy the Western theme of the game. Everyone else will love the zany tabletop card game designed for 2 to 4 players, but best played by 4.

Players take turns drawing cards and laying down tiles, trying to build a zany race course that must zig zag its way around the competition Barrels and back home to the Finish. At the same time players have to maneouver their Horse and Rider along the course, randomly dealing with hilarious physical tasks and challenges. The player who completes a track and makes it home first is the winner.

2-4 players, all ages.
Game play is 30 to 90 minutes depending on the number of players and varying game experiences.

Purchase this game at The Game Crafter: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/busted-barrel-racing

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Racing
mechanics: Action/Event, Multi-Use Cards, Race, Tile Placement, Track Movement

name: Trick o' Roof
description:
The player becomes a roof painter in a certain town, and repaints the roofs using three colors of red, blue, and yellow in response to the instructions of the government office and requests from the residents.

Depending on the status of the request, the roof that was just painted blue by a colleague may be immediately repainted red.

The turn order is determined by trick taking, and chips are placed on a sheet with the image of the roof of a city. Points are scored if you can create a theme sequence consisting of three colors: red, blue, and yellow.

The theme line is won on a first-come, first-served basis, so of course you want to win with tricks, but the player who was lower in the trick can also gain an advantage depending on the result of the previous player repainting the roof or the situation of the theme. Also, during the trick, players who could not follow the lead have a chance to score, making it a play that is not straightforward.

name: オタク騎士くんにやさしいギャル令嬢は存在する。(Otaku Kishi-kun ni Yasashii Gyaru Reijiou wa Sonzaisuru.)
description:
In this world gyaru are friendly to otaku. In some families daughters become gyaru, which otaku who became knight are trying to support while aristocracy is trying to fix them through the disciplinary comitee.

In each of the 9 rounds players play one of the 10 numbered cards, the losing card gets turned, usually loses the card with lower value, however each turn has an event which can change the course of action.

After 9 turns winner is the player whose sum of not turned cards is greater, alternatively if in one round both the gyaru daughter and the disciplinary comitee gets played, the player who played the gyaru daughter immediately loses.

name: Drive! A Travel, Road Trip Game
description: DRIVE! A Better-Than-Bingo road trip game—with the scavenger hunt elements everyone enjoys! Just take five cards in your hands & start spotting clues...in five widely-varied categories. Game is available as a Print & Play digital download via Etsy. Comes with rules and 72 printable cards. Overview: Each of the 5 decks of 12 cards is quite different from the rest. Every player receives one card from each deck. Players must complete their 5 cards in order...going from the D card, to the R card, to the I card, etc. until they've spelled Drive! Very portable.

name: Hack & Slash: Promo Cards
description:
With these 13 new Promo Cards for Hack & Slash, you'll find 9 new quests and 4 new Treasures! Thus giving you more variety and replayability than with the core game and expansion alone.

Contents
9 Quest cards
4 Treasure cards
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Crossbows & Catapults: Castle Battle
description:
Crossbows & Catapults: Castle Battle is a restoration of Crossbows and Catapults, the 1983 classic game of kinetic warfare. Each player builds their castle, then players take turns using their weapons to fire discs at their opponent's castle, trying to knock over their warrior figures.

This new version features highly engineered weapons and building bricks. The new weapons no longer use rubber bands, replaced by spring-powered and pinch-to-fire technology that ensure reliable velocity and reward player skill.

On the building side, castles are constructed using a variety of detailed components to allow for larger, more intricate, and more varied structures.

-description from publisher

name: Sailing Women
description:
The game is a bootleg imitation of the Japanese manga "Pretty Guardian Sailor Moon" which was extremely successful in Italy. As the box says, a 3-Dimension game! (whatever it means...)

The game is for 2-4 players.
You are one of the fantastic Sailing Women and you have to fight Malvaghya, the Queen of the Evil Kingdom, and her evil army.

You move across the board using a spin to determine the movement and the weapon you will use against the enemies (monsters as Terybhlya and Lychantropa) then you have to walk on the dangerous elevated road and you will launch your character against Malvaghya herself to dethrone her and to win the game.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: パチスロシミュレーター (Pachislot Simulator)
description:
Pachislot Simulator is a stochastic deduction game, where players try to determine which of six unidentified stacks of cards has specific makeups.

Each stack of cards has a different population of eight types of cards; one may have an abundance of "grape" cards, and another may have a paucity.

To start the game, the stacks are randomly labeled 1 through 6, and during the game, the players attempt to determine which stack has which makeup. (The makeups are printed on the back of a player screen.)

The game takes place over four rounds, and in each round, the players have 4 minutes to look through the deck(s) of cards and try to do their deduction. More specifically, each player has one deck and a time, and can do the following procedure, in real-time. Look at 3 cards from the top of the deck, and note what you saw. Then, shuffle that deck, look at the top 3 cards, take any notes, and repeat.

After each round of searching, players have a limited amount of time to take notes before the next round begins.

The person to correctly identify the most correct correspondences of the numbered decks to their actual composition wins.

name: Hey Hey it's Saturday: The Board Game!
description:
The game is a traditional roll and move (single die) and when players land on key squares (e.g. Hey Hey, Red Faces, Phunny Foto, Molly's Hat, Plucka Duck, Celebrity Stars, Dikies Van)
, actions are performed. The overall aim is to collect 6 Silver Dongers which can then be traded for a Gold Donger. To win the game a player must be the first player to reach the finish square with a Gold Donger with an exact throw.

The key squares have the following conditions:

1) Hey Hey Cards - Take a Hey Hey Card and do exactly as it says - some my say steal a Silver Donger from another player

2) Red Faces Cards - To a card and either a) perform the impersonation or mine, b) take the dare. If successful, they receive a Silver Donger

3) Phunny Foto Cards - When a player collects two half of the same phunny photo they can exchange for a Silver Donger

4) Molly's Hat - if land on this square get a gold record -
three gold records can be traded for a SIlver Donger. A Gold Record can also be traded with another player for a Phunny Foto

5)Plucka Duck - take a special path and if you land on Play Plucka Duck, do what is on the wheel

6) Celebrity Star - if a character lands on the star of the playing piece character, they get a Silver Donger

7) Dickie's Van - a player only takes the Dickie's Van path if they land on the appropriate square.

From back of game box, the game is described as s "Hilarious Fun for the Whole Family!

"Become your favourite "Hey Hey" character in a game of T.V. hijinks that pits you against your fellow cast members in a fun filled frollick through some of Hey Hey's zaniest segments! Enter Red Faces to impersonate a man wrestling a crocodile or maybe try belly dancing for a dare! Collect the pieces to make your very own phunny foto or try your luck on Plucka's wheel receiving prizes on the way, all in the race for T.V's ultimate accolade - the gold donger!"

name: Explorers State Your Claim
description: US history board game. Use your knowledge about America to claim the most states. Play tactically and steal oponents states. Will you be lucky and win two states with the correct answer includes game board 400 game cards 8 categories 2 spinners instructions and counters

name: Teahouse Ambush
description:
Two contenders for the Imperial Seat meet at a teahouse to ‘discuss’, both are ready to ambush the other.

It is a small tactical and bluffing card game for 2 players. Each player tries to protect their own emperor whilst simultaneously trying to find and kill the opponent.

—description from the designer

name: 花束リボン (Bouquet Ribbon)
description:
Tie the flowers together with a ribbon to create a beautiful bouquet.

You can play 4 types of games using cards with 7 types of flowers and ribbons drawn in beautiful watercolors.

"My Bouquet"
The goal is to arrange the limited 8 cards well and create more and more valuable bouquets.

"Everyone's Bouquet"
Arrange the cards together and make a bouquet.
We aim to contribute to the creation of bouquets by sometimes carpooling, sometimes interfering, and sometimes rushing out of the way.

"Bouquet loop"
Make a bouquet using 8 cards. However, the ribbon must be looped!
Make effective use of special actions (reset tableau piles, rearrange).

"Bouquet Order"
While presenting the flowers ordered by the player next to you, leave the flowers for yourself well to complete a good bouquet.

—description from the publisher (translated)

リボンで花を束ねて、素敵な花束をつくりましょう。

7種類の花とリボンがきれいな水彩で描かれたカードを使って、4種類のゲームが遊べます。

「わたしの花束」
限られた８枚のカードを上手く並べていき、より価値の高い花束を、より多く作ることを目指します。

「みんなの花束」
全員でカードを並べ、花束をつくっていきます。
時には相乗り、時には邪魔し、時には抜け駆けして、花束作りに最も貢献することを目指します。

「花束ループ」
8枚のカードを使って花束をつくります。ただし、リボンはループになっていないとダメ！
特殊アクション（場札リセット、置き直し）も効果的に使いましょう。

「花束オーダー」
隣のプレイヤーに注文された花を差し出しつつ、自分用の花をうまく残して、良い花束を完成させましょう。

—description from the publisher
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: Honey Collect
description: Draw honey pieces from the board to complete sets of 8. The player who gets three sets of 8 honey pieces first wins. If you draw honey equaling 8 you can keep the honey, but if you go over, you lose it.

name: とれにゃーはんたー (Treanyure Hunter)
description:
Cat hunters who search for treasure every day. The site this time is in a mountain where fossils have slept... We have to collect fossils before they are taken by other cats! I want you to lend me your strength as a new member!
Aiming for treasure, the hunters are now on the move!

"Torenya Hanta" is a treasure hunt game where you collect scattered fossils from a random map. Be the first to collect 3 fossils!

—description from the publisher (translated)

日々お宝(とれにゃー)を探すねこハンターたち。今回の現場は化石が眠った山の中…他の猫にとられる前に、化石を集めねば！新たな隊員として君も力を貸してほしい！
お宝を目指して、今、ハンターたちが動き出す！

『とれにゃーはんたー』は、ランダムマップの中から、バラバラになった化石を集めるお宝探しゲームです。誰よりも早く、化石を三つ揃えよう！

—description from the publisher
publishers: 合同会社 スタジオつくし(STUDIO294 LLC.)

name: Desert Generals
description:
Desert Generals is a medium-complexity operational level game of the Desert Campaign, from 1940 to 1942.The game captures the ebb and flow of the North African Campaign from late 1940 to November 1942 with a unique emphasis on leadership and command. The game also recreates critical supply constraints. A player refighting the Desert Campaign, like his real-life counterparts, cannot fight continuously – he launches an offensive, pauses to build up supply, then resumes his offensive…unless his opponent has preempted him and launched his own offensive first. As in real life, offensives tend to run out of gas (literally) as they approach the enemy’s home base.

Historical elements include air support, minefields, engineers, artillery, anti-tank guns, Axis fuel shortages, and Allied command and control problems. From Operation Compass to Second Alamein, Desert Generals covers the Desert War from start to finish.

—description from the designer

name: Dalek
description:
This game is based on the 2005 Doctor Who episode Dalek. A damaged Dalek is being held in a secret underground complex in Utah where the Doctor and Rose find it. The Dalek absorbs Roses’ Time Energy which heals the Dalek and then escapes its cell and attempts to get to the surface. The game represents the escape of the Dalek with three squads of Guards trying to stop it.

You will need a pack of 52 playing cards with two jokers, one Dalek miniature and three Guard miniatures to represent the Guard squads.

The game is set up by placing cards on a table in a 5 by 5 grid pattern to make a playing area, with the playing pieces moving about on them by playing cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Dirty Cheat Racing
description:
DCR (Dirty Cheat Racing) is a game with the theme of a machine race over the universe.
If you run the course and reach the goal, you will get points, and the person with the most points at the end of the 3 rounds will win.
However, even if it's a race, you don't need machine driving techniques to win.
All it takes is a little bit of luck, a sneaky cheat, and a blast of fucking guts!

—description from the publisher (translated)

『DCR（Dirty Cheat Racing）』は大宇宙をめぐるマシンレースをテーマにしたゲームです。
コースを走ってゴールするとポイントゲット、３ラウンド終了時に最も獲得ポイントが多い人が優勝します。
ただしレースと言っても、勝つためにはマシン運転のテクニックなんていりません。
必要なのは、ちょっぴりの運とこっそりのチート行為、そして圧倒的なクソ度胸です！

—description from the publisher

name: Children of the Sun
description:
In Children of the Sun, a two-player strategy game, players take control of the mighty dragon children of Ino'itl, the Sun god. The two were sent to Earth in order to create a beautiful landscape as an ode of love to Xochanama, the Moon goddess forever fated to be out of Ino'itl's reach.

During the game, players draw and place Elemental Tokens onto a 6x6 game board, jumping opponent pieces and flipping them over. For every opponent token jumped, along with the token placed, the player gains corresponding Elemental Resources. Earth, Water, Life, Void, and Spirit.

Resources are used to gain Creation Cards, which represent the fantastic landscape being crafted by the players. Creation Cards come in five different types: Terra, Aqua, Species, Source, and Wonder. Each card type has its own unique scoring mechanic. Terra Cards score for the player who creates the most expansive landscape. Aqua Cards score based on the difference in value from one card to the next. The more varieties of Species Cards you create, the higher your point value. Source Cards grant the player extra resources, and also score for each corresponding Creation Card crafted. Wonder Cards score points for each token flipped to your side at the end of the game.

In addition to scoring, Creation Cards affect each other through an interconnected ecosystem. You must generate enough Terra to support your Aquatic creations, or else they are discarded at the end of the game. Aqua is needed to keep your Species alive, with each species type requiring different amounts of water. If a Habitat Icon shown on one of your Species cards matches a Habitat on one of your Terra cards, you gain valuable bonus points.

Along the way, players can acquire and use Dragon Powers to try and get a one up on their opponent. These abilities include actions like creating additional cards on your turn, flipping tokens on the board, increasing your hand size, and even discarding an opponent's Creation Card. Players can also spend resources to Flourish their Creation Cards, generating more Aqua, Terra, and victory points. And once per game, each player may summon the aid of the Sun god and Moon goddess to recharge their powers or redraw a new hand of Creation Cards.

The winner of Children of the Sun is the player who crafts the most captivating landscape, pleasing the Moon goddess and securing favor from the Sun god!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Várzea
description:
In Várzea, the players of an amateur soccer team must deal with the attacks of the opposing team, the irregularities of the field and a cow.

On each turn the active team may have up to 3 flicks on the ball. Before each flick, the opposing team can move the cow to one of the other black dots on the field. The team must flick the ball at least one time before a goal. If the flick aims to score a goal, the team must announce to the opponent team. After the announcement and before the flick, the opponent team can replace the goalkeeper. The shift ends if the team flicks the ball 3 times, if the team throws the ball out of bounds or if the team scores a goal. The game ends as soon as one of the teams scores 10 goals and becomes champion!

—description from the designer

name: Carbon Lean
description:
In Carbon Lean, you represent a citizen, having the capacity to “consume” different products, goods and services. Each of them has a “carbon cost” in CO2 emissions – calculated in Kilos Equivalent CO2 (kgCO2) according to official and referenced figures. Your objective is to reduce your “total carbon footprint” by choosing products, goods and services that consume the least compared to other players!

The Carbon Lean game can be used in different variants, of increasing difficulty (1, 2 and 3), thus allowing the whole family to play. It also allows you to estimate your own carbon footprint. With its 3 variants, you can play with your children (V1-V2), or race between teenagers and adults (V3).
The publisher advises playing variants 1 and 2 at least once, to better discover the cards and their “cost” in “kilograms CO2 equivalent”, before starting many games of variant 3.

—description from the publisher

name: 有機大富豪 (Organic President)
description:
In 有機大富豪 (Organic President), players use the reactant cards in their hand to move from one molecule to another on the reaction map provided. The first player who depletes their card hand wins.

Different molecules can be present on the reaction map and they can sometimes react together.
Explosive molecules can be created. They will set on fire all other molecules present on the reaction, unless other players use CO2 cards. Whoever manages to extinguish the fire becomes the next player, otherwise the player who started the fire gets another turn.

—user summary

有機大富豪は、有機化学のさまざまな反応を身につけられるカードゲームです！理系高校生はもちろん、大学生や文系でも楽しめるゲーム性がオススメポイント！
有機大富豪では、各プレイヤーが手札を使って反応を起こし、化学変化をまとめたマップ(反応経路図)の上を動き回ることでゲームが進行します。すなわち、ゲームをやればやるほど有機化合物の反応が身についていくのです！！ 勉強は疲れたけど、遊ぶわけにもいかない……そんなマジメなあなたにこそ、有機大富豪をおすすめします！

—description from the publisher

Organic President is a card game where you can learn various reactions of organic chemistry! The recommended point is the gameplay that can be enjoyed not only by science high school students, but also by university students and humanities!
In Organic President, each player uses his or her hand to cause a reaction, and the game progresses by moving around on a map (reaction path diagram) that summarizes chemical changes. In other words, the more you play the game, the more you learn about the reactions of organic compounds! ! I'm tired of studying, but I can't even play... For those of you who are serious, I recommend Organic President!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: ディノスクラフト (Dinos Craft)
description:
Players explore an area of ​​4 squares x 4 squares.
During exploration, you can find materials such as various dinosaurs and ores.
Earn victory points by befriending dinosaurs and creating bases using collected materials!

—description from the publisher (translated)

プレイヤーは4マス×4マスのエリアを探索します。
探索では、様々な恐竜や鉱石などの素材を見つけることができます。
恐竜を仲間にしたり、集めた素材を使って拠点を作成したりして、勝利点を獲得しましょう!!

—description from the publisher
publishers: あんきろわーくす (Ankilo Works)

name: Carbo 覇道の王権 (Carbo Dominant Throne)
description:
It's a fighting game.
Secure territory, increase the number of people, and fight using various items obtained in forests and waterfronts.
Stack pieces to increase your battle score and defeat your opponent.

—description from the publisher (translated)

対戦型ゲームです。
領地を確保し、民を増やし、森や水辺で手に入れた各種アイテムを用いて戦います。
駒を重ねて戦闘点数を増やし、相手を撃破しよう。

—description from the publisher

name: Million Data_ Baby
description:
Welcome to Million Data_ Baby, where you will dive into the ruthless universe of startups ready to do anything to enrich themselves thanks to the personal data of their users.

Here, ethics is relegated to the background, the profitability of the personal data business being the absolute priority.

Competition is fierce and low blows are common in this frantic race to dominate the market and become the biggest data provider!

Each of your applications has a boycott level that limits the collection and resale of personal data. Without mining this data, you will never be able to accumulate valuable crypto-bifs to enrich yourself.

Million Data_ Baby offers many ways to accelerate your growth, whether through hacks, espionage, negotiations or even legal manipulation. However, beware of your competitors, as they will do anything to prevent you from thriving, whether by pursuing justice, rallying whistleblowers, activists, or resorting to piracy.

The road to glory may be strewn with pitfalls, but you are determined to engrave your name in the pantheon of the greatest data traffickers of this world.

So get ready to dive into a ruthless world where data is king, and show the world what you're made of!

All Million Data_ Baby cards, without exception, were created from news articles and public studies. And the worst part is that you have access to all the sources. If you want to feel disillusioned, feel free to wander around our Million Data_ Baby site.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Layering, Pattern Building

name: The Beast's Battles Card Game
description:
Descend into the Beast's undersea world with Kraken Rum.

Deal out the deck of cards and then each player's goal is to collect all the cards and be declared the winner.

The current player will declare one attribute on his card and compare to the rest, the player with the highest wins and takes all the cards and is the current player for the next round. Last player standing is the winner and gets to drink their favourite cocktail.

Basically top trumps gameplay on some nice art cards produced by Kraken Rum as a limited edition bonus gift with their rum.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Party Game

name: Trains on Tracks
description:
In Train on Tracks, player tries to lay railway tiles to connect coal mines to the power station, then trains depart each round. The goal is to create efficient railway layout so that returning empty trains don't block full ones.
The player assumes a role of a railway track company in the age of steam with goal to build railways.
The innovative laying system giving player freedom to create any tracks with almost any intersections.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: The Faceless: Adrian Crossover
description:
Adrian is a Romanian kid who travelled into The New World together with his father who found job as undertaker.

In 19th century there was a lot of work out there and it was easy to find richness with that specific job. Adrian loved the life in the New World, one of his best hobbies was to jump on the various tombs and create funny games with a Wooden Stake.

One night He was still awake when his father went to sleep, a lightning bug entered in his room and He wanted to catch it. The lightning bug escaped but finally Adrian was able to catch it jumping inside one of his fathers’ tombs, when suddenly Billygoat appears.

Compatible with "The Faceless" & "The Faceless - Amusement Park"

—description from the publisher

name: Warp Gate
description:
Choose one card from your hand and place it face down in front of you, revealing all the cards at the same time.
The revealed card determines whether it becomes a meteor or is placed.
The player with the fewest meteors at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

手札から1枚を選んで自分の前に裏面に置き、すべて同時にカードを公開します。
公開したカードによって流星になるか配置するかが決まります。
ゲーム終了時に流星が最も少ないプレイヤーが勝利します。

—description from the publisher

name: Coin Smash
description:
It is a game that can be played with a game card (business card) and one coin.
This is a simple game where you flip a coin with your finger and put it in a business card.
It's a business card, so it's free.

—description from the publisher (translated)

ゲームカード(名刺)とコイン1枚でプレイできるゲームです。
コインを指ではじいて名刺に入れる簡単なゲームです。
名刺なので無料です。

—description from the publisher

name: Universe Duel
description:
You are the creator of the universe. Place beautiful stars to build an enchanting universe. However, if you focus only on making things, you will allow invasion from other creators. Let's create your own universe while making full use of cards so as not to get in the way!

—description from the publisher (translated)

あなたは宇宙の創造主です。美しい星々を配置して、魅力的な宇宙を構築しましょう。 しかし、作ることだけに熱中すると、他の創造主からの侵略を許してしまいます。 邪魔をされないようにカードを駆使しながら、あなただけの宇宙を作り上げましょう！

—description from the publisher

name: 猫 X 東京 ミニ (Neko Kakeru Tokyo Mini)
description:
Worker placement × luck factor
Easy rules that can be played immediately × Advanced strategy and moderate stimulation
Detailed artwork × original cat piece

—description from the publisher (translated)

ワーカープレイスメント × 運要素
即プレイ可能な簡単ルール × 高度な戦略性と適度な刺激
細密なアートワーク × オリジナルの猫駒

—description from the publisher

name: OHANARABE
description:
up, upbringing, borrowed
Grow buds and make your own flowers bloom! The player who makes flowers bloom by arranging 3 flowers in one row vertically, horizontally, or diagonally wins!
Oh, by the way... watch out for those hungry caterpillars!

—description from the publisher (translated)

うえて、そだてて、かりとられ
つぼみを育てて自分の花を咲かせよう！たて・よこ・ななめのどれか１列に３つ並べて花を咲かせたプレイヤーの勝ち！
そうそう、くれぐれも…お腹を空かせたイモムシたちには気をつけて！

—description from the publisher

name: OHANARABE タイル (Tile)
description:
Like the previous ``OHANARABE sold in 2021, the rules have been renewed while maintaining the fun and cuteness of ``playing with flowers blooming on the board! !

This time we will make flowers bloom in the flower bed with tiles.

Again this year, a competition will be held here in OHANA Village to determine the best gardener.

You are an apprentice gardener. If you win this competition, you have a chance to be recognized as a full-fledged person!

Will you be able to win a splendid victory while amazing skills gather from all over the country every year?

—description from the publisher (translated)

前回2021で販売した「OHANARABE」と同様に“盤上でお花を咲かせて遊ぶ”という楽しさと可愛らしさはそのままに、ルールは一新！！

今回はタイルで花壇に花を咲かせます。

今年もここOHANA村で　いちばんの庭師を決める大会が開催されます。

あなたは見習い庭師。この大会で優勝すれば、一人前として認められるチャンスです！

毎年全国からのスゴ腕達が集まるなか、あなたは見事優勝することができるでしょうか？

—description from the publisher

name: Gogasha
description:
This is a top-level game like Old Maid, where two players' karma intertwines. Each player builds a deck of three rounds with four fate-illustrated cards in their hand and on the field, aiming for nirvana at the end of the cycle of samsara by discarding the fate that matches each other's.

—description from the designer

name: Tumble-Top: A Topping Top Game
description:
Tumble-Top: A Topping Top Game is a delightful family game that takes inspiration from the beloved spinning top games of the 1940s and 50s. Players spin tops onto a vibrant, colorful board, each aiming for the top to tumble into one of several holes, each assigned with a different point value. The first to reach a score of 100 is the victor. This game is not only a test of skill but a spectacle of chance and anticipation as players eagerly watch their tops spin, wobble, and finally settle into a scoring hole. Packaged in a retro-inspired box, Tumble-Top embodies the charm and simplicity of yesteryear's games while providing timeless fun for today's families.

—description from the publisher

name: March of the Wicked Horde
description:
March of the Wicked Horde is a card game that simulates fantasy battles. The setting is medieval fantasy including factions such as elves and undead. The gameplay is a mixture of chess-like strategy and mechanics similar to trading card games but with no randomness like shuffling or dice.

Players choose a faction and determine who goes first. They then take turns placing land and units, moving units, attacking, activating schemes and using scheme abilities. There is no board but cards are used as tiles and arranged in a grid relative to other cards. The object of the game is to kill the enemy commander.

The elves hail from forested lands, using assassins with acrobatics and bow tactics to consume an enemy's forces. The undead hordes emerge from graveyards and grow faster as they kill the enemy. New factions are planned and each new faction that comes out will increase the number of players for the game by one.

March of the Wicked Horde is all about skill. There are no dice, no shuffling and no face-down cards to draw. The movement may remind you of chess but units can only be attacked when your threat is greater than the enemy's reinforcement. You may need to pick off weakly reinforced enemy units, pose a greater threat by ganging up on a strong enemy unit, or combine schemes in a clever way. Any two games are very unlikely to go exactly the same way as there are many possible actions on each turn and many layered strategies to experiment with.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement

name: Strategtree
description:
Strategtree is a cardgame consisting of 52 cards with trees on them. Each tree has different properties: Treetop shape (three shapes), treetop color (five colors), trunk color (black or white or both), number of fruit (1-4).
9 cards are laid out on the table in an X-shape. Players take turns placing a card from their hand. It has to match at least one property with each adjacent color. Score one point for each match. Each player also holds on supercard that can be placed on top of an existing card to score extra points. When all cards have been placed, the player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Crimescene
description:
Crimescene is a simple drawing and deduction party game.
At the start of the game, two teams of witnesses are given their 'crime scene' - an animal, a place, a school subject, etc - which only they know but which their detective must guess. Teams take turns selecting from a grid of 25 random transparent cards (clues) with preprinted graphics. They can then use dry-erase markers to draw additions to their clue before placing it onto their detective's investigation sketchboard, painting a picture of their crime scene.
The team whose detective correctly guesses their crime scene from their investigation sketchboard first, wins the game. Watch out though, as opposing witnesses and detectives have ways to keep your mouth shut!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: The Game of Exchange
description:
The object of the game is to collect all cards of one of the seven commodity types (to form a “corner”) by way of trading cards with other players.

Cards are shuffled with seven dealt to each player (the number of commodities in play corresponds to the number of players). The players are given time to arrange their cards and decide which commodity they may wish to corner. The commodities have different point values (coffee 100, eggs 50, etc.)

Play occurs simultaneously with players trading one or more cards with each other. Once a corner is made play ends and that player scores the value of the commodity cornered. The first player to reach 250 points wins the game.

This is Selchow and Righter’s version of the commodity trading games published at the turn of the 20th century. Similar in play to Commerce, Gavitt’s Stock Exchange, and Pit.

name: Moebius Circuit Race
description:
Moebius Circuit Race is a print and play racing game on a moebius strip.

Innovation meets retro style: Play an arcade car racing game like back in the 80's on a sheet of paper!

You only need a pen and one sheet printed double sided for each player.

Tick icons, switch lanes and race, but keep an eye on the skidding risk!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck, Race, Simulation, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: One Card Vegas
description:
Welcome to the world of One Card Vegas, the game that will take you on an exciting journey through the glitz and glamour of a Las Vegas casino... all in one card! The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach $50,000 or be the only player left in the game with money. There are 5 different games available that allow players to win (or lose) money: Roulette, Poker, Slot Machine, Craps and Black Jack. Each of these games is based on the version that is actually played in casinos, but has been adapted to be played on a single card and with a limited number of components.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race

name: 3 & 4: The Game
description:
Two players compete on a circle shaped board, moving their four counters around it.
Cards in their hands indicate coloured triangles and squares that they should form by moving those counters, in order to gain points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Kadri-Cube
description:
Kadri-Cube is a wooden Maze which is played in Teammode. It can be played as a Race 2 vs 2 or you can try to beat the clock or play a full collaborate game.

On one side of the wooden box is the labyrinth and on the other side is the playing area which is plain and where the playing pieces are moved by the players. On the other side you can see the true way without any obstacles and you have to explain the other players how to move. In various modes the communication is restricted.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Communication Limits, Hidden Movement, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Kulling
description: Kulling is a Swiss curling variant played on the table. Two players or two teams try to use a wooden slide to slide their own discs (called Kull) into the target area. Similar to curling, precision is important. Because the pucks with the spinning ball in the middle should come to a standstill as close as possible to the center of the target. If a disc rolls too far, it falls into the penalty area. Playing over the boards and pushing the opponent's discs with your own is allowed. Kulling is also suitable for on the go: the accessories can be stowed in the secured upper compartment and the entire game can thus be transported using the carrying handle.

name: Sourisquick
description: She has to be quick and nimble, the mouse who wants to be the first to climb the peak of the cheese. The higher the players make it in a predetermined time, the more points they get. This requires a lot of skill, after all, with Sourisquick the ball inside the mouse must not roll through one of the cheese holes. The mouse navigates up and around these traps using two drawstrings, which players grasp at their ends and use to navigate the mouse. The choice of the ball - a larger one made of wood and a smaller one made of metal - and the set angle of inclination of the game board (three are possible) determine the level of difficulty.

name: Spirobille
description: Over time, a large number of smaller table games developed from classic billiards, all of which have remained true to the successful basic principle of sinking the ball. The Spirobille also comes from the sphere of billiard-like games, a variation that is as unusual as it is fascinating and whose game principle is extremely simple. A steel ball is brought into play via the center piece and rolls down the sloping field towards one of the players. He should remove the ball from his goal as soon as possible using the flipper lever and, if possible, hammer one of the teammates into the goal. This borrowing from the pinball game that emerged in the early 1950s gave it its current speed. (In its predecessor, the Jeu de Marteau, you still had to maneuver the balls in the direction of the opponent's goals with small clubs.) Spirobille is best played with four players, but it's just as much fun - the vacant goals are then blocked by insertable steel brackets lockable – for two or three people. The Spirobille, which is made entirely in Switzerland, is part of the standard range of so-called toy libraries there – a kind of libraries for games – in which it has to withstand all the requirements of lending. It is accordingly solidly manufactured and lasts far beyond the total exhaustion of the players.

name: Toad in the Hole Game
description: A very old game where the players throw metal disc from 2-3 meters away and try to get the disk in the frogs mouth (most points) or a hole (lesser points). After the throwing you count the points and it is the next players turn.

name: Murder on the Dance Floor
description:
Murder on the dance floor is a groovy twist on a game night classic! a ghastly murder has taken place at the club and the killer is still at large! it is now your job to solve the murder and capture the killer.

Players must use their knowledge and tact to conclusively crack the case, but first all 4 aspects of the crime must be deciphered;

A card-only Cluedo-type game.

name: Codex: The Voynich Manuscript
description:
We go back to the years around 1925.
Embark on a fantastic journey and search for the most enigmatic book in the world – the voynich manuscript, which no human has been able to translate to this day.
It is written in an unknown script and language and profusely illustrated with images of unidentified plants, enigmatic astronomical drawings, and puzzling human figures.
Find the missing pages of the medieval codex and discover the secret behind the magical drawings and mysterious glyphs.
Compete against your competitors and be the first to solve all puzzles. But be careful, agents are on their way to steal your discoveries and knowledge.
And some bibliophiles experts need to be convinced by you before they pass on their key findings to you.
Take advantage of the world's largest Zeppelin airships, airplanes and ocean liners to get anywhere quickly or choose the elegant Orientexpress to meet informants in Constantinople.
Recruit agents to purchase important artifacts ahead of your competitors.
Travel around the world, search for the most mysterious manuscript in the world and find all the necessary information and artifacts to solve the puzzle first.
Who will be the first to solve the big riddle and thus become world famous or keep his occult secret to himself in order to become one of the most powerful people in the world?
Codex is an exciting board game with strategic and cooperative elements for two to six players in the race for one of the greatest riddles of bibliophile and occult history.
The game mechanic is a combination of deck building, set collection, worker placement, area movement and engine building.
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck Construction, Negotiation, Worker Placement

name: Petal Panic!
description:
A 2-4 player hand management game about building a flower crown. You have a choice to collect your flowers from two different decks the forest and the meadow. Manage your hand by trading with the corresponding flower stall so you only have to play what you want to play. Play three of the same color flowers into your basket and get one for your crown. Be on the lookout for the unique wild flowers that can be played as any color! Every time a deck is reshuffled a new seasonal wild flower is placed into that deck. The game ends when someone has completed their crown or when the decks have been depleted 4 times.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Drawing, Hand Management, Market, Pattern Building, Trading

name: 分数陣取りゲーム「フラテリ」(Fraction Territory)
description:
If you place the color pieces that correspond to the fraction cards you have and complete your own color circle, you win!
Double the bargaining! Aim for a one-shot reversal with a function card!
You never know who will win until the end! ? Let's find out which circle will be completed!

—description from the publisher (translated)

手持ちの分数カードに対応した、色ピースを置いて自陣の色円を完成させたら勝ち！
駆け引きが倍増！ファンクションカードで一発逆転を狙え！
最後まで勝負は分からない！？どこの円が完成するかしっかり見極めよう！

—description from the publisher
publishers: ragazzo ragazza laboratorio (ラガラガ・ラボ)

name: fLEAP
description:
You can move forward while freely placing circle chips that indicate your destination.
Area chips can be placed on the route where the piece has progressed, and it becomes your own position.
If you can place all your area chips splendidly, you win! !

—description from the publisher (translated)

自分の行先を示すサークルチップを自由に配置しながらコマを進めていきます。
コマが進んだルートはエリアチップを置くことができ、自分の陣地となります。
自分のエリアチップを見事全て置ききることができれば勝利！！

—description from the publisher

name: VASA Forcebook
description: Gives background and game statistics for VASA players in the VOID / Urban War Universe.

name: Viridian Forcebook
description: Gives background and game statistics for Viridian players in the VOID / Urban War Universe.

name: Spin to Win Words
description:
Spin to Win Words is a simple spelling game. Two to four players make words by spinning letters on an everchanging board. Three-letter words are the primary target, however two- and -four letter words are possible.

Gain points by aligning arrows in lines similar to tic-tac-toe but with letters.

SETUP:

Start with one of the random 3x3 game boards and two stacks of single letters and bigram letters cards.

GAME PLAY:

Each player maintains two cards of each type (single & bigram). Combining two cards, a player calls out a word and spins the top card to point at the player.
When three cards in a straight line point to a player, that player scores one point. However, if the cards are all of the same type (single or bigram), the player scores two points.

Play continues until someone scores 10 points.

—description from the publisher

name: Harvest Festival
description:
It is that time of year! The little mice of the town must share their annual harvest among everyone in the town, as "evenly" as possible, but trying to keep the best part to become the... King/Queen of the Harvest Festival!

Harvest Festival is a no language dependent, family-friendly game that takes the mechanic "I cut, you choose" and gives it a little twist.

In your turn you must play a single card in one of the piles that are in the plaza (Center of the Table) and if the card under the played card matches... You will be able to play another card!

Beware! The time of the day will indicate if the card is played face up or facedown.

Try to get rid of all your cards. This will give you a lot of points! In addition, if you no longer have cards, you can take one of the piles from the plaza to score at the end of the day.

But there is a catch! The leftover pile on the plaza will go to the Mayor, The Festival Organizer! And this will dictate the value of each of the fruits and vegetables of the festival, making them worth many points... Or even zero!

And let's not forget the invited mice, each one of them that you take will ask you for food and if you are the host with the most mice fed, you will get a bonus!

So play your cards strategically, make the piles attractive to everyone and score as many points you can!

At the end of the 3 days of the festival, the player with the most points will be the winner! And the King/Queen of the Harvest Festival!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: The Girl and the Robot: The Card Game – Kickstarter Exclusive Pack
description:
As an added reward for the success of the Kickstarter campaign, Flying Carpet Games teamed up with three indie video game developers to include cards inspired by their games. There are three cards in total:

Insignia's Cursed Hat (King of the Hat)
Weapon: When played, place this weapon face down. After defeating a Demon, you must destroy another weapon on the table if able.

Colos and Suses (The Messenger)
Action: Destroy a weapon on the table or force a player to discard 2 cards.

Yamata no Orochi (Abyss and Dark)
Action: To play this card, you must also discard 2 cards. Destroy 2 weapons on the table if able. Gain 2 Ability Points this turn. Draw 2 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dunkles Verlies
description: You take on the role of Heldo Braveheart and try to find the daughter of King Throngold. You'll venture through the Shadow Forest and into a dungeon. In your search for the princess you will encounter friendly and hostile creatures. But the path itself is a mystery every time. Find the right path through the forest and the walls by correctly placing the available path pieces level by level.

name: La Conquista de los Polos
description:
Game about the epic of the conquest of the Poles during the years 1908 to 1912 with a system of pushing your luck and with historical explorers both in the North Pole and in the South Pole.
Each player will organize an expedition and launch it on an adventure, winning the one that achieves the best milestones (closest to the Poles).


Expeditions are organized by spending money that each Explorer (with a card that represents it) contributes, by means of sledges, animals, provisions and equipment.
The development of each expedition combines chance with Weather and Terrain cards and the decision to push your luck... with Freezing, Hunger or Disorientation problems.
Victory conditions depend on how far the Expeditions go (closest to the two Poles), which will give Victory points.
It can be played alone or with two players and each one can take several Historical Explorers.
mechanics: Connections, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: It's on me!
description:
In It's on me!, players have ingredient cards for making cocktails and recipes for those cocktails. There is also a common deck of ingredients.

During the game, players have the opportunity to draft ingredients out of the common deck and replace with other cards from their personal ingredient pool.

Players will discard recipe cards and then ingredients are revealed from the common pool. If no players can complete a recipe from their hand, reveal an additional ingredient card. If all players can complete a recipe, then the ingredient deck is adjusted again, and players discard additional recipe cards.

However, if only some people can complete a recipe, those recipes are completed and given to a player who could not make one.

The game ends after a number of rounds or when someone is too drunk - based upon the alcohol content of the drinks which have been placed in front of them. The winner is the least drunk player.
mechanics: Contracts, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: CastleScape: Gates and Guilds
description:
In CastleScape: Gates and Guilds, the world of guild competition and castle construction expands into new realms of challenge. Building upon the foundation established in the original CastleScape game, this expansion introduces an array of new features, including the introduction of the ability to build "Gates", as well as an assortment of new cards and guild powers.
