The King is not happy with the simplicity of his castle. There must now be grandiose gates built in desirous locations to augment the grandeur of his might. Guild masters, driven by ambition and a thirst for renown, seek to prove their guild's worth by being the ones to build and control these Gates. To succeed, guilds must adapt their strategies, collect increasingly diverse cards and utilize their guild powers.

Will your guild rise to the king’s call? Prepare to use everything at your disposal to become the victor in the expanding world of CastleScape.

-description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Square Grid, Take That, Zone of Control

name: Salon
description:
August 1863. Preparations begin for the Salon, the largest and most prestigious art exhibition in the world! The Louvre halls will be filled with paintings from floor to ceiling, and you will be one of those responsible for selecting the works.
The task is not easy: hundreds of works have been entered, and you will need to choose the best ones for the room you are curating.

To be successful, it is fundamental to identify which themes are most in vogue this year and to reject the very modern paintings, which have no place in a classic Fine Arts salon, but which may dictate the new directions of art in the future.

In Salon, players bid on paintings with different styles and formats and then place them on their player boards according to the highlight they want to give the selected painting. Paintings not chosen are sent to the Hall of Rejects and may give bonuses to the player who places them there.

Throughout the game, players try to get medals for their paintings, make the themes of their interest more valuable and prepare for the next auctions.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game will be considered the best art curator in the Salon de Paris.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Commodity Speculation, Tile Placement

name: Poo Collection Card Game
description:
Collecting sets of pictures, earning points for completed sets, and strategically using Toilet Cards to flush away opponents' collections. The player with the most points at the end emerges as the winner.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards, and the objective is to form completed sets by either having two cards with the same picture or by connecting pictures. When a player completes a set, they earn a point.

To determine the dealer, a game of rock, paper, scissors is played, and the next player in line draws a card from the dealer's hand. The player who draws the card checks if any pictures line up in their hand, and if they have a completed set, they place the cards in front of them. Then, the next player draws a card from the first player's hand, and this process continues in order.

Players take turns drawing cards and checking for completed sets until everyone's hands are empty. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

Additionally, the game introduces a special card called the "Toilet Card." If a player has two Toilet Cards, they can select a collection of another player's cards, known as a "poo collection," and "flush" it away. The flushed poo and toilet cards are placed together on the side. The Toilet Cards can be used at any time, but if a player holds onto them, another player might take them. Collecting all four types of Toilet Cards grants a bonus of four points.

name: Crane Game
description:
The card game has a theme centered around a crane machine and collecting prizes. The players take on different roles: Chief Officer, Crane Player, Cheerleaders, and Referees. Players aim to accumulate the most prizes and coins to achieve different titles at the end of the game.

To set up the game, the cards are folded and placed on the game board along with a prize. Each player starts with three coin cards. The Chief Officer, Crane Player, and remaining players are assigned their roles.

During gameplay, the Chief Officer gives one of their coin cards to the Crane Player, who acts as the crane operator. The Crane Player uses their hand, mimicking a crane arm, to try and grab prizes from the game board. The Chief Officer verbally guides the Crane Player on the movement of the crane arm.

The Crane Player closes their eyes and moves the crane arm based on the Chief Officer's instructions. The Chief Officer can give instructions to move right, go forward, and drop a prize. The Crane Player tries to grab the prize using their thumb and index finger. If successful, they must rely on intuition to return the prize to the game box without opening their eyes.

If the Crane Player successfully returns the prize to the game box, the Chief Officer receives the prize. However, if the Crane Player fails to grab the prize or drops it midway, their team's turn is over. The game continues with each player taking turns as the Chief Officer and the Crane Player moving to the left.

After everyone has completed a round as the Chief Officer, the second round begins with new assignments. After each player has had three turns as the Chief Officer, the game ends. The player with the highest number of special prizes becomes the "Best Player," while the player with the most coins becomes the "Best Crane Player." The player with the most prizes and coins earns the title of "Crane Master."

name: ともだちあつめ (Friend Atsume)
description:
Strategically collect friends to throw a successful party. Players aim to gather all their friends and score points while competing to be the first to reach 20 points.

At the start of the game, the kigushun cards are shuffled and placed face down. Each player is dealt four cards, and the remaining cards are kept within reach. Players carefully examine their cards and consider which friends they want to bring together.

During their turn, players add a card to their hand and place one card face up in play. The next player can either draw from the deck or take a card from the face-up cards. This process continues until someone is ready to "party."

When a player has five cards and believes all their friends have been gathered, they declare "Agari!" and reveal their cards. Each card is checked to see if all the friends have been collected. Successfully completing the party without any missing friends earns points. Each friend collected is worth one point.

The game continues until a player accumulates 20 points, at which point they become the winner.

name: Balance Tree
description: Players test their stacking skills and hand-eye coordination. The objective is to carefully add colored pieces to a swinging tree structure without causing it to collapse. Each player takes turns rolling the die and placing pieces according to the color rolled. The game incorporates strategy as players must decide where to add their pieces, considering the stability of the tower and the availability of colors. The tension escalates as the tower becomes more precarious with each new addition. The player who topples the tower by causing the pieces to fall loses the game.

name: Marshals Unleashed, Waterloo
description:
Experience unparalleled Napoleonic wargaming as you step onto the legendary battlefield of Waterloo on June 18, 1815. Witness the strategic brilliance of Wellington as he establishes a formidable defensive line along the Ohain Road, with key strongholds at Hougoumont, La Haye Sainte, and Papelotte farms. Command renowned leaders like Emperor Napoleon, Marshal Ney, General Kellerman, and General D'Erlon, and even alter history with the arrival of Marshal Grouchy, providing support to Napoleon's forces. With a high-quality battle map, unit displays, icons, and easy-to-follow game instructions, customize your army, unleash your strategies, and embark on an exhilarating gaming adventure.

Take command over 100 units per side and experience realistic Napoleonic-era battles like never before with our Waterloo game. Our game is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy an immersive strategy game without needing an in-depth knowledge of the era. You'll be able to easily apply tactics and benefit from an outstanding gameplay experience. Feel the responsibility over your army as you make decisions in this thrilling recreation of Napoleon Total War.

Game content

The Waterloo ready to build edition offers an extensive range of content designed to enhance your gaming experience. Here are the key components included:


Campaign Map: Immerse yourself in the epic battles of Waterloo with a meticulously crafted campaign map. Measuring 160 x 90 cm (62.99 x 35.43 inches), this high-quality map is constructed from frontlit waterproof material that is both durable and easy to clean.



Unit Displays and Stickers: Bring your armies to life with customizable unit displays and stickers. The unit displays, crafted in polystyrene plastic, provide a sturdy platform for showcasing your troops. Utilize the waterproof stickers to easily mark and differentiate units, ensuring clarity during gameplay. These stickers are designed to withstand prolonged use, ensuring durability throughout your gaming sessions.



Dice: Enhance the element of chance with four specially designed dice. Each die is equipped with stickers that correspond to the game mechanics, adding an extra layer of excitement to your strategic decisions.



Damage Icons and Timeline Icons: Keep track of the unfolding battle with the included damage icons and timeline icons. These stickers allow you to monitor unit status and track the progression of events on the battlefield, contributing to a dynamic and immersive gaming experience.



Extensive Unit Variety: Experience the full breadth of the Waterloo conflict with a comprehensive collection of 247 units. This includes:



118 French army units
51 British army units
32 Dutch army units
10 Brunswick corps units
36 Prussian army units
10 Generals



Gaming time: up to 4 hours and more. Play 1vs1 or 2vs 2.

—description from the publisher

name: Cry of the Stars
description:
Fight through three waves of enemy ships, preserving your own hull integrity, upgrading your ship from salvaged enemy craft.

Place cards representing enemies and choose a path through, taking on each enemy in turn. Various strengths of enemy craft, with predetermined attack patterns.

Each battle takes place using dice, player choosing one of two weapon options (missile or lasers) and rolling dice to attack, either matching a pattern or rolling a dice sum greater than the enemy shield value. Then the AI enemy responds and the pattern repeats until one is destroyed.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Leitin að stjörnunni
description:
Dive into the realms of Icelandic and international music and film culture with this exciting board game. The game features 700 thought-provoking questions and puzzles that challenge your knowledge and critical thinking skills. With one beautifully crafted game board and 10 game pieces, players can participate in teams or as solo competitors.

The game mechanics are straightforward - players take turns asking each other questions and solving intriguing puzzles that span a variety of categories, including general trivia, quote excerpts, finish the song lyric, multiple choice, true or false, and even fun activities like singing and acting. Aim to reach the final spot on the board to emerge as the champion. Once you secure victory, you're crowned the star, a symbol of your triumph and knowledge.

This crown can be worn to showcase your achievement to friends and family, signifying that you're truly gifted in navigating the fascinating world of music and film culture. A perfect choice for family game nights or social gatherings with friends, this game offers endless hours of fun and entertainment. The game also includes easy-to-follow instructions to ensure a seamless playing experience.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Penalty Kick
description:
An early British two-player action game, simulating Association Football (Soccer) Penalty Kicks. The game consists of two opposing plywood figures: the penalty taker and a goalkeeper in a wooden goal frame. The object is to score most goals by shooting the ball into the goal using the Striker's spring-loaded leg. The goalkeeper attempts to save the shot by moving across the goal mouth along a horizontal wire guide.
A simple game typical of the period, it dates from the early 1950's.

name: Rundfahrt mit dem Zuge
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The First player to reach space 50 wins the game. If a player rolls more eyes than he needs to reach space 50 has to start anew from the beginning!
On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Journey Through the Center of the Earth
description:
Journey was originally designed to be included in an issue of Dragon magazine, but was rejected. Tom Wham revised it to be published as a giveaway for GaryCon XII.

In the game up to four explorers travel through a hollow Earth in search of treasures. Movement is from one "decision point" to the next; on a turn a player assigns dice sides to the arrows leaving their current point as they wish, then roll a die which determines which one is used. If a hazard/reward area is entered the player rolls on a table to determine what they gain or lose.

Players cannot exist on the same space and so bump each other, but the player being bumped decides where they move to.

Players are each given two random special abilities at the start of the game.

The game ends when all players have exited the map or when the treasure deck runs out; at that time the player with the greatest total value of treasure wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dish of Spurs
description:
Dish of Spurs (DoS) is a set of miniature rules for skirmish actions during the Border Reivers period.

In DoS players lead bands of raiders or the forces out to stop them. Each unit gets two actions per turn with which they may move, shoot, herd cattle, break down doors, etc. Captains confer bonus actions on their troops and heroes inspire their fellows to greater bravery.

Actions generally require a die roll to succeed, and all dice are normal d6. To shoot for example, you must roll higher than your shoot score. To rally, you must roll higher than your morale.

The game is scenario driven, with victory varying according to circumstance. A raider may win by getting a certain number of cattle off the board, the local marshal wins by preventing them. Or perhaps two clans fight over a wedding, one seeking to prevent the union, the other to see it carried through.

The game includes an optional hidden movement rule which while slowing play adds a lot of nuance to the tactics of each side.

-description from designer

name: Keelhauled!
description:
Yarr Matey! Rumors be floating about, with tales of great fortune said to lie on Treasure Island! Be the first to make it there and you’ll be rich beyond compare! But beware, you aren’t alone on this journey, as it seems some other scallywags have decided to hunt for the treasure as well. There’s only one way to be sure they don’t get there before you do- you’ll have to send them to Davy Jones’ Locker!

Overview:

Keelhauled is a deck-building game in which 2-8 players take on the role of pirate captains to see who can be the last captain standing. During the course of the game, players will gain weapon, crew, tool, and ship cards from the cargo deck to build their decks. Along with gaining cards, players will draw cards from the seas deck to represent scenarios that take place on their voyage throughout the game, as well as fighting deadly sea monsters from the monster deck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Drawing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Farm & Weeds
description: This is your farm where you grow different types of vegetables and fruits as seasons changes it's time to harvest them. But wait there are weeds growing up as the seasons passing by. its your job to clear them all and harvest your crops properly. good luck.

name: Mortal Kin
description:
Step deep into the shadow for only then you might find what you seek. Embrace the darkness sewn from flesh and become one with the truth. Explore, grow and learn, loot, and gather. Escape the death’s blade by a hair and you might be rewarded. Survive, combine and, through great effort, lead your mortal to victory against both horrors of the world and the ones within. If you don’t like the feeling of a knife being stabbed into your back, only trust yourself. At all times. Your decisions will be your ultimate weapon. Wield the artifacts of the fallen gods and unravel the history behind the curtains of massacre. Make sacrifices along the way and rise. Be cunningly humble and fearlessly greedy. Forcing your own playstyle against the game or your fellow players will be the pillar of your ascent. Or your downfall. Test your limits, concentration, tactical thinking, and stomach in the world of Mortal Kin. The world abandoned by hope and the gaze of gods alike.

Mortal Kin
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Tussle For Victory
description:
A new racing game to be 3D printed. Between skid marks, fouls and brawls a real fight to finish first!

The game stipulates that the one who crosses the finish line first wins.

The first feature of the game is that you can draw your track!

When you were kids, how many times did you play with toy cars or with toy bricks and draw the tracks on which you could let your imagination run? We did it a lot of times!

And that's where the game came from, from the idea of recreating those tracks, but playing them as a game with well organized rules.

Every car plays its turn and it can execute some actions: select the gear that will designate the maneuvers to execute, select the silhouette of a maneuver, place it on the board in front of the "pins" and determine the movement of the car, and finally fight and use the special abilities that every character possesses.

And off to victory!

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Racing, Wargame

name: Puzzler's Quest: World of Wonders
description:
Assemble a vintage map puzzle and print and solve mysteries hidden within the map.

This game uses the 1939 World Wonders map produced by Ernest Dudley Chase. It is a highly detailed pictorial representation of known historical and geographical facts at the time.

Players cooperate to first assemble the puzzle into a map.

Players then print individual quests that can only be solved by examining the map. A quest is solved by decoding a mysterious sentence with hidden words.

Each quest consists of a series of questions. Players examine the map to locate each answer and write the answer into the empty boxes on the printed page. At least one letter of the answer is highlighted and that letter relates to one of the mystery words.

Once all words have been found, their letters are collected and unscrambled. Once the words are ordered correctly, the mystery sentence is decoded.

An example of a mystery sentence to decode:
Columbus hid the obelisk in Montevideo.

Players may work together or solve their own mysteries.
Unlimited random mysteries can be generate forever.

This puzzle is part of the Pluzzables series of puzzles that each turn into board games. In this case, Puzzler's Quest is also a print and play game.

—description from the publisher

name: FlickrRails
description:
A two-player, area majority game of reversed and connected rails, where each player uses white and black rail chips to expand their own track by sandwiching and reversing their opponent's chips, connecting longer rails being the goal of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction

name: Manafolds
description:
Manafolds is a fantasy-themed trick-taking/area control game. You lead a faction that is aligned primarily with one of six manafold types. Manafolds, also called “folds", are magical locations, each with unique characteristics. You seek to deepen your knowledge of the folds, channeling energies from them to best your rivals and gain the most Prestige.
You win a game of Manafolds by having the most Prestige after three Ages or being the first player to reach 20 Prestige, whichever comes first. The majority of Prestige points that you can earn come from securing Titles. Titles can be granted through ruling manafolds, fulfilling card-based objectives, and other unique goals.

Each Age consists of four Encounters, preceded by a bidding session to determine the player who will lead the Age’s first Encounter and dictate which fold is exalted (i.e. the “trump” suit). Exalting a manafold suit grants you the privilege of setting the Titles that provide Prestige points, and the exalter must make their bid in points from these Titles in order to avoid losing any Prestige.

At the start of each Encounter, the lead player will take a turn, which involves playing an Encounter Card from their hand and taking some actions. Some of these actions for example will let you move your units between manafolds, deploy more units, attack other factions, and increase your chances of winning encounters. In turn order, each other player will similarly take some actions and play an Encounter Card, following suit if able. After all players go, the winner is determined, which is the player whose played card is in the lead suit with the highest power, unless bested by an exalted-suit card. The winner chooses an Encounter Effect (a boon from any one of the played cards), claims all played cards, and leads the next encounter. After all encounters have been resolved for a given Age, Prestige is awarded, followed by a transition to the next Age.
As the game arcs, players will be deepening their skill and understanding of the folds (making corresponding actions stronger), gaining more mana discs to be able to take more actions during their turns, and acquiring powerful Relics, further enhancing their own unique action tableaus. Will your faction be immortalized through the tales of the people, or will you be forsaken? Only time will tell…

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Augmented Reality Tiermemo
description:
Bring your matching game to life! In this classic game, you try to find two identical animals by uncovering them. Using your smartphone, the animals come to life on your table and move. From roaring lions to pecking chickens, the animals are ready for you to discover!

To play the matching game without the smartphone app, all you need are the playing cards. These are shuffled face down and laid out. The first player turns over two cards of their choice. If they show the same animal, they can take the cards and place them in front of them. In this case, the player gets another turn to flip over two more cards. If the cards show two different animals, they are turned face down again after all players have had a chance to see them. The next player's turn begins and they can turn over two cards of their choice. The game ends when there are no cards left. The winner is the player with the most cards at the end.

The game with the free smartphone app follows the same rules. Instead of turning over cards, animated 3D models of the animals appear.

-description from publisher

name: PLANE!: An air travel trip game
description:
PLANE! is a better-than-bingo airplane trip game—with the scavenger hunt elements everyone enjoys! Just take five cards in your hand & start looking for clues...in five widely-varied categories. And the best part is, you and your playing mates will be the only ones "in on the secret" and everyone else sitting near you will wonder what y'all are up to. Recommended player count: 2 to 4. There are 50 total cards—5 categories, 10 cards in each.

—description from the designer

name: Frondeurs et Frondeuses
description:
Frondeurs et Frondeuses is a political game about the events that took place in France between 1648 and 1652 AD, collectively known as the FRONDE, a 'time of troubles' when the famous Sun King was just a boy and his regime was struggling with a broken economy, unpaid armies, and over-mighty subjects. The Fronde had many facets. This game focusses on high politics and intrigue, involving four key factions: the Mazarinists, who aim to preserve the status quo and save the state from bankruptcy; the Cabalists (les Cabale des Importantes), a group of high aristocrats who want Mazarin gone and their own power augmented; the Retzists (pronounced ‘reyists’) under Coadjutor Retz, who also want Mazarin gone so that Retz can take his job; the Condéeans, following the Great Condé, who aims to turn himself into a new ‘Mayor of the Palace’. Apart from these selfish aims, each side sees itself as defenders of the King, the young Louis XIV. There is no thought of supplanting him, but all want to be in the most advantageous position when he reaches his majority. Meanwhile, the lower classes groan under high taxation and shortages. They demand an end to the ceaseless war with Spain. Or else.

You will play one (or more, if the player count is less than 4) of the four factions, seeking both political and military influence among your peers. Will you champion the cause of the common folk (whether honestly or cynically) to exert leverage on the Crown, form networks among the noble houses to oppose the will of your rivals, or rely on the Army to crush all opposition?

The game uses the same mechanics as RSG’s popular Parcel o’ Rogues. Action cards allow you to place and remove cubes of your colour from a board representing the connections between those people, places, and institutions who were relevant to the Fronde. Having Influence (your cubes) in a location allows you to score it; locations score for both their political and military value. Special Season cards advance the turn marker and trigger various events. Rules unique to this game include the arrest of certain individuals, military campaigns on the frontiers, the ability to make a Royal Progress, Spanish Gold, Mazarin‘s cunning use of voluntary exile to confuse his opponents, and the presence of the resourceful d’Artagnan and the Three Musketeers!

—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Political
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Dinn: Metal Mace
description:
Promo card exclusive with online order of Chapter Pack 2.

The equipped Hero is immune to your opponent's card abilities.

name: Dinn: Pooka
description:
Promo card exclusive with online order of Dinn: Horror Starter Deck.

All cards entering the graveyard this round are banished.

name: Space Travel
description: Answer solar system themed quiz questions to place your tokens on each of the planets (and Pluto).
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Traveller Ascension: Master Engineer Pack
description:
Can you fix it? YES! YOU CAN!! With the Master Engineer add-on pack take advantage of new events to help build your outposts, repair your ships and increase your Power throughout the sector.

Contains 16 cards and one Faction panel.

name: Waters Edge: Expand Your Shoal
description:
An expansion to add 5 or 6 players

Invite two more recruits to your game with extra base cards and other essential extras found in this expansion pack.

Expand your Shoal includes new buildings and fish to enhance the artwork of your base game, making it a fun addition no matter how many players are joining your next game.

This expansion contains 36 cards and a manual presented in a tuck box.

—description from the designer

name: Waters Edge: Ahoy There
description:
Waters Edge is facing a pirate mutiny... add this expansion pack to your base game and prepare yourself for lots of pirate malarkay!

Captain S. McGull is on top form alongside fishy plunder, ghost fish, desert islands and canon fire.

Will you survive a week in Waters Edge?

This expansion contains 36 cards and a manual presented in a tuck box.

—description from the designer

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Petrichor Sleeves and Stechhelm Promo Cards
description: This is a promo set consisting of the Petrichor Sleeves and Petrichor Stechhelm Gear cards, as well as a related Glossary card. This promo card was included with the Mist - Raikin Armor miniature, which itself is not part of the game.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Flipping Frenzy Card Game
description:
Join Greg, Rowley, Manny and the whole Diary of a Wimpy Kid crew in this super fast card game! Everybody plays at once as they try to make the longest chain of cards - without repeating characters or colors! Easy-to-learn gameplay keeps everyone having fun and is perfect for travel!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Raccoon Restaurant
description:
In this thrilling board game, you step into the paws of mischievous chef raccoons on a culinary quest to open the most sought-after eateries in the forest.

Each round consists of a gathering phase and a feeding phase. In the gathering phase, chefs may dig through 2 trash cans for ingredients by flipping over food chits. They have 30 seconds to gather as many ingredients as can fit in the bowls at their food stand. In the feeding phase, chefs draw patron cards and attempt to satisfy the unique food requests at the bottom of each patron's card. At the end of 5 rounds, the chef who has served the patrons with the highest total points claims victory for their restaurant!

With its whimsical theme, unique gameplay mechanics, and strategic decision-making, Raccoon Restaurant is a thrilling culinary adventure that will keep you on your toes!

—description from the designer

name: Würfel-Spiel Chassez-Croisez
description:
4 people take part in the game, each has a color.
The colored number tiles are placed on the dots of the same color.
The players take turns to roll the 3 dice and the number tile thrown is moved forward one space. If you roll one of your own numbers, you can roll the dice again. The tile may only be moved straight ahead or diagonally, never sideways. If the path is blocked by other numbers, the tile thrown is not moved any further.
If a number tile that has already reached the opposite square of the same color is thrown again, the owner may move another of his tiles one space forward.
The first player to get his 4 numbers on the squares of the same color is the winner.

The game was published about 1900.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: War in India: Scenarios 1798-1846
description:
From the First Mysore to the First Sikh War. 130 pages all colour illustration. Orbats and and Maps. Comprehensive section for MAD DOGS & ENGLISHMEN Rules or any other ones you fancy. In this scenario book they have included 42 scenarios, allowing you to explore some of the key battles that led to the birth of British India.

–description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mad Dogs & Englishmen: Wargaming India 1798-1859
description:
The 1st volume catered for colonial wargaming across a fairly long time line and in multiple theatres. This new 2nd volume is honed back to India alone, but seeks to split the conflicts across a time span of around 60 years, effectively from the 4th Anglo-Mysore War to the Indian Mutiny.. For 15-28mm figures, the more the merrier. Card enhanced set of rules.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Mad Dogs & Englishmen: 2nd Edition – Add On Pack
description:
New Scenarios; Campaign ideas, Solo play rules; Quick Reference sheets; Card sets to save you cutting up your precious copy.

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Witch Night
description:
Witch Night is a party game for witches. Players roll and move forward on a track. Each field they land on marks a category for which they draw a card. The cards tell them to answer a question or perform a creative or silly task within one minute. If successful, they can proceed to roll again.
A witch that reaches the central field will have to draw a card from each of the six categories. If they can fulfill at least four of the six tasks, they win the game.
Each witch also holds two special cards, a positive and a negative one. These can be used once in a game. The positive card gains you an advantage, the negative card can be used as an obstacle to another witch.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mythology, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Drawing, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kess
description:
Kess is a two-player, abstract strategy board game where players move their pieces around the board trying to capture each other's pieces. Players take turns moving five spaces (using one or more of their pieces) trying to surround the opponent's pieces on three side to remove them from the board. Claim victory once your opponent has only two pieces left.

Strategic enough for skilled players, but easy enough for children, Kess can be taught in three minutes and played in twenty.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending

name: After Dinner Amusements: Love Trivia
description: Flowers, a candlelit dinner, and love trivia - a perfect combo! Take turns pulling a card from the deck and read the question out loud. Whoever answers the question correctly gets to keep the card. The player with the most cards when the last card is played wins!

name: 01VERSE
description:
Programming with a board game.
Program battle of hackers unfolds in the virtual world 01verse! This is the discussion room where you can enjoy both battles and solos. Optimize your program!

Player plots a marker to action card. Action card activates from upper side. The card affects to life points. Player aims for zero life point.

name: Relic & Ritual
description:
Welcome to the world of Relic & Ritual! In this world, you play as a young sorcerer’s apprentice who has gotten access to a secret and powerful altar where you can claim special relics and perform arcane rituals. Capturing and placing these relics on your personal tablet opens a powerful portal which allows you to claim victory over other sorcerers’ apprentices who are attempting to do the same thing. You must focus on collecting the right relics in the right order to perform these formidable ancient rituals. The apprentice that scores the greatest number of victory points when the first portal is opened wins!

Relic and Ritual is played over a series of turns. Players complete turns in order before the next player takes their turn. Turns proceed clockwise around the table. Turns are taken until the end game condition is met.

A player’s turn consist of ALL of the following actions taken in this order:

Activate 1x Ritual (Optional and at any point during the turn)
Select an Eye (Mandatory)
Sleep Walk (Optional)
Jump using the Eye (Mandatory)
Capture Relic(s) (Mandatory)
Take Sleep Stones (Mandatory)


Activate 1x Ritual (Optional and at any point during the turn)

Players’ examine their Personal Tablets to determine if they have collected enough relics to activate a ritual.
Players’ may then select ONE (1x) ritual to active once during their turn.
Players’ may active a ritual the SAME TURN they acquire the 5th relic for the row necessary to activate the ritual.


Select an Eye (Mandatory)

Selecting an Eye is an action that a player MUST take on their turn.
This involves the player selecting an Eye that they wish to move on this turn. This can be either the “All Seeing Eye” which all players can move OR it can be the player’s Own Eye. -A player can only move EITHER the All Seeing Eye OR their Own Eye during their turn.


Sleep Walk (Optional)

Sleepwalking is an OPTIONAL action that players MAY take on their turn.
Players may “Sleep Walk” during their turn prior to jumping and capturing pieces.
Movement requires the ONE Sleep Stone per Unoccupied Space moved.
Moves can only be completed from an Unoccupied Space to an Unoccupied Space.
Players may ONLY take Sleep Stones from (1x) row on their Personal Tablet during their turn (therefore the maximum number of spaces that a players can sleepwalk during their turn is 5x).
Players may NOT visit the same space TWICE when Sleep Walking.


Jump Using the Eye (Mandatory)

Jumping is an action that each player MUST do on their turn.
Jumping involves moving a selected Eye in a straight line from the Occupied Space of the Eye to ANY Unoccupied Space in the straight line.
Players may skip over Unoccupied Spaces in a straight line.
Players may skip over the All Seeing Eye; other players’ Eyes; and event their second eye when jumping in a straight line.
Any Relics that are “jumped” over may be captured by the player.


Capture Relic(s) (Mandatory)

Capturing Relics is an action that each player MUST do on their turn.
[Multiple Relics MAY be captured using the “Ritual of Speed.”]
The player MUST take the captured relic(s) and place them on their appropriate location(s) on their Tablet.
Relics types that have NOT been captured previously are placed in the NEXT Unoccupied Row on the Tablet.
Players MUST select at least ONE Relic to capture on their Jump.
Players MUST first select relics that are capable of being placed on their Tablets prior to prioritizing other relics.
If ALL options for Relics to capture would result in their Tablet being completely full then the Game Ends Immediately.


Take Sleep Stones (Mandatory)

Taking Sleep Stones is an action that each player MUST do on their turn.
After a player has captured the Relic(s) during their jump and placed them on their board; they determine if AND how many sleep stones they must take during their turn.
The number of sleep stones that a player takes is based on the number of unoccupied spaces surrounding their eye.
An Unoccupied Space is a space that lacks either the All Seeing Eye; a Player’s Personal Eye; a Relic; or a Sleep Stone.
Players ADD sleep stones to their Tablet based on the number of Unoccupied Spaces around their eye.
It is possible that a space is completely surrounded by occupied spaces. In this case the player does not take any sleep stones.
Players may add sleep stones to their Tablet in ANY empty space not occupied by a relic or another sleep stone.
Sleep Stones on Tablets prevents the placement of relics on these spaces.
Sleep Stones may be removed through Sleep Walking.
Each Sleep Stone counts as NEGATIVE points at the end of the game based on the row where they are placed.
If a Player must take Sleep Stones and there are no more available spaces to place them on the Player’s Tablet; then the Game Ends Immediately.


End of Game

The Game Ends IMMEDIATELY when one of the following conditions occur:

A player’s tablet is COMPLETELY full with Relics and/or Sleep Stones. This means that all spaces are occupied by one or the other.
A player must take Sleep Stone(s) and there are no longer any unoccupied places for them on the Player Tablet.
ALL Relics on the Altar have been Captured
The Game Ends Immediately. No further turns are taken by any players.


Determining a Winner

Players’ calculate scores according to the relics they have captured according to the row the relic occupies.

Relics on Row 1 are worth 1 Point Each
Relics on Row 2 are worth 2 Points Each
Relics on Row 3 are worth 3 Points Each
Relics on Row 4 are worth 4 Points Each
Relics on Row 5 are worth 5 Points Each
Relics on Row 6 are worth 6 Points Each


Sleep Stones count as negative points against the player.

Sleep Stone placement counts as negative points based on the row it occupies.
Sleep Stones on Row 1 are worth -1 Point Each
Sleep Stones on Row 2 are worth -2 Points Each
Sleep Stones on Row 3 are worth -3 Points Each
Sleep Stones on Row 4 are worth -4 Points Each
Sleep Stones on Row 5 are worth -5 Points Each
Sleep Stones on Row 6 are worth -6 Points Each


The player with the highest score is the winner.

Resolve ties in the following order:

The player with the least Sleep Stones is the Winner.
The player with the most Row 1 Relics is the Winner.
The player with the most Row 2 Relics is the Winner.
The player with the most Row 3 Relics is the Winner.
The player with the most Row 4 Relics is the Winner.
The player with the most Row 5 Relics is the Winner.
The player with the most Row 6 Relics is the Winner.
If the tie cannot be resolved then the victory is shared.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Static Capture

name: Ship's Wheel
description: Ship’s Wheel is the game that rewards being different. Develop new strategies as you try to collect cards that are NOT similar in any way. It can be a valuable and fun teaching tool for younger players! The object of the game is to avoid and get rid of cards that are the same shape or color so that nothing matches. The winner will be the first to have cards that are all different in shape and color (or use wild cards).
publishers: The Ship's Wheel Card Game Company, LLC

name: Log Cabin
description:
Welcome to the Canadian mountains, where pine trees scrape the pale blue sky and bears are snoozing in snowy burrows. You have inherited a quaint little log cabin with one empty room. Tenants are eager to stay in this remote and picturesq location but they require a little more than a hardwood floor. Time to get out your best lumberjack coat and trusty hammer - it's renovatin' time!

Players take turns drawing resource and event cards throughout winter and summer, then spend resources to add furniture, comforts and additional rooms to the log cabin to appease paying tenants. Each tenant has unique requests. Watch out for nasty termites and other disruptions and be sure to take advantage of any trade opportunities with other players. The first player to 12 coins wins.

—description from the designer

name: Pik Qwik
description:
Flip over a card and be first to make a word from the letter tile pile in the middle. Hit the buzzer when you do and score!

There are 4 categories: Same Name, Mix Up, On Topic, and Rhyme Around. When you flip over one of these cards you must follow the rules of it and create a word faster than your opponents.

—description from the publisher

name: Neither King Nor God
description:
A strategy game for 5 players in Europe in the Age of Renaissance

Mercenaries in the 16th century didn’t believe in a religion common to all of their comrades nor did they follow faithfully one and the same ruler. They didn’t care about confession nor country borders. They only followed the sound of drums and fought for whoever paid the most.

You lead one of five factions that played an important role in Central Europe: England, France, Habsburg Spain, the Papacy and the Italian City States in its vicinity or The German Holy Roman Empire.

To win the game you need to control a certain number of regions and need to maintain or convert a certain number of centers to the confession of your faction. Victory conditions for each faction are different and as some factions aim for a certain confession in the centers, they help their opponents fulfilling their victory conditions. In addition to that the English player may win the game if the continent is overrun by the troops of the Ottoman Empire.

To achieve your goal of the game you send out at the beginning of a turn members of your court to various centers in Europe where they fulfill tasks in your name. Your diplomats, your generals, admirals and spies. These will affect the possibilities of your actions in the regions of Europe. Your merchants will try to ensure your share of the market potential in a region, your bishops will try to convert a Center’s confession.

A turn starts by each player increasing their treasury. For each “Barrel” on the map players increase their income by 1. Players may then recruit new armies, build new fleets and most importantly instruct members of their court. Players buy new “Barrels” that they plan to place on the map.
After increasing their treasury, building new units, players send on journey their “Members”. The starting player first places one of his Members with its identity face down in one of the Centers on the game map. The following player does the same. If he wishes to place his Member in the same Center, he places his Member on top of the player before him. One after another the players place their Members one by one. They build stacks of Members in the Centers of Europe. When all Members are placed, their identity is revealed one by one, from top to bottom, and they execute their possible actions. Members allow players to move units, take a share of a market in a region, lay siege on Centers, fight battles, try to convert the confession of a Center, explore the New World and so on.

If a player fulfilled his victory conditions at the end of a turn he reveals his Victory Card and is declared the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tactiques Issue #6
description:
This is the sixth issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 8 ASL scenarios, 11 overlays and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le Franc Tireur".

Publication date: June 1994.

Contains 48 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: Les américains dans la bataille du bocage (Cobra : la rupture, Le dernier bocage, Les bleus et les gris (29th US division), bibliographie) - historical articles
-Tactique: Saut de haies (article on bocage and walls in ASL)
-Tactique: Pris au piège? (article on attack and defense in bocage)
-Tactique: Furia Germanica (analysis of Kampfgruppe Peiper I)
-Tactique: Prises de tête (ASL Q&A rules)
-11 overlays involving hedges/bocage hexsides

-10 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC43: Massacre au Paradis
ASL TAC44: Drame Libanais
ASL TAC45: Rakkasan Butaï
ASL TAC46: Les Démons des Glaces
ASL TAC47: Des Roses pour Vandervoort
ASL TAC48: Pris au Piège
ASL TAC49: Des Fauves aux Abois
ASL TAC50: Task Force Smith
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tactiques Issue #7
description:
This is the seventh issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 8 ASL scenarios and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le franc tireur".

Publication date: December 1994.

Contains 48 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: La campagne de Tunisie (Le piège tunisien, Le second soufle, Tristes djebels, Les RCA en Afrique du Nord, Bibliographie) - historical articles
-Tactiques: Planté dans le désert (article on desert rules for ASL)
-Tactiques: Sus au hillock (analysis of TAC40 Cauchemar Ecossais)
-Tactiques: Prises de têtes (ASL Q&A on rules)
-PBDYO: Platoon-based design your own for Italians and French during Tunisia campaign
-Local informations
-8 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC51: L'Union fait la Force
ASL TAC52: L'Armée du Bout du Monde
ASL TAC53: Victoire à la Pyrrhus
ASL TAC54: Nel Nome di Roma
ASL TAC55: Carrefour Dangereux
ASL TAC56: Les Petits du Renard
ASL TAC57: Dernier Baroud
ASL TAC58: 29 Let's Go
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tactiques Issue #8
description:
This is the eighth issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 10 ASL scenarios, 7 overlays and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le Franc Tireur".

Publication date: June 1995.

Contains 48 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: La Fin de la Guerre en Europe (Le Dernier Acte, Combats de rue, La Panzer-Division 45, Bibliographie) - historical articles.
-Tactiques: Oiseaux de proie (ASL article on aerial attack)

-7 overlays: 6 railways and 1 Reichstag
-10 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC59: ULa Bataille du Rail
ASL TAC60: Partie de Campagne
ASL TAC61: Des Fantômes dans la Jungle
ASL TAC62: Panzer marsch!
ASL TAC63: Un train pour Arnhem
ASL TAC64: Tenez vos Poisitions!
ASL TAC65: Le Dernier Pont
ASL TAC66: L'Ultime Assaut
ASL PBDYO1: Le Ciel et la Boue
ASL PBDYO2: Les Sentiers de la Gloire
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tactiques Issue #9
description:
This is the ninth and last issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 10 ASL scenarios and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le franc tireur".

Publication date: December 1995.

Contains 52 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: Nomonhan'39 (La guerre oubliée, Les fils du soleil, Premiers pas) - historical articles
-Tactiques: Les hommes des cavernes (ASL article on Japanese)
-Tactiques: Sauve qui peut (ASL article about routing)
-Tactiques: 3 Banzaï et un CC (Scenario analysis of TAC52 L'Armée du bout du monde)
-Tactiques: Prises de tête (ASL Q&A on rules)
-Au Reichstag: Mini-campaign combining scenarios TAC65-TAC73-TAC66-TAC74
-PBDYO rules for Japanese (1938-1940) and Russian (Extreme-orient 1938-1939)
-10 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC67: Déterrez-les!
ASL TAC68: Le Mont Akayama
ASL TAC69: Battambang Bang
ASL TAC70: Brise-Lames
ASL TAC71: Terminus Sened
ASL TAC72: Engagement pour une Tour
ASL TAC73: La Maison de Himmler
ASL TAC74: Drapeau Rouge
ASL PBDYO3: Baintsagan
ASL PBDYO4: Le lycée technique
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Race to the Inn
description:
Roll & move game described in “A Compact Encyclopedia of Games Games Games for People of All Ages” by Mary Hohenstein.

Players move about a winding path, trying to move between a village & an inn three times. Certain die rolls grant players tokens, which they can spend on extra movements.

Players double their dice roll on the second leg of the race, & may eliminate others by landing on them during the third leg.

The sample board has multiple paths, but is too small to use; players are supposed to draw their own board.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Race, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Krimi al Dente: Göttliche Antike – von wegen unsterblich
description:
Göttliche Antike is a Mystery Dinner game set in ancient Greece. Players play the roles of Greek gods and godesses. Zeus' wife Hera has been murdered, and all the deities are suspects, including Zeus himself.
Players gather for a dinner party. Over the course of several 30 minute rounds, they will have to find the player who is lying. In each round, new information becomes available, until at last, the truth comes to light (or not). Aside from trying to find the murderer, each player has side tasks to fulfill that decide their final score.

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield – Crown Zenith
description:
Experience the full beauty of the Pokémon TCG with Crown Zenith’s Galarian Gallery! Witness the ghoulish gaze of Hisuian Zoroark VSTAR under a full moon, observe Darkrai VSTAR over a moonlit lake as it wields the power of nightmares, and take a stroll with the ambitious Cynthia as she researches the myths and legends of Sinnoh on these special alternate-art cards.

–description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: 1890: Plano Nacional de Viação
description:
In the year 1890, Brazil has just become a provisional republic. One of its goals is to keep the market thriving, and for that, goods from all over the country need to circulate more easily and in larger quantities.

Thus, a plan was created for the development of railway lines in Brazil, with the objective of connecting the new railway routes with the existing ones, as well as utilizing well-functioning river routes.

The plan sparked interest from many companies, which led to significant investment and internal and external interferences. However, despite being one of the boldest plans that could theoretically improve freight transportation in the country, it fell into disuse. 1890: National Railways Plan is a game that brings to the table the experience of this plan, applied over three decades.

In this game that blends elements of 18xx with euro games, we are investors buying and selling shares of companies interested in investing in Brazil's railway lines. The stock market is constantly changing as it reacts to players' interactions with the market itself, as well as the development or lack thereof, of the companies.

These companies, in turn, will buy trains, construct routes, collect revenues, and pay dividends to investors or not. Such crucial decisions will be made by their respective presidents, meaning the player who holds the highest percentage of the company in question.

The winner will be the one who can best manage the companies and manipulate the stock market, as the individual with the most money and the highest-value portfolio will be the victor of 1890.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Market, Network and Route Building

name: Pokémon TCG: Scarlet & Violet – Paldea Evolved
description:
Evolve New Strategies with Powerful Abilities

Pokémon Abilities can make or break a deck, and there are plenty of new ones to look forward to in Scarlet & Violet—Paldea Evolved. Get your game off to a strong start with Squawkabilly ex’s Squawk and Seize Ability, which allows you to discard your hand and draw six cards. Squawk and Seize is reminiscent of Dedenne-GX’s Dedechange Ability or Crobat V’s Dark Asset Ability, with two key differences—you don't have to play the Pokémon from your hand to activate this Ability, but it can be only be used during your first turn. If you’re looking for some explosive Energy acceleration, Forretress ex can flood your board with up to five Basic Energy at a cost—when you use its Exploding Energy Ability, Forretress ex is Knocked Out, giving up two Prize cards. Pelipper and Tinkaton can lend a hand, too, with the former helping you search out or recover a Supporter card and the latter drawing you three cards a turn.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: GORKBULL: l'invasion de la horde
description:
GORKBULL, the horde invasion, is a miniature game for 1 player. Through several scenarios, linked in the form of a campaign, you will face creatures managed by the game itself with the aim of finishing in the most heroic way possible and developing your characters by following a gripping narrative. The simplicity of the game, thanks to a unique and ingenious system, makes it possible to keep the tactical interest of this type of game, but also to reinvent the style with a very original sequencing of actions for even more strategy. The management of activation cards and your power tokens will offer pleasant tactical choices. The objective is to combine ease of access with great depth of play. Let the adventure begin!

—description from the publisher (translated)

GORKBULL, l'invasion de la horde, est un jeu de figurines pour 1 joueur. À travers plusieurs scénarios, reliés sous forme de campagne, vous allez affronter des créatures gérées par le jeu lui-même dans le but de terminer de la manière la plus héroïque possible et faire évoluer vos personnages en suivant une trame narrative prenante. La simplicité du jeu, grâce à un système unique et ingénieux, permet de garder l’intérêt tactique de ce type de jeu, mais aussi de réinventer le style avec un séquençage des actions très original pour toujours plus de stratégie. La gestion des cartes d’activations et de vos jetons de pouvoirs offriront des choix tactiques plaisants. L’objectif est d’allier une simplicité d’accès à une grande profondeur de jeu. Que l’aventure commence !

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Krimi al Dente: Goldene 20er – Swing mir den Jazz vom Tod
description:
Karl Gloringer, owner of a jazz club in 1920s Berlin, has been murdered. The murderer is among you - can you find out who did it?

Players gather for a dinner party. Over the course of several 30 minute rounds, they will have to find the player who is lying. In each round, new information becomes available, until at last, the truth comes to light (or not). Aside from trying to find the murderer, each player has side tasks to fulfill that decide their final score.

name: Asteria
description:
Asteria is a strategic level card wargame in which two players compete for the domination of the galaxy through military, commercial, and technological objectives.

Using multi-purpose cards, collect resources to enhance your military power, research new technologies, and explore new areas of the galaxy in a game with great variety and replayability.

Each Asteria card incorporates the 4X (Extract, Expand, Explore, and Exterminate) elements. Choose which of the four sides of the card to play on one of the open planets to determine the effect and military power being deployed.

Use combinations of cards to modify plans with technologies and cards that rotate others already in play.

Play your own way to earn points by fulfilling various objectives and emerge victorious with the Galaxy in your hands in Asteria!

This 4X card game is designed for 2 players and features 54 multi-functional cards that ensure each game is thrilling and unique.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Multi-Use Cards

name: Yotta
description:
Each player in turn throws a number die and moves along his line of advance by the number thrown until he reaches the middle space 13. This space can only be reached if the corresponding number of free spaces is rolled. If, on the other hand, the player has thrown more eyes than there are spaces up to 13, he must wait until he rolls the right number. The player now has the right to roll two number dice and the movement die immediately after his last roll.
The player advances or retreats to the number that results from the calculation of the symbols and numbers on the three dice.
During the game, the play money regulations indicated at the edge of the game board apply.
If a figure hits a space occupied by the other player, it is moved back by one space.
From the spaces of numbers 76 to 91 you only play with the two number dice, from the number 92 to the end only with one number die. The number 100 can only be reached in the same way as the number 13.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: The Daily Master
description:
Players play a manager that receive set of orders and need to decide quickly (under 30 sec) each turn how to allocate and process them using different specialist resources in order to complete them and pass the finale approval into "done".

The gameplay mechanics is Based on the popular "Agile Kanban Board" used by professional teams worldwide, this game brings rapid decision-making, strategy, and a bit of luck.

End gamer and Duration:
The game consists of 10 rounds (each is about 2 minutes) or one sprint, the player with the highest number of "DONE" orders end of each sprint emerges as the winner, people play 3 to 5 sprints to determine the ultimate "Daily master."

name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 13
description:
Arm yourself with technical readouts, playable scenarios, an in-depth look at the weaponization of gift giving in the Draconis Combine, a glimpse into Clan Sea Fox’s customer service, an article on the importance of battlefield salvage, and more—all from elite BattleTech authors and recruits who have earned their stripes.

Contains rules for:


Technical Readout: Alb-6u Albatross
Unit Digest: Wilson’s Hussars
Rpg Adventure: Tinker, Tailor, Seamstress, Spy
Planet Digest: Gandy’s Luck
Alpha Strike Scenario: Strike And Fade


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Racing Line
description:
Racing Line is a Formula 1 inspired board game designed for everyone to enjoy, not just F1 fans.

Choose your car and compete across a Championship to score the most points and be crowned Racing Line Champion.

Use your incident cards to hinder your opponents or boost your chances.

The specially designed track offers excitement and jeopardy in equal measure.

So grab your family and friends and prepare to flip the board as the pressure mounts in the exciting world of Racing Line.

name: Thott
description:
Thott follows the life of Birgitte Olufsdatter Thott. She was a Danish and Swedish noble, landowner and royal county administrator. She was one of the biggest landowners in Scandinavia, and her estates played a role in politics in Sweden and Denmark.
Send your spies on secret missions to Sweden or Denmark, and return them safely home. Use the resources they acquired to earn influence and avoid being arrested and sentenced to death or life in monastery.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Medieval, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Heroes of Arcania
description:
A card/board game for 1-5 players with a non-linear episodic storyline that pits players as epic heroes vs a great evil. 1-4 Players may assume the role of mighty heroes while another player may take the reins of the great evil in an attempt to stop them. The heroes will go on random drawn side quests or engage in challenging main quests to thwart the advance of evil and save the world. The game has a RPG feel as you use dice to battle your way through dungeons, ruins and even full scale wars gaining level and powerful artifacts along the way in your journey to become a legend. Encounter special locations, build a retinue of helpful NPCs and see where your adventure takes you.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: 花手水に福来たる (Fortune Comes to Hanachuzu)
description:
Hanachōzu is a bowl of colorful flowers that is used to purify one's hands at temples and shrines.
Prosperous business, success in love, longevity in good health...

As the chief priest, you will decorate the flower chozubachi beautifully and make the temple the most blessed.
A competitive set collection game where you spread flowers on a 3x7 water square and compete for the number of profitable roles.

By forming sets of 3 or more of certain flowers, claim your blessings from the Gods. If the blessing belongs to others, steal them by outdoing them with your flower display
Don't forget to set bamboo in your chozubachi to hold ladles for people to use
Whoever holds the most blessing at the end of the game is the winner
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Kingdom Spirits
description:
A skill-building two-player battle card game that tests your choices and courage with simple rules!

Three interesting points
① Psychological reading!
Each player takes out one card from their hand and wins! Compare the numbers on the cards and the bigger one wins!
Guess what cards will come out from the skill used by the other party and read the back of the back!

② Lose and build skills!
Activate skills by manipulating the souls of the dead who lost the game! Take advantage of the next game!
Dare to lose and build skills! ? Build while losing and aim for victory with a keen eye!

③ Hire and increase your hand!
Hire unique mercenaries to increase your strength! Aim for victory with various skills!
First-come, first-served from the two cards on the front!
The timing to acquire is also an important choice!

Victory/End Conditions There are three conditions for victory !
The player who fulfills any of these conditions wins!
If you win 10 times before your opponent, you win!
You win when your opponent runs out of cards!
If you beat the king with a clown or angel, you win!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rules for the Mid-Eighteenth Century
description:
Published in Wargames Illustrated 075, a very simple set of miniatures wargames rules aimed at mid C18 conflicts, including the Seven Years' War, the French & Indian Wars and the Jacobite Rebellions.

They are designed for quick battles, played to a conclusion, using a moderate number of units each with a small number of figures (e.g. 8 figs/infantry battalion). The key concept within the rules is to assume that obvious things are happening i.e. there is no 'musketry' sub-system, it is just assumed that if a unit is in effective range, it is firing. There are some optional rules for including command and control issues, and a few optional rules for specific conflicts.
categories: American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dwarven Beerfest: Happy Hour Mini Pack
description:
Listen up Everyone... It's Happy Hour!

Although the dwarfs were already quite intoxicated, upon learning that a barrel of rare Mimic Ale was being served, they proceeded to resume their drinking game!

In this mini pack you'll find 10 new cards for Dwarven Beerfest.

CONTENTS:
x3 Action Cards
x5 Mimic Ale Drink Cards
x2 Tavern Cards
x1 Tavern Mini (First Player Marker)
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Pattern Pursuit
description:
Place, cover, swap, remove build cards in a collaborative space, attempting to form your patterns while blocking other players from forming theirs. First player to build all of their patterns wins.

—description from the designer

name: Professor Brainstorm Word Challenge Card Game: BrainForce Expansion 1
description:
The first of several expansions for the Professor Brainstorm Word Challenge Card Game. It has 20 cards -- 10 blue, 10 orange -- and a data sheet on the members of BrainForce, each of whom is represented by a card in the set:

Arnee the Amazing Toad
Boltz the Robot
Gwendolyn, a human teen from Earth
Risky Racoon
Rumble the Hillfar Giant
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Escape Experience: Final Game
description:
Participate in a Battle Royale - will you be the last contestant in the arena?

The goal of the game is to escape from a time loop. To achieve that, the party has to make decisions which cost time points. When the time points are used up, the party has to restart the game, but keeps collected items and information that can be combined to solve the mysteries. The group wins when it escapes the time loop with a perfect game.

name: Escape Experience: Strange Summer
description:
This episode of Escape Experience is set in a US highschool in the 1980s. But some teachers follow sinister plans and try to summon an ancient demon. Can you find allys to spoil their plans?

The goal of the game is to escape from a time loop. To achieve that, the party has to make decisions which cost time points. When the time points are used up, the party has to restart the game, but keeps collected items and information that can be combined to solve the mysteries. The group wins when it escapes the time loop with a perfect game.

name: Professor Brainstorm Word Challenge Card Game: Terra Expansion Set
description:
Inside are 25 cards from the Kingdom of Terra, the Earth-like land where Dinkees polish the precious energems under the hade of the huge Dinkoia Tree and the Knights o Terra protect all living creatures.

—description from the back of the box

The set actually has 26 cards -- 16 blue (consonants) and 10 orange (vowels and effects) -- plus a rules card and a card about their website.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Professor Brainstorm Word Challenge Card Game: Dragonia Expansion Set
description:
Inside are 25 cards from the Kingdom of Dragonia, the volcanic land where dragons fly in the smoky skies over Mt. Cinderblast and Goblins dig up the precious energems in the deep mines.

—description from the back of the box

The set actually has 27 cards -- 15 blue (consonants) and 12 orange (vowels and effects) -- plus a rules card and a card about their website.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Traxit
description:
Traxit is an abstract boardgame, where the goal is to be as close to the top as possible at the right moment. The catch is that the opponent to your right decides which of 16 path tiles you must use for your next movement.

Each player has 2 pawns and 16 path tiles. Each of the 16 paths are unique. Your path tiles are given to the player to your right. Players each chose a side on the lower level, and place their pawns freely outside of the corners.

You opponent chooses which path you have to use. You can rotate the path any way you like, giving you up to 8 different moves per pawn for assymetrical paths. After use, the path tile is discarded. You can't move through other pawns, nor outside the board, and if you can't move at all, your opponent takes one of your pawns and moves it to the lowest level. This move is called a Traxit, which is latin for being pulled.

Scoring
At the end of every 4 rounds (4, 8, 12 and 16) you score points for the position of your pawns (0, 25, 50 or 100) depending on how close to the top they are.

Bonus
A 50 point bonus is added for getting both your pawns to the top at any time.

Variants
There is also a short version of the game, where you only play 12 of the 16 path tiles, and a team variant where you team up with the player opposite you, to play against the players to your sides.
mechanics: Hand Management, Movement Template, Team-Based Game

name: Treasure Island
description:
A board game based on the novel (with the novel included in the box).

You gather money to buy ship and equipment and hire a crew. After that you travel to the Treasure Island, and in the end the winner is the player to deliver the treasure to the princess first.

name: Wacky Puppies
description:
Welcome to the wacky, tail-wagging world of Wacky Puppies! An explosively fun card game where strategy and dog puns collide.

Your mission? Be the last puppy standing by avoiding the explosive combo of the bomb and detonator cards because…Bam! You're out if you nab both. But fret not! You can dodge those explosive mishaps and still stay in the game if you play your cards right.

It's a game of high stakes hide-and-seek with a deck of 100 wild cards, giving you the power to dodge doom, mess with friends, or bring in a tidal wave of silliness. As the deck dwindles, the suspense (and giggles) just keeps growing!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Sudden Death Ending

name: Ice Cold Penguins
description:
Pick a place to enter the ice from the outer edge of the game board and spin the spinner. Move that many spaces in a straight line stopping if it hits another penguin (which gets bumped one space even if it means off the board).

The game ends when all player's penguins are on the ice. Penguins that have another penguin on all 4 orthogonal sides earn 1 point. Player with the most points wins.

name: Big Bull Junior
description:
In Big Bull Junior, it's all about your stocks portfolio/collection. You try to collect companies' stocks and try to increase the price of the companies (or trying to decrease the price of companies held by other players) in the central market. But since you don't know what stocks are held by other players, you might inadvertently help them increase the value of their collection!

During one's turn, a player can collect a card, increase/decrease the value of one of the stocks in the central market. You can bluff, strategize or collude to spike/crash stock price.

At the end of 10 rounds, the wealthiest/richest player wins the game.

Its time to pull your socks oops....stocks! Can you become a big bull.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Multi-Use Cards, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Geheime Botschaften
description:
The Agents' Agency is looking for talented agents to recruit for their secret missions. In order to qualify, you receive 15 letters from all over Europe. Can you solve all the puzzle and decode the secret messages?

The game contains 15 letters in envelopes. Solving the puzzles in the first one will tell you the next envelope. Note the order in which you opened the envelopes - this will be crucial for your final score. In the end you will find an evaluation of your success, so you know whether you qualified for being a secret agent.

name: Twerk Pong
description:
Twerk to win! This super fun game puts your twerking skills to the test. Fill your box up with the ping pong bills and race to see who can empty their box the quickest! Twerk Pong is perfect for parties, gatherings and family fun and has three different game play modes. Be prepared for some laughs!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Census: The Party Game
description:
Census is a survey based card game that allows players to answer 500 carefully designed questions anonymously, generating hours of fun and laughter.

—description from the publisher

name: Wacky Face VS
description:
Take on your opponent and spin the wheel! Don't get splattered!

Who is going to get whipped cream in their face?! You can also use the jelly, slime or whatever you want on the hand!

Spin the spinner and turn the lever on the side of the base the number of times that you landed on when the spinner was spun (e.g if you land on a two you turn the lever twice). The ajm is to avoid being pied in the face by the hand. Whoever is pied the least wins!

name: Belly Battle
description:
Welcome to Belly Battle!

Build your own restaurant empire! Buy restaurants from Mr.Munchwalla catering to one of the six different cuisines and collect Munch Fees from visiting players or choose to upgrade your restaurants by hiring more chefs or getting a Star rating. Exchange, swap or take over other restaurants. Get more visitors during Munch time!

When any player goes bankrupt, the game ends. Every other player then calculates their wealth. 5. The player who has the maximum wealth (Sum of restaurants + chefs+ Stars + Money), wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fatal Arena
description:
Players enter a proving ground to build army of various beings, equip them with weapons and abilities and cast a diverse array of spells - all to survive in the arena as long as possible.

Fatal Arena is a quick battle game, where the fate of all players depend on a single deck of cards. Players look for ways how to build effective offense AND defense from the small number of cards they can gather each game.

Plays similar to Hearthstone or Magic: the Gathering, with simpler rules and a unique yet straight-forward resource system: your "resource" is simply the number of cards in your hand.

—description from the designer

name: Galo da Madrugada
description:
Galo da Madrugada is the biggest carnival block on the planet.
In this simple mancala game based on the carnival block, players try to collect "Foliões" (the people who participate in the block during the carnival).
Each round, players seed markers (as usual in a mancala), and where the last marker ends, a card is collected, representing a person, instrument, dance, or other form of expression of Galo da Madrugada.
Each card shows "foliões" in different colors and, at the end of the game, each color of "folião" has brings different amounts of points and groups of "foliões" of different colors bring additional points.

name: Yo Sabo
description: Yo Sabo The Game is the new card game for your next game night! It started off as a way to remember some tricky Spanish words but it has evolved into a way to reconnect with your childhood and share some funny memories with your friends. Do not worry, you can still win the game by answering Latino Trivia or by winning the challenges on the Chancla cards!

name: Detective Bullshit: Private Dick
description:
Detective Bullshit is a game for 3-5 players you win by making shit up.

Think of Clue meets Cards Against Humanity, sort of. It's a competitive storytelling game centered around a fictional criminal case. Unlike Clue, there's no right answer, but like Cards Against Humanity, the fun is in getting your friends to pick your ridiculous story.

For each case, one player is Chief Bullshit and other players are detectives.

The Chief draws a victim card and decides the location of the crime. It's then up to the other detectives to play suspect cards from their hands and convince the Chief that their suspect is guilty. But things get complicated in the 3 rounds of each case as additional evidence, complications, and bribery keep even the best bullshitters on their toes.

This expansion adds 90 new cards including 6 blanks where you can add your own phrases and people.

name: Cretaceous Rails: Variable Player Powers Mini Expansion
description: The Cretaceous Rails Mini Expansion Promo Cards consist of four cards depicting time tourism company employees and their pet baby dinosaurs. The mini expansion introduces variable player powers to the game. The promo cards were originally distributed as a free bonus for For Glory: Champions Kickstarter backers and given away at Origins 2023.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Trains

name: Der Hamburger Ausruf
description:
