Hamburg, as one of the largest sea and trading cities, is already worthy of our attention, how much more interesting is it not to learn about the national life and freedoms of this famous city?
Each player has starts an equal number counters. Each player puts an equal number of counters into the kitty. The 'court' (figurine) cards are dealt to each player in equal quantities. The smaller cards are put into a small bag and drawn out. Each small card has a cry in 3 languages as well as a number. The first player to match one of his Court Cards to a number or cry, takes the small card. The first person to match 5 numbers receives half of the kitty.
With the other half of the kitty, another type of game begins. The cards are shuffled and evenly distributed. The player who can put together the figure and lettering cards with a number, so that the whole appears complete, hands them over to the Banker and receives 1 or 2 counters for them. If there are more cards, someone starts to give away a card of his choice to his neighbour. In this way, it is possible to find the cards that match and to exhaust the kitty, which ends the game.
Regrettably, the game is all luck-oriented but it look great.

name: Picaresque
description:
Far from here, through the towns and valleys of the land, something important lies in wait. You cannot resist it, even if many troubles lie between here and there. With good friends at your side, set off on a fantastical questto discover what lies at Journey's End.

Choose one player to be the GAme Master (GM); everyone else is a player. The GM will describe the scenes the players journey through and introduce the trials they face. The players will devise plansto overcome the trials in order to get to their Journey's End.

The game takes place over a series of stages, each representing a stage of the journey. Each stage has four parts which take place in turn:

Create a new scene: The GM places a new scene between the current scene and Journey's End. This is the next place characters are trying to get to on their journey, which will eventually lead to the Journey's End.

Explore the scene: Players roleplay freely, exploring the current scene and looking for ways to get to the new scene.

Introduce the Trial: The GM selects a Trial card as an obstacle in their way. The players devise a plan to overcome the Trial.

Face the Trial: At a climatic moment in the plan, the GM pauses the roleplay to resolve the Trial.To succeed, the players require a total greater than or equal to 7; otherwise the players fail. Reveal the top 2 cards of the deck and add their Values, then applying bonuses.

If players passed the trial, they earn a Boon. After overcoming two trials, the next scene is Journey's End. Players must overcome one last Trial to reach their final destination and succeed in their quest.
mechanics: Player Judge, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Stan Lee's Genesis
description:
In Stan Lee's Genesis, players must harness their creative energy to give birth to a unique universe. Genesis is intended to put the power of creation into the hands of the players and honor the legacy of Stan’s brilliance as one of the preeminent creative forces of the 20th century. Every game is different as players both compete and collaborate as they construct a comic book universe full of heroes, villains, super team, evil syndicates, galactic threats, and all-encompassing cross over events!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Der Rhein und sein Stromgebiet
description:
A game master is chosen who shuffles all the cards well. Then he distributes 6 cards to each player, which are placed face up upon receipt. The rest of the cards are given to the game master, who piles them face down in front of him.
The first player takes one of his blue- or red-printed tiles, calls out the name, and exchanges it with the game master for a blue pin for a blue-printed card, or a red marker for a red-printed card. The needle is placed at the beginning of the river identified by the map, while the red marker is placed at the location indicated by the map.
In turn, the players continue with one card each. It should be noted that the blue-printed cards with rivers and the red-printed ones with cities that are on the Rhine can be used without further ado, while for the black-printed cards with cities that are on tributaries of the Rhine, you only then get a black marker, which is then placed on the relevant location if the river on which the city is located is already pinned by a blue pin.
Whoever gets rid of their cards first wins.

—user summary

name: Scrabble BINGO
description:
Why should kids have all the fun? Bring family and friends together to play The Scrabble Bingo board game reimagined for intergenerational connections. This family game is actually three different games in one. Scrabble and Bingo, two iconic games, are combined into a fun game of strategy and luck. Players can also play using classic Scrabble gameplay, or quick rounds of the Scrabble Pass game, an easy word game that has everyone playing against the timer. All three games are designed with older adults in mind, and created with easy-to-grasp, easy-to-read components. Get the conversations started when grandkids use words unfamiliar to older generations and vice versa. You never know what you’ll discover, but you know you’ll have fun and be engaged!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Bingo, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Spelling, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Please don't fight over me!
description:
Bet on the present or bet on the future. The card game to see the timing to challenge.

Players get encounter cards in exchange for the dialogue cards in their hand, and compete for points.

The active player draws an encounter card into play. At this time, the encounter card for the next turn will also be revealed, so please check it carefully.

The active player play the Dialogue Card with the same time zone as the Encounter Card and acquires the Encounter Card. However, at this time, other players can say "Wait a minute!" and participate in the Encounter Card acquisition. In the event of a battle for the Encounter Card, the winner is the player who puts into play the Dialogue Card of the Type written on the back of the Encounter Card.

By considering the number of cards in opponents' hands and the upcoming encounter cards, strategically determine when to preserve cards in your hand and when to move aggressively to increase your chances of winning.

The game ends when a confession card appears or when all players have no more cards in hand.

—description from the designer

name: Humbug: das zweifelhafte Kartenspiel – Original Edition 3
description:
This "dubious" card game is a crazy-cheeky card game ideal for cheating, guessing, bluffing and betting!
It's perfect for fun, casual game nights with friends and family!

Guess if the player whose turn it is is either describing the picture on the card or making up a scenario. Unmask the swindler and collect points in the form of betting chips.

name: Humbug: das zweifelhafte Kartenspiel – Original Edition 4
description:
This "dubious" card game is a crazy-cheeky card game ideal for cheating, guessing, bluffing and betting!
It's perfect for fun, casual game nights with friends and family!

Guess if the player whose turn it is is either describing the picture on the card or making up a scenario. Unmask the swindler and collect points in the form of betting chips.

name: The Devil By Your Side
description:
In this single player PnP you sold your soul to the devil and now want it back. The devil's deal is that you help his demons recover lost sins and then you get your soul back. But the longer you stay in Hell, the harder it is to come back...

In this PnP you need one of the game boards (Circles of Hell), 4 dice, a pen and a meeple to mark your movement through the Circle of Hell. First you roll to set one objective out of six that you have to fulfill in order to please the demons.
Then you roll 4 dice each round with which you can do actions such as moving, collecting or cleansing or you can craft items or transform sins in order to fulfill your objectives.
But be aware the time also goes forward and if you take too long you will not get out of Hell.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Barbecubes
description:
Barbecubes is the sequel to the hit game Tinderblox by Alley Cat Games.

In this cooperative game players place “bbq pieces” on the fire and stack them in a particularly configuration before taking them off the fire to plate up.

The game gets progressively more difficult the more cards you choose to play with.

—description from the pubisher

name: Disney sjovt at lære klokken
description:
Disney sjovt at lære klokken is a memory-based, educational board game published by Disney. Designed to teach children about time, the game challenges 2 to 4 players to match clock pieces to corresponding time-slot pieces on their board.

During gameplay, players take turns flipping over Disney character pieces to reveal a background color, which indicates the color of the clock piece they should look for. Players then flip a clock piece; if the color and time match one of their time-slot pieces, they cover it with the clock piece. Otherwise, both the clock and Disney pieces are flipped back over.

The game continues with players trying to remember the placement and colors of the pieces on the table. The winner is the first player to cover all of their time-slot pieces with matching clock pieces. A delightful way to learn about time, this game is suitable for children aged 5 and up.

name: Spreng den Ring
description:
Each player places his 3 pawns in the starting space of the inner circle of his color. If a player rolls a 6, he places one pawn on the red-bordered starting space and then has a second roll. He now advances in the direction of the line. After every throw of a 6, another figure is placed on the starting point. If the player's pawn reaches a space on the track that is already occupied by another player, he throws his pawn back into the starting space.
If a player has his 3 pieces on the track, he is entitled to another throw after every 6 thrown.
Each player strives to break the ring with his pawn and thus reach the next ring. For this purpose he must occupy the red space with his pawn. Immediately afterwards, he has a second roll, through which he continues his pawn in the next ring. If he exceeds the red space with the number of points rolled, he reaches the pendulum spaces marked with black arrows. With the following throws he has to shuttle back and forth over the red space until he occupies it and then leads his pawn into the next ring with another throw.
If the player reaches the red space of the outer ring with a pawn, he places it in the target space of his color.
If a player has occupied the target space with his 3 pawns, he is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Muraÿa
description:
In Muraÿa, your aim will be to try and predict your opponent's moves in order to block his Soldier counter or move your counter to the other side of the board, into the opponent's territory formed by the 1st row of squares on the opposite side.

Players take turns. On his turn, a player may perform 1 or 2 of the following actions:

move his soldier 1 hex,
move a wall of his color,


The same type of action can be repeated, with the same piece or two different pieces (if it's a wall). If the player performs 2 actions of different types, they can be played in any order.

A wall can only be moved on the spaces between the squares, while a soldier can only move on the squares:

Soldiers can only move vertically or horizontally, while Walls can rotate 90° or move in a straight line. Walls cannot be placed on the edge of the board.

The game ends if the opponent's piece is blocked in any way, or if one of the 2 players' pieces reaches the edge of the board on the opponent's side.

name: Pöbbkviss
description: "Pöbbkviss" is an engaging Icelandic trivia game, a phonetic play on the English term "Pub Quiz". The game comes with 1,000 trivia cards, featuring questions from various categories including general knowledge, famous quotes, fivefold (a popular segment in the trivia show Kviss), and three hints. Suitable for gatherings, travel, and parties, it can accommodate an unlimited number of contestants, typically played in teams with one person serving as the quizmaster.

name: Above and Beyond
description:
Nine spacefaring crusader states will engage in a zero-sum (nearly) multidimensional tug-of-war for ownership over nineteen keystone worlds, sending ships from their fleets out into the cosmos up to ten times per game.

Any or all of these nine states can be controlled by an algorithm. As a human player, you must be able to visualize how algorithm-based opponents will behave throughout each nineteen-planet sequence of action resolution and also to visualize how you and your human opponents (if any) can affect the algorithm and send it spinning in a different direction.

(You could also set the nine algorithms against each other to see what happens.)

You will need to balance a healthy supply of ships in your reserves (i.e., NOT on the map) with a strong presence of control flags among the 19 worlds to avoid elimination.

Win by planting your 11th flag, by having 5 fleets in play at the start of a round, or by surviving all 10 rounds and having the highest score.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Force Commitment, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Programmed Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Krakkakviss
description: Krakkakviss is the junior counterpart of the Icelandic trivia game Pöbbkviss. It's designed for players aged 6 and up, and includes 100 cards featuring 300 age-appropriate questions. This engaging trivia game encourages team play and cooperative learning, making it ideal for family game nights and children's gatherings. With Krakkakviss, trivia fun is within reach for young players, fostering their curiosity and knowledge.

name: Rodzice Roku
description:
Become parent of the year!

Rodzice Roku is a game about motherhood and fatherhood, but taken with a pinch of salt. If you don’t have kids, this game will prepare you for the challenges of parenthood. And if you are already a parent, this game will bring back old memories. Those who decided not to have kids can check if their devotion is right.
The game will take you for a trip over 3 trimesters of pregnancy and you will be collecting baby’s layette.
Check if you are able to do multiple tasks at once and if you have all the knowledge parents must have. Can you make quick decisions and finally can you draw and sculpt in … poo?
If so, there’s is a high chance that you will become the parent of the year.

name: La Pétoche: une pétanque de poche
description:
It is a pocket version of Pétanque.

Pétanque is a dexterity game that originated in France, but is now played all over the world. You win points by getting your boules close to the jack. Playing Pétanque is a great way to spend time with friends.

—description from the designer

name: EVANGELION:2015 Angel Attack
description:
EVANGELION:2015 Angel Attack is a trick-taking game in which the player who advances the scenario by making full use of Seele and the Angels and finally carries out the Human Instrumentality Project.

It's basically an orthodox trick-taking game, but the rules are reversed only for the final order.

name: Y2Killer
description:
Making murder mystery games cool again.

The story: It’s December 31, 1999, and the threat of the Y2K bug divided the population into two types of people: those who are panicking and those who are partying like it’s 1999. Jo Jive, the owner of the hottest record label of the decade, just wants to party. Jo invites the most VIP of VIPs to the hip new nightclub, Encore Lemieux, for a potential end-of-the-world celebration. What was intended to be a bougie, totally exclusive affair takes a turn when some uninvited guests arrive, invitation mysteriously in hand.

As midnight approaches and the threat of the Y2K bug draws near, not everyone plans to ring in the New Year in typical fashion. A killer is afoot.

Key suspects: Jo Jive, London Ritz, Nicki Simpson, The Rainmaker, and Reggie P. 11 extra guests are included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time

name: Cryptid Cafe: The Chef's Apprentice
description:
Welcome to Cryptid Cafe: The Chef's Apprentice! This game is set in the same universe as the popular Cryptid Cafe. This time around, instead of serving customers in the front-of-house, we’ll be venturing into the back-of-house, where players will take command of their cryptid line cook with aspirations of becoming a chef someday. However, before putting on that glorious white chef’s hat, they must first become…The Chef’s Apprentice.

Each turn, you and your fellow players will choose monstrous food dishes from the main chef's table board and plate them in your own tableau format. Your placement, preparation, and garnishing skills will determine how well you satisfy the customers' requests and earn their praise. Your cryptid line cook's expertise will also come in handy as you prepare dishes. However, be warned of challenges from the Kraken Chef, who will test your skills and separate you from the pretenders.

The player who earns the most praise from the customers and our resident Chef wins the game.

Are you ready to become The Chef's Apprentice?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Delayed Purchase, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: The Fantasy Trip: Adventures
description:
A collection of new adventures for use with The Fantasy Trip Legacy Edition!

This package includes:

One 64-page hardcover book packed with five adventures.
The Chaos Triads, by Steven Marsh
The Curse of Katiki-Mu, by Robert Saint John
Fire in the Temple, by David L. Pulver
The Clockwork Tower, by Greg Poehlein
Tomb of the Wizard-King, by Christopher R. Rice

Also inside:

An afterword, with further game notes, by Steve Jackson.
5 sheets of die-cut megahexes & counters, for the adventures.
5 dry-erase treasure cards.
5 dry-erase fighter cards.
2 different 9" x 12" pocket folders you can use to carry your campaign notes, character sheets, and other loose sheets.

name: ダークユールに贖いを (Dark Yule ni aganaio)
description:
Once every ten years, vampires gather in a town in the far north.
On the night of the great gathering to decide how to treat the humans, an incident was discovered just before the opening of the gathering.
What was found was a charred, blackened corpse. The number two vampire of one of the two opposing factions had been destroyed. Which was the victim?　The higher ranking vampires glaring at each other. The newcomers are trying to solve the case for a hidden purpose. Vampire hunters' traps are hidden in plain sight. And the shadow of an old vampire from the distant past.
Who has achieved redemption...?

name: 河辺の夜の夢 (Kawabe no yoru no yume)
description:
It was the end of the 16th century, just as the reign of Queen Elizabeth (I) was ending. The incident took place in a riverside town in central England. A man who had been staying in an inn was found dead after plunging his head into the river not far from the back door.
The travelers who were also staying at the inn, the local white witch who is well-liked by the locals, and the inn's servants all look at each other with suspicion. Each of them looks at the other with suspicion. What is the truth behind the incident that took place in the hometown where the playwright, who has gained fame, returned to after a long absence?　And what will become of the story woven by those with secrets?

In this genre, each player plays a different character, and each character is given a separate winning condition. Other players' winning conditions are unknown, and after the end of the game, all players who achieve the conditions become winners.

name: 神さま日本酒おつぎします (Kamisama nihonshu otsugishmasu)
description:
You are a waiter and you are entertaining drunken gods. However, the situation changes when you enter "Hebereke Mode," in which the cards are flipped over! The gods' pitch goes up and a big surprise happens. Can you entertain the drunk gods well enough to succeed in your mission?

The "Drunken Summit" mode is a cooperative type in which players communicate with each other and line up numbered cards, while the "Drunken After Party" mode is a competitive type in which players play cards that match each other's conditions.
The cards are double-sided, and the "Drunken Mode," in which the cards are reversed, is the key feature. The cards are double-sided, and the "Drunken Mode" is the key to the game, which can cause a major upheaval if used properly.

name: 死者の供述 (Shisya no kouzyutsu)
description:
Six men and women participated in a certain hot spring tour.
Just an unusual tour held in a slightly unusual place,
It seemed that all the unusual people gathered together.
But the hot springs were great and the view from there was exceptional.
The next morning, one of the tourists, "Kirifuri" is found dead.
He died from a fall from a cliff.
Dead men have no mouths to feed. Accidental death or murder? The truth was supposed to be a mystery...
However, one of the tourists happened to be an shaman, a person who can speak the voice of the dead.
And not just one, but all of them seem to be itako.
How is this possible? The investigation begins in a bewilderment.

name: 星屑の彼方で (Hoshikuzuno Kanatade)
description:
On board the Blue Swan, a space freighter traveling to a distant planet. Five men and women are forcibly awakened from cryo-sleep. Sirens blaring and warning lights flashing red. What is happening on board this ship?

A space survival for survival begins.

In this genre, each player plays a different character, and each character is given a separate winning condition. Other players' winning conditions are unknown, and after the end of the game, all players who achieve the conditions become winners.

name: Hochzeit machen, das ist wunderschön!
description:
Well shuffled, backs up, the 40 cards are placed in the middle of the table. 19 "male ideals", 20 "role models of real femininity" - and the maiden room for the beauty who loses in the race for the right man.
In turn, each player takes a card. A gentleman's card and a lady's card always make a pair, one suitable or one unsuitable! This can be argued about and there will also be disputes, which, if necessary, will ultimately be decided by the selected game master.
Whoever has a matching pair reads out the two texts and asks for recognition so that they can discard the pair.
When all cards have been taken from the table, you draw from your right neighbor. At the end, a lady card and the maiden room remain in one hand. That costs a deposit.
The player to arrange the most auspicious marriages receives the award and is the winner.

The game is from about 1925.

—user summary

name: Pandemain: Traditional Farmers' Bread: Günzburg
description:
Promo village Günzburg.

When selling Bread in Günburg:

The bread sold there gives you 2 VP.
High quality bread: Increase you reputation by one extra level, unless you have already maxed out.
You can leave an ox in the space of your color.
Discard the current demand and fill up with two future demand grain tokens. Fill out the last space from the reserve. Also do this at dawn, us usual.

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Turnier-Set zum Kartenspiel – Updatepack
description: 3 Cards to bring the Turnierset to the 2 new addons Wissenschaft & Fortschritt and Ritter & Händler.

name: Astrogiocando
description: Space-themed game dedicated to kids. Moving along the way, players will have to collect "astrogiocando tokens" and answer questions about the solar system. Each correct answer will donate a token that can be used to solve one of your objectives and whoever manages to conclude two of them first will be the winner.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Rock Fall
description:
Rock Fall is a strategic word game for one to five players, aged 7+, where players deflect letters into words.

Miners are digging a mine shaft. Rocks are falling. Rocks are encoded with letters.

As the rocks fall and are deflected by planks, they land and sometimes form words from adjacent letters.

Quickly spot words before your opponent to score points.

Game Play:

After randomly inserting deflector planks into the mine shaft, place the rock tiles into the bag.

Players simultaneously drop rocks into the mine shaft. The rocks will tumble and deflect.

Be quick to spot landed words of the same colour.

Call out and score your words.

Play several rounds.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Matching, Stacking and Balancing, Tile Placement

name: Star Battles: Solar Powered Ships – Solex
description:
Starbattles (Solar Powered Ships) is a compilation of Ship Control Sheet Diagrams and rules for Solar-Power-Ships (or, Sailing Ships of the Galaxies)

It includes 24 CSD's and a 4 Page rules supplement for use with Starbattles (Mainline)

name: Tholian Go
description:
Tholian Go is a symmetrical two player abstract game where the goal is to surround and remove your opponent's tokens.

The board is comprised of separate dark nodes (connected as triangles) and light nodes (connected in hexagons) overlaid in a geometric pattern.

name: Quodd Heroes (2nd Edition): A Heroic Journey
description:
In Quodd Heroes "A Heroic Journey" you become your favourite Heroes as they make the long perilous journey to Fringe, and reveal the stories that led up to the adventures in the main game. Don't miss out on the unique puzzley-challenges, discoveries, and adventures in Quodd Heroes, "A Heroic Journey"!

—description from the publisher

name: Quodd Heroes: Modular Game Boards
description: Want to add the Modular Boards from the 1st edition to your 2nd edition? This is the add-on for you!

name: Carampool
description: Carampool is a table billiard where each player tries to be the first to get one of their marbles in each of the six holes. Players can play by flipping the marbles with their fingers or by useng a cue.

name: Die lustige Neun
description:
Every player gets a pawn. Two dice are needed for the game. Anyone who has reached space 91 may only use one die.
The players take turns to roll and move.
If you come to stand on a space that borders the lower part of the nine, you can move to the upper part of the nine.
However, if you land on the upper part of the nine when rolling the dice, you have to go back to the lower part of the nine.
If you come to a red number, you have to go back to the next red number. If you stand on OGA, you have a free throw.
Whoever reaches space 100 first wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Blitz in the East: Scorched Earth
description:
Scorched Earth is an expansion for Blitz in the East. It includes a card deck, several new counters and markers and rules. It includes 28 new events/rules such as:

Scorched Earth
Evacuation of Industry
Partisans
Turkey Joins Axis
Festungs
and more
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Shields Up Engineering!
description:
'Sandbox style card game with a high level of complexity and "take-that" elements.'

Building upon the core elements of "Shields up!", this card game puts you and your opponent in the unenviable shoes of Chief Engineers - pushing their starships to the absolute limit, in a tense space battle to the death.

Players will have to manage their respective ships' four key systems (Reactor, Life Support, Shields, and Weapons) and implement cunning (and warranty-voiding) modifications to these systems, hoping to push the envelope just enough to destroy their opponents ship without wrecking their own.
mechanics: Action Points, Multi-Use Cards, Take That

name: Raccoon Restaurant
description:
In this thrilling board game, you step into the paws of mischievous chef raccoons on a culinary quest to open the most sought-after eateries in the forest.

Each round consists of a gathering phase and a feeding phase. In the gathering phase, chefs may dig through 2 trash cans for ingredients by flipping over food chits. They have 30 seconds to gather as many ingredients as can fit in the bowls at their food stand. In the feeding phase, chefs draw patron cards and attempt to satisfy the unique food requests at the bottom of each patron's card. At the end of 5 rounds, the chef who has served the patrons with the highest total points claims victory for their restaurant!

With its whimsical theme, unique gameplay mechanics, and strategic decision-making, Raccoon Restaurant is a thrilling culinary adventure that will keep you on your toes!

—description from the designer

name: Krakkaleikar
description: Krakkaleikar is an engaging and lively charades-style game designed for groups of friends or families. The game consists of 500 cards with various prompts that players must act out, with actions ranging from impersonating a vampire to walking like a sleepwalker. The aim is to perform the prompt on the card in such a way that your team can correctly guess what you're enacting. Its easy-to-understand mechanics and diverse prompts make "Krakkaleikar" a fun game suitable for all occasions. The call to action is simple: "One, two, action!

name: Djinn Rummy
description:
You are the most powerful of ancient magicians and shapeshifters, but for a thousand years you have waited, sealed inside a meagre brass lantern, lost under the sands of time. A group of ardent archeologists have now uncovered your magical prison, and want to use your powers to grant them power and riches beyond belief. Polishing your lantern they have awakened not only your slumbering spirit, but your powerful cleverness and guile. Will you be able to grant these foolish mortals their hearts desires while outplaying them at their own game? Success for you means freedom from endless years of servitude and a return to earthly pleasures. Or is your fate sealed, like the burnished brass lantern which has been your solitary cell for centuries?

Djinn Rummy is a card game based on classic rummy depicting the battle of wits between a Genie and mortals. Mortals attempt to lay down runs and sets to score points and empty their hands of cards. The Genie plays differently, by playing a run from 1 to 10 (symbolizing the thousand years they have spent imprisoned), trying to empty their hand first. However, the Genie may take cards played by mortals by granting them "wishes" that possibly increase their chances to score and to win. If the Genie wins, they score alone; if any mortal wins, they score alone; but if a Genie grants three wishes to any mortal, that mortal and the Genie score, excluding all other mortals. At the end of each round, the Genie appoints a mortal as the new Genie to hinder their chances of winning.

—description from the publisher

name: Furtive Findings
description:
A strategic, competitive, 2-player game to print and play. Win the war of espionage using both luck and strategic skills. Two world powers on the brink of war send out their spies and armies to obtain secret information and strike in strategic locations.

Each player has a map with a 5x7 grid, a character token, 3 army tokens and one die, also a coin is needed. Each players secretly notes the location of their spies and secret documents. Be the first to retrieve the secret documents and uncover the enemy spies.

Roll your die to move around the map, find the documents, uncover the spies. The game rounds are divided into three phases, and each phase is played simultaneously by both players. Players must start and end each turn at the same
time. You can active secret documents to influence your abilities, move around the grid and place armies and fight with them by flipping a coin. The first player to uncover the 3rd enemy spy wins!

name: Deep Shelf: United Reclamation – Faction Expansion
description:
The United Reclamation: Faction Expansion adds an entirely new fifth faction to the game with its own unique play style.

United Reclamation is a highly mobile faction that utilizes a second submarine, has superior scouting capabilities, and the ability to use slag and raw ore to create cheap refurbished facilities.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: あわてんぼうのサンタクロース (Awatenbou no Santa Claus)
description:
The player is a frazzled Santa Claus who has arrived there on the 24th.
He left his watch at home, so he measures 24 hours by feel and places presents.
Who will be the first to place a present on the 25th?

Each player decides his or her own color and holds a Santa card of each color and a card for 2, 4, or 8 hours. Put one of the Santa cards in front of you so that you can recognize your color.
After all players take out their cards, the game starts at midnight on the 24th and performs the following processing in order from the first card issued.
If it is on the 24th, it will be advanced by one hour.If it is the first present after midnight on the 25th, the player who placed the present will win.

name: Wake
description:
In Wake players move their sailing boats upwind two cards at a time. As the biggest gains and losses in yacht racing are usually on the up-wind legs, this is what Wake models.

Cards are played face down simultaneously. Then flipped to determine player order. But a player does not have to use the card they played, for a card to be added to a boats wake (always two cards long) it must not be less than the sum of the two cards already in the wake. If a player is unable to add a card to their boats wake, they may "bank" it face down for additional value in a following turn.

The first boat to round the windward mark is the winner.

Wake is a free to print n play game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Movement Template, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Krakkakviss: Heimurinn
description:
This special edition of Krakkakviss takes players on a global journey, making it a vibrant trivia game for kids interested in the world around them. It covers a wide range of topics such as countries, cities, food, languages, travel, and much more.

The game encourages competitive play where players can hold their own trivia competition or challenge friends to see who can answer the most questions. Sample questions include: "What important document do you always need to bring when traveling abroad?", "What is the most common name in the world?", and "What does the Spanish word 'gracias' mean?" This edition of Krakkakviss provides a fun and interactive way for children to learn about the world.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Jóla-Krakkakviss
description:
This special Christmas edition of Krakkakviss is an entertaining trivia game that delves into all things related to Christmas and various interesting facts that captivate children. The game includes 100 cards with 300 questions designed to get everyone into the holiday spirit. Sample questions include: "Which Yule Lad has a peg-leg?", "What are Grýla candles made of?", and "What two words can be found on most package labels?". Players can engage in their own trivia competition or challenge friends to see who can answer the most questions, making "Jóla-Krakkakviss" a fun and festive way to enhance knowledge about Christmas traditions and facts.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Krakkakviss: Fótbolti
description:
This version of Krakkakviss is an interactive trivia game designed for children with a keen interest in football. The game encompasses a wide range of football-related topics, including renowned football clubs like Liverpool and Manchester United, notable players, championship records, and tournaments like the World Cup and the European Championship. It also features content about the Icelandic national team and the Champions League. The game allows for individual play or can be enjoyed in a competitive format where players or teams challenge each other to answer the most questions, making it a fun and engaging way to expand knowledge about football.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Krakkakviss 2
description: Continuing the success of the popular Icelandic trivia game Krakkakviss, comes Krakkakviss 2, a trivia game for children that spans topics from all over the world. Designed for players aged 6 and up, the game includes 100 cards featuring 300 diverse questions. Sample questions include: "Which animal travels at night and sleeps upside down?", "From which country do pizza and pasta originate?", and "Who says 'Hakuna Matata'?" The game promotes team play and cooperative learning, making it a perfect choice for any occasion, from family game nights to children's gatherings. With Krakkakviss 2, trivia fun continues to engage young players, further nurturing their curiosity and broadening their knowledge.

name: Krakkakviss 3
description: Krakkakviss 3, the latest addition to the popular Icelandic trivia game series, is tailored specifically for younger audiences. This engaging trivia game comes with 100 cards containing 300 questions that cover a broad spectrum of topics suitable for any occasion. Inquisitive prompts such as "What is a super glue?", "Which girl has superpowers in the animated film Encanto?", and "What sport is Ping Pong?" inspire friendly competition and team play. Players can host their own trivia competition or challenge friends to see who can answer the most questions. Perfect for family game nights or children's gatherings, Krakkakviss 3 continues the tradition of making trivia fun and accessible for young players.

name: Pöbbkviss 2
description: Pöbbkviss 2, the sequel to the highly successful Icelandic trivia game, is an entertaining choice for friend gatherings, family events, road trips, and parties. After the resounding success of the first edition in 2020, Pöbbkviss 2 brings 1,000 brand-new questions from various categories, including the addition of a new segment called "fivefold," which has gained popularity in the trivia show Kviss. The game accommodates an unlimited number of players and can be played in various ways. In the traditional version, players form teams, with one person taking on the role of the quizmaster. Teams write their answers on paper, and the team with the most correct answers at the end wins.

name: Ti Lo Chi
description:
Ti Lo Chi is an abstract area control game with perfect balance, open information and a dash of luck. Claim victory by being the first to control 15 tiles!

Each player has identical deck of 15 glyph tiles and 15 matching crystals. You play with your hand of 3 tiles face up.

There are 3 phases to each turn; reveal, play, discard.
On their turn, players reveal by flipping over 2 additional tiles in to their hand so that they have five face up tiles. The player then selects a tile to play adjacent to one or more tiles potentially gaining control of them. The player places their crystal on the newly played tile and additionally replaces any opponent’s crystal with one of their own on any captured tile(s). Their turn ends by selecting one of their 4 remaining face up tiles to be placed face up in to a discard pile. Play continues clockwise with the next player repeating these steps.

—description from the designer

name: B.R.A.V.E.: 勇士候補生寮対抗不統一試験
description:
A competition among 13 students, with each dormitory having its own special characteristics!
The first round is for first-year students, the second round for second-year students, and the third round for third-year students!
The first round is for first-year students, the second round is for second-year students, and the third round is for third-year students!
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Dorasure ひとり旅 (Hitoritabi)
description:
This is a single player card game in which the story is told by flipping cards.
It is a prequel to Hunter, an adventurer included in the Dorasure Basic Set.

Players read the text on the cards, decide the path to take, and sometimes make decisions as they read the adventure. Different endings are reached depending on the player's decisions and luck.
How will the record of your adventure end up!

name: Rupee
description:
You and your friends just finished robbing some weirdo, with a green cap, and a bag full of rupees. Now you've got to figure out how to split the loot. Being the upstanding bandits that you are, you decide to play a little game for keeps.

Rupee is a bag stealing game where you can be mean, nice, and always get your cut. Players choose to spend rupees to complete objectives for points or use abilities to nab even better rupees for more points.

The game ends when a player draws the single, precious golden rupee in the entire game. However, being upstanding bandits, it goes to the player who completed the most objectives. Will you score high or wide? Be kind or cruel? Sabotage the bag or practice some alchemy? Whatever you do, make sure you get the best share of the loot!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, End Game Bonuses, I Cut, You Choose, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: 마타르니아 (Matarnia)
description:
Matarnia is an epic board game about a group of adventurers trying to strike the final blow in a boss raid. While there is a common goal of defeating a single raid boss, each player's real goal is to land the "final blow" and claim all the rewards.

On each player's turn, they draw 2 cards from the character deck. After checking both cards, he or she places one card underneath the boss card without revealing it, and the other card to one side with the boss card revealed. The area under the boss card is called the party recruitment zone, and the area where the remaining card is placed is called the party waiting zone.

Character cards are divided into normal and special classes, with special classes being treated as two normal classes and should be left uncovered when placed in the Party Recruit Zone. However, depending on the boss card's abilities, you may need to keep special class cards covered as well.

On the other hand, instead of drawing cards when it's their turn, players can also keep the cards in the Party Recruit Zone to themselves and decide whether to keep them in the Party Recruit Zone or send them to the Party Waiting Zone. This can be used to confirm that your own calculations are correct, but it can also be used to disrupt your opponent's calculations.

If you think you can defeat the boss with the character cards in the Party Recruitment Zone on your turn, declare "Defeat". At this point, all cards in the Party Recruitment Zone are revealed. The boss card describes the boss's power, how much power each class brings to the party, and the boss's effects.

The game ends when one player captures the boss, when all other players are eliminated and only one player remains, or when the character deck is exhausted. If a player successfully captures the boss, award that player 2 victory tokens, and if only one player remains, award that player 1 victory token. If the deck is exhausted, no one gets any victory tokens.

The round is then repeated, and the player with the most victory tokens (3 or more) wins.

name: 발렌타인 (Valentine)
description:
Players must select their heroes and use their skills to defeat their opponents each turn, based on a set master of a given skill. It's also important to figure out which master they are and defeat them.

There are four faction cards in Valentine. Players of three to six are randomly assigned an affiliation card and must fulfill their role throughout the game.

Once you're aligned, you'll pick a hero to recruit each turn. You start by picking your own hero, and then pass the rest to the player next to you. This is psychologically strategic, as you have to make your picks while trying to anticipate what your opponent will pick.

Once all players have chosen their heroes, they are called out in turn, starting with number one, and the battle begins. You'll need to use the compatibility between your characters to make predictions and attack the enemy.

As each player progresses through the game as a Heroic character, they take hits to their HP and gain access to unique abilities through their affiliation.

name: Crosscut
description: Crosscut is a two-player abstract strategy game where the goal is to be the first player to make a horizontal or vertical line spanning the board. The game is played on a square board. The pieces never stay on the perimeter squares of the board, so on a 10x10 board, the goal is to make a line that is 8 pieces long. This also means that it is possible to play the 10x10 game on a Chess board.

name: Örlagaspil
description:
Örlagaspil is an engaging card-based party game, ideally suited as a drinking game for players aged 20 and older. Players take turns drawing cards and performing the actions stated on them. The first player to accumulate a sufficient number of "likes" is declared the winner. The dynamics of the game and the destiny laid out by the cards determine the number of sips a player needs to drink throughout the game.

The game features five types of cards:


“Who is most likely to...?" - Players decide who among them is most likely to do the action described on the card.
"Never Have I Ever" - Players admit whether they have done the action described on the card.
"Pressure" - The player must answer a potentially challenging or revealing question.
"Who am I?" - Players must guess the identity or concept described on the card.
"Fate" - These cards likely include random, unpredictable actions or events.


Designed and promoted by popular Icelandic influencers and podcast hosts “Spjallið”, Örlagaspil comes in a neat box and is divided into five categories. Players can choose to include all categories or select their favorites for gameplay. This game is designed to enhance any party experience and can accommodate 2 to 10 players, or even more. As the game's tagline suggests, Örlagaspil makes a good party better​.

name: The Dragon Prince: Mystery of Aaravos Booster Pack
description: This expansion adds new cards to the deck of each character in the base game. Two new cards are added to each character deck, adding powers and abilities from the fourth season of the show.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Team-Based Game

name: Chaos im Heldenwald
description:
In this party game for 3-6 people, ages 16+, you choose a hero and give your character a name.

Each round, one of the players becomes the leader of the round and reads out a quest to be filled with the name of your hero and a character or item from the hero forest!

The gap in the text must be filled in as amusingly as possible so that the round leader determines your card as the winner of the round!

The winner is whoever has collected the most quest cards at the end or the hero who has reached a certain point limit that you have previously agreed on.

name: Today we go shopping
description:
On the way to the market, the little hedgehogs learn where their food comes from. Can 1 to 3 children find the right ingredients for their favorite dish? Pay quickly and pack everything in the backpack. The player that acquires the ingredients first wins.

The game includes two difficulty settings.

name: Escape Game Party: Mission Alpha
description:
CAN YOU ESCAPE FROM THIS ADVENTURE?

You are Vincent Lenoir, Agent Alpha, one of the time travelers recruited by the Escape Time agency. Over the course of your missions, you have discovered that Escape Time's indentions are malicious and you intend to expose it to the light of day. But the agency is aware of your betrayal... Quick, it's time to flee before they silence you! Discover a breathtaking adventure in which you will have to observe, manipulate and solve puzzles (encrypted alphabet, labyrinth, deduction, logic, etc.), just like in a real escape room.

All the equipment to play like in an escape room!

name: Duke's Domain
description:
The mountain border of the kingdom has been conquered, on the other side an unoccupied new world! You have been granted a royal charter to settle this new world, expanding your duchy in the name of the king. Unfortunately so have your rivals, and only the most successful among you will keep his new lands. Explore, build and settle to become the strongest duke.

Duke’s Domain is a worker placement, resource management, exploration game. The goal is to have the most victory points after 10 turns. Victory points are earned through constructing building and exploring the map.

Players start with a village and 3 workers on the edge of an ever expanding map. Earn resources each turn by placing workers on resource tiles. Develop resources to increase the yield of a hex. Manage your resources well to continue developing your lands. Explore the adjacent lands to uncover more resources and earn victory points. Hire more workers to develop and explore more. Fund your efforts through building villages and towns.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Income, Map Addition, Worker Placement

name: B-29: Bombs Over Japan
description: A Solo Roll and Write WWII Wargame, which is easy-to-learn and simple-to-play solitaire gaming experience where you play as a B-29 Bomber heading out on bombing rais in Japan. All you need to play this warbook are 2 six-sided dice, a twenty-sided dice, a copy of the main game sheet from this book, and a pen or pencil.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Micro Titans: Wrestling – MicroMania
description: Micro Titans: Wrestling is a card game like no other, capturing the excitement, surprises, high spots, twists, turns and emotion of a pro-wrestling match. Season 1, MicroMania, is heavily influenced by the 1987—1992 golden era of professional wrestling. It will deliver the base game, a ten character strong roster and four additional game modes spread across multiple, fully loaded, game changing expansions.

name: Bezzerwizzer Sport
description:
Bezzerwizzer Sport is a trivia game in which you will have to use your knowledge and tactical skills.
The game contains 1200 questions that will challenge the knowledge of your friends, family and yourself on everything from athletics to soccer and racing to the olympics.

—description from the publisher (translated)

BEZZERWIZZER Sport er et quizspil, hvor du skal bruge din paratviden, dine taktiske evner og naturligvis din bedreviden. Spillet indeholder 1.200 spørgsmål, der vil udfordre dine venners, din families og din egen viden om alt fra atletik til landsfodbold og fra motorsport til OL.

BEZZERWIZZER Sport Kategorier: Atletik, Boksning & Motor, Cykling, Dansk Fodbold, Holdsport, Håndbold, International Fodbold, Landsholdsfodbold, OL, Singlesport, Vandsport og Vintersport.

—description from the publisher

name: Thermodynamics Workers
description: Thermodynamics Workers is a roll-and-move game which takes place on a 2D graph of volume x pressure. Each cube a player has on the graph represents a different system, and the goal is to be the first person to collect 80 Joules of work when your systems increase in volume.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: House of Stolen Goods
description:
House of Stolen Goods in a push your luck card game in which players are trying to acquire goods in three different colors. Each color has some cards worth points, as well as a thief, and a counterfeit work. There are also some colorless cards, such as a safe and an appraiser.

On a player's turn, they reveal 1 to 3 cards from the deck and can choose to take them or discard them. Under some circumstances, the player is obliged to discard them. A player will only have 3 piles to sort cards to in front of them. Alternatively, a player could also take the entire discard pile to occupy one of their piles.

The game ends when all but one player has acquired 3 piles. The player with the most points wins.

name: Stars, Galaxies and the Big Bang
description:
In Stars, Galaxies and the Big Bang, the players are creating galaxies, adding stars face down to a series of galaxies. Once a black hole card is drawn or one galaxy has nine stars, the round ends. Players take turns drafting galaxies, revealing the cards and hoping for the lowest valued sum. Pairs of the same number stars are removed prior to calculating the sum.

The first player to 6 points wins.
publishers: 東京なかよしデザイン (Tokyo Nakayoshi Design)

name: Heroverse: Battleforce 20th Anniversary Edition
description:
Beware the balance of shifting power in this fast-paced card battler. Will you select the right heroes and villains to defeat your opponent and take control of the Heroverse?

Heroverse: Battleforce is a fact paced 2 player card game in which you will face off in a series of battles with the Controlling Power Source changing from battle to battle. The game has alternative rules for 3-4 players. Each game takes about 5 minutes to play.

This deck consists of 48 character cards in 4 Power Source categories:


Blue/Combat-based characters
Yellow/Technology-based characters
Green/Energy-based characters
Red/Magic-based characters


Each game consists of 2 rounds. Each round consists of 4 battles, played 3 cards at a time. The player with the most cards at the end of both rounds wins.

The Heroverse: Battleforce card game was created in 2003 and premiered at the inaugural New York Comic Con in 2006 at the Heroverse booth.

The 20th Anniversary Edition features new character art on 20 cards including 3 brand new illustrations by Eisner nominated artist Ryan Benjamin, created especially for this edition. Other changes include new special case power mechanics and balancing from the original game, and 6 bonus cards that can be swapped into the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Garden Wars
description:
Do you have what it takes to become Best Gardener? Liven up your game night with Garden Wars, a light-hearted, quick play, "take that!" tabletop card game of strategy and defense.

Your goal is to grow the most bountiful garden in town, while undermining the progress on your rivals. To win you must:

Plant a diverse set of Crop cards with stacking bonuses.
Defend your land from invading predators, disease, weeds and nosey neighbors with Expert and Block cards.
Become a force of nature to take down your opponents with Attack cards.
Avoid disaster from flood, locust and drought with your trusty Almanac.


Standard gameplay is for 2-4 players, with expanded "4 Season" rules for 4-6 players. Play time is 30-60min.

Garden Wars is perfect for family game night or a quick round at the bar. The whimsical artwork and boisterous gameplay is sure to bring a smile to your face. Plant, grow and win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Take That

name: Critical Cut!
description: In Critical Cut, the players take turns cutting a structured deck of cards and collecting the card they cut to. Points are awarded for finding sets of the same number, sequences of numbers, and flushes. Bonus points are awarded for ranks which match a players' birth month or kings.

name: Animal Duet
description:
In Animal Duet, players aim to collect pairs of cards. The game uses a mechanic where players choose to either reveal a card from the deck into a row and then take another turn, or collect all revealed cards. If a revealed card matches a card already in the row, a player busts and takes only the newest revealed card, ending their turn.

In Animal Duet, all face cards and jokers are treated as jokers and when taking cards from the row, if there is a joker present, the player takes all cards on either side of the joker and the joker itself (rather than the entire row.)

name: ねこまねき (Nekomaneki)
description:
This is a game in which you invite cats by giving them fish.
Cats will often come to the cat who gives them fish, but you can't always give fish to the cat you want to give.
You may attract cats with their favorite food such as bonito flakes and silver vine.

The fish card is given to the cat sitting on the cushion with the number that comes out from the dice roll. The one whose total of the two fish cards is larger than the other's is the one that beckons the cat.
The player can invite the cat, but only half of the cards are known how many fish cards the other player has played.

This is a game where you can enjoy not only bluffing in conversation and psychological warfare, but also logical thinking by calculating backwards from the disclosed information!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Dice Rolling

name: ラドラボ -Dr.ウーノの放射線研究所- (Radiation Laboratory)
description:
This game is an educational card game created with Dr. Tsunoyama of the Radioisotope Research Center, Kyoto University.

While having fun playing the game, you can learn about the basic knowledge you need to know now: the relationship between types of radiation and shielding.

This game is a radiation-themed card game for two players.
Select the appropriate card for each type of mysterious creature "radiation" and "block" it!
Sharp tactics and speedy development of whether you should play or draw a card are hot!

name: 손맛 전자 빠른 수리 (Handmade Electronics Quick Repair)
description:
Handmade Electronics Quick Repair is a game about a part-time employee of "Handmade Electronics" who fixes televisions by beating them with his hands.

Prove that you have a 'touch sence' by arranging the parts in order faster than anyone else!

A card game that combines push-your-luck and action recall mechanics, inspired by Sorting in programming.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: SquAlma
description:
SquAlma is an abstract strategy game for 2 players of at least 8 years of age, with an average playing time of 20 minutes, aiming to create a path connecting both players’ back rows. It is played on a square board, consisting of 64 squares, 8 on each side. Each player is assigned with discs of either black or white colour and alternate turns, moving a disc of their colour following a set of rules, until victory condition is met.

—description from the designer

name: HexAlma
description:
HexAlma is an abstract strategy game for 2 players of at least 8 years of age, with an average playing
time of 30 minutes, aiming to reach the opponent’s back row. It is played on a hexagonal board,
consisting of 61 hexagons, 5 on each side. Each player is assigned with discs of either black or white
colour and alternate turns, moving a disc of their colour following a set of rules, until victory
condition is met.

—description from the designer

name: HexCore 6
description:
HexCore 6 is an abstract strategy game for 2 players of at least 8 years of age, with an average playing time of 35 minutes, where players try to create the longest path/biggest group connected to the ‘’Core’’. It is played on a hexagonal board, consisting of 91 spots, 6 on each side. Each player is assigned with discs of either black or white colour and they alternate turns, following a set of rules until victory condition is met.

—description from the designer

name: Crazy Travel Stories
description:
The party game where the whackiest tale wins!

Entertain fellow players to win points and become the Ultimate Crazy Travel Storyteller. Combine cards into a whacky travel story, vote with your leftover cards and use more flip flops to score higher!

Journey cards set the scene for everyone's Crazy Travel Story. Use 5 of the 7 Word cards in your hand to come up with a middle and an end. Word cards can be anything from a character to a place, an object or an activity.

Cards are ranked in order of difficulty with the harder cards being more difficult to work into a story but scoring more points. Harder cards are green with 3 flip flops, easy cards are pink with 1 flip flop and the blue cards are in the middle with 2 flip flops.

—description from the publisher

name: Crypto Millionaire
description:
Buy low, sell high, use cards to your advantage, and don't get caught by a crash! Have the most points at the end of the game to win.

On your turn, Buy, Sell or use an action on your cards to manipulate the market to your advantage. Then flip over a Market card and move the market (one coin up and one coin down).

Build the best portfolio before the market crashes!

Includes 3 expansions:
Headline cards give each round an unexpected twist.
Booms and Busts cause multiple coins to rise or fall in value.
Colouful Pupcoins add a homage to DogeCrypto to your gameplay.

Crypto Millionaire have lots of scope for different strategies and high replayability with multiple varying Value Tracks to control the market during the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Snappy Slaps
description:
Race to collect the most cards in this fast-reaction card game!

We've snapped photos of the crocodile Olympics for you to collect. Be the first person to slap matching cards and claim them as your own. Watch out for instant snap and change-direction cards that mix up game play. Be the last croc standing with cards to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Two Left Feet
description:
Bust all your moves out to your followers and be the first player to get rid of all your cards to complete your video! The deck consists of 4 dance crazes, and featured numbered steps to do the dance. You can only play cards from your hand that match the dance craze in the center or show a higher numbered step as the card in the center. Look out for action cards that could cut your Wi-Fi or send your pet in to sabotage your video!

—description from the publisher

name: Dueling Cupids
description:
Create new love connections for classic characters while you explore their traditional roles in Shakespeare’s plays! Score points for hitting targets, matching characters, and collecting three characters in a row from the same play. Aim for bonus points by collecting characters that match your secret objectives. All’s fair in love and war!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Tile Placement, Worker Placement
publishers: Gray Wolf Games, Panda Game Manufacturing (PandaGM)

name: Consensus
description:
Our first tabletop game, Consensus, requires strategy, pattern recognition, and communication. Made for 2-10 players, this game serves as a creative reaction to the polarized dialogue and toxic partisanship in our communities.

Consensus uses game theory and a variety of custom layers to stimulate a turn based debate between people with different agendas. You can control the setup to either be competitive or collaborative. Play to outsmart and outscore your opponents or add real topics and your opinions to find common ground.

At Game Genius, our goal was to build a fun game that doubles as a conversation tool. Within our services, we facilitate introductory play sessions with Consensus because it's an effective way to learn more about a group.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Different Dice Movement, Negotiation, Prisoner's Dilemma, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Tidbit
description:
Ready for a bite-sized battle of words and wits? In Tidbit, Players (or teams) claim cards by identifying words connected to themes in a row (horizontal/ vertical/ diagonal). They will need to be clever and pay attention as others may be vying for the same cards!

After a series of 4 rounds, players count up their cards to determine the winner. But that's not all. There's another title up for grabs! With their claimed cards, players create a final word. Whoever uses the most cards earns the prestigious title, "Word of the Day".

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Word Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Judge Dredd: The Game of Crime-Fighting in Mega-City One – Judge Fish promo
description:
Promo playable character.

Judge Fish has 5 strength and the ability

"Aquatic:
You may cross the river where there is no bridge present. You may ignore bridge closures.

You can move from the Grand Hall of Justice to the Power Tower this way, but cannot enter the open water on the left of the map."
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 7 Seas: The Pirate King
description:
Ahoy there, mateys! Welcome to 7 Seas: Pirate King, the exciting and immersive game that will have you setting sail on the high seas to become the most feared pirate of them all. With a unique pirate map board, ship and crew leveling up, and strategic battles against the Navy and Traders, 7 Seas offers a thrilling and engaging gameplay experience that will keep you hooked from start to finish.

In 7 Seas, you'll start with a small ship and crew, but as you navigate the treacherous waters of the 7 Seas, you'll have the opportunity to level up and improve your ship and crew. With each victory against the Navy and Traders, you'll earn treasure and resources that can be used to upgrade your ship's cannons and sails, your own leadership and cunning as captain, as well as your crew's skills and abilities.

But becoming the Pirate King won't be easy. You'll need to outmaneuver and outwit your opponents, making strategic decisions about when and where to attack, and how to best use your ship's strengths and weaknesses in battle.

And with a unique pirate map board, and different ways to level up your crew, every game of 7 Seas is different, offering a fresh and exciting gameplay experience every time you play. You'll explore new ports and encounter new challenges as you sail across the 7 Seas, battling against the Navy and Traders to claim your place as the Pirate King.

So gather your crew, hoist the Jolly Roger, and set sail for adventure in 7 Seas: Pirate King. With a rich and immersive game world, deep gameplay mechanics, and endless replayability, this game is sure to become a favorite among pirate lovers and board game enthusiasts alike.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Dead Inside: Zombie Survival Card Game
description:
Have you ever wanted to survive the zombie apocalypse from the safety of your kitchen table. Well now you can. Dead Inside is a unique zombie survival experience played with 2 to 4 players.

Each round you can scavenge for supplies. You may find all sorts of useful items including food, water, weapons and medical supplies. Use these items to keep yourself alive. Without food or water, you will die. Players have three ways they can die. Hunger, thirst or health. If either of these stats reach zero, you're dead.

While you are out scavenging you will no doubt come across some undead folks. With eight unique zombie types, some with special abilities, you better be prepare to defend yourself. You may choose to run or fight. But don't let that horde get too big or you will get overwhelmed.

Being the strongest survivor sometimes means doing a few underhanded actions. Dead Inside gives you the chance to sabotage other players. Break their legs so they can't run from their horde and are forced to fight. Cut them so they slowly bleed out, without the right medical supplies they are sure to experience a slow death.

—description from the designer

Components: (from the Kickstarter)

Each deck will come with 126 cards, 2 dice and an instruction booklet.
Contained in the deck is
8 Unique Zombie Cards (41 Cards)
5 Unique Status Cards (16 Cards)
6 Unique Action Cards (14 Cards)
4 Unique Equipment Cards (12 Cards)
13 Unique Item Cards (43 cards)

There is also a mobile app on the Play Store to help track your health, water and food.
The app is not required in order to play the game, however.

name: Stacks & Stacks
description:
Stacks & Stacks is a quick and easy theme-based card game.
Claim cards from Stacks on the table.
Try to Claim the most points each Round.
Just 2 Rounds and a final Winner is declared.
Shuffle up and Play again!

Each theme has its own unique flair, goofy goblins or cute critters.
All the familiar fun of classic playing card games.
Luck has its role, but strategic thinking and foresight pay off.

Hordes & Hoardes: Stacks & Stacks Deck
Once upon a time, there was a DRAGON who wanted more GOLD for his HOARD where he sleeps.
Instead of getting it himself, he thought he could threaten GOBLINS to take GOLD from other DRAGONS' HOARDS to feed his greedy need.
It would seem this was not the only DRAGON with such an idea. Who will get the most?

Critters & Crops; Stacks & Stacks Deck
Once upon a time, there was a BEAR who wanted more FOOD for the WINTER when he sleeps.
Instead of getting it himself, he thought he could threaten CRITTERS to take CROPS from FARMERS' FIELDS to feed his greedy need.
It would seem this was not the only BEAR with such an idea. Who will get the most?

Each Turn is 1 of 4 Easy Choices:
DRAW ◊ MOVE ◊ PLAY ◊ PLACE

3 Ways to Enjoy Stacks & Stacks
Standard Stacks (the standard way to play)
Solo Stacks (more fun than Solitaire)
Versus Stacks (Theme vs. Theme with added twists)

—description from the designer

name: The Assembly Board Game
description:
As a member of The Assembly, you'll use your special powers and abilities to fight against the nefarious forces of Blacklace. You'll need to manage your energy carefully, making strategic decisions about when and how to use your powers to defeat your opponents. With a modular hex board, every game of The Assembly is different, offering a fresh and exciting gameplay experience every time you play.

​But if you choose to play as a member of Blacklace, you'll have your own unique abilities and powers to unleash on The Assembly. You'll need to work together with your fellow villains to outwit and outmaneuver the heroes, using your wits and cunning to gain the upper hand in battle.

As you battle against the other team, you'll earn Victory Points that will determine the ultimate winner of the game. With a fast-paced, action-packed gameplay experience, The Assembly is a game that will keep you engaged and entertained for hours on end.

​So gather your friends, choose your side, and get ready for an epic battle of good versus evil in The Assembly: Board Game. Whether you're a fan of superhero stories or just love a good game of strategy and tactics, this game has something for everyone.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Lord of the Labyrinth
description:
Introducing Lord of the Labyrinth, a cooperative-multi-progression board game that will take you on an unforgettable journey through perilous labyrinths filled with danger and mystery. In this game, you and your friends will go on a quest to defeat enemies, solve puzzles, and eventually make your way to the Minotaur—the Lord of the Labyrinth—as you embark on this roguelike adventure.

Using a combination of cards, a shared dice pool between allies and enemies, and highly replayable gameplay, Lord of the Labyrinth offers a unique and challenging experience that will keep you engaged and entertained throughout multiple games. You'll have the opportunity to level-up your characters as you progress, gaining new abilities, loot, and powers that will aid you on your journey.

But be warned: the Minotaur is not the only danger lurking in the labyrinths. You'll encounter treacherous traps, deadly monsters, and mysterious artifacts that could spell your doom if you're not careful.

Luckily, you won't be alone. As a cooperative game, Lord of the Labyrinth encourages players to work together to overcome the challenges that await them. By combining your skills, abilities, and dice puzzles, you'll be able to overcome even the most difficult obstacles and emerge victorious...eventually. As a roguelike, expect to fail sometimes, but use the knowledge, experience, and new loot you gained to help win the next time!

So gather your friends, prep your characters, and get ready to take on the Lord of the Labyrinth. It's time to begin an epic adventure that you won't soon forget.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Spitfire Pilot 1940: Dynamo to the Blitz
description:
Sat inside the cockpit with the engine rattling through your bones, you turn to engage. Managing your energy and fuel, can you gain position to get a shot off? Or will the bandit get the better of you? Sometimes it is better to disengage than push a losing fight.

Spitfire Driver is a solitaire game of aerial combat in the Second World War. Using a game card that acts as your Cockpit and also as a mission generator. The player and Bandit take alternating actions to try and get a shot on the opposites aircraft.

Each sortie lasts between 5-10 minutes, and the player has a logbook to advance their career. As the player completes a campaign, they have the option to keep the logbook and continue their career in different aircraft and theatres.

All is needed is at least four D6, a small marker for the advantage track, and a pen or pencil for the logbook. Everything else is included in the print and play PDF.

Do you have what it takes to complete a campaign in Supermarines iconic fighter?

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Blossom
description:
Welcome to Blossom, the enchanting board game that will transport you to a vibrant world of colorful flowers and lush gardens. In this game, you'll compete with other players to create the most beautiful and bountiful flower garden by strategically drafting cards and managing your resources.

Blossom is an engine-building style game that challenges you to create the most efficient garden possible. You'll need to carefully select the flowers you plant, manage your water and fertilizer resources, and build your garden up over time to create a stunning and diverse landscape.

As you progress through the game, you'll acquire new abilities and powers that will help you build your garden even more effectively. You'll also encounter special events and challenges that will test your skills and force you to adapt your strategy on the fly.

But Blossom isn't just a game about mechanics - it's also a feast for the eyes. With stunning artwork and a vibrant color palette, Blossom is a joy to look at and play. You'll feel like you're strolling through a beautiful garden with every turn.

Whether you're a seasoned board game veteran or a newcomer to the hobby, Blossom offers something for everyone. It's easy to learn but difficult to master, and every game is different thanks to the card drafting mechanics.

So put on your gardening gloves, grab your watering can, and get ready to plant the most beautiful garden of them all in Blossom!

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting

name: Simpatico: A Civilization Game
description:
Step into the world of Simpatico, the exciting civilization board game that will take you on a journey through time and space as you build your civilization from the ground up. With simple mechanics and countless options, Simpatico offers a deep and immersive gameplay experience that will keep you engaged and entertained for hours on end.

In Simpatico, you'll start with a small group of settlers and work to build a thriving civilization. You'll need to manage your resources carefully, making strategic decisions about where to focus your efforts and how to best grow your society. With a modular hex board, every game of Simpatico is different, offering a unique and challenging experience every time you play.

One of the things that sets Simpatico apart is the multiple ways to score. Whether you focus on faith, culture, military, or science, there are many paths to victory in this game. This gives you the freedom to pursue your own unique strategy and playstyle, making each game of Simpatico feel fresh and exciting.

As you progress through the game, you'll encounter challenges and opportunities that will test your skills and force you to adapt your strategy on the fly. With so many options and possibilities, Simpatico is a game that offers endless replayability and depth.

So gather your friends, prepare to build your civilization, and get ready for an unforgettable gaming experience with Simpatico. Whether you're a seasoned board game veteran or a newcomer to the hobby, this game has something for everyone.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Income, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Empyres
description:
Welcome to Empyres: The Board Game, the strategic and immersive game that will take you on a journey through time as you build and expand your own empire. With worker placement, multiple paths to score, and tableau engine building, Empire offers a deep and engaging gameplay experience that will keep you coming back for more.

In Empyres, you'll start with a small kingdom and work to build a vast and powerful empire. You'll need to manage your workers carefully, making strategic decisions about where to place them and how to best utilize their skills and abilities. With multiple paths to score, every game of Empire is different, offering a wide range of strategies and playstyles to explore.

As you expand your empyre, you'll discover new cities, recruit great people, and build a wide range of buildings and wonders. With over 140 cities, 70 people, and 70 buildings to discover and explore, Empire offers a wealth of content and possibilities.

But to truly succeed in Empyres, you'll need to master the art of tableau engine building. By carefully constructing your own personal tableau of buildings, wonders, and people, you'll create a powerful engine that will fuel your empire's growth and success.

With a rich and detailed game world, deep gameplay mechanics, and endless replayability, Empyres: The Board Game is the perfect choice for fans of strategy and empire-building games. Whether you're a seasoned board gamer or a newcomer to the hobby, Empyres is a game that offers something for everyone. So gather your friends, prepare to build your empire, and get ready for an unforgettable gaming experience with Empyres: The Board Game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Worker Placement

name: Disturblings
description:
Disturblings is a push-your-luck, tower-defense game for one player that’s full of bullets and colorful oddities.
