You play as three-armed anti-hero, Bobby Butcher, as he’s handcuffed to an injured sheriff and struggling to fight off the disturbingly cute, lab-altered creatures scampering towards you.

As you scramble to reload the sheriff’s service weapon, you’ll need to strategically reallocate resources to build up your defenses and ensure you’re not overwhelmed.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 15 Minute Cold War
description:
Change the course of history in your very own 15 Minute Cold War.

Choose from the mighty Soviet Union, the United States of America, the People's Republic of China or the United Kingdom. Build up your unique technology and culture, your military defences and special abilities while balancing the need for protection with the urge for aggression.

Form new alliances with your fellow countries and use all of your skill to remain the last leader standing and the next great superpower!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: TwoTimes
description:
Zweimal is a quick tile-laying game for two players ages 8 and up.

The game is played in a 4x4 tile grid or a 5x5 tile grid of roads.

The aim of the main game is score more points & maintain the majority on roads. To achieve that goal you place your meeples on the grid to secure that road.

As long there is no meeple on the tile, you can play other tiles to change direction of the road.

—description from the publisher

name: MechaTop: Campaign Book #2
description:
16 battles that will lead you to the capture of the mysterious enemy and his stunning confession!

New rules:

In-depth rules for large-scale battles;
Optional rules for your "solo" player-controlled units;
The very fun "ARCADE" game mode!


—description from the publisher

name: Chytré kostky: Dinosauři
description:
In Chytré kostky - Dinosauři one player rolls four different die (size, weight, natural habitat, etc.), then everyone tries to find animal matching most rolled symbols. After every player has chosen one animal every picked animal is turned to other side and each match equals one point.

Once each player rolled once (or twice in two player game) it is end of the game and player with most points wins.

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #08 – Anniversary
description:
Can you believe it? Quests Over Coffee came out one year ago! I released it as a little thing for my birthday and it has found such a wonderful player base that it has exceeded all expectations. To celebrate the one-year Anniversary, I decided to release an expansion of 9 new cards! Thank you so much for playing.

What is included in this expansion?

2 Quests, 5 Items, 1 Environment, and 1 Companion!

Any Quests Over Coffee game requires 10 Quest cards and at least 6 Item cards, so it's best to start with the base game if you don't have enough! If you want to play with Environments, make sure to read the most up to date rule set (1.2 or above)!

What is Quests Over Coffee?

Quests Over Coffee is a single player dice throwing game where you try to claim fame and fortune. With a some strategy, some items, and a little bit of luck, you can find yourself on the other side of the glory or in the pit of a grave.

The game is also a system that allows for you to create your own Quests and Items to experience. Let your imagination and experience run free!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Quests Over Coffee: Patreon Goodies – Promos and Things
description:
In a land not so far away, in a town you probably don't remember, there is a coffee shop that specializes in quests and, well, coffee. They like to tout that they're the only place where you can get a cup of decent coffee and complete a set of quests (with included fame and fortune) before you finish the last drop. Will you partake in this marketing ploy thinly veiled as a call for adventure?

Patreon goodies now available!

Note that these goodies are Quests Over Coffee card game specific, so things like Companions, Items, Quests, and so on. Spin-offs aren't included here.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Quests Over Coffee: Danger Room
description:
What is included in this game?

Single sheet to print and play on!

What will I need to play?

You will need 3d6 and 3 different tokens/markers (one for the player, one for time, and one for score).

What kind of game is this?

You will roll 3d6 and assign that to different pieces in the game. You travel around the board to try to score on squares that give you points during that turn. You have a limited amount of time to do it though!

name: Tipping Point
description:
Tipping Point is a contentious 2 player Negotiation game of Governance. Players represent political factions that strive to cement their legacy by accumulating enough Victory Points (VPs) before the accumulation of Carbon Emissions or Government Debt result in a Critical Tipping Point in which all players lose the game. Players deploy their Political Capital to score VPs through actions of governance like elections, legislation, shifting policy, appointing justices, and more but not all actions can be done alone in a divided Government so players must occasionally work with and against their opponent at the same time.

—description from the designer

name: Kill Dracula
description:
Players move around the board first on a coach going to Dracula's Castle. they have to watch out for the wolves. When they get there, they must try to sneak away while the gypsies are unloading the coach, if they are unfortunate and the gypsies force them to enter the castle, they won’t be able to get out of the main entrance. they must Try to make your way to the back gate where they can escape by carefully jumping down. Making their way to the Village where they will find items to aid them. they must must first kill 3 vampires then they can find Dracula and kill him. they will find him in the crypt.

Players movement is done by the amount of actions they have, which depends on their health. player will have encounters with vampires in the hours of the night. Encounters are a die roll. Players can attack vampires and Dracula by finding items in buildings. Going to the castle and killing Dracula.

Object of the game is to must find weapons to kill three vampires then kill Dracula in the castle.

—description from the designer

name: The Calling:  A Roguelike Game
description:
One day while patrolling the marketplace, you witness a child miraculously healed by an old man. The man speaks gibberish about horde and lava-water, then darts into the alleys. Next thing you know, you're being accused of murder by a Suit.

Since Horde-infested alleys are just a fairy tale, and you are apparently being framed for a crime you didn’t commit by a corrupt mercenary, you take off after the man in search of the unknown.

In The Calling | A Roguelike Game, you are a Market Man, running through alleys and building your character, in hopes of finding a light in the darkness.

Build your initial character, choosing stats and abilities. Run the alleys, fend off horde, and avoid traps to gain XP. Purchase better stats and abilities to amp up your survival before the game sucks you into the alleys forever.

The Calling is a dungeon escape, rogue-like game that plays in 15 mins. per round. Stats and abilities carry over between rounds, but the permadeath mechanic can be frustratingly brutal.

That's ok...If you lose really quickly, learn from your mistakes, and run it back.

(This game is made for solo gamers at its core. There is an add-on expansion that shifts gameplay from a solo roguelike to a 2-4 player roguelite, where the respawns are welcomed and points by goal attainment are key.)

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Luminary
description:
In a world of darkness and uncertainty, Luminaries light the way. True light comes in many forms and colors but must always flow from the River.

In Luminary, you are in fact a Luminary yourself, bringing light in a time of darkness.

In this quick 24 card-tile game, you draft colored-light tiles, lay out a variety of light groupings, and modify your rotation-based, card-tile, tech tree as needed.

Gather light, establish light, and advance your tech tree as you seek to provide Light to attain victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Market, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: NOVA: Race from the Sun Promo Pack
description:
Six Technology Cards with blank fronts allow you to create your own Techs to mix in the game. The standard pack contains Tech Cards for Mars, the Belt, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Quidditch: Le Jeu de Plateau
description:
Quidditch - Le Jeu de Plateau is a game in which you will take part in a Quidditch match, wizards and witches favourite sport game from "Harry Potter" books series.

Move your chasers, avoid the bludgers, protect your hoops and score goals. Audacity and strategy will lead you to victory ... but don't forget to catch the Golden Snitch!

Each player manage their own quidditch team. They moves their meeples (who represent the Chasers) whose role is to play with the Quaffle and to score goals. In parallel they try to catch the Golden Snitch by drawing and playing game cards.

Victory is set by the number of points won by scoring goals and/or grabbing the golden snitch.

Thanks to the game cards, players can send Bludgers to the opposing team to destabilize it. Spells cards also allow you to spice up the game and carry out special actions.

Quidditch: Le Jeu de Plateau is a dynamic boardgame, action-oriented, with a share of strategy and chance, while remaining as faithful as possible to the spirit J. K. Rowling’s imagination.

—description from the designer (translated)

*********************************************************************************************************************************************

Quidditch - Le Jeu de Plateau vous permet de prendre part à un match de Quidditch, le sport préféré des sorciers du monde de Harry Potter.

Déplacez vos poursuiveurs, évitez les cognards, protégez vos anneaux et marquez des buts. Audace et stratégie vous mèneront vers la victoire… mais n’oubliez pas d’attraper le vif d’or !

Chaque joueur incarne une équipe de Quidditch dans un match typique des romans de la série Harry Potter.

Il fait évoluer sur le plateau ses pions (qui représentent les Poursuiveurs) dont le rôle est de jouer avec le Souafle et de marquer des buts. En parallèle il tente d’attraper le Vif d’or en piochant et jouant des cartes de jeu.

La victoire est déterminée par le nombre de points gagnés en marquant des buts et/ou en attrapant le Vif d’or.

Grâce aux cartes de jeu les joueurs peuvent envoyer des Cognards sur l’équipe adverse pour la déstabiliser. Des cartes "sortilèges" permettent également de pimenter la partie et de réaliser des actions spéciales.

Quidditch - Le Jeu de Plateau est un jeu dynamique, orienté action, avec une part de stratégie et de hasard, tout en restant le plus fidèle possible à l’esprit du sport et de l’univers créé par J. K. Rowling.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Multi-Use Cards, Simulation

name: A Fistful of Meeples: A Few Meeples More
description:
"A few Meeples more" brings a collection of modular mini-expansions to "A Fistful of Meeples". They can be added individually or all together at once, kitchen sink style.

Mavericks: These wild meeples can shift between builder, miner, robber, or deputy - all at a drop of a hat.

Skip, the Dog: This pooch guards buildings, keeping meeples from entering. They have to skip over Skip. Woof!

The ghostly Madame: The Madame is back - from the grave... Now she haunts the town, scaring meeples out of their wits - and out of their buildings!

The Biggins: Robber Baron, Sheriff, Gold Tycoon, and Freemason are bigger versions of their smaller counterparts. Each one has a unique special ability, adding in some extra spice.

Building Facades: These first come, first served tiles can be built on top of Marquees, providing new end-game scoring opportunities.

-description from crowdfunding campaign
mechanics: Mancala, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Colonade
description:
Two trade merchants try to stock wares. (4 player optional.)
they roll dice to determine which products they can get. The dice uses are also their currency, so they have to decide wise, which products to stock.

—description from the publisher

name: Card Guard
description:
3 to 4 players play cards on the field to score high values of points. Pairs or matches of cards are to be avoided, though.

If pairs happen on the field, these cards leave the play.

The players decide beforehand how many points they want to play or they decide for an amount of time that is played. If any of these conditions are met in the game, the game ends.

In a 3 player match, players take turns to guide "AI" to be the 4th player by playing 2 cards at random.

—description from the publisher

name: Seize: Guilded Treasures
description:
Seize: Guilded Treasures is a new, interactive, arena battle trading card game developed by King's Games. It takes elements of familiar card games mechanics and very new ones along with board interactions on a grid. Instead of having your characters sit in position they instead have specialized movement on the grid to give them more character and lively interactions. You play as a Guild Leader, and your deck of 60 cards is a representation of your resources of your Warchest along with the Mercenaries you have hired to complete the task of defeating the opposing Guild Leader. Your goal in Seize is to reduce the opposing Guild Leader's Warchest Loot to zero. How is that done? By defeating opposing mercenaries with a Bounty Cost, or having an allied mercenary get to the other side of the battlefield and Plunder their Warchest. Each Mercenary, Treasure, Ability, Movement, and Attack matter so it's up to you as a player to manage your resources and develop a strategy wisely to defeat your opponent!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Events, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Interrupts, Line of Sight

name: Meal Deal
description:
What does it look and feel like to be in the saddle, with a bag full of hot food on your back, as your traverse city high-rises looking for the address of customer? What is the financial impact of waiting around all day for work that never comes? Is it worth pushing your luck and taking a risk if it makes the difference in wages?

Meal Deal is a game that puts players in the saddles of cycle couriers working in the gig economy. With a finite amount of stamina on tap each day, the cards allow players to weave their own gig economy story based on academic research with couriers in Manchester, York and Edinburgh in the UK.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Resource to Move

name: Portals
description:
Portals is a two-player tile-placing game set in the fantasy world Lorakis.

Next to the World of Lorakis there are uncounted Fairy Realms, marvelous and dangerous alike. Portals connect this magical Places to the known world. As an apprentice of the Portal Guild you have to prove that you could follow the trails of magical energy to find Portals. But only one of you could become a Path Master.

In Portals you collect Magical Energies of Fairy Realms by drafting Tiles and placing them in your area. Whenever you collected enough magical Energy of one type you open a Portal to the corresponding Realm, which means you are allowed to place a Portal Stone on one of your tiles. The first one who could place all his Portal Stones win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: BCL: Baseball Craps League
description:
A "roll & score" baseball game based on the rules of craps.

This version requires neither the graphical representation of the "diamond" nor pawns. The score sheet is the main feature of BCL™.

All necessary adjustments have been made to make the game smooth and with easy-to-remember rules.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hill Hill
description:
Hill Hill is a first of its kind card-based billiards strategy game. Whether you’re an amateur pool player or a pro, this game provides unique challenges, helpful tools, and a pathway to improving your game in a fun, competitive new way.

Players take turns drawing a card and attempt to complete challenges/runs on the table. If you’re successful, you keep the card and accrue points. Players can also use certain cards to make their path to the “Hill” easier, or more difficult for opponents.

name: Kreuz und quer durch Europa
description:
There are rules for 3 games included:

1. Leisure travel
Before the start of the game, place all the round buttons - printed side down - on any city ring! Then place the information boards face down anywhere across the railway lines! Distribute the tokens evenly among all players and leave 20 in the till! The first player rolls the die and may use a colored button to cover as many sections from a drawn location as he rolls (6 points = 12 sections). You choose your journey in such a way that you reach buttons that you can collect as quickly as possible. If you come across a notice board, you have to follow the given instructions as soon as you have traveled the route you rolled. If you can catch up with a fellow player, he has to return to Bern and pay the snatcher 5 points. If there are only 10 buttons left on the playing field, you can fly, i. H. the sections between two city circles are now considered sections. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins. Not only the tokens count as points, but also the buttons and information boards that you have scooped up.

2. Lay routes
Distribute the buttons evenly among the players! Each player places them face up in front of them! The first player places a port location. If he owns subsequent locations, he may move on. Once he has occupied a node, he can set the new direction of travel, provided he has an adjoining location. If he cannot continue, it is the next player's turn. If you reach an end point or a line that is already occupied, you can start a new one following an already occupied line. The first person to lay out their buttons wins.

3. Zigzag
Place all buttons, except fives, face down on any location! The first player draws a button and goes to the location printed on it. If this is occupied, he keeps the first button and continues in the same way with the new one. But if he comes to an uncovered place, the following player may continue. In the first round you can take a maximum of 5 buttons! Whoever buys the most buttons wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Links und rechts
description:
Participation in the dice game “Left and Right” is unlimited.
The amount of the bet must first be determined and placed, e.g. B. 20 coins per participant.

Dice case "Nimm"
Nimm 1: the player takes 5 coins. from the cash register
Nimm 2: the player takes 10 coins from the pool
R Nimm 1: the neighbor to the right of the dice player takes 5 coins from the cash register.
L Nimm 1: the neighbor to the left of the dice player takes 5 coins from the cash register.
Alles Nimm 2, so each player takes 10 coins from the cash register.

Dice case "Gib"
Exactly the same regulations apply as for "Take" with the only difference that the player himself or his neighbor "Left and Right" has to pay into the till.

Nimm deins (take yours): With this roll of the dice, the dice thrower takes his full bet from the till.

Setz doppelt (pay double): In this case, the thrower has to place double the stake in the cash register.

Nimm die Hälfte (take half): the dice player takes half the content of the cash register.

✝: Here the player is dead for one turn (i.e. the next following one) and has to sit out once.

If the cash register is empty due to a payout, the game begins again.
Play to empty the cash register: this can be done according to the following rules:

Each player is paid an equal part of the pool.
You roll the till "dead" by counting each roll as "take". So it's just take.


—user summary

name: Kentucky Derby Horse Racing
description:
Electric horse racing to simulate the Kentucky Derby.

Race your Horse against your opponents' Horses and collect points for your finish in multiple races. The first Horse to reach 21 points wins the Day at the Derby.

Points:
1st: 4
2nd: 3
3rd: 2
4th: 1

name: SLAPFIGHT
description:
Players pick fighters to represent them in the mother of all show-downs - a slap fight!

With customized dice to represent your fighters life, and cards that give you an arsenal of items, defenses, and attacks, roll your way to victory!

Plays similar to Exploding Kittens or Unstable Unicorns, with a strong dice rolling element to it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Nuts!
description:
Nuts is the strategic memory game which will drive you nuts. Players take up the role of a Squirrel trying to hide their nuts and then trying to find them again. The winner is the player who finds the most nuts and avoids finding the trash.

The game is played in two stages - groundwork and discovery … or rediscovery more like. During the first stage you will take turns placing tiles until all tiles in play are placed. Each player can see their own tiles, but not the opponents.

Note: Every new tile must touch a previous one to form one picture. Keep in mind that you are trying not only to remember where you place your nuts, but also to confuse your opponents and make sure they don’t find all of theirs.

When all the tiles are laid out and you have a nice picture of a forest floor, it’s time to go Nuts!

Second stage: All players take turns picking a tile and flipping it until every player has flipped exactly 10
tiles and placed them in front of them. The aim is of course to pick the tiles that have your nuts underneath. There are 10 nuts in every set and as you get exactly 10 tries, there is
no room for mistakes.

When all players have picked their 10 tiles, it’s time to score. The player who scored highest, wins the game.

name: Ghost Roll
description:
Can you make it to the mansion without waking the ghost?

Try your luck and roll the dice, collecting Candy along the way and trying to beat other players' scores without going over the ghosts!

Roll dice for each round and take turns placing them on your path.

Use Super Trick cards to boost your score and collect your Candy rewards!

—description from the publisher

name: Spork!
description:
Let out your inner child to create the best problem-solving hybrids!

Flip over a Need card with a problem for all players to solve.

Choose a Thing players have to use to solve it.

Players scramble to find a crazy combo using the communal Thing card and a card from their hand and doodle the best solution!

—description from the publisher

name: Habanero
description:
Will you be the master of spice?

You and your friends are testing your luck to see who can eat the spiciest peppers.

Take turns eating small amounts of peppers to build up your Spicy Tolerance Level.

If you feel you can handle the heat, compete in a Spicy Pepper Eating Challenge. The first player to successfully complete 3 challenges wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: BENTO
description:
Fill your bento box with tasty food tiles, complete goals and score points. May the best bento win!

Take turns to pick a food tile, a card or a partition from the resource grid.

Try to group food tiles of the same type together on your bento board and create compartments for them with partitions.

Use your Ability cards to help your game and complete Goal cards to boost your score.

—description from the publisher

name: Yakatabune: Sequence Variant
description:
The Sequence Variant adds another layer of strategy to the standard Yakatabune rules by requiring players to play Fireworks cards from their hand in order from left to right. After drawing their starting hands, players can only change the order of their cards by making use of red Yakatabune cards. Forethought and careful planning will be the keys to victory in this clash of master pyrotechnicians!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition

name: Pizza Time
description:
Pizza Time is a real-time dexterity game. Two players are racing to build pizzas based on their order cards. The conveyor belt is battery-operated, and players try to stack ingredients like pepperoni, tomatoes, and peppers on their pizzas using tweezers. At the end of the conveyor line, the pizza is placed on a plate. The conveyor belt gradually accelerates during play, so later pizzas become more difficult to assemble.

—description from the publisher

name: Chaos Chess (Second Edition): Medieval Madness
description:
Chaos Chess is a genre-mashing game that turns a common chessboard into a dynamic and exciting board game. The core rules of the game remain, but humorous cards allow players to break the rules of chess to do fantastic stuff like


Make a piece move like a different piece
Move an opponents piece for them
Freeze a piece so it can't move
Send a piece to or from "Limbo"


And much more. There are counters to track permanent and temporary effects. Eight new pieces included with this version highlight how flexible the game of chess really is - all while punching the game up to the next level. Pieces include


Anti-Pawn
Dragon
Flame Snake
Frankenpawn
Last Pawn Standing
Many Colored Animals
Pinball Wizard
Superpawn


Players can play cards on their turn by spending cards from their hand. Their opponent can "counter" any card played by discarding three cards. Players must balance card play with chess to achieve checkmate.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Tricks of the Trade
description:
Tricks of the Trade adds a unique twist to the classic concept of a Trick taking game through negotiation and trading. True to its name, players negotiate and exchange cards with each other to try to find an advantage before the Tricks Phase of the game. The unique Tech Deck game effects on cards give players different asymmetric 1-time use abilities through the game making every game fresh and exciting.

OBJECTIVE – The objective of the Tricks of the Trade is to score points. Players score points by bidding accurately, winning tricks, and winning tricks containing cards matching the domain (suit) of their goal card. Skillful negotiation and trading helps players score by improving their odds to win tricks or take tricks with cards matching their goal cards.
GAME PLAY – In each round, players get to trade with each other. Then, they bid on how many tricks they think they will win. Players get to use a Game Effect from a card in their hand. They play 6 rounds of trick-taking and then determine scores based on tricks won.
GAME END AND WINNING – Tricks of the Trade ends after three rounds of play.
THEME – Trick Taking Variant Game

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Predictive Bid, Trading, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: The Summer Fair
description:
The Summer Fair is a quest-based game where players assume the identity of one of multiple animals. Said animal has a series of preparations they need to complete before the aforementioned Summer fair arrives.

The game is played without a die, with players being able to move anywhere from one to five squares every turn. As they move, players draw item cards(representing items they found on the forest floor) and encounter obstacles.

Obstacles are cards that are drawn once a player's pawn steps on designated squares. These cards will have requirements on them. The most common way to overcome an obstacle is by discarding a certain amount of common items (as specified on the card). Players are encouraged to make up explanations for how they would use the items to overcome the obstacle (i.e: I use the pen as a pole vault to jump over the fallen tree).

Each character has special abilities that act as boosts for movement, storage space... or as hindrances to the other characters. First one to finish their quests and return home wins. The Summer fair has arrived.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Storytelling

name: Henchmania: Royal Visit
description:
This expansion contains 3 new modules that can be played independently or together:


The King's Whims


At the beginning of each day, randomly draw a special card that describes the King's Whims.
It explains what the King expects from his subjects for this turn and temporarily changes the rules, creating mini objectives for the day to earn the King's favors, which will help you for the rest of the game.


The Throne Room


The Throne Room is a new place that gives access to new powers. However the places are very limited, even more so than in the other quarters of the city.


Alliance or Betrayal

name: The Power Generation
description:
The Power Generation is a skirmish game where music is power. Play as one of four WarBands of different music genres from the titular Power Generation, a generation of musicians who gained the ability to fight with the power of their music. Your goal is to either perform at venues on the customizable hex-grid map, or defeat the opposing WarBands in combat. The first WarBand to control 3 venues, or the last WarBand standing, is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Order Counters, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Xander and the Dog Circus
description:
Xander has always loved the circus, now that he’s seen a dog circus he plans to train his own pup to learn how to stand on its hind legs, walk a ramp, even jump through a hoop!

Players will be creating the best dog circus they can to impress Xander, but in order to do so, they will need to win tricks. In this trick-taking game the trump suit changes each hand, with 4 total hands being played. Players must follow suit, play a card from the matching suit of the original card that led the trick if possible. After all players have played a card the trick ends.

Winning the trick:
The highest ranked card matching the original suit played wins the trick and that player takes the cards. The player fills in a value of card onto a dog trick on their sheet. Tricks are worth points.

Losing the trick:
The player(s) who lost the trick will count the number of cards from one suit they have in their hand, they will write down the total number (or less as players can bluff) in the left most box of the matching suit on the player sheet (left side). When the boxes for the suit are full, the player can no longer count that suit.

Scoring:
Players add up the numbers for each dog trick on their player sheet, X counts as a 0, and write the total value of the numbers in the larger boxes. Players also add up the numbers they have written for each suit on the left side of the player sheet.

The player who has the most total points is the winner.

Play your cards as cleverly as possible to maximize your points!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Word Travellers: The Lost Luggage Card Game
description:
Lost Luggage is a game about reuniting lost luggage with their destination airports. It is a word game for two to five players, aged 7+. Using a combination of airport codes and single A-Z letters, call out words and drop off your lost luggage.

COMPONENTS

five sets of 26 A-Z baggage cards
96 airport code cards
one die.


SETUP
Shuffle the airport code cards and place face down between the players. Give each player a complete set of 26 A-Z baggage cards to keep in-hand.
GAME PLAY
Play in rounds until someone depletes all of their baggage cards or six consecutive rounds fail to make words. On each round:

Someone flips over an airport card and rolls the die, whose number indicates the maximum number of baggage cards to drop.

All players:

Think of a word to make.
Secretly select one or more letter in-hand to combine with one airport code (if possible).
When all are ready, each player calls out their word.
Drop the letters to verify their word.
Discard their letter cards.
Discard the airport card.


Play in rounds until someone has used all of the letter cards.
If you cannot make a word, try next time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Travel, Word Game
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Arráncate Cuco
description:
The aim of Arráncate Cuco is to teach children how to face different things that scares them.

Players will take a card with a fear and use a card with a strategy to face that fear (usually they will have to talk about the strategy)

The first player to face all fears in their board will win.

name: Cataclysm
description:
INTRODUCTION Cataclysm is a two-player game played on a square board of any size, initially empty. The two players, Red and Blue, take turns placing their own checkers on the board, one checker per turn, starting with Red. Passing is not allowed. Mark Steere designed Cataclysm in July 2023.

OBJECT Red must form a path of red checkers (interconnected via horizontal or vertical adjacencies, or both) connecting the two red sides of the board. Diagonal adjacencies are irrelevant in Cataclysm. Blue must form a path of blue checkers connecting the two blue sides of the board.

PLACEMENT You can place a checker on any unoccupied square.

CROSSCUT A crosscut is a group of four adjacent checkers arranged in a square. Two of the checkers in a crosscut are red and two are blue. Like-colored checkers are diagonally opposed.

CATACLYSM Whenever you form a crosscut, you form a bicolored group containing two or more red checkers and two or more blue checkers. Immediately replace all of the enemy checkers in the group with friendly checkers, concluding your turn.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid

name: 探偵無宿2 椚の杜に潜む悪魔 (Unregistered Detective 2: The Devil Lurks in Kunugi Forest)
description:
Yohei Kunugi, respected business leader and head of the Kunugi family, was found dead in his room, leaving his family with only a vague will and a haunting enigma. When Yohei's younger brother also turns up dead, it's obviously a murder plot. But who's behind it? Could it be Yohei's widowed daughter? Or maybe it's his illegitimate daughter, kept hidden in the mansion? There's also the gardener he hired to do his dirty work. The murderer could be his grandson, secretly in love with a maid, or maybe it's another maid jealous of their affair? And just who is the mysterious child wearing the fox mask, known only as Forget-Me-Not?

The card game 探偵無宿2 椚の杜に潜む悪魔 (Unregistered Detective 2: The Devil Lurks in Kunugi Forest) is a remake, not a sequel, to Unregistered Detective. It's inspired by classic Japanese murder mysteries, especially those written by Edogawa Ranpo, but this is not a deduction game. It's an atmospheric game where players take on the roles of detectives, each with their own special ability, who try to influence the story to gain the most victory points.

Each round begins with 3 Character Cards, drawn from the Investigation Deck and placed in an Investigation Lineup. As the round progresses, players draw Character Cards and add them to the Lineup. When a character is drawn, they trigger different actions. The cards in the Lineup also represent resources, which players use to play Event Cards, representing significant events in the case. Some Event Cards require a certain number of character deaths or even the deaths of specific characters. Event Cards grant victory points, resources only available to that player, and helpful actions. When a player draws the Night of Tragedy card, the round ends. If a character has more of their Character Cards in the Lineup than anyone else, they are murdered and no longer active in the game. In the event of a tie, no one dies unless 5 Curse Tokens have built up.

The game begins with only 1 of each character in the deck and 1 Curse Token in the play area, so it's unlikely someone will die in the first round. But additional cards and Curse Tokens are added each round, so further deaths are inevitable. Players play increasingly significant Event Cards, crafting a different version of the story each game. Once a player accumulates 10 victory points or five characters have died, the game ends and the winning detective is decided.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Catacombs Conquest: Bonus Card Pack 2
description:
Eight additional cards for Catacombs Conquest, originally offered as part of the Beyond the Event Horizon expansion during the Catacombs Conquest Kickstarter campaign, and later sold on their own.

Sword team:
Weeping Matriarch, Carnelian Knight, Jade Knight, Battle Robot

Skull team:
Necromancer, Specter, Gobin Boar Rider, Keystone Keeper

—user summary

name: FOO-DIES?!
description:
A social deduction tabletop game for people who love food more than people. There are two sides: the APPLESTATES (APOSTATES) aiming to end the Human Gods' tyranny. The DISSAPPLES (DISCIPLES) believe paradise still exists within the Human Gods' mouths.

Players end up on one of these two sides. There are destruction cards that have to be added by the APPLESTATES to kill the Human God, while the DISSAPPLES have defuse cards that prevent those destruction cards from going off. Whether they kill the Human God or not, players will have to turn on each other to save themselves from death using the cards they have.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Finale Ending, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Wise Wars
description:
An exciting deckbuilding card game, where you will play the role of a cunning fortune teller who manipulates fate to shape his own fortune
He summons powerful commanders, masters ancient spells, and unleashes masterful tactics as you compete against other divination masters in your quest for absolute dominance.
In a game of Wise Wars, players must use their arcana cards to obtain one of the two conditions
of victory possible.

Reduce the opponent's health points to zero.
If the arcane recruitment deck runs out, the player with more Power points will be victorious.


—description from the designer

name: Star Blazers Fleet Battle System Game: Module II – The Dark Nebula Empire
description:
The latest edition to the Star Blazers Fleet Battle System contains updated and expanded rules along with the ship and weapons statistics to recreate man of the battles between the warring space powers from the acclaimed science fiction animated series.

Book 0103 introduces the Dark Nebula Fleet, as well as additional fleet units for the expanded EDF, Gamilon, and White Comet Empires.

The information in this rule book is based on the movies Yamato: The New Voyage and Be Forever Yamato.

The Dark Nebula rule book comprises 76 pages of rules, plus 20 additional pages of optional rules which players can utilize, or use to modify existing scenarios. The game has three levels of play to allow players to acquire the skills to master the complete game system. Also included are 16 scenarios plus the “Assault on Gatlantis” mini-game.

Statistics for 43 new space warships have been added to the original 42 warships which were introduced in the first game book. A total of 85 redesigned warship display forms plus an additional eight pages of statistical data for the Gatlantis mini-game, as well as five pages of ship counters are included. The game can be played with these counters or with the lead-free miniatures especially designed for this game system. A complete catalog can be found in the rules book.

A Technical Manual with 143 illustrations and line drawings of the new ships, battlecraft, new weapon systems, and space stations are also included in this publication.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: The Barons' War: Outremer
description:
Expansion to The Barons' War rules. Outremer (French: outre-mer, lit. 'overseas'), also known as The Crusader States, is a political hotbed granting ambitious Frankish Barons the opportunity to make a reputation for themselves. This new battleground dominated by a scorching sun, inhospitable terrain and lethal new foes provides fresh challenges for any Commander.

New rules, named characters, and a linked scenario-driven campaign, Peril on the Pilgrim Road, encourage you to recreate warfare in the crusader states. Choose to create a retinue from the Armies of Outremer: settled Franks, crusaders, or the military orders. Alternatively, select from the myriad of warriors that comprise the cultured Forces of Islam, led by a sultan or emir of a particular Askar.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Dawn of Breya
description:
Breya stands at the precipice of change. The power of the Primordials who once ruled the land has faded, and the fledgling mortals have begun to grow in power. Each of the four prominent peoples of Breya have positioned themselves to succeed, but only one can ascend to complete hegemony over Breya...

Dawn of Breya is an area control game set in an original high-fantasy world, where players vie for hegemony over the land of Breya. Players will control one of four unique factions, each with their own history and strategy.

Players will expand their territory and bolster their military, carefully managing their usage and harvesting of resources, utilizing them in numerous ways in a turn.

Expansion and exploitation of the land comes at a cost, however, as the abundant heartland territories at the center of Breya not only risk conflict with other players, but with the ancient beings that lurk in the heartland of Breya. The combat between the players and fearsome Primordials is the climax of the game, with the players setting aside their differences in order to stand a chance against the powers of the Primordial they awakened.

Each game will have branching paths in map construction, secret objectives, unique leaders, and the Primordials that are encountered. Each playthrough presents new challenges and features a tenuous balance between competition in territory expansion and collaboration in defeating mighty Primordials.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Automatic Resource Growth, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Force Commitment, King of the Hill, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Purloin
description:
Time travel in the proper paws is profitable! You are a felonious feline who can traverse the space-time continuum. You will steal valuable art, religious, and science artifacts from famous locations and characters of the past, present, and future. However, if you leave too many paw prints behind when you pilfer, then the time patrol will imprison you. Anything and everything is yours for the taking! But only the most cunning cat can avoid getting caught, claim victory, and become the wealthiest of all time.

Purloin is a hand management heist game. As a time-traveling cat burglar, you will purloin valuables from the past, present, and future. The player(s) with the most paws is caught by the Time Patrol dogs and cannot gain Endgame bonuses. Then after bonuses, the player with the most wealth wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Storyburg
description:
Storyburg is a co-op adventure story deckbuilding game for 1-4 players.

A mysterious force is ripping apart Storyburg. Explore the perils solo or as a team by playing as Dorothy Gale, Peter Pan, Alice Liddell and Little Nemo. Players will travel to Oz, fly to Neverland, fall down the rabbit hole to Wonderland, and dream of Slumberland. Solve the mystery of the Pages and save Storyburg before it’s too late!

Players will equip cards, play actions, and create ultimate dice rolls in a thrilling adventure for the ages. Elements of dungeon-crawlers, deck-building, and pick-your-own-stories create a unique gameplay each time. With five action-packed Chapters, Storyburg will entertain your gaming group through multiple sessions.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Book, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Income, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Afishionado
description:
Afishionado is a quick set collection & drafting game for 2-3 players.

In Afishionado, players compete to build the best aquarium! Players will draft fish cards, collect sets, and finally place their drafted cards out into their aquarium. The goal of Afishionado is to construct the most efficient & biodiverse aquarium and earn the highest score!

Gameplay in Afishionado occurs over six rounds. In each round, players draw cards, pass one to an opponent, and finally select one to draft to their aquarium. Fish cannot be moved from their place in your aquarium once placed!

Each type of fish will score points in a different way. Some fish may score higher if they are placed next to others of their kind, while others may prefer to be next to fish of different types. Some fish may not care who their direct neighbors are, as long as there is a certain number of their kind swimming around the aquarium.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Race for the Galaxy: Xeno Counterstrike
description:
Xeno Counterstrike is the sequel to Xeno Invasion, together forming the 3rd arc of RFTG expansions.

It expands Race for the Galaxy into the starry rift frontier and border zone that lies between the galactic empires and the Xeno hive worlds, with more than 40 frontier worlds (in separate decks) and a different risk/reward method of settling them.

The resulting greater empire sizes extends the game end conditions to 15+ tableau cards and 15 VPs/player in the common pool. This makes Xeno Counterstrike the version for those players who have wanted RFTG to be just a bit longer (typically, 1-2 rounds more), as the lead now frequently changes near the end as those final large frontier worlds are settled, the larger economic engines hit their stride, and the last 6-devs hit the table.

Xeno Counterstrike can be played by itself with just the base game, though its fifth player and optional counterstrike game require Xeno Invasion.

The counterstrike game begins as a Xeno invasion which, once the Xenos are repulsed, turns the tables as the galactic empires then strike back at the Xeno home systems across the starry rift frontier and border zone.

In this version, tableau size no longer ends the game: the counterstrike game continues until either an economic victory (VP chips in the pool of 30 VPs/player run out) or a military victory over the Xenos occurs. This is the epic conquest version of Race for the Galaxy; final tableau sizes of 25 cards are not uncommon.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Unhappy Arrangements
description:
Set in the chaotic city of Orcwood you play the part of a prominent family. Grow your wealth and power by arranging marriages with the other families. The only problem is that this is a fantasy land; Witches, Goblins, Gelatinous Cubes, Vampires, Ogres and many more crazy creatures. Only the best matches will secure your victory, so who will you choose?

Taking in turns each player presents a bride and then chooses a suitor from one of the other players. They then roll the dice to see how successful the marriage was. The winner is the player who accumulates the most power.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Auction/Bidding, Bribery, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Random Production, Storytelling, Trading, Turn Order: Auction, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Escape Game
description:
Leatherface and his infamous killing machine are back in this escape game that immerses you in the grimy countryside of 1970s Texas. You will encounter the main characters from the original film, the cannibal family, and in order to survive, you must solve incredibly twisted puzzles. Face the infamous Leatherface and narrowly escape his bloody clutches. Dive into the unforgettable horror of the cult film "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre" with this immersive Escape Game. This captivating game stays true to the terrifying atmosphere of the film and will test your skills. Are you ready to experience live horror?

Who among the players will make it out in one piece? It's hard to say, but one thing is for sure: getting sliced and diced has never been this much fun!
categories: Deduction, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Events, Player Elimination

name: Cookierun Rolling Pop
description:
Cookierun Rolling Pop is a dice rolling game in which you roll unique shaped Cookie dice and score points based on the side they land on. You can aim for a high score with more challenging postures!

On your turn, you roll 4 Cookie dice and may reroll once for free. Any additional rerolls require you to spend a Bear Jelly token. Once you fix your roll, you choose one of the 8 spaces on the score sheet and record your score based on the results of the roll.

After everyone plays 8 rounds, players sum up their scores and determine the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Mystic Rememberland
description:
We mixed sabotage into this classic memorization mechanic.

You flip tiles over to find pairs, like usual. However, you can also use markers to prevent a certain area from being flipped, in case you might know the locaiton of a pair and want to prevent another player to find and score it.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pieces as Map, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: NEXUS: Legacy Edition Rulebook
description:
Take the NEXUS: Arena Combat System to the next level with the Legacy Edition Rulebook. Dive even deeper into the NEXUS with 250+ pages of extra content!


Create & level up your Lanistas & Helots!
Equip, modify, & repair your Helots!
Create custom barges and turning point cards!
Create pre-fight & post-fight events!
10 new motivations!
4 New Hazards!
Learn to be a Pit Boss!
Dive deeper into the lore!
Enjoy 150+ new pieces of artwork!


—description the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: 51 Stan: Master Set – karty Siedziby
description:
Four new Capital cards which you can shuffle into the deck. Compatible with all expansions.

These cards were available as promos in the 51st State Ultimate Edition campaign on Gamefound.

name: Classic Napoleonics: Wargame Rules in the Age of Scruby
description: Classic Napoleonics: Wargame Rules in the Age of Scruby allows you to take command of the forces of the Napoleonic Period whether you are trying to recreate the famous battles of that era or are trying your hand at battle situations of your own making.

name: Jumping Jackalopes
description:
Jumping Jackalopes is a card game for two to five players who each turn play cards either to start a new set or add to an existing set of mythical creatures. Each creature has its own unique ability that activates when it is played that will help the player in some way. Additionally, players may also play a Jackalope on to one of the mythical creature sets in front of them. Playing a Jackalope causes a different Jackalope to jump from its current location to a different one. At the end of each round players score for the mythical creatures in front of them as well as a number of points for Jackalopes they control. Jackalopes are worth one point for each different mythical creature you control that a jackalope is on.

—description from the publisher

name: Horse & Musket: Annual #5
description:
Horse and Musket Annual Number 5 is the fifth fan expansion to Horse & Musket. It will add new scenarios for owners of Volumes I-VI and Horse & Matchlock.

The scenarios include...

Hambledon Hill - August 4, 1645

Halmstad - August 17, 1676

Cassano - August 16, 1705

Velletri - August 12, 1744

Domstadl - June 30, 1758

Brandywine - September 11, 1777

Marengo - June 14, 1800

Medina de Rioseco - July 14, 1808

Sacile - April 15, 1809

Horseshoe Bend - March 27, 1814

Chippawa - July 5, 1814

Contreras - August 20, 1847

Churubusco - August 20, 1847

The Alma - British Attack - September 20, 1854


The Alma - French Attack - September 20, 1854

Fredericksburg - December 13, 1862

Chancellorsville - May 2-3, 1863

Marye’s Heights - May 3, 1863

Salem Church - May 4, 1863

Milliken’s Bend - June 7, 1863

Plymouth - April 1864

Kolb's Farm - June 22, 1864

Kennesaw Mountain - June 27, 1864

Münchengrätz - June 28, 1866
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tribus CG
description:
Welcome to Tribus, the card game! Tribus is a multiplayer deck-battler for 2 or 3 people. Be the last person standing to win!

In Tribus, players awaken in an afterlife called "Nimbus," ruled by the Great Dragon. For a chance at rebirth, players must fight through the "Carnival," an all-out tournament where only the most attuned to their colors can survive.

Using a "Tribus," a three chambered heart, players can choose and play with three of the seven colors of cards, each with their own unique playstyle. Players take turns playing one card at a time, one color at a time.

Summon "dudes," play epic moves, and knock your opponent's guard down to be reborn as an amazing warrior in the game of Tribus!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Ordering, Player Elimination

name: 51 Stan: Master Set – 6 kart Lokacji
description:
Six location cards, which you can shuffle into the main deck regardless of the expansion you are using.

This set of cards was available as a promo in the 51st State: Ultimate Edition campaign on Gamefound and it's actually 51st State: Promo Set 1 (5 location cards) and 51st State: FLGS Promo (single Friendly Local Gun Store card).

name: Capitol Deal
description:
Capitol Deal puts you in the shoes of an ambitious politician. Climb the ladder of power in DC and aim high: becoming President! How? Collect three full sets of Power Cards. But here's the twist! Unleash Action Cards to swipe cash, swap cards, and even squeeze campaign donations. Keep your rivals on their toes with Reaction Cards to foil their plans. Oh, and don't forget to build up those Campaign Funds! Why? Because just like you, those sneaky players are politicians too, always ready to deal, steal, and mess with your plans. Let the political games begin!

—description from the publisher

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Crimson Hand Enclave Team
description:
Crimson Hand Enclave Expansion – The Crimson Hand Enclave are a secretive sect, even within the shadowy cult of the Crimson Hand. They specialize in tracking down the most legendary ancient relics and forbidden lore. This Expansion includes the new Crimson Hand Heroes, with 4 unique types of Crimson Hand to play as—the Inquisitor, leading the sect with fierce determination, the Cultist, a veteran member of the Order that has seen wonders and horrors beyond human comprehension, the Acolyte, well-versed in ancient knowledge and arcane magik, and the Cloaked Assassin, a silent hunter that melds into the shadows. This allows players to take on the role of a team of nefarious Crimson Hand cultist Anti-Heroes for the first time.

This Expansion includes all of the Heroes, Miniatures, and cards needed to play as a Crimson Hand Enclave, including Crimson Hand Personal Items, Starting Gear, Upgrades and Skill Tree, Team Ability cards, Arcane Items and Ancient Orbs, and an 8 Mission narrative story campaign, allowing your Enclave to venture into other worlds on raids for relics, to infiltrate and spread the influence of the Crimson Hand, and even performing summoning rituals to bind creatures of the Void to your will (at least until they break loose).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Splatters
description:
Splatters is a multiplayer competitive puzzle matching game. Two to ten players compete to quickly fill their “splat” with “splatters”. A game for all ages 5+.

LASERCUT COMPONENTS

Ten wooden “splats” to hold splatters.
120 wooden splatters.


SETUP
Spread all the puzzle pieces and splats faceup on your table. Each player grabs an equal number of splats. Discard any remaining splats.
 
GAME PLAY
Players all look for splatter pieces to fill their splat(s) at the same time. Game play is fast and frantic near the end as players compete to be first to fill their splats. Play in rounds.

WINNING
The first player to fill all of their splats is the winner of the round. Optionally, repeat until someone has won two rounds.

—description from the publisher

name: Who Pooped?
description:
Funny memory game for families: Did you know that wombats poop in cubes? Whose poop is bigger—a hippo or a moose?

—description from the publisher

name: Tunnel Rats
description:
Tunnel Rats is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire wargame using a tables-based game engine and randomized mapping system.

As the leader of a special assignment US Army Combat Engineers Tunnel Rat team operating in the Vietnam Mekong Delta region, your ultimate goal is to survive a 6-month Vietnam tour of duty during the year 1968. Your mission assignment is to enter underground Viet Cong tunnel complexes in the Cu Chi province and seek out and destroy any VC you may encounter. You will also attempt locate VC work shops and store rooms for the Combat Engineers to later destroy with C-4 explosives. And finally, the discovery of any VC documents in command post rooms is always an added bonus.

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with numerous Tunnel Rat skills, weapons, mission types, possible tactics, random events, a multitude of table modifiers, and a randomized mapping system, Tunnel Rats offers high replay value. Are you up to the challenge?

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Sword Gone to Texas
description:
The Sword and the Flame (TSATF) adaptation for Wars of Texas' Independence in 1836.

This variant includes the following actions:


Siege and storming of the Old Mission at San Antonio de Behar (Alamo) (March 6, 1836)
Battle of Coleto Creek (March 19, 1836)
Battle of San Jacinto (April 21, 1836)


Includes details on Texan and Mexican organization, movement, shooting and close combat. Charging, rally and morale checks are included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: The Sword to Adventure: A Close Combat Variant
description:
A variant for Close Combat for The Sword to Adventure, Skirmishes and Small Wars 1908 - 1931

For gamers who do not like Larry Brom's original melee system.

Adds details on how to handle attacker movement, when a figure can defend and melee combat to adjust the number of dice needed by teams of men, officers/NCOs, type of rifle, etc. Combat resolution covering wounded/killed is also included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: The Sword, Cross and Gold
description:
A variant for The Sword and the Flame (TSATF) covering the Conquistadors versus the Aztecs.

Includes versions for both the Revised Edition (1994) and the 20th anniversary edition.

Detailed coverage on tips for scenarios, firing by weapon, weapon types/ranges, morale, rally, charging, melee and close combat. Optional rules are included to include casualties to horses creating an infantryman.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Makirama
description:
Makirama is a 3-6 player team-based in which spirimonsters (cute ethereal creatures) try to capture makis, in a world inspired by psychedelic art. They can draw new abilities and have to adapt to (un)lucky events.
The game is over when there is no maki left, neither in the bag, nor on the ground. The team with the most makis wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Family Feud: Kids vs Adults
description:
Is your next game of Family Feud gonna get loud?
Survey says… Yes!

One of the most popular game shows of all time, Family Feud is back with a fun new Kids vs Adults edition.

Complete with hundreds of survey questions for kids plus hundreds of survey questions for adults it’s time to find out who feuds better in this showdown between young and old.

—description from the back of the box

name: Epic Shogun
description:
Epic Shogun is a fun, strategic card game that thrusts players into the world of feudal Japan, where emperors vie for the Shogun. Each player starts with a Castle and a hand of cards, aiming for one of three paths to victory: building a powerful Kingdom, forging strategic Alliances, or reaching a Kingdom value of 300.

The game revolves around the Flop, where three cards are revealed from the Draw deck, forming the initial battlefield. Players take turns drawing, burning unwanted cards, and buying from the Flop to strengthen their armies.

Constructing a Kingdom involves placing Kingdom cards around the Castle, creating Towers that must be conquered in descending order. The player who completes the final Princess Tower wins. Building a 300-value Kingdom also secures victory.

Strategic alliances play a vital role, allowing players to attack and subjugate rival Castles, creating Allied Kingdoms. Allies provide blind cards, bolstering the ruler's power.

Battles ensue as players form Troop Hands with a sum of up to 21. Epic 21 combinations, achieved through Hero cards, offer a potent advantage. The Final Showdown determines the winner, as players battle relentlessly, seeking to conquer rival Towers.

Epic Shogun's blend of strategy, diplomacy, and tactical decision-making makes it a thrilling and engaging card game. Embrace alliances, plot your path to victory, and rise as the supreme ruler of feudal Japan in this epic saga of conquest and triumph.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chaining, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Stacking and Balancing

name: Mr. Gameshow: Glitz & Hollywood Trivia
description:
Expansion game for Mr. Gameshow.

This is an additional tape to add to the base game tape that includes more specific trivia regarding Hollywood. Gus Glitz also is the host for this expansion game as he was for the base game. Game play is not changed by the expansion - just more questions!

name: Guilds and Gambits
description: Guilds and Gambits is a fantasy battling card game that draws inspiration from auto battler video games, deck-building board games, and trading card games. In this world, two players assume the role of rival guild masters, recruiting guild members, acquiring powerful items, and battling it out until one remains. Be the first player to eliminate your enemy's health points to bring glory to your guild!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Kitchen Chaos
description:
Kitchen Chaos pits two teams of chefs against each other to serve dishes to the customers first! But be wary of traps! Delay the other team with strategically placed traps, or by taking away their ingredient!

The small kitchen can only accommodate a few chefs at each station, so chefs must plan on using their time and resources wisely. Your chefs can perform different actions each turn, from getting ingredients and trap cards, to cooking dishes, and serving food. You can also place strategic traps which trigger whenever your opponents move to a targeted station or perform a certain action.
​
Don't let the chaos of the kitchen get to you, and deliver your dishes before your opponents!

—description from the publisher

name: Miniature Adventures: Adventure 1 – Goblin Troubles
description:
The Kingdom of Delriah has a little trouble with some goblins! They need the help of an adventuring party! Will you answer their call?

Miniature Adventures is an exciting co-op adventure card game inspired by old-school 16-bit RPGs and designed to be portable while still challenging!

Choose a Hero and overcome four Levels of challenges in order to complete the entire Adventure Level. Adventure solo, or with up to four players!

Players take turns performing actions or Rolling for Adventure. Players will slot dice rolled into their three Points value locations on their Character cards. These values will help determine their Initiative (speed), Power (ability), and Actions.

There are several types of Encounters players will need to overcome such as Mobs (enemies) and Challenges (perils). Survive through every Encounter in a level to progress to the next level and gain a reward! Once all four levels are complete, the Players win and are victorious!

name: Rogues of the Realms
description:
Battle in a magical realm with a rich and deep history where many practice the arcane arts but only the best can master it. Explore our diverse characters and craft their fates.

In this magical battle board game, eliminate enemy characters to earn points, collect Magic Tokens to activate special abilities, and use strategic character placement and fighting power to win!

Every team is a trio of characters who have set stats for attack, defense, movement, and range. Each character has a special ability that is unique to them as well as a passive ability based on their class (striker, guardian, maven.)

Dice combat is done through attack dice and defense dice. The enemy loses health equal to the number of successful attack dice minus defense dice.

Who will you choose to forge your victory?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Scarlet Envelope VII: Tale of a Golden Dragon
description:
This is the seventh game in the series of "Scarlet Envelope" games.

Solve escape room-style enigmas and become a hero of a Medieval fairytale! Crush puzzles together with the Dragon Trainer, the Wizard, and the Witch to figure out how to stop the legendary Golden dragon. This treasure hunt puzzle game mixes interaction with physical cryptic items and a digital multimedia experience (videos, audios, and a chatbot.)

—description from the publisher

name: Scarlet Envelope VIII: Dinner with Anonymous
description:
“First course - peanut stew, main course - your dirty lies with a tahini dressing.” Five honorable guests have been blackmailed into dining with Anonymous, a charming psycho claiming to know everyone’s dark secrets. In a twisted turn of events, you find yourself in Anonymous’ basement, kidnapped and challenged to answer two questions: "Who is Anonymous? And what have these five people done to piss them off?"

Expect CREEPY VIBES (we're talking videos with Anonymous wearing a TV head helmet, cooking a pie out of shuttered glass, and filming puppet shows.) You will peel off, decipher, fold, and investigate. Roughly 2h of gameplay, linear structure, puzzles unlock pieces of the story until the big reveal.

name: Scarlet Envelope IX: Ashes of Persepolis
description:
Travel to Ancient Greece to solve a mystery of Persepolis, the priceless Persian city burned to ashes by Alexander the Great. The hero’s secrets are interwoven into an intricate puzzle guarded by Olympian Gods and an all-seeing Oracle. Only the mightiest can read Oracle’s cards to find out what really happened in Persepolis.

Ashes of Persepolis is an epic adventure with familiar scenes from the myths and legends of the Ancient Greeks. Based on historical events and a lot of research. We hope you’ll learn a thing or two about the quest of Alexander the Great!

PUZZLES:
Expect to solve a variety of visual and logic puzzles. The tringle-shaped cards provide a unique playground for puzzling! You’ll build a maze, cut paper, invent the unique decoder wheel, investigate constellations, make sacrifices to Gods, and of course, you’ll THINK and HAVE FUN!

STRUCTURE:
Roughly 2.5h of gameplay, linear structure, with all puzzles unlocking major pieces of the story (in video format) until the big reveal.

name: The Last Bottle of Rum: Draconic Cookbook Promo Card
description:
Promo card included in the Kickstarter copies of Taverns & Dragons.

Card ability: Double your Loot Points

name: Cosmic Peaceforce, Mission: Harmony 3
description:
We’ve created a cooperative board game for adults that serves as an introduction to cooperative game models, movement strategy building, and last but not least, key principles in nonviolence. It serves as a creative way to build positive, empathic, and meaningful connections between diverse individuals.

Designed for 3-5 players, the game time runs approximately 90 minutes. Cosmic Peaceforce invites us into a whimsical and profound world at the edge of the inner and outer realms of existence, where we have a duty to work together, face down temptations and adorable, chaos-loving goats, embrace conflict as an opportunity for drawing closer together, and learn from our most bitter experiences.

How to achieve the mission (win): The Cosmic Peaceforce must unlock 4 portals to Harmony 3 through strategy, conflict, and chance. The Team does not achieve the mission (loses) under three conditions: The lotus reaches 0 petals, any player loses all of their Soulforce tokens, or the Disharmony Yuga freezes shut 2 portals to Harmony 3.

—description from the publisher

name: Jinni
description:
A fairly traditional trick-taking game which has its roots in Hearts. It is a "must follow" game, where the winner of the trick will collect all cards played to it and lead to the next trick.

The game plays over 4 rounds and the player with the lowest score will win. Points are acquired by winning the 9 of any suit or any cards of the red suit.

name: オウムガエス (Oumugaesu)
description:
In オウムガエス, players are attempting to remember the locations of face down animals cards. On their turn, a player will look at two cards; if they match, they will collect them and take another turn, but if they do not, they will be returned face down and the next player will take their turn.

However, the cards are never shown to the other players. Instead, the player makes the sound of the revealed animal. A few cards show a parrot, and if a parrot is seen, the player makes the noise of any other animal in the game.

The player with the most pairs collected when only parrots remain is the winner.

name: エモマン (Emoman)
description: Emoman is a game about discussing your emotions and expressing empathy for others. The game includes a deck of cards showing facial expressions on one side, and describing a certain situation on the other. A card is revealed from the deck and players use an emotion wheel to express how much they feel the emotion shown in the situation described. Once everyone has set their wheel, the values are revealed and discussed. The players who have values closest to each other gain points.

name: Cauldron: Bubble and Boil – Familiar Pack
description:
This Familiar Pack Mini-Expansion is an 8-card deck featuring familiars. These cards remain in play from turn to turn, each with their own unique abilities.

—description from the publisher

name: Money Giant
description:
Roll & Move property trading game released in 2005. Players compete to become “Money Giants” by winning a million dollars.

—user summary

name: That's No Avocado!
description:
It's avocados versus imposters in this game of speed matching madness. Pick a team and be the first to get all of your cards into the crates by matching cards, but watch out for action cards and rotten fruit.

Any cards with the same color background are a match!
Match Avocado cards with the same illustration.
Imposter cards need matching characters.

There's no waiting for your turn, everyone plays at once, so be speedy! The fastest matchers win!

—description from the publisher

name: Mute Mishaps
description:
You've laughed, you've cried, and you've survived all kinds of video call shenanigans and lived to tell the tales. Dare to join the meeting?

Roll the dice to set the scene, then use the cards in your hand to tell the story of a video experience. Was it cringeworthy or hilarious? Disaster meeting or best first date?

Best story that fits the scene wins!

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: Romans
description:
History Heroes: Romans will challenge your knowledge of the ancient Romans and their Gods. Discover and learn more about the most significant Roman characters and their (12 most important) Gods on 40 fantastically illustrated cards, packed with facts about them. Learn your Caesar from your Claudius and your Jupiter from your Juno. Discover which emperor made it a capital offense to mention a goat in his presence…and why!

In the game are a great range of Roman characters from rulers like Julius Caesar to the first Roman emperor, Augustus, the sickly but cunning Claudius, who conquered Britain, Hadrian, and the first Roman emperor from Africa, Septimius Severus, who died in York. Foreign leaders, who challenged the Romans’ rule are in Romans too: Cleopatra and Boudica, leading the way! Gladiators, male and female, are in the game too, including the iconic Spartacus: learn more about how he became such a legend in Roman history.

As the Monty Python sketch once said, "What have the Romans ever done for us?" Well...play History Heroes: Romans and discover how much of our present world, knowledge, and history comes directly from those ancient times.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts about each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Accumulation
description: Accumulation is a Taiwanese original boardgame based on Darwin’s definition of evolution, descent with modification, from his masterpiece, On the Origin of Species. Players as biologists which are transported to a primitive world, aims to make the world diversified. They may manipulate the evolution of species by accumulating the length of limbs, either lengthening or shortening. And players may help those animals to survive the catastrophic event by observation and research. The level of the game can be adjusted by the age of players and the circumstances, which makes it suitable for family, friends and class uses.

name: Star Fall
description:
Where do shooting stars go? Maybe someone's collecting stars?
In star fall, the player is the guardian who makes constellations in search of shooting stars. Players can enjoy cute and lovely stars and beautiful night sky through simple action.

—description from the designer

name: Zulu: Rorke's Drift Expansion Plus!
description:
This is an expansion to the army card sets. It contains unit cards and an optional command action card.

The set will include the following 16 cards:

British: The commanders of Rorke’s Drift (Lt. Chard, Lt. Bromhead, Colour Sergeant Bourne, Pvt. Hook, Surgeon Major Reynolds), rules for bayonet section, double mielie bag walls and field hospital.

Zulu: Zulu ibuthu key, a sangomas (witch doctor), mystic hut and an optional command action card.

Boer: commando key, bethel commando pom-pom gun, field nurse Betty Wessel & field hospital.

The Rorke’s Drift Expansion Plus will fit with your existing cards into the card boxes which come with your Zulu Skirmish Army Card Sets!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Escape Box: Intrigues au Louvre
description:
An Escape Game on the Louvre… for the whole family!

Extend the adventure with 3 different scenarios, which correspond to 3 levels of difficulty.
