Discover the fascinating works of the Louvre, and solve the three mysteries that hover in the galleries and the different departments.

In partnership with the Louvre Museum.

New box with hard case.

name: Task Force Ranger: Somalia to Afghanistan
description:
Task Force Ranger (TFR) is a Solo or Multi-player “team” level rule set for up to five players. It has been designed to simulate combat operations in the middle east from Somalia during Operation Restore Hope (1992-1994), to Afghanistan 2022. Enemy forces are Automa (automatically card driven) units. Campaign play with the included campaign system and Tournament play usually consists of two to four players on the same game table. A fifth player may run any special ops teams and helicopters (helos) or play the Leader of the Enemy Forces!

CONCEPT OF PLAY

Task Force Ranger (TFR) is an immersive card driven game. Cards provide you with the majority of the team and equipment information needed to play. The easy to reference rule book walks you through the rules in detail. To begin play, you choose a mission. Your Ranger Chalk is then inserted by land, sea or air and moves out to accomplish it. That mission, like a Snatch & Grab (capture an enemy figure), will enable you to gain victory points (VPs) if you choose keep your teammates in a campaign. Otherwise, just being able to accomplish your mission with good team decisions and a low causality count will be your reward.

During game play each of your chalk teams takes two actions. After each team completes their actions, draw an enemy activity card. As you play, these cards add situational flavor. Add up their different point values. A total of five causes an enemy attack card to be drawn. These cards allow enemy teams to enter play. Who will engage first? Will you make it to your objective? Will you complete your mission? From solo to larger games you will be challenged! At tournament level, chalks may operate together on the same mission! “Blackhawk Down” could be that mission!

A CAMPAIGN SYSTEM WITH 6 SCENARIOS
Including Blackhawk Down, Somalia
& Roberts Ridge, Afghanistan!
Can your rangers accomplish their mission against the Muj in Fallujah?
Will your troops survive outside the wire in the Sandbox?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Spirited Earth
description:
Immerse yourself in the epic adventure of Spirited Earth AE 1777 as you uncover the remains of human civilization that existed before Earth's Great Extinction.

Explore abandoned cities, ruins, and monuments around the world.

Discover sciences, artworks, cultures, games, events, inventions, and historical characters. Gain experience, knowledge, improve your skills (powers) and gain tactical advantages throughout the game as you reconstitute a part of your ancestor’s history.

The player who maximizes his discoveries and gains the most victory points during the evolving timeline wins the game.

Spirited Earth AE 1777 is a medium-complexity euro-style game for 2-4 players, with card drafting, worker placement, resource and dice management.

—description from the designer

name: Dark Domains: Lotus District
description:
Medis, with its strange feudal politics and reverence of those capable of mastering magic have districts set up in most great cities of the world and Harrows is no exception. These districts search out talented wizards and provide allies as well as an outlet for their assorted strange products. Wherever there is a Lotus District, magic and mystery go hand in hand. Exotic recreations and unknown dangers abound and can cause a societal rift at the drop of a hat.
The Lotus District expansion for Dark Domains provides new challenges and new opportunities to challenge even the staunchest ally of the Necromancer. A new mini-board is included, the Lotus District, which allows a wider variety of elements with one minion, as well as the Wing Kong Market where everything is for sale, but the currency is evil instead of coin. New buildings inspired by the architects of Medis are available and new monsters can be imported to lair in your accursed domain. New fortunes are revealed by the mystics of that foreign land. Finally, new adventurers and henchmen walk the streets of the district eager to seek glory in your defeat or provide their own unique aid to your cause.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Meme Your Life
description: Meme Your Life is a party card game. Your life gathered in a game. Each round, one player takes the role of judge and plays a photo card, after which everyone else plays a caption card to complete the meme. The judge decides the funniest pairing, and whoever played the winning caption card wins the round.

name: Foco
description: Find in 30 seconds the largest number of images with the letter or theme drawn on the roulette wheel. Exercise attention, memory and language.

name: Jogo das 7 famílias
description:
The Card Game about finding family members.

"I wonder who the son of the Takanara family is with?
And the mother of the Mato Fino family?
And the grandparents of the Bom Fim family?"

The cards are shuffled and dealt to all players.

The object of the game is to form a complete family of 5 cards. To complete the family on their turn, the player simply asks who has "that person from family x". Whoever has the letter trades with you. And so the game continues until the first one completes his family. A quick and easy game to teach, ideal to play with children from 3 years old. Stimulates reasoning, memory, and intelligence.

name: Pixel Tactics: Zombie Survivor / Dodge
description:
Promo card that was part of the Pixel Tactics Deluxe Kickstarter.

Card text:
You can only recruit this hero into the Vanguard.

Vanguard: This hero does not block melee.
Flank: This hero cannot be attacked in melee.
Rear: Spell: Remove this hero from play to draw 6 cards.

Leader: If there are 8 corpses in your unit, you win the game.

name: Mr. Potato Head: Monta-Batata
description: Find all the parts and assemble your own Potato Head before your friends do. But be careful, other players will try to be faster than you! The player who rings the bell first wins the game.

name: Oggin: Rota do Tesouro
description:
Oggin is a sea route building game where players must face each other and the board!

Your objective is to reach the treasure island faster than the other pirates.

"Oggin" controls the entire sea and uses it to hinder his plans. Always at the end of the rounds he comes into action.

Use bombs and islands to your advantage and watch out for sea creatures. Show who is the best pirate captain and not even Oggin can stop him.

—user summary

name: Onde vivem os animais?
description:
The child will learn to associate each animal with its habitat, where the pairs of cards are an association between the animal and the region where it lives.
A fun way to test children's memory.
and the adults!

GAME DESCRIPTION

The game is played in rounds. In each round, the first to play (who will be called the leader) must draw an environment card from the bag and show it to all players.

The game offers 2 ways to play:

SIMPLE RULE - where the objective is to get the highest number of associations.

ADVANCED RULE - where you can bet points when you are sure that the animal you are looking for is on the card to be turned

The player with the highest number of points, forming pairs of animal cards and environments, wins the game.

name: Nåt ska bort: Pocket
description: Nåt ska bort: Pocket is the pocket/travel version of Nåt ska bort. It is a standalone game that can be integrated with its big brother.

name: Plano de Fuga
description:
Somewhat flustered inmates are once again trying to escape from prison. Taking advantage of the guard's nap, they manage to dig a tunnel, and are close to achieving their objective. But will it work, as each thinks more about getting in the way of their colleague than escaping?

In the first part of the plan, they must build a tunnel…

… And in the second part, it's time to escape!

Prisoners must now escape through the constructed tunnel, while being chased by the prison guard. Disturb your colleagues, and reach your long-awaited freedom before them!

name: Pixel Tactics: Wondrous Game Designer / Antoine Bauza
description:
Promo card that was part of the Pixel Tactics Deluxe Kickstarter.

Card text:
Vanguard: Spell: If your unit's total attack strength is great than the rival unit's, apply 3 damage to that unit's leader.
Flank: Spell: Put a hero from your hand into play in any empty slot in your unit.
Rear: Spell: Discard a card to remove 2 damage from your leader and give it [+1 attack].
Order: Discard up to 3 cards to remove 2 damage from your leader and give it [+1 attack] per card discarded.

Leader: Players may not look at their hands, but rivals can. Limited free action: choose a card in your hand and a zone (vanguard, flank, or rear). A rival must tell you the text of that zone's ability. Any player may use this action.

name: Pixel Tactics: Belle of the Ball / The Belle
description:
Promo card that was part of the Pixel Tactics Deluxe Kickstarter.

As a leader, The Belle scores points based on the number of heroes in play, and so your goal is to load your side up with as many heroes as you can and keep them there.

name: Tortus
description:
Tortus is a 2 player game that tests your perception.
On a board made up of 7 x 7 chips, manipulate these chips to define a path to your opponent.
Move your pawn, capture the opponent's pawn and throw it into the hole to score 1 point.
With 3 points you win the match.

—user summary

name: Um a Um
description:
Estrela arrived with another game from the Academia da Mente line, meet Um a Um.

The objective of this game is to exercise logical reasoning, numerical perception and mathematical problem solving.
This game is perfect for amusing children and helping them to stimulate their memory, attention and concentration.

Although most of the games are aimed at children, the Academia da Mente line, by Estrela, is also aimed at the elderly. By stimulating senses and functions such as attention, memory and language, they help keep the mind healthy and fight symptoms of degenerative diseases.

This new Estrela collection aims not only to have a fun aspect, but a slightly more “medicinal” side, stimulating the brain more and more to avoid future health problems.

Exercise your numerical perception, calculation, logic and problem solving in this game.

name: Pinball Showdown: Kickstarter Promos
description:
The additional playfield devices Roto-Target and Mini-Flipper along with an additional Combo card "Wheel of Chance" which requires both of those devices were given to all original backers of the Pinball Showdown Kickstarter. In addition, these were handled out during the initial release of the game at Origins and GenCon 2018. They can simply each be added to the correct deck for use though are not required to the game.

—description from the designer

name: Trivial Pursuit Familie Zomer Pocket Editie
description:
A summer pack of cards that adds to the normal Trivial Pursuit Family or to the board that you could buy separately (Trivial Pursuit Zomer Pocket Editie).

The cards came daily with the Dutch newspaper "Het Laatste Nieuws" during the summer of 2004.

name: Trivial Pursuit Kids: Pocket Editie
description:
A new amount of questions to add to your original game or to add to the board you could buy separately.

The cards came daily with the Dutch newspaper "Het Laatste Nieuws" during the summer of 2004.

name: Off with His Head
description:
A short game (15-40 minutes) for 2-6 players (and a 'dummy' King). Players each have a hand of three cards and are trying to get a specific set of cards into the King's 'hand' (which they cannot see) before the Guillotine comes down.

Players play a card in front of another player (the 'Lobby', do the effects on the card, and then it becomes that players turn. A turn ends when all players have gone.

Suitable for adolescents and adults, difficulty can be adjusted by using certain cards as the deck as each card has special effects on gameplay).

—description from the publisher

name: Who Am I & What Am I Doing?
description:
Laugh at yourself and others by taking on new identities and acting out absurd scenarios. Win the most points by getting other players to guess who you are and what you're doing!

Who you become may surprise you (and have friends and family in stitches). In this party game you can become:

Lord Voldemort on a stag do
Barack Obama working in telesales
Borat checking train tickets
Boris Johnson speed-dating


The game offers over 10,000 combinations!

There are two card decks, "Who am I?" and "What am I doing?". You take one card from each deck which gives you an identity and a scenario. You immediately assume that identity and have to speak and act as they would and act out the given scenario. Other players shout out guesses. Then it's their turn.

name: Math Rally
description:
Rick the race car driver is in a big hurry to win the rally.
But before he can reach the finish he has to get the calculations right, otherwise he can't keep driving. Who can help Rick get to the end by adding and multiplying correctly?
The game material familiarizes children with the numbers 1 to 100 by completing various tasks. As well as this, they also have the opportunity to consolidate their knowledge with various game ideas.

name: Incubo
description:
A Cooperative Push Your Luck Deck-Building Game

Incubo is a cooperative deck-building game designed for 2 players, where they take on the roles of a child "Tommy" and his best friend cat, "Alpha", as they confront their fears to rescue their sister, "Nina". Together, they must build their decks by passing cards between each other, eliminating weaker or negative cards, and facing various adventures within the dream world. The game is divided into three R.E.M. phases, each culminating in a confrontation with a terrifying monster, such as a ball of yarn, a half-opened wardrobe, a pigeon, and more. These monsters are confronted simultaneously by both players on different parts of the creature, and every victory strengthens the characters. Throughout the game, players will manage their resources, represented by the ticking of time to ensure they can save Nina.

Tommy, Alpha, and Nina were three inseparable friends,
Creating fantastic stories, thanks to Bimbo's dad's tales they blend.
But a new kitten, Lana, caused chaos in the home,
And a nightmare made them face their deepest fears all alone.

In the dream, Nina was a prisoner of worries,
And Tommy and Alpha joined to save her in a hurry.
Through a world where fears were alive, they traveled,
Overcoming them with courage, strength of spirit and bravery unraveled.

A dark forest they faced, where monsters roamed,
But they weren't intimidated by the fears they showed.
And when the monster who held Nina captive was defeated,
They woke up refreshed, ready for new adventures, fears defeated.

Tommy, Alpha, Nina, and Lana lived many extraordinary adventures,
Learning that friendship and courage are the most powerful weapons.
Together they faced fears and obstacles with valor,
And their friendship grew stronger with every passing hour.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck

name: Task Force Ranger: Captain to Colonel Expansion
description:
This expansion turns the Captain’s set into the Colonel’s set by adding a second chalk, vehicles and helos!

Includes: 136 game cards, i.e., 16 Task Force Ranger (TFR) command cards, a second vs light enemy activity deck (28 cards ~ for a second chalk), the mech card sets (56 cards), helo card sets (36 cards), one marker set and three plastic card boxes.

Note: this expansion requires the Captain’s set to play TFR. It does not include the Task Force Ranger rule set, the first half of the command deck or the starter vs light card sets found in the captain’s set.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Task Force Ranger: VS Light Enemy Activity Deck
description:
This expansion allows you to play an additional ranger chalk!

Includes: a 28 card vs light enemy activity deck and a card box.

Note: This expansion requires the Colonel’s set or Captain’s set to play Task Force Ranger.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: World War Fun
description:
World War Fun is the game all political leaders should be playing instead of engaging violently in real world conflicts.

Designed as a crossover from Risk and Axis & Allies this game is an Ameritrash style boardgame which is suitable for experienced players as a party game. Or a game you could play with your children to introduce them to dice game battles. In the game you purchase troops and units, attack your opponents and make some strategic decisions in each of the five game turns.

World War Fun board game involve tactic use of tanks, ships, planes and strategic nuclear attacks!

—description from the designer

name: World War Fun: Expansion Axis
description: Bringing the "AXIS" powers to World War Fun. Adding GERMANY, JAPAN and ITALY to the game. 30 new random event cards that are optional usage in the game. With the expansion it is possible to now have eleven player participating in the game.

name: Professor Brainstorm World of Aura Ambassador Kit
description:
This is a kit that has everything for two players to play both Professor Brainstorm games that are set in the World of Aura:


The World Challenge Card Game, the company's first game, where two players combat each other by spelling words.
The Equation Invasion Card Game, their newer game, where players combat by making mathematical equations.


It comes with two copies of the Origin Deck for each game, and two copies of the BrainForce Expansion Set 1 for each game.

It also includes four of the higher-quality Play Mats, one for each of the Kingdoms of the World of Aura:

Kingdom of Dragonia
Kingdom of Hydra
Kingdom of Industria
Kingdom of Terra


The BrainForce members - one from each of the four Kingdoms, along with a human teenage girl from Earth -- are shown on the cover of the box.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Math, Word Game

name: Spirits of the King
description:
Spirits of the King is a 1v1 open-drafting card game with hand management and dice rolling elements. Players conjure Spirits by offering their Blood, Soul, and Sanity cards in an effort to destroy all three of the opponent's lifelines.

Players begin the game with 4 or 5 of each resource card in their hand. On a player's turn, they select a spirit to conjure from a shared pool, paying its cost and resolving its effect. As players conjure more spirits throughout the game, they gain experience and may conjure stronger (yet more costly!) spirits. However, players must be careful with what they offer the spirits, as becoming too low puts them at risk of losing their lifelines!

Will you overcome the costs of power? Or will you fall victim to sacrificing too much?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Kandy Crush
description:
Kandy Crush is a two-player game that portrays the Kingdom of Kandy (on the island of modern day Sri Lanka) and how they fought (and allied with) neighboring kingdoms as well as three colonial powers.

The game is played in up to three turns (called epochs) with each epoch having one active colonial power. They are, in order, Portugal, the Netherlands and Great Britain.

Each epoch consists of three phases of card play where the two sides take turn trying to manipulate the game state by using events from the cards as well as their Action Point Value to resolve actions.

At the end of each epoch a winner of that particular epoch is declared. The first side to achieve two Epoch Victories is declared the victor of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Events, Multi-Use Cards

name: Hai & Papagei
description:
You want to get rid of those soul tokens as quickly as possible, but the other players have the same goal. It goes from island to island and the lucky 7 always helps you. All other numbers can have bad consequences. Let the sharks circle!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Inspired by Säbel & Schädel.

name: Schwankende Planken
description:
Things are getting hectic in this legendary "seaman's chess" of the Caribbean South Seas. Positioning on the right planks of wood is crucial; Groups of 4 help. With the highest score you will receive glorious reputation, eternal fame & highest honor at the end.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Lustige Schlümpfe
description: A Smurf rarely smurfs alone - seven funny Smurfs show on 36 domino cards that a well-known and popular children's game with these funny figures is particularly attractive.

name: The Lord of Borders
description:
Miniature garden management & defense board game to protect your city together
Somewhere not here. Someday, not now.
A world where swords and magic are commonplace.

In this world, humans and "demi-humans" such as elves and dragonewts coexisted.
Each race formed its own cultural sphere as a "nation", and repeated exchanges and conflicts.

You are dispatched to be in charge of reconstruction of a section of the fortified city "Rhineland", which is adjacent to many nations.
However, at the time of the inauguration ceremony, an astrologer warns that "Ajin will attack this city."

The remaining period is 2 years.

In order to fend off attacks, it is necessary to cooperate with the residents of the city and sometimes team up with demi-humans.
Also, if his activities are evaluated, it is not a dream to be promoted to "Lord" who has control over the entire Rhineland.

For the sake of territory, people, and one's own honor.
Use your skills to protect the city and rebuild it.

name: The Republic`s Struggle
description:
The Republic's Struggle is a thematic game with card engine for 2 players, set during the historical events that took place in Spain after the resignation to the throne of King Alfonso XIII, and the proclamation of the II Spanish Republic, in 1931. With the creation of the new regime, the struggle for power between the different social, political and ideological sectors increased, which gave rise to continuous changes of political power, alterations of the public order, armed uprisings and violent acts, carried out by the numerous ideological factions of the moment; which culminated in 1936, in a failed military uprising. The failure of this coup d'état originated the Spanish Civil War.

The game represents all the events of this turbulent period in the history of Spain, which led to a bloody civil war and the destiny of the nation. Spain was not isolated from the rest of the world and especially from the old Europe, so it was a victim of the tensions of the so-called interwar period. During the development of a game, one player on the Republican side, and another on the National side, will be able to recreate events of the period to increase their popularity in the localities by carrying out political propaganda, recruiting troops or militias, generating revolts or assaults, establishing diplomatic relations or carrying out bloody bombardments. All this will be done by playing their hand of cards in an alternative way, either by increasing the events or by playing the action points or icons to perform any of the other actions available to the players.

But both factions will not only seek to control the country, but will also look abroad through diplomatic relations for international support. In the interior, localities of great importance are the localities of barracks, air bases and naval bases. Their control will give important advantages to the player faction for the control of the different fronts. But although Republic Struggle may be inspired by the famous Twilight Struggle, it is not a copy of this game but has its own independent spirit and enough differences and adaptations to the conflict it represents to make it an essential piece that cannot be missing in your toy library. The role of armies and armed roadblocks that can prevent political propaganda from spreading makes it all very interesting. In addition, armies can move from one front to another and defeating enemy armies will help you take control of certain regions even if the politically full people support your rival. And don't forget that it is possible to bombard your opponent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tug of War

name: ゴールデンフェニックスブラスター (Golden Phoenix Blaster)
description:
The three modern Phoenix Squadron Horangers and the two ancient Phoenix Squadron Orangers join forces to finally corner the Demon King Black Giraffe to the final battlefield. The hot and long battle is now about to reach its conclusion.

There is only one way to defeat the Demon King. It is a super special move in which all the heroes unite their hearts.

Scream!! Golden Phoenix Blaster!!

Deliver true bonds that transcend words and communicate with hearts to children all over the country!

name: Emmet and the Spiders Web
description:
Emmet and the Spiders Web is a puzzle game. Using three cards in your hand, tell you what symbol configuration within a 2x2 box you need to activate that card. That card lets you score a point/bug and then swap two symbols. It also generally flips a symbol to the spider side, making it harder to make configurations in the future.

—description from the designer

name: Bumblebee
description:
Bumblebee is a solo pattern recognition, route building, 9-Card game about a bumblebee pollinating a set sequence of 6 flowers (1 x Flower per Card)and returning to the nest before the cards run out.

—description from the designer

name: Saga of Soldiers & Heroes
description:
Saga of Soldiers & Heroes begins with one simple mechanic: When a player takes their turn, they draw one card from their deck, then they play one card from their hand. That's all.

The play area is divided into three battle. When a card is played, it is added to one of the battles, where its force value will be added to its side.

The game is played over five rounds. Each player plays with a deck of units: 9 basic soldiers and 3 heroes. You get to choose which heroes you want to include each round. Heroes can be stronger than Soldiers, but more importantly, each hero has a unique special ability.

The game includes 15 different heroes. Both players have an identical collection to choose from.

When both players have played all of their cards, the round ends and victory points are awarded for winning the battles.

name: Uno Ultimate: Superman – Impervious Promo Card
description:
SDCC extended art holofoil Promo card

Character Power Card

Card Text:
Superman
Impervious
When you lose your turn, choose a player to burn 2 cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: 0-100 Familj: Mini
description:
A trivia game where you have to answer with a number ranging from 0 to 100. Answers can be in length, width, height, temperature, speed, size, age and given in units like centimeters, years, hours, crowns etc. The game differs from other trivia games which are often limited by given answer options.

The game is played in one round, consisting of seven questions. The player with the lowest score at the end of the game is the winner.

There are a total of 175 unique questions.

name: Anachronic(les)
description:
They were the world's greatest heroes in the 1980s and 1990s. They might be older and slower now, but they still can kick your a**!

In this storytelling card game, players must use action movie tropes and cliches to build their epic story, taking turns adding scenes and choosing the best resolution for those until the explosive grand finale!

name: Peppa Pig: Bunte Ballone
description:
In turn, each player rolls the die and then, depending on the color shown on the die, picks up a tile of that color from the center of the table and places it on his own board.

The first player to complete his board with all 6 balloon tiles wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Traiectum
description:
A 2-4 player game in which you work together to build the Roman Fortress at Traiectum (or, the Dutch city of Utrecht as it is known now). Make sure you finish before the end of the fifth round as the Germanic Tribes will attack. And without the Castellum to help with the defense, you will all die.

Roll dice and play matching cards to collect the needed men to build the fortress. Use your wood and stone resources to build up to four different support buildings. Perform additional tasks for the Roman government, or gain favor from the Gods. All these things will get you victory points. And if you succeed together in finishing the Fortress, the player with the most victory points will reign supreme in the fortress.

-user summary

Na een lange mars komt een groep Romeinse legionairs aan bij de zuidelijke oevers van de Rijn. Ze hebben de opdracht gekregen een fort te bouwen aan de natuurlijke noordelijke grens van het Romeinse keizzerrijk. De Germanen in het noorden hebben een leger bijeen gebracht om de Romeinen te vernietigen. Alleen als Castellum Traiectum af is voor de Germanen aanvallen hebben de legionairs de kans om te overleven.

Lukt het de spelers om Castellum Traiectum te voltooien voor de Germanen aanvallen? Of gaan we allemaal roemloos ten onder!

Naast het bouwen aan Castellum Traiectum zijn er nog meer punten te verdienen in het spel. Doe in het geheim missies, of zet een eigen bouwwerk neer door een vicus, schip, wachttoren of barak te bouwen voor meer hulp. Zorg dat je principia punten verdient en kom verder met de hulp van de Batavieren of zet deze tegen je medespelers in...

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Bamse Sverige-spelet
description:
Go on a train ride with Bamse and his friends, and learn about Swedish geography at the same time.

Each player get three destinations they must get to. The first player to visit these places wins.

You move by rolling a die and can choose to move forward or backward. There are balloons that you can use to fly to other balloon stations.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice

name: Mordred: Old Enemies
description:
The Old Enemies Expansion comes with:

1 Gaul Island Board
1 Uther Leader Miniature
3 Monster Miniatures
2 Gaul Region Cards
1 Uther Leader Card
3 Monster Cards
3 Fate Cards
15 Essence Tokens
Hobs Faction
Hill Men Faction

name: Mordred: Forces of Nature
description:
The Forces of Nature Expansion adds these factions to your game:

Wood Elves Faction
Plains Dwarves Faction
Fauns Faction

name: Mordred: Warbands
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Warbands expansion introduces a roster of 12 new Heroes to Britannia! This expansion also adds a new Blight mechanic to your games of Mordred, a foul plague that corrupts the minds of men and pushes them to the brink of madness.

—description from the publisher

name: Moon Trek
description:
Moon Trek is based on the Kariuchi design. The rules are almost the same as the basic Kariuchi.

Changes to the rules were created to make it for 4-player or group competitions. The changes are as follows.

Players can play individually with 2, 3 or 4 players, or in groups of 2-2, 2-1, 2-1-1, 3-1, etc.
Group pieces can be stacked. There is no limit to the number of pieces that can be stacked. Therefore, players cannot remove their own group pieces from the board and returned to the reserve.
If a player's own piece stops at an enemy piece already on the board, the enemy piece is removed from the board and returned to the enemy's reserve position. If multiple pieces are stacked on the space, all the pieces are returned to their respective reserve positions.
If an enemy piece on the circle is removed, the "Kari" die can be cast again. However, if the throw was a roll of 4 or 5, the throw is not repeated twice. Also, if an enemy piece is removed during a short-cut move in the circle, it cannot be re-thrown.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Il gioco della guerra simulata
description:
A comprehensive set of tactical wargame rules for the late World War II period (1944-45), written by a retired Italian Army officer.

Also included are rules for minefields, bridge laying, weather and logistics (with fuel, ammo, water and food consumption).

The rules use OO/HO models with a reduction scale of 1:3. The appendix includes detailed orders of battle for German and U.S./Allied units listing the number of men and vehicles needed in the above scale.

The rules may be played by two players but are thought for a larger number of players and with the help of a judge.

—user summary

name: Defeat the Threat!   THE FIRST GUNSHIP
description:
Defeat the Threat! THE FIRST GUNSHIP is a SOLITAIRE wargame of operational and tactical command. At the game's core is a patent pending Threat Assembly that simulates an attack by a mysterious alien Threat, making this a truly SOLITAIRE game-playing experience. The Threat Assembly is tied to varying Intelligence Reports and can be adjusted to varying difficulty levels. The player commands the maneuver of aircraft, armor, and infantry divisions to repel the Threat attack on the ground and to clear the launch of the First Gunship to move global defense to the next strategic phase.

During each round of play, the player as the Ground Forces Commander orders divisions to maneuver and engage Threat Elements that deploy throughout the game, which represents an operational campaign of 22 months, based on the Threat Assembly. A Reference Card summarizes all major features of play for quick reference. The player must achieve the game's objectives, which include successfully defending certain city regions and clearing certain regions of Threat Elements so that the strategic breakthrough of the launch of the First Gunship is achieved.

The game usually lasts 8-9 rounds. In each round, the Threat deploys based on using the patent pending Threat Assembly. The player then collects income and purchases new units for deployment at the end of the round. The player then moves units and conducts Offensive Combat. The Threat then moves based on the game board configuration, after which Defensive Combat is conducted. Each round ends with new unit deployment.

The patent pending Threat Assembly is designed to deploy the Threat based on various Intelligence Summary reports that are provided to the player. The player can thereby control units with advance knowledge of at least some of the Threat's expected movements. However, the patent pending Threat Assembly also varies the deployment of the Threat so that there is always an element of surprise that varies with each game. That is, the Threat deployment always varies significantly between games, although the Threat attack proceeds generally based on the provided Intelligence Reports that may change between games.

description from publisher
mechanics: Income, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Worker Placement

name: Fill in the Game: Origins 2023 Promo
description:
The top half is a 2 point challenge called Origin Story. The bottom half is a rule called O-H...
Both portions have an Origins Game Fair logo.

Origin Story has you monologue about your villain origin story for one minute, whereas O-H... has other players respond to that phrase as directed by the active player.

name: Special Detective
description:
Special Detective is a game in which the police attempt to capture the bank robber before he can escape from the city.
The red car is the bandit's car; the remaining cars which are blue, green and yellow are police cars.
The bandit has first turn to play and starts at space "Bandit Starts Here." Once his car enters a street he must go forward to the next intersection unless he lands on a space indicating otherwise. Upon reaching an intersection, he may turn in either direction.
The police decide among themselves the order in which they will move; they will start separately from the spaces indicated on the board. Once a police car enters a street, it must continue to go in a forward direction until reaching the next intersection. Each police car moves in turn before the bandit's car moves again.
If a police car lands on the same space already occupied by the bandit's car, the bandit is considered captured and the game is over. If the bandit lands on the same space already occupied by a police car, then the police car is out of the game. If any player's car lands on a marker telling him to go back to another street or location, he immediately goes back as instructed; then on his next turn he has the option of starting again in any direction from that space.
The bandit must land on the space marked "FREE" by exact count to win the game. If he is six spaces from the "FREE" space, and throws seven, he is taken one space past and the chase continues.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: White Noise
description:
White Noise is a card game of survival and adventure in deep space. You are a space traveler who is lost and must find your way home. But the journey is full of dangers and mysteries. You must use your wits, skills and luck to overcome the challenges and obstacles that await you.

The game is played with a deck of 100 cards, each featuring a Jump number, a Challenge number, location flavor text and an event. Card number 1 is placed face up in the play area, and the rest of the cards are shuffled and divided into two piles. You choose one pile as your playing deck (the other pile is not used this game).

You also choose a character card and place it in front of you. Each character has four statistics: Health, Reputation, Energy and Intelligence. You have 6 character points to distribute among these statistics as you wish.

On your turn, you draw the top card from the playing deck and place it next to the previous card in the play area. You must guess whether the Jump number on the new card is higher or lower than the Jump number on the previous card. If you guess correctly, you follow the event on the new card. If you guess wrong, you lose 1 Health and must face the Challenge on the new card. To pass the Challenge, you must roll 2 dice and add the value of one of your statistics to your (gold) dice and add the challenge number to the event (white die). If the result is higher than the Challenge number, you succeed. If not, you lose 1 health.

The game ends when one of the following happens:

You find the Home card in the playing deck. You win!
You run out of Health. You die!

White Noise is a game of suspense, strategy and chance. Can you make it home alive?

—description from the publisher

name: Speedway
description:
The object of this game, as in a stock car race, is to be the first player to complete five laps around the track.
To begin, each player selects a car and lap markers of matching color. The lap markers are put in the center of the board where indicated. Each player then throws the dice. The one with the highest throw puts his car in starting position on the inside lane (lane nearest pit). The player with the next high number puts his car in the next lane, etc., until all cars are in position at the starting line.
First player again throws the dice and moves his car the number of spaces indicated. Each time a player completes a lap, he takes one of his colored markers from the board. Players may, if they wish, move their cars from one lane to another; however, a move to another lane must be made from adjacent squares of the same color. For instance, a player may move his car from a red square in his lane to an adjacent red square in the next lane.
When a player's car stops on one of the spaces indicating mishaps, he must do what the space instructs immediately.
One car may not pass another car in the same line. All passing must be done by changing lanes as explained above. If a player throws a number that allows him to move his car past a car ahead, but it is impossible to do so by changing lanes, the cars are said to collide; they are out of the race.
A lap is completed only when a car has crossed the finish line; then a player may take one of his lap markers from the board, indicating he has completed a lap. The first player to complete five laps is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Gearwrights
description:
Welcome to Gearwrights, the innovative and immersive board game that puts you in the shoes of a budding inventor in a steampunk-inspired world. With resource management, engine building, and a unique pachinko dice tower featuring custom d6 dice, Gearwrights offers a rich and engaging gameplay experience that will have you striving to become the greatest inventor of all time.

In Gearwrights, you'll start with a dream of creating the next great invention. As you work to build your engine and manage your resources, you'll have the opportunity to design and build a wide range of gadgets, contraptions, and gearwrights, from simple machines to complex inventions that will change the world.

But the competition is fierce, and you'll need to work quickly and efficiently to beat out your rivals and claim the title of the Greatest Inventor of All Time. By carefully managing your resources and utilizing your engine to its fullest potential, you'll be able to create more and more elaborate inventions, earning prestige and acclaim along the way.

And with a one-of-a-kind pachinko dice tower featuring custom d6 dice, every roll of the dice in Gearwrights is a thrilling and unpredictable event. You'll never know what fate has in store for you, but with strategic planning and a bit of luck, you'll be able to overcome any obstacle and achieve your goals.

So if you've ever dreamed of being a great inventor, or if you just love the unique dice towers, Gearwrights is the game for you. With a deep and engaging gameplay experience, endless possibilities for invention and discovery, and a rich and detailed game, Gearwrights is sure to become a favorite among board game enthusiasts and budding inventors alike.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Die lustige S u. F Reise
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The players start in Offenbach at space 1. The first player to reach the central office of Schade & Füllgrabe in Frankfurt a. M. at space 120 wins the game.

The game was published for the 50th anniversary of Schade & Füllgrabe.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Tier-Würfelspiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game.

The game was published to promote the encyclopedia "Grzimeks Tierleben".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Hands: Promodeck
description: Promo deck for 2nd edtion of Hands. More gestures, more fun!

name: On Bloody Ground: The Norman Conquest
description:
On Bloody Gound - The Norman Conquest is a 64 page, perfect bound rulebook, with common sense core rules, including brutal combat and a system of orders that makes the game dynamic, exciting, fun and challenging.

The rules are designed for use with individually based 28mm miniatures, but can easily be adapted for use with any scale or basing.

This first book in the series covers the Dark Ages in Britain between the 8th and the 11th centuries and includes army lists for Saxons, Vikings, Normans, Irish, Scottish and Welsh.

—description from the publisher

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trun Outcast Hero Pack
description:
The Trun Outcast is a special Hero Class that we put together for the Kickstarter to let Brimstone veterans and new players alike dive even deeper into the crazy world of Shadows of Brimstone!

Part of a brutish warrior race of reptilian soldiers, the Trun tower over humans, standing around 10' tall. With rippling muscles and a thick scaled hide, the Trun are the ultimate hunters in the galaxy, using brutal weapons and wearing heavy armor plating. They seek out deadly prey to test their skills, living and fighting in tribes of armored warriors.

Sometimes, when a member of a Trun hunting pack becomes disgraced or fails in a critical hunt, they are banished from the tribe, an outcast to their people. These warriors often seek out a glorious death in combat or travel great distances to stalk the deadliest prey alive. But some... some choose to take on a new life. A life of adventure...danger...the life of a Hero! Or maybe just a mercenary. If the pay is high and the chance of glorious death is higher, a Trun Outcast can rarely say no.

This new Hero Pack lets players take on the role of a Trun Outcast; an alien brute from another world, able to pick up and throw smaller Enemies around, smash through combat with a meaty fist, and blast his way through the toughest opponents using his alien weapons and martial prowess. He can even learn from his prey, getting better at hunting and fighting them over time, developing new tactics and techniques to bring ruin on his enemies! The Trun are not subtle... but when you play a Trun, you're not really looking for subtle. You're looking for a battle monster that can get the job done, or die gloriously trying in an epic way!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Boss Monster: Birthday Party Promo Card
description:
A promo card in celebration of Boss Monster's 10th Anniversary. This promo card will be given away at Gen Con 2023 as well as at Brotherwise Games' featured retailers.

This card is a Monster Room, with the following ability: This Room has +3 damage if your Boss has Leveled up.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Achtung Jabo!
description:
Achtung Jabo! is a solitaire wargame about the 371st Fighter Group, which flew ground attack missions on D-Day in the P-47D Thunderbolts (known for its famous "Razorback"). Gameplay depicts the Group's missions on D-Day, June 6, 1944, and the book includes extensive research into the techniques, history, and practices of Allied fighter-bomber units at the time of D-Day.

All Game Maps are historically accurate paintings -- 14 in all -- created meticulously with reference to photo reconnaissance images from the time, featuring all of the targets assigned that day. The game focuses on replayability and targets will vary each time you play. Your pilots should expect to encounter German Tiger tanks, Panthers, "Hetzers", armored half-tracks, Opel Blitz trucks, artillery pieces, and Wehrmacht infantry. You will fly along railroad routes looking for locomotives and rail cars. You will bomb bridges and target gun emplacements, "tobruks" and pillboxes. Beware, the Germans will respond in force with their famous 88 flak guns and rapid-firing quad-20 mm guns for close-in defense. You will be armed with bombs and a full load of bullets for each Thunderbolt's eight .50 cal machine guns.

Just as in history, your Fighter Group's three squadrons will rove across the Normandy countryside in the areas located behind UTAH and OMAHA Beaches. Your overall mission is to prevent the Germans from reinforcing their forces arrayed in defense against the Allied landings, but you never know what targets will present themselves as you fly your assigned patrols. Your mission orders are clear -- and they are exactly the same orders as the 371st Fighter Group actually received that day.

Victory requires you to complete ALL of your assigned missions and hopefully not lose too many of your planes and pilots to enemy fire. It's time to paint D-Day invasion stripes on your planes and get into the air!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Educational, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Supersonic Jet
description:
Supersonic Jet is a two-player card game set in a new golden age of air travel.

You and your opponent lead rival airlines seeking to expand across the globe. You compete to control the most airports and carry the most passengers. In this zero-sum game, remember to pursue frequent fliers at every opportunity. These high-value travelers can unlock decisive strategic advantages, including the ultimate prize — the supersonic jet.

—description from the publisher

name: Heirs to the Air
description:
Post-Impact Earth does not suffer many to live on the surface: only the mutants can survive in the dense, orange haze that seeps and spreads from Ground Zero, in Antarctica. Whether the meteor brought the mysterious hot catalyst with it or simply thawed it is unclear and unimportant. The world's remaining superpowers wage war over the rights to Antarctican airspace and the freedom to purchase this ore from the mutant miners below.

You are the mutant miners. You dig, you sell, you dig... while you collect and repair the bullet-ridden wreckage that falls from above the haze. After all, you don't plan to stay down here forever.

Heirs to the Air is a resource-management game in which every load of ore that you sell to the first-world factions overhead puts you one step closer to building your own dirigible fleets so you can fight for control of the 12 territories. On the other hand, every load of ore that you sell makes one of the first-world factions stronger.

You will race against your fellow mining factions to assemble an air force, time your ascent, and then try to hang tough. When the final first-world faction is eliminated, the game ends, but beware: you can all lose if a first-world faction runs amok and establishes dominance over Antarctica.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Boxtop Pinball: Welcome to Las Vegas
description:
Family-friendly dexterity game about flicking dice down a cascading boxes of a Vegas themed pinball machine.

Players will flick dice over the course of 3 rounds aiming for bonus zones multiplying their pip totals by the area they land on. You can also try and knock opponents out of bonus zones on subsequent dice flicks but bumping them off the zone they are in.

Bonus games include collecting the best blackjack hands by bumping into cards, betting on the outcome of roulette spins and more.

—description from the publisher

name: Rep-Tiles
description:
A group of scientists have unearthed new species of reptiles; however, their population is incredibly small. You and your fellow conservationists have been tasked with protecting these new species, while we learn more about their patterns and habitats. It is no easy feat, but you’ll gain your mastery of conservation as you save these beautiful reptiles.
Each round you’ll be drafting colorful scale tiles to place on your reptile cards. Reptile cards have specific patterns that you’ll need complete to save them. On your turn you’ll be making progress towards conservation by choosing to: feed, grow, protect, or save. Your decisions will effect what actions you can take on a turn, so choose wisely.
As you play you’ll earn masteries based on your successful conservation efforts, these masteries reward you with additional points. Once the final mastery is drawn, the final round begins. The player with the most points earned, wins!

—description from publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Keeper of the Sacred Flame Hero Pack
description:
As part of an ancient and secret order of Egyptian warriors, the Keepers of the Sacred Flame have taken an oath that has passed down for generations. It is their sworn duty to prevent the ancient enemies of mankind from returning to power and casting the world back into Darkness.

With whispers and rumor of the fabled Lost Tombs being unearthed, and the cursed Dark Stone rediscovered within, the Keepers have begun to gather their forces, sending agents to stop those that would seek out the relics and rituals needed to resurrect the corrupted sorcerer Khamuntet by the followers of his fanatical cult. Or perhaps their greatest fear, that the long-dormant gates to the Sunken City have been found...and opened, reawakening the ancient and terrible Kingdom of Pharrox.

This new Hero Pack contains everything you need to play as a Keeper of the Sacred Flame. Trained from birth as saboteurs, warriors, and assassins, the Keepers of the Sacred Flame have been standing against the Darkness for millennia... and they are ready to fight!
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood & Coin
description:
Blood & Coin is a lightweight, auction-driven roll and write game with a unique bidding mechanic. It plays in under 30 minutes with 2-6 players. The players lead mercenary companies in 15th century Europe, recruiting soldiers as they disband from the English and French armies during the Hundred Years War.

—description from the designer

name: Picture This!
description:
Picture This! consists of 50 cards with close up photographs of common objects on the front and the name and photograph of the object on the back. One player displays the front of one card to the other players and they have one minute to guess the object. The first player to identify the object from the close up image gets the card. If no one can identify the object the card is placed back in the deck. The player to the left takes the deck and displays the front of the next card. The first player to get 5 cards is the winner.

—user summary

name: Raketou do Vesmiru
description:
Raketou do Vesmiru (English translation "Rocket Into Space") is a space race board game for 2-4 players from earth to mars and back. Unknown publisher, this game was produced in Czechoslovakia before manned space flight in 1961.

The game see players with 2 wooden rockets each. One of the rockets is an auxiliary rocket used only if needed when reaching a space station. Players leave earth and progress along a path to the space station (space 95), then mars (space 132) and back to earth (space 183), landing at each place by exact count. The wonderfully futuristic space graphics on the large board (68 x 45cm) has red numbered spaces that cause delays for the traveler, such as Oxygen leaks, magnetic interference and rogue rockets.

Most interesting with this game is instead of a dice to decide player movement a "Rocket Range" determines the count. This is similar to the Carnival Strongman game using a hammer to hit the bell. In Raketou do Vesmiru a wooden rocket slides on a steel rod when released from a spring. The top of the rocket continues along the rod and stops at a number(1 - 10)that determines a players move. If a player launches the rocket too hard, it hits a bell at the top of the "Rocket Launcher" and the player has to move back 10 spaces.

The winner of the game is the player to get to mars and return to earth first.

—user summary

name: Portal
description:
In a magical and remote archipelago, a sorcerer helped by invading goblins enslaved the Goddess of the Island, generating discord between the 4 warrior tribes, responsible for protecting the island's temples.
Each tribe has magic crystals that can awaken a great warrior, capable of opening a magic portal and saving the Goddess, sending invaders to another dimension.
Now at war, the 4 tribes believe that only one of the tribes can save the fate of all.

In Portal, players use action points to move their warriors, seeking to collect diamonds from other tribes and take them to their own temples. For this, in addition to movement, players spend action points to acquire action cards, which allow special actions and even attacks against goblins and against warriors from other tribes.
Additionally, each time a diamond is taken to a temple, a random event is triggered, generating randomness with each new game.
The game is won by whoever manages to collect diamonds from all the other tribes, awakening their great warrior, and taking him to the ceremony site for opening the Portal.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: H.Y.S.T.
description:
H.Y.S.T. (How You Steal Things), is a board game for 2-6 players. Each of you is a thief that needs to steal the diamond for a mysterious wealthy buyer. This particular diamond is housed in a museum that has "state of the art" security. Also, the museum's halls are a maze of passageways that can be arranged in over 14 billion ways using 9 tiles to create the board.

In the middle of the museum is the target of your heist, the diamond. You will use action cards that assist you to bypass security, hinder opponents, or gain movement. Regular movement is taken using dice rolls. Get to the diamond first to steal it, Be warned, other thieves can steal the diamond from you using luck or action cards. Choose your exit wisely as another thief may catch you.
Be the first to get out with the diamond to win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Modular Board, Race, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Hexagods
description:
Lots of people live and work in the city of Myra, other people travel to see the beauty of the city. They live their own lives and have their own ways.
Where different people live, trouble always finds its way. Sometime through natural events, sometimes through intervention of the Hexagods.

Become part of the Hexagods community and create the stories of the characters in Myra.
Why is it that Maxi & Höbt holds a grudge against Esmaralda and will this end up in a fight?
The world is in your hands. You, as the Hexagods, choose the teams, while the players play the battles on the battle mat with the goal to win the battle of the hexes. Start creating stories and winning battles!

Inspired by the Print & Play genre and tactical video/tabletop games, Hexagods provides exciting skirmish battles in an ever expanding universe. Build your team of gorgeous miniatures and fight it out against your friends or dive into the lore and discover an unique world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Thrust!
description:
Thrust! is A Space Combat Microgame Inspired by Very Bad Chess by Zach Gage and the Upcoming Ship Combat Rules From the Mothership Shipbreakers’ Toolkit. It also features secret board gameplay, giving it a vibe best described as Space Battleship.

To play, you randomly choose four space ships that will be your fleet for the game. Combat is quick and brutal, running out of fuel is as big of a threat as violence. Each time a ship is damaged, there are permanent consequences. Every game will be unbalanced and unique, and this is by design, you need to think on your toes using the ships available to you. The winner is the last person with a surviving ship.

—description from the designer

name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scientist Hero Pack
description: A Pulp Adventure staple, the mad scientist with his gadgets and crazy ideas was too fantastic an archetype not to add to the game. His starting Upgrades let you choose how ‘mad’ you want him to be, as a Gadgeteer inventor, using Fringe Science, or with an endless supply of Master Plans. He also has a Techno-Gadget that can be redirected for different purposes throughout an Adventure, and can be leveled up along with your Hero, using its own mini-Upgrade Tree to unlock the power of Super Science!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wasteland Warrior Hero Pack
description:
This is another Hero players have been asking about for years, and the time has come for him to make his prison break—a playable alien Hero from the Blasted Wastes—the Wasteland Warrior. This is another special Hero Class that we put together for the Kickstarter to let Brimstone veterans and new players alike dive even deeper into the crazy world of Shadows of Brimstone!

Hailing from the deadly sulfur deserts on the alien prison world of the Blasted Wastes, the Wasteland Warrior has mastered the art of survival above all else. Able to customize and trick out his armor, weapons, and wargear by Scavenging for Scrap and wrecking other items for Scrap and Tech, his gear is always changing to suit his needs. Armed with Rust Blades and a Scavenger’s Rifle, this alien fighter can Snap Fire as he closes with Enemies, shredding them with desert ferocity, then falling back to get set up for a sniper’s shot!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Keeping Up With The Joneses
description:
The Joneses just bought a new car! What are you waiting for?! You must keep up with their expensive lifestyle!

When the Joneses buy something, you and all your neighbors have to buy the same thing too!

Experience the thrill of the chase for new stuff to keep your status in the Joneses' affulent neighborhood while you struggle to stay out of bankruptcy. Take on new income opportunities and hope you don't get some unexpected expense like a broken appliance to drain your bank account!

Playing against the Joneses can be taxing. Yet, your goal is simple: Stay financially secure while trying to sell your house and relocate. But while the goal is simple, the cards may or may not be in your favor.

In this game of chance, just try to Keep Up With The Joneses.

—description from the publisher

name: Kamigami Battles: Chaugnar Faugn Promo
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

Chaugnar Faugn is promo card # ROTOOP006

Act: Banish 1 Warrior or Disciple from your Hand: Add 1 Energy to your God.
React: Pay 1 Energy: Warriors or Disciples who Defend this turn are returned to the player's hand instead of their Discard Pile.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kamigami Battles: Vexoria Promo
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

Vexoria is promo card # KBP-005

If Vexoria does not Attack during your turn, you must Banish a Warrior or Disciple from your discard pile, if able, at the end of your Discard Phase.
Act: A God damaged by Vexoria this turn cannot use a Warrior to attach Vexoria on their next turn.
React: When a Disciple is played, give it Act: Attack 1. Banish this Disciple at the beginning of the Discard Phase.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kamigami Battles: Cultist Zolon Promo
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

Cultist Zolon is promo card # KBP-006

Act: Attack 2.
React: If Cultist Zolon is Banished from play, shuffle him into the Warrior Deck instead.

Includes randomizer, card separator, and 5 copies.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Wolfsrudeltaktik
description:
Wolfsrudeltaktik is a card game where players take the role of World War II German U-boat wolfpack commanders. The objective of the game is to prevent the Allies from shipping enough supplies to Britain to end the war early, and to sink more enemy tonnage over the course of the war than your opponent.

Manage your submarines, utilize your special skills, and choose carefully which convoys to attack; the Allied destroyer escorts are always on the lookout to sink a German U-boat.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Conquest of A.I.
description:
Welcome to the Conquest of A.I. Board Game, where you must create your own artificial intelligence by 2023 using cutting-edge technologies. The exciting task you have set for yourself is to gather the six innovations needed to make it.

You'll come across a lot of thrilling opportunities in this game where you can freely move around the board, come up with methods, and create plans. This board game provides a true sandbox experience where players' imagination and ability are crucial.

Using the 30 reward cards and 54 fascinating technology cards, demonstrate your ability to manage your research points and action points properly. Investigate all of your alternatives so that you may best develop and protect your own servers. The option to assault other players' servers gives you another way to engage in rivalry with them while playing.

Every choice counts, and the exciting competition and strategic components guarantee that you'll never get bored. To achieve a deserving win, go out on this expedition and build the most cutting-edge artificial intelligence!

—description from the designer
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Hexagon Grid, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: Magic Maze Tower
description:
Magic Maze Tower is a new standalone game in the universe of the Magic Maze range.

The adventures of the dwarf, the elf, the barbarian and the magician at the mall were a failure and our (brave) adventurers find themselves prisoners of a tower, or rather, of a high-security prison. They will probably need the help of a 5th hero to help them....

The goal of the game is to complete as many levels as possible to escape the prison.

Magic Maze Tower is played on a single Level tile, without an hourglass (you can take your time!), without a “do something” token, but the communication is still limited: Speaking is forbidden.

SETUP


Place a Level card in front of the players.
Place the Hero pawn of the corresponding color on each Hero space (not all 5 pawns are used every time).
Distribute the Action tiles to the players.


HOW TO PLAY

For a level to be completed, all conditions for passing the level must be met and the heroes must then use the exit.

All players will simultaneously move the pawns according to the action assigned to them.

Together, solve the puzzle to save the adventurers.

When a level is completed, you move on to the next one.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Grid Movement, Multiple Maps, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: BLEEP!
description:
This fun-for-all game is designed to bring entertainment and endless frustratation to your gatherings, parties, and game nights. Bring together both family and friends, and prepare for a savagely thrilling experience! Your objective is simple: be the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. But don't be fooled by its simplicity! BLEEP! will challenge your wit and test your ability to outsmart your opponents. Will you use your cards strategically to gain an advantage, or will you play an aggressive action card to shake things up? The choice is yours! BLEEP! combines strategic thinking, several twists and turns and a dash of mystery to create unlimited fun. The game includes a set of numbered cards ranging from 1 to 12 and a collection of aggressive action cards that will let you wreak havoc upon your opponents! But be careful, what goes around, comes around!

—description from the designer

name: Trial!: Murder on the Beach
description:
Murder trials have never been so much fun!
Trial! Murder on the Beach is a card game with a English trial theme. Each player is a Defendant on trial for the murder of Victor Tim. The aim is to place Guilt on the other Defendants so that they are convicted of the murder and you are not.
In the first part of the game, Defendants use Solicitor Cards to win Trial Cards and build their hands for the Trial.
In the second half of the game, the players use the Trial Cards to win control of the witnesses and raise each other's Guilt.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Events, Trick-taking

name: Palin & Drome
description:
Enter the circle of rocks, in the center of the ring of mushrooms, behind the trees of eternal autumn, hidden in the valley of sister souls, there is hidden the treasure that will give you freedom.

Soulmates Who is the dreamer and who is the shadow?

Palin & Drome is a board game for 1 to 4 players that is very quick to learn and play.

Each turn the player must decide how much to move, knowing that each step he takes will be reflected by his opponent, as if a shadow or spirit were stalking him... By placing traps and taking advantage of the walls, they must try to collect as many points as possible before any of the two fall exhausted. The player with the most points will be the winner.

They must be careful what traps they place, where and how they take advantage of the traps that their own opponents set in their favor.


The game was originally devised during the Global Game Jam 2014 as DoppleGanger in Córdoba, Argentina by the team of Débora Schvartz, Carlos Kirincic, Emmanuel Rubio, Lucio Estevez.

name: It's In The Groove: Country
description:
Have fun playing the It's In The Groove Country Trivia Card Game. Hear song lyrics from classic country tunes from Garth Brooks, Kenny Chesney, Tim McGraw, Brooks & Dunn and many many, more.

Two or many players have fun taking turns reading the lyrics cards while the other players shout out the song title and or artist. Many ways to play. 107 cards in every deck will test your recall as you race to answer.

Cards can also be played with the It's In The Groove Deluxe Board Game.

—description from the publisher

name: Shadows of Brimstone: River of the Dead Enemy Theme Pack
description:
River of the Dead is a new type of product for Shadows of Brimstone called an Enemy Theme Pack, and this one is about the nefarious Cult of Horus and their devotion to finding and resurrecting the scattered relics and mummified remains of their ancient master, Khamuntet!. It's a great way to add a bunch of exciting new Enemies, cards, and Missions that are all themed for a specific World or faction in the game.

River of the Dead
The great god Osiris was lord of the dead, ruler of the afterlife, and master of resurrection. The fields would grow at his command and the souls of the dead would be judged in his name, worthy or unworthy to pass on into the afterlife. Killed by his jealous brother Set, Osiris’s body was cut into pieces and spread throughout the land, before being re-assembled and resurrected by the power of the goddess Isis, his wife.

It was in this tradition that the Arch-Villain Khamuntet, after finally being defeated millennia ago, was also cut into pieces and sealed away in the hidden tombs of his own dark sorcery, buried deep in the desert sands. Now the fanatical Cult of 'Horus, son of Osiris', seek to reassemble and resurrect Khamuntet in the same way, so he too may pass judgement on mankind, spreading Darkness across the land!

The River of the Dead Enemy Theme Pack comes with a horde of new Egyptian Enemies to challenge your Heroes, as well as new Cult of Horus themed Missions for the Lost Tombs, and over 40 new Game cards with assorted counters. You get 1 Priestess of Judgement, 3 Large Ushabti Warriors, 1 Large Ammut - Eater of the Unworthy, and 6 Osirian River Guards.

Priestess of Judgement
A powerful sorceress in the Cult of Horus, the Priestess of Judgement follows the sect of Osiris, charged with performing the sinister rituals and harnessing the dark magik that will re-forge and resurrect their master, Khamuntet! Possessing the Scales of Truth, her harsh judgements can bring death and destruction to anyone that stands in the way of their master’s glorious return, as she unleashes Ammut, devourer of the dead, on her foes.

Ushabti Warriors
Carved of stone and placed in burial chambers and tombs, Ushabti were created to be servants and minions of the dead. They come to life at the call of their master, taking up tools and weapons for the task in need. Though many are created as legions of small figurines, the most terrifying Ushabti Warriors are those sculpted at great size and adorned with hieroglyphics. Crafted in the likeness of Osiris, and armed with hefty Egyptian war axes, these stone warriors are formidable foes when called to war.

Ammut, Eater of the Unworthy
A monstrous creature that combines the front of a lion, hind-quarters of a hippopotamus, and the head of a vicious crocodile, Ammut is a divine beast that feeds on the hearts of those deemed unworthy. When the scales of judgement tip not in your favor, Ammut is ready to devour your soul!

Ammut is a nightmarish Large creature that ruthlessly hunts those found unworthy of joining the blessed dead in the afterlife.

Osirian River Guard
These skeletal warriors guard the River of the Dead. Armed with Dark Stone-tipped spears and heavy shields, they bear the ceremonial dress and armor of the Pharaohs. Nearly unstoppable in their ghastly resolve, they rise back up from the dead to fulfill their sacred duty and bring ruin on any that would defy the judgement of their master.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Fury of the Reich Enemy Theme Pack
description:
Fury of the Reich is a new type of product for Shadows of Brimstone called an Enemy Theme Pack, and this one is about everyone's favorite Pulp Adventure villains to punch! It's a great way to add a bunch of exciting new Enemies, cards, and Missions that are all themed for a specific World or faction in the game.

Fury of the Reich
As a buildup to war in Europe seems all but inevitable, the fascist Reich have begun scouring the globe for ancient and powerful occult relics that could help further their ambitions. Founding an elite and secretive branch of the military known as the Trident Korps, they embark on expeditions into the far reaches of the world, using experimental technology and ruthless cunning to achieve their goals. Researching tales of the lost city of Atlantis, the Trident Korps has dispatched a detachment to the desert sands of Egypt in search of the key to unlocking the power of this ancient fallen kingdom.

The Fury of the Reich Enemy Theme Pack comes with a host of new Pulp Adventure Enemies to challenge your Heroes, as well as new Relic-hunting themed Missions for the Lost Tombs, and over 40 new Game cards with assorted counters. You get 1 Colonel Stein, 6 Reich Soldiers, 1 Tressa - Femme Fatale, 3 Trident Kommandos with Harpoons, and 3 Trident Kommandos with Lightning Guns.

Colonel Stein
A veteran of the Great War, Colonel Stein has seen his share of horrors on the frontlines, both manmade and supernatural. When his unit’s trench was overrun with tentacled monstrosities, only his ruthless nature allowed him to survive; but the evil of the Void creatures left their mark, corrupting his flesh with hideous mutation. Rising through the ranks, he now leads a division of the Trident Korps, seeking out occult artifacts and ancient relics that could bring him more of the raw power he felt on that dark night so many years ago.

Reich Soldiers
Reich Soldiers form the backbone of the Trident Korps’ expeditions. These soldiers are hand-picked from the military ranks for their cold demeanor and fanaticism. Equipped with gear for exploring ancient tombs and temples, the Reich Soldiers carry the deadly MP.36 submachine gun to ensure that they have the upper hand in a fight.

Tressa, Femme Fatale
Using her beauty and cunning to take advantage of her adversaries, Tressa is a cold-hearted killer. Second in command to Colonel Stein, she is in charge of tracking down leads on the locations of the lost tombs and temples in the deep desert. Her disdain for the heat only serves to make her more sadistic in achieving her aims. Fast and agile, Tressa depends on subterfuge and deception, striking the killing blow without warning or remorse.

Trident Kommandos
The Trident Kommandos are elite troopers armed with powerful advanced weapons and armor, harnessing the power of the Void to their own evil ends. Their suits are engineered for exploring OtheWorlds and harsh environments like the deep sea. They are at the forefront in the hunt for the Lost Kingdom of Pharrox and the priceless treasures and technology that could be found in the Sunken City.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Underflow
description:
The objective of Underflow is to be the merchant with the most objective points at game's end. Each Objective card and additional abilities award points to players. The game is primarily resource collection with dice drafting and a bit of engine building mechanics.

The game is played in four phases in each round. These include the Flow phase, a collection phase, a second collection phase, and finally the objective phase. Players draft dice which represent positions of locations or cards on the 9x9 grids.

Objective cards give players points and abilities including end game goals and in game actions. The player with the most objective points after 6 rounds is the reigning merchant.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses

name: Operation KITA
description:
