In February 1945, the Japanese executed Operation Kita ("North"). Two hybrid battleship-aircraft carriers and four escort ships dashed home to Japan from Singapore. The Allies detected the Japanese task force, but all their tries to attack it with submarines and aircraft were ineffectual and failed. These were among the last IJN warships to safely reach Japan before the war ended.

This number 28 in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS Inc.

name: 東のポテトマン (Potato Man of the East)
description:
Potato Man of the East uses a deck of cards of 1 through 5, and a few wild cards, and is played as a memory game. The cards are shuffled and set out on the table in a grid.

On a player's turn, they reveal cards one at a time. When they reveal a third card, if they have revealed three of a kind, three in ascending order, or three in descending order, they can choose to stop and score or keep revealing cards. If any time time the revealed cards don't satisfy one of those criteria, the player's turn is over and the next player takes their turn.

The player with the most points wins.

name: Pacific Rim Breachfall
description:
Pacific Rim Breachfall can be played with two to four players. One team sides with the Pan Pacific Defense Corps (PPDC) and can build mighty Jaegers. The other team plays as the alien Precursors who create the dangerous Kaiju who want nothing more than to destroy humanity.

The two different groups have a different goal throughout the game to achieve victory. The Precursors must destroy all the cities around the Pacific Ocean and the PPDC must find a way with their Jaegers to close the 'THE BREACH' so that no more Kaiju can come to Earth.

When one of these two goals has been achieved, the game ends. The team that completes the goal wins!

During the game you can always consult with your teammate to determine your tactics. You can also show each other your cards. But be careful, because your opponents can of course hear you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Pieces as Map, Team-Based Game

name: Bestiary of Sigillum: Collector's Edition – Out-of-Control Chaos Promo Campaign
description:
Out-of-Control Chaos campaign is a mini-expansion for Bestiary of Sigillum: Collector's Edition that consists of 3 consecutive two-player missions with unique mechanics. Each mission changes the core rules to set up a narrative and create a new playing experience.

In the Chaos of Space mission, hexes adjacent to the Citadel (central hex) change their terrain type every time the Time Dial is rotated. The Chaos of Time mission allows characters to use Abilities of their allies with a one round cooldown penalty. Finally, in the Chaos of Events mission players get Event cards that can be played in a special way, with their effects applied only one time and only to one character or one suitable condition.

Whenever a mission is completed, both players score Victory Points: the winner gets 3 VPs, while the loser gets VPs based on the number of damage points the opponent’s Castle has suffered. When the campaign is over, the player with the most VPs wins. In case of a tie, both players share the victory.

Take advantage of chaos to battle against your opponent under unpredictable conditions!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: 凡庸ロボットのネガイゴト (Negaigoto of mediocre robots)
description:
凡庸ロボットのネガイゴト ("Negaigoto of mediocre robots"), also referred to as "The Wish of a common robot", is a growing Must "Knot" Follow trick-taker. If you are to play a card of a suit already in play it will be ranked lower than all other cards played in the trick.
Can your hand become stronger or, conversely, become weaker? What's more, you can select one card from tricks each round and carry it over to the next round...! You can also get batteries by getting cards with tricks! If you raise your skills with batteries... you can get strong cards...! There is a chance to score additional points...! Strategize your way to victory!
publishers: ぽてきゃっ党 購買部 (Potkyattou Purchasing Department)

name: Design Your Destiny: Running Out of Time
description:
Read a fictional story about Charlie and Natalie as they are whisked away to the future to try to stop the invention of time travel itself! Every couple of chapters you get to play as Charlie and Natalie in a game where you help them progress through the story. Unfortunately, each game is broken and needs your help to fix it.
The next few pages after a game will guide you on ways you can fix the game, but you are given complete freedom to fix it however you want. Each task you complete earns you a sticker that helps put the time machine back together. If you complete enough tasks and fix the time machine, then you unlock the final chapter to see how the story ends.
It's a sci-fi story but also a game design tutorial that's great for kids or for people just getting into game design.

Kickstarter link (live now!): https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/failfaster/fail-faster-...

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Flicking, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Pattern Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lants & Lot
description:
Lants & Lot is a cooperative game of rivaling marionette casts. Players attempt to "K.O." advancing opponents using a common poll of Sicherman dice. By manipulating the type of dice in the pool and playing the right pair of hand cards, abilities can be gained and odds can lean in your favor.

The cast has Chip Points which are players health. Each player chooses a character with their own traits, These traits determine how many dice may be rerolled when compared to enemy traits.

If players defend their sage from the last rival with at least 1 Chip Points left for each player, they are victorious!

—description from the publisher

name: Gorge
description:
Gorge is a silly 2 player game of Clans competing in a competition for fishing rights. Cards act as levers to launch objects over and into the gorge in order to achieve a set number of Feats.

The game combines worker placement on ever changing actions and a bit of understanding of fulcrums and levers crated by the two ends of the Gorge. Even Clan members can be launched but a player must have at least 1 clan on their side of the gorge at all times.

—description from the publisher

name: BeanS BooM BANG!
description:
Two tough Guys on the hunt for scoundrels and scoundrels! With BeanS BooM BANG! you will experience the adventures of Bud Spencer and Terence Hill firsthand, and you can even reinvent from scratch. Take on the role of a director and invent crazy stories, defeating criminals with thunderous blows. Right jab, left slap in the face or the infamous hammer fist: anything is allowed, it...

Each player starts with 5 BEANS cards on the table. Each BEANS card represents one kind of blow (left punch, right punch, double punch, left slap, right slap). The cards must lie covered on the table, in front of the player.

Each turn, one of the players performs the role of the director. The director chooses randomly a BOOM and a BANG card from the stacks on the table. BOOM and BANG cards describe places and situations. The sum of the points printed on the two cards are the points earned by the player who will win the turn.

The director, following the suggestion provided by the cards he picked, invents a story. He cries out "Action!" and all the players must put their hands on their knees. At a given point of the story, the director will name a blow at his choice, such as "Right punch", or "Double punch". The players should beat the table performing the right action. The first one who succeeds wins the turn, and therefore removes the BEANS card in front of him corresponding to the action requested by the director.

The game ends when a player get rid of all his BEANS cards or if a player have eaten too many sausages or drunk to much beer. Sausages and beer cards are part of the BOOM and BANGS decks. If a player has more than one beer or sausages, the game ends early and the winner is the one with the highest number of points.

name: Lucky 7th
description: A baseball game from 1937 with the results of each play determined by the consultation of charts corresponding to six-sided die rolls with no differentiation per player.

name: Captain's Log #7
description:
Captain’s Log #7 includes the fiction story What Price Victory? about a battle between the Yorktown and the Klingon cruiser Pitiless. Captain Merrin Hunter, Star Fleet’s only female cruiser captain, is locked in a mortal test of wills with Klingon Captain Keng. The fate of a vital Federation outpost hangs in the balance!

Also included are five new scenarios, four new ships (Federation battlecruiser, Hydran Apache light command cruiser, Klingon MD5 war cruiser mauler, and Lyran Single-Tooth Jaguar war mauler), information about officer ranks and a list of the officers on a Klingon D7 battlecruiser, the first and only trivia contest, an example about carrier drone storage, the first Battleforce 500 article, tactics, and the original version of the SFU Index.

The F&E section includes Q&A, The Molasses Attack (strategy), and The Breeze, which is a new F&E scenario.

Supports Star Fleet Battles and Federation & Empire.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Do You Know Gaming?
description:
Delve into the depths of your mind and test your gaming knowledge with Did You Know Gaming’s new, dungeon-crawling trivia card game. Alongside a group of fellow heroes, you’ll be tasked with using your wisdom and insight to answer gaming-related questions as you progress through the depths, killing monsters, acquiring gear, and becoming stronger, all in the hope of defeating one of several deadly bosses and escaping the Trivia Dungeon. Choose an iconic player character and either band together with friends to take out the dungeon boss, or go it alone and escape solo. It’s now time to prove whether you really Do Know Gaming!

—description from the publisher

name: Tides of War: 1944
description:
In Tides of War: 1944, two to four players command their soldiers over a shifting battlefield, strategically adapting to evolving terrain and reinforcements of troops. At the start of the game players choose how to arrange the board and objective, but over the next 60 to 90 minutes, explosions and flames will alter the landscape and leave the terrain different than how it started. Along with the variety of Troops, Terrain, and Victory Conditions, Tides of War also offers a unique set of rules that remains simple, yet entirely different from more generic mechanics, offering many more possibilities which allow for a unique game experience each time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Simulation, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Strataccor
description:
Enter the fascinating world of business negotiations and prove that you are the master of strataccor.

Walk the boardgame, buy tiles, buy properties and ask rent.

A variation of monopoly but the properties power depends on the tiles you own.

name: Ghost Face: The Game
description:
The spin on the game is that it will be themed around July 4th. These games are played on holidays, at least for now, and we needed to make it different than the movies. So we’re creating a brand-new story: It’s July 4th weekend, and this little town of Clarion, Pennsylvania, is having a big drive-in for the holiday. They wake up to a newspaper report that these Ghost Face killers are running around and killing people. The idea is that the police officers have figured out that this Ghost Face (or Ghost Faces – key!) is headed to the big drive-in to kill a bunch of people. And it features nine masks in the line. So you’re gonna get the gold Ghost Face, the devil Ghost Face, the orange, the green, the scarecrow, the aged one. The idea is to celebrate the line of Ghost Face masks that Fun World has been cranking out but aren’t in any of the movies … it’s a brand-new adventure for Ghost Face. He’s still killing.

Unlike the other Stop the Killer games, we have a multiple-killer angle, which you find out throughout the game, and it’s different with every game, whether there are one, two, or three killers you have to stop. And there’s a whodunnit angle.

—description from the designer
categories: Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Traitor Game

name: Lethbridge-Opoly
description: While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Lethbridge we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich traditions and of course…Nikka Yuko Japanese Garden - a little something for everyone! Looking for a fun way to experience The Windy City? Buy your favourite Lethbridge properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to GO Lethbridge! You may soon be the Mayor…or out of the game for eating too many Blues Burgers from Coulee Brew Co.!
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Patton Liberates Brittany!
description:
Super fast and simple, conventional point-to-point game about Patton's historically failed attempt to grab logistically strategic Breton ports and liberating Brittany. (Simpler, sleeker system than Postcard Brittany but retaining the essential gameplay objectives.)
German units, roadblocks, and blanks begin game hidden - to stay so in a 2-player game until revealed or until the end of the first Patton turn in a solitaire game.
6 turns. As for Postcard Brittany, 11 US, 3 French FFI (having special abilities), 11 German infantry and extra-resilient parachute units.
Lotsa dice combat system - defender firing first. Push-your-luck No Retreat! rule.
(Note also the Brittany side game coming out with Phalanx's logistical system Keep'Em Rolling.)

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Okuno
description: Okuno is a game similar to UNO. Players race to empty their hands. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile and pass their turn. The special cards can spice things up a bit.

name: Code Freeze
description:
It’s only 7 days until code freeze (the business’s deadline for code changes), so it’s crunch time for you and your fellow project managers. Bribe developers with coffee, buy your new User Interface from a vendor, and acquire Management Support as you try to get everything done before the deadline. Don’t forget to watch out for bugs in your code, though! A single Null Pointer Exception can ruin an entire Ticket (not to mention Stupid Mistakes). You’ll need strategic planning, management, and probably synergy (or something) to succeed, but god help you if the build breaks. Whoever impresses upper management the most will win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Interrupts, Resource Queue, Take That

name: Bouw je Wijk Spel
description:
The game is made for the police of Zeeland (a Dutch district) to promote their work for a safe neighborhood.

You start with 6 card board tiles in your hand. On your turn, you may place a tile adjacent to the space where your pawn is on a map of Zeeland provided the design of an adjacent tile fits. 3 times 4x4 tiles show the same village with houses, streets and a police station. If you have another tile that fits to the placed one, you may put it as well. If you don't have a fitting tile, throw the special tile to move your pawn the respective number of spaces across already placed tiles.
If you have no tiles left, you may alternatively move neutral pawns like citizens and policemen across the spaces. If you are adjacent to a neutral pawn, keep it for scoring. When all neutral pawns are taken, player with highest score wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: hvad er jeg?: mad & drikke
description: Play Hvad er jeg? mad & drikke, a.k.a. What am I? food & drink, with up to four friends by placing cards on your forehead, then taking turns asking questions to discover what food you represent.

name: Captain's Log #14
description:
“Are we Klingons, or are we spineless worms? We may die, but death in battle brings glory to us all.”

Read all about the betrayal at Oxvind V where the crew of a Federation battlecruiser fight for their lives in a Klingon trap in Romulan space.

Enjoy new play aids: the particle cannon energy record form for Star Fleet Battles and Klingon and Lyran record keeping forms for Federation & Empire.

Star Fleet Battles players will find new ships (Klingon G2C police leader, Klingon F5W war destroyer, Kzinti war destroyer carrier, and Kzinti fast carrier resupply frigate), Ask Kommodore Ketrick, Ask Uncle Ardak, information about tractor beam auctions, scenarios, a Seltorian seminar, Victory at GenCon 1993 by Alex Pundy, SFB Rules cross index, and Term Papers.

Federation & Empire players will find Federation & Enquire, Tactical Notes, Alliance strategies, rules notes, and The Tholian Web, a new scenario.

As is usual, there is information about the company, Star Fleet Awards, Q&A, humor, background information, and information on Prime Directive and Star Fleet Warlord.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Chaos vor der Kamera
description:
The players slip into the roles of Bob, Peter and Justus and use their brains and a good memory to try to find out who is innocent and who is responsible for the acts of sabotage.

20 cards are placed face down on a game board, two for each of the ten people. One of these is collectively identified as the "culprit". The players move their pawn across the game board (between the character tiles) using dice and may then look at one of the neighboring pawn tiles. In this way, they try to find memory-like pairs of figures until only the "culprit" remains.

—user summary

name: Knäppgök
description:
How weird can you act in front of other people without laughing?

The art of behaving strangely in front of others without laughing or blushing requires a tremendous talent or years of practice.

Knäppgök is a party game consisting of 100 cards with tasks that are guaranteed to be difficult to perform without laughing. The more you try to keep from laughing, the louder the laughter will be! The cards can be handed out to the party participants but can also be used as seating cards.

name: Hurry up card game
description:
Math + memory + fun are intergrated in this innovative game and activity card deck. Who said math has to be boring?
"Hurry up" is a combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, memory games and activities.Everybody will have endless hours of fun.
It is time to unplug and have real interpersonal bonding time. With "Hurry up" everyone can improve their math skills and cognitive memory

name: Thuis
description:
Boardame based on the very popular Belgian tv-series/soap "Thuis".
You have to choose one of the main characters and answer quiz questions about the series (running for 25 years on television). The one who gets the most correct answers gets to organize a Thuis-party and wins the game. Best suited for fans of the series.

name: Swords and Bagpipes: Village Deck
description:
This was a KS exclusive that adds 5 additional village locations:

Trading Post
Stables
Outpost
Barracks
Barricades
publishers: Mamute Jogos, Moroz Dev Studio, Rightgames RBG SIA

name: Så det kan låta: Schlager!
description:
Så det kan låta: Schlager! is the "Melodifestivalen edition" of Så det kan låta.

By solving four "musical" tasks, the teams must move their game marker from Start to Finish on the game board. First to finish wins!

name: Flow of Fate
description:
In Flow of Fate, players draft powerful Character, Weapon, and Resource cards to assemble the most synergistic tableau they can manage in 3 short rounds.

Every Fate card has multiple actions, and every Character, Weapon, and Resource card has multiple purposes, from being upgradeable, to helping other cards upgrade, to contributing to colored sets which are worth bundles of bonus points. The result is that your strategy is never set in stone; you can always pivot to outmaneuver your opponent!

Flow of Fate has an expandable player count. With two copies of Flow of Fate, you can play with up to 4 players, and with three copies, you can play with up to 6 players!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Escape Game Party: La Malédiction du Temple Maya
description: Could you escape those two adventures? Items have been stolen from the Calakmul from and the curse of Maya's gods is about to strike: the end of the world is announced. Get into the mysterious temple in order to attempt to ease their anger.

name: Kitty Kakes
description:
Objective in Kitty Kakes is achieve your cats eats more cakes than others, it is 2 different zones, hand zone and towers zone. Cat cards are numbered with 1, 2 or 3. In towers zone each turn this cards have to be played to build towers (one above other) until achieve specific quantity of points to exchange by box cards, 6-7 for 1 box card, 8 points for 2 box cards and 9 or more for 3 box cards.

All box cards have to be dispersed but face down on the center of the table . When a player exchanges a cat tower for box cards this box cards have to be put in their respective towers zone where player can open it using cat points from their hand zone cards.

In order to open box cards, you have to use 6 cat points from the cards in your hand zone. Be aware some boxes might be empty. Although there is dog cards and mouse cards, these cards are used to difficult your rivals advance, like scaring (dropping a card) your rivals towers cats or stealing closed boxes from other players.

A player wins when he achieve the next objective, which one will change depending the number of players. 10 cakes to win in 2 players mode, 7 cakes in 3 players, 5 cakes in 4 players, 4 cakes in 5 players and only 3 cakes in 6 players mode. It also exists a simple player mode but the rules changes a little bit.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Noodle Knockout!
description: This fine motor game is a ramen rumble! Kids build new preschool fine motor skills as they snag oodles of noodles and toppings to make bowls of ramen in the Noodle Knockout! Fine Motor Game from Learning Resources. Draw one of the 10 double-sided order cards, pick up a pair of fine motor chopsticks, and grab the noodles and ingredients needed to take a delicious victory! In addition to fine motor skills, these fun skill games also help kids build early preschool counting and color recognition skills. Designed for 1-4 players, there are even multiple ways to play—test your fine motor skills with a solo bowl, or compete with up to three friends! This versatile preschool skill development tool also comes packaged in a sturdy, reusable plastic bowl that acts as both the game board and storage!

name: Great War at Sea: The Wine-Dark Sea
description:
In one of the First World War’s best-known naval escapades, the German battle cruiser Goeben eluded her British and French pursuers in August 1914, escaping to Turkey and helping to widen the war into entirely new theaters. That would only be the first of many naval operations on the Mediterranean Sea and the adjoining Adriatic and Black Seas with naval action continuing well after the official end of the war.

The Wine-Dark Sea covers all of the naval action in the Mediterranean between 1914 and 1918. The game includes 280 “long” playing pieces representing major warships, and 280 square ones representing smaller warships, aircraft and fleets. There are two operational maps, covering the entire Mediterranean Basin from Batum on the eastern end of the Black Sea out past Gibraltar into the Atlantic Ocean on the western edge.

The ships and planes of all the participants are present: Austria-Hungary, Britain, France, Italy, Greece, Ottoman Turkey, Romania, Bulgaria, Germany, Japan, Spain, Imperial Russia and the United States.

There are over 100 scenarios included, organized in our popular “story arc” format that places them in historical context.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Minimap Resolution, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Underground Dice Racers
description:
Introducing Underground Dice Racers, an adrenaline-pumping push your luck dice game designed for 2-4 players. Step into the shoes of a Hotted up Street Racer, where each player takes control of their own racing machine and sets out to conquer the tracks. In this thrilling tabletop adventure, the key to victory lies in rolling your Engine Dice and daring to push your luck to the limits. Roar down the lanes, manoeuvring through challenges and obstacles, all with the ultimate goal of being the first car to cross that coveted Finish Line. Only the boldest and most strategic racers will claim the glory and bask in the well-deserved triumph. So, rev up your engines, brace yourself for heart-pounding moments, and get ready to embrace
the thrill of Underground Dice Racers. The race to victory awaits!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Push Your Luck, Race, Re-rolling and Locking, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: The Dead Eye: XP
description:
Expansion for the The Dead Eye.
Contents includes: 24 Hope, 24 Strength cards, 9 Story cards, 3 Character cards, 1 Rules card, and 1 Sneak peek card.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Push Your Luck

name: Captain's Log: China & Portugal
description:
Relations between China and Portugal during the colonial period were complex and often conflictive. Portugal was among the earliest European powers to venture into China, establishing a colony in Macau in 1557. This colony marked the initial point of contact between China and Europe, playing a pivotal role in fostering commercial and cultural.

The historical context of "Captain's Log China & Portugal" will be enriched with new improvements and enhanced roles, aiming to gain fame and recognition. Stay tuned as the rest of the content unfolds gradually, revealing an engaging and intriguing narrative.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Nautical, Pirates, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Bias, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Shark in the Water
description:
Shark in the Water is a competitive card game for 2-4 players ages 7 and up.

play time is approximately 5-10 minutes per player
Goal= first player to 20 victory points wins
in Shark in the Water, players use their one action per turn to build up their fleet of fishing boats, play fishermen to catch fish or send the shark or pirate card to another player in order to capture their fish or destroy their boats.
as players draw up their hand limit of 5 cards, any fish cards drawn into their hand are immediately played to the center of the table and become available to catch. This does not count as your one action and is mandatory.
with any remaining cards left in your hand you may choose to play a boat card into your fleet in front of you or (provided you have an available boat to place a fish on), you may play a fishermen card to catch one of the available fish from the center of the table.
When a boat has the required number of fish on it, that boat can immediately be "docked" for it's victory points.
once you've taken your one action, play continues clockwise to the next player who draws one card at random from your hand before drawing up their remaining hand limit of 5 from the central draw deck.
The shark or pirate cards can show up in any players hand at any time and if that player chooses to, they may use it for their one action to attack another players fleet.
The shark is able to destroy another players boat and cause that boat to be discarded along with any fish on it.
The pirate can be used in a similar way however instead of destroying the boat, the pirate is used to steal the fish on that boat.
In a defensive play, if the player being attacked is holding the "chum" card, that player can send the shark to attack another player instead of themselves.
Pirate and Shark attacks can both be defended against by playing the Jed Fishworthy (dynamite Fishermen) card. In this defensive play, the player being attacked discards the Jed Fishworthy card in order to immediately stop the attack and send the Pirate or Shark to the discard pile, which is then reshuffled back into the central draw deck.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection, Take That

name: Star Schlock
description:
Blast off for adventure with Star Schlock—the tabletop miniatures game inspired by sci-fi of the 1970s and 80s! Use miniatures from the growing line of Star Schlock figures—who may bear an uncanny, yet legally distinct resemblance to familiar sci-fi tropes—to wage intergalactic war on your kitchen table.

Fortunes can swing dramatically in Star Schlock! Mount sweeping charges against your enemy's flank! Risk it all with a plan so crazy it might just work! This isn't a passive game where you set your figures up and spend two hours seeing if your deployment decisions worked. You'll need to think hard to use the limited resources at hand to outwit your opponent, push your units to the limit of their capability, and exploit the vulnerable spots in your opponent's strategy.

Play a nail-biting game against a single opponent on a 3'x3' battlefield, or bring the game to your club and play an epic six-player confrontation on a sprawling 4'x6' table (or larger!). Star Schlock is a flexible system built to handle a variety of gaming group sizes.

Use the rules for your universe, or come play in ours. The Star Schlock rules emulate the adventures of the long running Canadian sci-fi series of the same name (it ran for 20 years—surely you've heard of it?). From the Explorer Corps boldly going where none have gone before, to the madhouse that is the Space Ape home world, the Star Schlock universe is full of space princesses, mystical crystal knights, infectious mutants, plucky robots, and a host of other familiar sci-fi tropes. The Starter Set is the perfect place to jump in as we kick off the Galactic War that would be fought onscreen, in comics, novels, and trading cards for two decades!

Dozens of character and unit profiles already detail the denizens of the Star Schlock universe, with more to come. Gather troops with abilities that synergize with each other to unleash epic combos that will leave your opponents reeling!

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Triax
description:
Triax is a 2-player abstract strategy game where you control three Mages that you will move along the hex paths and through warp gates. The Mages are at their strongest when they are together so the player who can place all three of their Mages in the same hex at the end of their turn wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Pattern Recognition, Track Movement, Variable Set-up
